Design dehumidification logic with humidity [%] bands: Off below 55, Low between 55 and 65, High above 65. Apply 5% hysteresis and a minimum dwell time of 30 s per level. Raise an alarm if humidity > 85% for 60 s.
Map PM2.5 [ug/m3] to air quality categories Good, Moderate, Unhealthy, and Hazardous; drive an LED color for each. Sample every 2 s, and add a latching alarm in Unhealthy and above.

Filter temperature [degC] with a moving average over 5 samples at 5 Hz. Trigger an over temperature alarm if filtered value > 40 degC, but also trigger immediately if the instantaneous reading exceeds 50 degC. Detect a rapid rise rate > 2 degC per second and warn.

Implement a day night state machine using illuminance [lux] with states Day, Transition, and Night. Enter Night when lux < 60 for 30 s, Day when lux > 200 for 30 s, else stay in Transition. Provide alarms for prolonged Transition > 10 minutes.

Use two humidity sensors to compute a median relative humidity [%] for control. If their difference exceeds 10% for more than 30 s, set a sensor fault and freeze control outputs to a safe level. Log the fault condition.

Convert temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%] into absolute humidity [g/m3] for display. Raise a warning if absolute humidity exceeds 20 g/m3 while temperature < 18 degC, indicating condensation risk.
Monitor carbon monoxide [ppm]. Enter Warning state at 35 ppm and Critical state at 50 ppm. In Critical, latch an alarm and require manual reset that is only permitted after CO < 20 ppm for 60 s.

Create greenhouse ventilation logic using temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]. Open vent if temperature > 28 or humidity > 80%; close when temperature < 26 and humidity < 75%. Add an overheat alarm at 40 degC.

Add a self test for the light sensor. If illuminance [lux] changes by less than 5 over any 10 minute period while the system toggles a test indicator every minute, flag the sensor as stuck and raise a fault alarm.
Sanitize barometric pressure [hPa] by rejecting spikes with rate of change greater than 2 hPa per second. Compute a 60 s mean and raise a low pressure alarm if this mean falls below 940 hPa.

Implement a comfort index state machine using temperature [degC] and humidity [%] with states Comfort, Dry, Humid, and Hot. Update at 2 Hz with WCET <= 3 ms per cycle. Provide distinct indicators for each state.

Control a 3 speed ventilator based on CO2 [ppm] bands: Low at 800 to 1200, Medium at 1200 to 1800, High above 1800. Enforce a 60 s minimum dwell per speed. On sensor fault, force High speed and raise an alarm.

Include a warm up state for a gas sensor measuring TVOC [ppb]. Ignore readings for the first 30 s after power up, then apply thresholds of 400 and 1000 ppb for warning and alarm. Latch the alarm until TVOC remains below 300 ppb for 120 s.
Detect light flicker by calculating percent flicker over a 1 s window from illuminance [lux]. If percent flicker exceeds 20%, raise a flicker warning; clear it when under 15% for 5 s.
Compute sea level pressure [hPa] from measured pressure and a configured site altitude [m]. Raise a weather alert when sea level pressure < 980 hPa. Indicate invalid if altitude parameter is missing.

Design a PID loop to maintain air temperature [degC] at 22 with a heater output. Sample at 5 Hz with WCET <= 4 ms, include anti windup and output limits. Trigger an immediate safety shutdown if temperature exceeds 40 degC.

Control humidity with a PID that targets 50% relative humidity [%] using a humidifier output. Use temperature [degC] to compute dew point and stop humidification if dew point is within 1 degC of air temperature. Include safety limits on duty cycle and a high humidity alarm at 80%.

Fuse CO2 [ppm], TVOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3] into a composite air quality score. Drive four alarm levels from Good to Hazardous with clear thresholds. On single sensor failure, degrade gracefully using the remaining sensors while raising a fault.

Stabilize barometric pressure [hPa] using a simple Kalman or equivalent filter that also considers temperature [degC] for noise modeling. Sample at 2 Hz, WCET <= 2 ms. Raise alarms on rapid pressure drops exceeding 6 hPa in 5 minutes.

Implement dual redundant temperature sensing with 2 out of 2 voting. If sensors disagree by more than 1 degC for 10 s, enter degraded mode, raise a fault, and freeze control. Use the voted temperature to drive a heater PID to 25 degC with safe output limits.

Add adaptive sampling for CO2 [ppm]. Use 1 Hz normally, increase to 5 Hz if rise rate exceeds 100 ppm per minute. Ensure WCET per cycle stays under 2 ms. Immediately alarm if CO2 > 5000 ppm regardless of sampling mode.

Maintain target illuminance [lux] at 300 using a PID to control a dimmer output. Sample at 20 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms, limit output range, and if the light sensor faults, set output to a safe minimum and raise an alarm.

Compute dew point [degC] and absolute humidity [g/m3] from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]. Trigger a fog risk alarm when dew point is within 0.5 degC of temperature for at least 2 minutes. Provide filtered displays updated at 2 Hz.

Detect potential water leak events using both temperature [degC] and humidity [%]. Flag a leak if humidity jumps by > 10% within 60 s while temperature drops by > 1 degC. Filter sensor noise and require persistence for 30 s before alarm.

Predict pressure trend by fitting a least squares line to barometric pressure [hPa] over the last 10 minutes sampled at 1 Hz. If the forecast 30 minute change is less than -8 hPa, raise a preemptive storm alarm. Handle missing samples safely.

Build a building environmental monitor with modes Normal, Energy Saving, and Emergency. Inputs: temperature [degC], humidity [%], CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [ug/m3], and illuminance [lux]. Define behavior per mode, safety thresholds for each sensor, latching alarms in Emergency, and timing constraints of 5 Hz main loop with WCET <= 3 ms. Include a watchdog and a brief test plan.

Create a cleanroom monitor with modes Startup, Monitoring, Calibration, and Fault. Monitor temperature [degC], relative humidity [%], differential pressure [Pa], and PM2.5 [ug/m3]. Enforce alarms on out of range values, lock outputs during Calibration, and require manual reset from Fault. Provide acceptance tests for each mode transition.

Design a greenhouse controller with DAY and NIGHT modes, each with distinct setpoints for temperature [degC], humidity [%], and light [lux]. Use PID loops for temperature and humidity, enforce safety thresholds (overheat at 40 degC, high humidity at 85%), and include mode dependent gains. Specify sampling at 5 Hz and WCET <= 4 ms.

Implement a multi zone air quality safety system for two rooms, each with CO2 [ppm], TVOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3]. Define a state machine with Normal, Alert, and Evacuation. If any room is Critical, enter Evacuation for both with latching alarms requiring manual reset. Include diagnostics for sensor faults and timing at 2 Hz with WCET <= 3 ms.

Develop a data center environmental guardian with states Normal, Alert, and Critical. Monitor inlet air temperature [degC], humidity [%], differential pressure [Pa], and illuminance [lux] for occupancy cues. Control fan speed with a temperature PID, maintain humidity within 40 to 60%, and trigger safe shutdown if multiple sensors fail. Specify 10 Hz tasks with WCET <= 2 ms and define self tests and pass fail criteria.
Create a simple temperature monitor that turns on a high-temperature alarm whenever the sensor reads above 50 degC, and turns it off when below or equal to 50 degC.
Raise a humidity alarm if relative humidity exceeds 85%, and clear the alarm when it falls to 85% or lower.
Activate a low-pressure alarm if absolute pressure drops below 90 kPa; otherwise keep the alarm off.
When ambient light falls below 100 lux, switch a light output on; turn it off when the level is 100 lux or higher.
If CO2 concentration exceeds 1000 ppm, assert a ventilation request signal; clear the request when CO2 is at or below 1000 ppm.
Trigger a cold warning indicator whenever temperature is below 0 degC; turn it off at 0 degC or above.
Turn on a humidifier control output when relative humidity is below 30%; turn it off when humidity reaches 30% or greater.
Drive an OK indicator when temperature is between 10 degC and 40 degC inclusive; otherwise drive a FAULT indicator.
Set an air quality alarm if PM2.5 exceeds 35 µg/m3; clear it when PM2.5 is at or below 35 µg/m3.
Sound a high-UV alert when the UV index is 7 or above; silence the alert when the UV index falls below 7.
Indicate COMFORT when temperature is within 20 to 24 degC inclusive; otherwise indicate NOT_COMFORTABLE.
Switch a night-light output on when illuminance is below 50 lux, and switch it off when illuminance is 50 lux or higher.
Immediately raise a humidity alarm when RH exceeds 90%; clear it when RH returns to 90% or less.
Enable a high-pressure alarm if pressure rises above 110 kPa; otherwise keep the alarm disabled.
Assert an indoor air quality alarm when TVOC exceeds 500 ppb; deassert when TVOC is 500 ppb or lower.
Implement dehumidifier control with hysteresis: turn ON when RH > 65%, turn OFF when RH < 55%. Include a safety override that forces OFF if temperature falls below 5 degC.
Create an over-temperature alarm that engages only if temperature stays above 70 degC continuously for 5 seconds, and clears only after it remains at or below 65 degC for 5 seconds.
Build a two-state day/night classifier using a light sensor: DAY when > 500 lux, NIGHT when < 300 lux, with a 2 s debounce to prevent rapid switching.
Detect a possible pressure leak: if pressure decreases by more than 5 kPa within any 10 s window, raise an alarm; automatically clear if the trend stabilizes (no 5 kPa drop) for 60 s.
Report COMFORT when temperature is between 22–26 degC and RH is 40–60%; otherwise report ADJUST. Update at 1 Hz.
Implement PM2.5 air quality levels with indicators: GOOD (< 12 µg/m3), MODERATE (12–35 µg/m3), POOR (> 35 µg/m3). Change outputs accordingly.
Sample temperature, humidity, pressure, and light at 10 Hz and update alarms each cycle. Ensure the worst-case execution time per cycle stays under 3 ms.
Add a sensor warm-up state: for the first 30 s after power-up, do not trigger any alarms and indicate WARMING_UP; then switch to MONITORING and enable normal alarm logic.
Calibrate a baseline illuminance for the first 60 s after startup, then alert if current light deviates by more than +50% or −50% from the baseline.

Implement robust sensor fault handling: if any reading is missing, out of plausible range (e.g., temperature < −40 degC or > 120 degC, RH < 0% or > 100%), or not updated in 2 s, raise a FAILSAFE alarm and set outputs to a safe state.
Add a two-stage temperature escalation: PRE-ALARM when dT/dt > 2 degC/min and T > 45 degC, CRITICAL when T > 55 degC. Latch CRITICAL until acknowledged.
Compute a 10-sample moving average of relative humidity at 5 Hz and trigger a high-humidity alarm if the average exceeds 80%.
Provide an alarm-silence feature: when the user presses a mute input, silence the buzzer for 120 s while keeping the visual alarm active; automatic re-arming after the timeout.
Monitor barometric trend and warn for storm risk if pressure drop rate exceeds 2 hPa/hour averaged over the last 15 minutes.
Control ventilation based on CO2 with anti-short-cycling: turn ON when CO2 > 1000 ppm, turn OFF when CO2 < 800 ppm. Enforce minimum ON time of 5 minutes and minimum OFF time of 3 minutes.
Create dual temperature thresholds: WARNING at 60 degC (amber LED) and CRITICAL at 75 degC (red LED + buzzer). CRITICAL must latch until a manual reset input is received.
Implement stepwise dimming from a light sensor: Level 3 when < 100 lux, Level 2 when 100–500 lux, Level 1 when > 500 lux. Update smoothly without chatter.
Calculate dew point (degC) from temperature (degC) and RH (%). Raise a condensation risk alarm when the dew point is within 2 degC of the measured temperature.
Provide an approach warning: if temperature is within 2 degC below a 70 degC limit and rising, assert PRE-ALERT; clear when temperature moves 3 degC away from the limit or is no longer rising.
Compute an approximate heat index in degC using temperature and RH, and set status: NORMAL (< 27 degC), CAUTION (27–32 degC), EXTREME (> 32 degC).

Design a temperature control loop to maintain 25 degC using PID. Sample at 10 Hz, enforce actuator limits and anti-windup, and cut off outputs if temperature exceeds 80 degC. Keep WCET per cycle ≤ 2 ms.
Fuse two temperature sensors into one robust reading using outlier rejection. If the difference between sensors exceeds 2 degC, raise a SENSOR_MISMATCH fault and inhibit control actions.

Combine two humidity sensors with offset calibration at startup to produce a single RH (%) value. If either sensor fails or diverges by > 10%, degrade gracefully and flag a warning. Enforce safety thresholds for mold risk > 80%.
Compute a composite air quality score from PM2.5 (µg/m3), TVOC (ppb), and CO2 (ppm). Map to categories (GOOD, FAIR, POOR) and command ventilation with rate limits on change to avoid oscillation.
Estimate altitude from pressure and temperature, and issue a storm alert if pressure drops by more than 6 hPa over 3 hours. If apparent altitude changes faster than 5 m/s, flag a sensor fault.
Regulate workspace illuminance to 300 lux using a PID loop driving a dimmable output. Sample at 20 Hz, limit output slew rate to prevent flicker, and keep WCET < 1.5 ms.
Control a dehumidifier to keep dew point below 16 degC. When dew point exceeds 16 degC, turn ON and run until dew point falls to at least 14 degC. Enforce minimum ON/OFF durations of 2 minutes.

Implement a noise-robust filter for temperature (degC) and humidity (%) readings with a 5 Hz update rate. Detect anomalies via residual checks and raise a SENSOR_NOISE_FAULT if residuals exceed thresholds.
Provide thermal runaway protection: if dT/dt > 5 degC/min and temperature > 60 degC, immediately shut down actuators and latch an alarm. Verify timing constraints and ensure WCET ≤ 1 ms per cycle.
Use three pressure sensors with 2-out-of-3 voting to produce a reliable pressure value. If sensor spread exceeds 3 kPa, declare DISAGREEMENT and switch to a safe state.

Build a multi-mode environmental monitor with NORMAL, ENERGY_SAVING, and EMERGENCY modes. Each mode uses different sample rates (e.g., 1 Hz, 0.2 Hz, 5 Hz), thresholds for temperature (degC), humidity (%), and air quality, and distinct alarm behaviors. Include formal safety requirements, WCET budgets, and a regression test matrix with boundary and timing tests.

Create a greenhouse controller with modes GERMINATION, GROWTH, and NIGHT. Maintain temperature and humidity using PID loops with mode-specific setpoints in degC and %. Coordinate supplemental lighting by measuring lux. Include safety thresholds (overheat at 40 degC, high humidity at 90%), watchdog timing, WCET ≤ 3 ms, and a verification plan with step-response and fault-injection tests.

Specify a comprehensive air quality management system that fuses PM2.5 (µg/m3), CO2 (ppm), and TVOC (ppb) to control ventilation and filtration with multi-level alarms. Define startup self-tests, sensor plausibility checks, degraded-mode behavior, rate limits, WCET constraints, and acceptance tests covering threshold edges and recovery from sensor faults.

Design a mission-critical environmental monitor with states CALIBRATE, MONITOR, ALARM, and SAFE_SHUTDOWN. Validate temperature (degC), humidity (%), pressure (kPa), and light (lux) sensors against plausibility bounds, enforce timing deadlines, log state transitions, and provide a detailed test plan including boundary conditions, timing jitter, and latched alarm behavior.

Develop a redundant sensing subsystem with dual independent channels for temperature, humidity, pressure, light, and air quality. Implement cross-checks, voting or median selection, safe-state fallbacks, mode transitions, startup and periodic self-tests, strict safety thresholds, timing budgets (cycle rate and WCET), and traceable requirements with pass/fail acceptance criteria.

Monitor ambient temperature in [degC] at 10 Hz. If it rises above 60 [degC], assert an overheat alarm; clear the alarm only after it falls below 55 [degC] (hysteresis). Provide a single boolean alarm output.
Read ambient temperature in [degC]. Trigger a freeze alert when below -10 [degC]; clear when above -8 [degC]. Output a single boolean indicating freeze risk.
Monitor relative humidity in [%]. Raise a high-humidity alarm when ≥ 85 [%]; clear when < 80 [%]. Include a single visual alarm flag output.
Monitor barometric pressure in [hPa]. If pressure drops below 980 [hPa], set a storm-warning flag; clear when above 985 [hPa].
Measure illuminance in [lux]. If below 50 [lux], set a 'dark' flag; clear when above 60 [lux].
Monitor CO2 concentration in [ppm]. If above 1000 [ppm], set a ventilation-needed alarm; clear when below 900 [ppm].
Monitor PM2.5 in [µg/m³]. Trigger an air-quality alert when ≥ 35 [µg/m³]; clear when < 25 [µg/m³].
Monitor VOC index (unitless). If > 3, raise an odor warning; clear at ≤ 2.
Ensure ambient temperature stays within 10–40 [degC]. Set an out-of-range alarm if outside; clear when back within range.
Monitor barometric pressure in [kPa]. Trigger an overpressure alarm when > 110 [kPa]; clear when < 108 [kPa].
Detect glare: if illuminance exceeds 30000 [lux] for more than 2 s, set a glare flag; clear when below 20000 [lux] for 2 s.
Detect rapid temperature rise: if temperature in [degC] increases faster than 2 [degC]/s, raise a rate-of-rise alarm; clear when rate falls below 1 [degC]/s.
Monitor low humidity in [%]. If below 20 [%] for 5 s, set a dryness alert; clear when ≥ 25 [%].
Monitor CO concentration in [ppm]. If ≥ 30 [ppm], assert a toxic gas alarm; clear when < 20 [ppm].
Monitor temperature in [degC]. Publish a 'safe' boolean that is true only between 18 and 27 [degC]; false otherwise.

Create a three-state comfort indicator based on temperature in [degC]: COLD (< 18), COMFORT (18–25), HOT (> 25). Use 1 [degC] hysteresis on transitions. Update at 5 Hz and output the current state plus a HOT flag.

Combine temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%] to flag 'mold risk' if humidity ≥ 80 [%] while temperature is between 15 and 25 [degC] for longer than 10 minutes. Include a latching alarm that requires a manual reset input to clear.

Implement an air-quality status from two metrics: CO2 [ppm] and VOC index. Status levels: GOOD, FAIR, POOR. GOOD if CO2 < 800 and VOC ≤ 2; FAIR if CO2 < 1200 and VOC ≤ 4; otherwise POOR. Add 30 s persistence to prevent chatter.
Detect fast barometric pressure drop: compute 3-minute rolling change in [hPa]. If drop ≥ 6 [hPa] within 3 minutes, raise a storm warning; auto-clear after change < 3 [hPa].
Light-based state machine with states DARK, DIM, BRIGHT from illuminance [lux]. Thresholds: DARK < 100, DIM 100–1000, BRIGHT > 1000 with 10% hysteresis on transitions. Output the state.
Monitor both indoor and outdoor temperature sensors in [degC]. If the absolute difference exceeds 15 [degC], assert a 'thermal shock risk' alarm; clear when difference < 10 [degC].
Compute the heat index from temperature [degC] and humidity [%] using a simplified approximation. Raise a 'heat stress' warning if heat index ≥ 32 [degC]. Update at 1 Hz.

Monitor IAQ with two thresholds: CO2 [ppm] > 1500 or PM2.5 [µg/m³] > 75 triggers a high-priority alarm; lower threshold CO2 > 1000 or PM2.5 > 35 triggers a medium alarm. Ensure only the highest active level is reported.
Add a sensor fault check: if any humidity reading is < 0 [%] or > 100 [%], set a sensor-fault flag that inhibits normal humidity alarms.
Schedule periodic sampling: read temperature [degC] and humidity [%] at 10 Hz; ensure worst-case execution time per cycle is ≤ 1 ms. If WCET is exceeded, set a timing fault flag.
Implement an exposure counter for light [lux]: accumulate time spent above 10000 [lux] and raise an overexposure alarm after 1 hour cumulative. Reset the counter on an external command.
Use two particulate inputs (PM2.5 and PM10 in [µg/m³]). Declare 'dusty' if PM2.5 ≥ 35 or PM10 ≥ 150. Clear only when both fall below 80% of their thresholds.
Implement visual and audible alarms for low pressure: if pressure < 950 [hPa], set a visual alert; if < 930 [hPa], also set an audible alert. Latch the audible until pressure > 940 [hPa] for 30 s.
Apply a moving average filter (window 5 samples) to temperature [degC] before thresholding. Alarm if the filtered value exceeds 50 [degC].
Monitor rate-of-change of humidity in [%/min]. If humidity rises faster than 10 [%]/min while temperature is < 20 [degC], raise a condensation risk warning.

Create a calibration mode triggered by a boolean input. In calibration, sample light [lux] for 10 s and record the average. In normal mode, flag 'too dark' if current value < 50% of the calibrated average.
Implement a sunrise detector: detect the first transition from DARK to BRIGHT using illuminance [lux] with hysteresis; emit a one-shot 'sunrise' event and ignore further sunrise events for 6 hours.
Aggregate air-quality metrics into a 0–100 score (100 = worst) using weighted contributions from CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [µg/m³], and VOC index. Provide WARN at score ≥ 50 and ALARM at score ≥ 75.

Monitor ambient temperature [degC] against a daily high watermark. If the current reading exceeds the stored max by more than 2 [degC], raise an 'unexpected heat' alert. Reset the watermark on an external daily reset signal.
Implement dual-threshold alarm for humidity [%] with hysteresis and minimum on-time: WARN at ≥ 70 [%]; ALARM at ≥ 85 [%]. Ensure any active level remains asserted for at least 5 s before changes.

Fuse two redundant temperature sensors in [degC] using median selection and plausibility checks. If their difference exceeds 3 [degC], mark one as suspect and flag a degraded-mode alarm. Provide a fused temperature output and a safe fallback if both are inconsistent.

Closed-loop temperature regulation using PID: maintain 25 [degC] setpoint with a heater control output limited to 0–100%. Safety: hard shutdown if measured temperature exceeds 60 [degC]. Sample at 10 Hz, require WCET ≤ 1 ms, include integral anti-windup.
Compute dew point [degC] from temperature [degC] and humidity [%] and predict condensation risk on a surface sensor [degC]. Alarm if surface temperature is within 2 [degC] of dew point for > 60 s.

Advanced storm detection: combine absolute pressure [hPa], 10-minute pressure trend [hPa], and humidity [%]. Raise warning when pressure < 990 and trend ≤ −3 [hPa]/10 min with humidity ≥ 80%. Include hysteresis on all criteria.

Sensor fusion for thermal comfort: compute a comfort score from temperature [degC], humidity [%], and light [lux]. Apply a low-pass filter with ~30 s time constant. Trigger NOTICE at score ≥ 60 and ALARM at score ≥ 80.

Redundant PM monitoring with fault isolation: take inputs from two PM2.5 sensors [µg/m³]. Use consistency checks and select the lower-of-two unless one is flagged faulty. Alarm if the selected value exceeds 55 [µg/m³]. Expose sensor-fault status.

Adaptive thresholding for CO2 [ppm]: learn a 24-hour baseline minimum with exponential forgetting, and trigger a ventilation alert when CO2 exceeds baseline by 600 [ppm] or is above 1200 [ppm], whichever is lower. Include saturation limits and a reset command.

Implement two-level air quality evacuation logic: if CO2 ≥ 2000 [ppm] and PM2.5 ≥ 150 [µg/m³] concurrently for 5 minutes, assert EVACUATE. If either stays above its threshold for 30 minutes, assert EVACUATE even without concurrence. Include manual acknowledge to silence a buzzer while the alarm stays latched.

Perform sensor self-diagnostics at startup and hourly: check humidity [%] within [0, 100], temperature [degC] within [−40, 125], pressure [hPa] within [300, 1100]. If any check fails, place system in SAFE state that suppresses normal alarms and raises a maintenance alert.

Implement a light exposure integrator with temperature compensation: compute a dose proxy using illuminance [lux] scaled by a temperature-dependent factor. Alarm when the daily dose exceeds a limit; reset on a daily reset signal.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes: NORMAL, ALERT-LATCHED, MAINTENANCE. Inputs: temperature [degC], humidity [%], pressure [hPa], light [lux], CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [µg/m³]. Define state transitions based on safety thresholds (e.g., overheat > 60 [degC], CO2 > 2000 [ppm]). In MAINTENANCE, suppress non-critical alarms but keep over-limit safeties active. Include latching/acknowledge behavior and a heartbeat output. Specify unit tests covering each transition and boundary.

Create a hierarchical state machine for air quality with levels NORMAL, ELEVATED, HAZARDOUS, and EVACUATION, driven by CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [µg/m³], and VOC index. Include a SENSOR-FAULT substate that overrides to FAILSAFE. Require deterministic 10 Hz updates with WCET ≤ 1 ms. Provide a formal list of acceptance tests and timing tests to verify no missed deadlines.

Develop a redundant sensing architecture: triple temperature sensors in [degC] with 2-out-of-3 voting, dual humidity sensors [%] with analytical redundancy, and a single pressure input [hPa]. Define fault isolation, reconfiguration to degraded modes, and safety cutoffs (e.g., shutdown above 70 [degC]). Include requirements for built-in tests, fault injection tests, and traceable requirements-to-tests mapping.

Specify a multi-rate scheduler: run a fast loop at 50 Hz for temperature [degC] and humidity [%], and a slow loop at 1 Hz for pressure [hPa], light [lux], and air-quality metrics. Guarantee end-to-end latency < 200 ms for critical alarms and WCET budgets per task. Include test cases that measure jitter and verify no priority inversion.

Define an environmental monitoring and control supervisor that blends sensor fusion and PID: compute an IAQ score from CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [µg/m³], and VOC; run a PID to regulate a ventilation command to keep IAQ < 50, with hard limits if temperature < 10 [degC] or > 35 [degC]. Provide modes NORMAL, POWER-SAVE, and EMERGENCY with explicit transitions, fail-safe defaults, and a comprehensive verification plan including worst-case scenarios and boundary tests.
Read ambient temperature [degC] once per second; if it exceeds 35 [degC], assert an alarm output. Clear the alarm only when temperature drops below 34 [degC] (1 [degC] hysteresis).
Monitor relative humidity [%]; turn on a warning indicator when humidity exceeds 70 [%] and turn it off when it drops below 65 [%].
Measure light level [lux] and activate an indicator when it falls below 50 [lux]; add 5 [lux] hysteresis to avoid flicker.
Read barometric pressure [hPa] every 2 s; if pressure is below 990 [hPa], activate a low-pressure alarm.
Monitor air quality CO2 [ppm]; if CO2 > 1000 [ppm], raise an alarm, and clear it when CO2 drops below 900 [ppm].
Sample temperature [degC] and publish an overheat fault if the reading exceeds 80 [degC] for longer than 3 s.
Check humidity [%] each second; if the value is below 20 [%], signal a 'too dry' alarm until it rises above 25 [%].
Sample light [lux]; when the value exceeds 3000 [lux], flag a 'glare' warning. Clear the warning when it falls below 2800 [lux].
Monitor ambient temperature [degC]; if the sensor reports below -10 [degC], assert a freeze warning.
Measure particulate matter PM2.5 [µg/m3]; if it exceeds 35 [µg/m3], drive an alarm output.
Measure barometric pressure [hPa] every 5 s; when the value rises above 1030 [hPa], set a 'high pressure' indicator.
Monitor temperature [degC]; turn on a 'comfort' indicator when temperature is within 18–22 [degC], otherwise turn it off.
Read humidity [%] every 1 s; if the value is invalid (NaN) or out of range (<0 [%] or >100 [%]), raise a sensor fault alarm.
Check light [lux]; if darkness persists below 20 [lux] for 10 s, assert a 'dark environment' flag.
Monitor carbon monoxide CO [ppm]; if it exceeds 30 [ppm], sound an immediate alarm.
Create a two-level temperature alarm: caution at 35 [degC] and critical at 45 [degC], with separate hysteresis of 1 [degC] and 2 [degC]. Ensure the critical alarm overrides the caution state.
Combine temperature [degC] and humidity [%] to approximate a heat index; trigger a heat-stress warning when the index indicates 'caution' or higher, and include hysteresis to prevent chattering.
Monitor humidity [%] and light [lux]; only report 'high humidity' when humidity > 75 [%] and light < 100 [lux] (enclosed-area heuristic). Suppress the alarm otherwise.
Sample pressure [hPa] at 1 Hz and issue a storm warning if pressure falls by more than 6 [hPa] within 3 hours; reset the warning after pressure stabilizes for 30 minutes.

Implement alarm silencing for a VOC [ppb] alarm: when VOC exceeds 400 [ppb], raise an audible and visual alarm; allow a 'silence' input to mute audio for 10 minutes while keeping the visual alarm active.
Build a light-level state machine: Day if > 200 [lux], Dusk if 50–200 [lux], Night if < 50 [lux]. Apply hysteresis on transitions and expose the current state.
Monitor temperature [degC]; if it exceeds 60 [degC], start a 30 s cooldown timer and keep the alarm latched until both temperature is below 55 [degC] and the timer expires.
Validate two redundant temperature sensors [degC]; if they differ by more than 2 [degC], raise a sensor disagreement fault; otherwise publish their average.
Compute dew point [degC] from temperature [degC] and humidity [%]; raise a condensation risk when ambient temperature is within 2 [degC] of dew point for more than 60 s.
Implement a rolling average (10 s window) on CO2 [ppm]; trigger a ventilation request when the average exceeds 1200 [ppm], and clear it when below 1000 [ppm].
Monitor PM2.5 [µg/m3] and PM10 [µg/m3]; compute an AQI category and announce the corresponding alert level. Apply a 60 s smoothing filter to stabilize readings.
Use a median-of-5 filter on light [lux] readings; trigger a flicker-resistant low-light alarm when sustained below 30 [lux] for 5 s.
If humidity [%] > 80 [%] and temperature [degC] < 20 [degC], assert a 'mold risk' warning; log time-in-warning and clear the warning only after either condition no longer holds for 10 minutes.
Pressure monitoring with dual thresholds: alert below 995 [hPa], emergency below 980 [hPa]. Maintain separate hysteresis and escalation logic, and latch the emergency alarm until acknowledged.
Add a watchdog for sensor updates: if temperature [degC] or humidity [%] values are not updated within 2 s, raise a communications timeout fault.
Implement dynamic sampling for air quality [ppm]: poll at 0.2 Hz normally, increase to 2 Hz when the value exceeds 800 [ppm], and revert after 5 minutes of normal levels.
Add a startup self-test that checks temperature [degC], humidity [%], and pressure [hPa] are within plausible ranges; inhibit environmental alarms until self-test passes or a 10 s timeout occurs.
Create an alarm handling state machine for CO [ppm] with states Idle, Warning, Alarm, and Acknowledged. Thresholds at 30 and 60 [ppm], manual acknowledge input, and clear rules with hysteresis.
Use light [lux] to adapt humidity alarm thresholds: at Night (<50 [lux]) use 70 [%], during Day (>=50 [lux]) use 60 [%]; apply 5 [%] hysteresis to transitions and thresholds.
Implement rate-of-change detection: if temperature [degC] increases faster than 2 [degC]/min for 3 minutes, raise a 'rapid heating' alert even if absolute thresholds are not reached.

Fuse two humidity sensors [%] using a weighted average that down-weights a sensor when it deviates by more than 5 [%] from the other. Expose the fused value and raise a fault if the disagreement persists for 10 minutes.

Implement a PID controller to maintain ambient temperature at 24 [degC] using a 0–100 [%] fan-speed command. Include anti-windup, and cut output to 0 [%] with an alarm if temperature exceeds 60 [degC].

Create a complementary filter that blends a fast-response thermistor [degC] with a slower calibrated reference [degC] to produce a stable temperature estimate. Sample at 10 Hz and ensure processing WCET < 2 ms.

Perform pressure sensor fusion using two barometers [hPa] with outlier rejection (discard samples more than 3 [hPa] from the median). Compute trend via linear regression over the last 15 minutes and raise a storm alert when appropriate.

Humidity control loop: PID regulates a dehumidifier command 0–100 [%] to maintain 55 [%] humidity. Disable control and assert a fault if humidity reads <0 [%] or >100 [%], or if temperature [degC] is below 5 [degC].
Compute an indoor comfort index from temperature [degC], humidity [%], and CO2 [ppm]; raise staged alerts and drive a guidance output 0–100 [%] indicating recommended ventilation intensity.
Implement an over-temperature protection state machine: pre-alarm at 70 [degC], shutdown at 80 [degC], cooldown recovery below 65 [degC]. Log all state transitions with timestamps for traceability.
Design a sampling scheduler: temperature [degC] at 10 Hz, humidity [%] at 2 Hz, pressure [hPa] at 1 Hz, light [lux] at 10 Hz, VOC [ppb] at 1 Hz. Enforce total CPU time per cycle under 5 ms (WCET).

Estimate dew point [degC] and absolute humidity [g/m3] from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]; if dew point rises within 1 [degC] of a provided surface temperature input, issue an immediate condensation alarm.

Implement a CO2 [ppm] alarm with dynamic baseline correction: adapt an 8-hour rolling baseline when minimum levels are detected; trigger alert at baseline + 800 [ppm] or absolute 1200 [ppm], whichever is lower.

Create a multi-mode environmental monitor with Normal, High-Precision, Power-Save, and Fault modes. Normal: sample temperature [degC], humidity [%], pressure [hPa], and light [lux] at 2 Hz. High-Precision: 10 Hz with averaging windows. Power-Save: 0.2 Hz with non-critical alarms suppressed. Fault: publish last known safe values and assert a general fault. Provide deterministic scheduling with per-cycle WCET <= 4 ms and debounced mode transitions.

Specify a full air quality supervisory system with modes Standby, Monitor, Alert, and Evacuate. Inputs: CO2 [ppm], CO [ppm], VOC [ppb], PM2.5 [µg/m3], temperature [degC], humidity [%]. Implement plausibility checks, sensor fusion for redundant CO2 channels, latching alarms, manual acknowledge/reset, and a testable sequence of operations. Include timing: 1 Hz fusion cycle with WCET < 3 ms and a 10 Hz fast alarm check.

Design a comprehensive safety system for a clean room: maintain a pressure differential of +15 [Pa] using a PID supervisory signal (0–100 [%]) while monitoring temperature [degC] and humidity [%] alarms. Include fallbacks if any sensor fails (switch to the median of remaining sensors), a Safe mode that commands outputs to predefined safe values, and verification hooks for unit and property-based tests.

Implement a state-oriented environmental controller with Calibration, Warmup, Operational, Degraded, and Shutdown states. During Calibration, block alarms for 60 s and compute offsets for temperature [degC], humidity [%], and pressure [hPa]. In Operational, enforce staged alarms and logging. In Degraded, use conservative thresholds and reduced sampling rates. Guarantee deterministic timing with a 20 ms tick and worst-case computation < 5 ms.

Define a multi-zone monitoring system (up to 4 zones) that aggregates temperature [degC], humidity [%], pressure [hPa], light [lux], and CO2 [ppm] per zone. Provide per-zone alarms with hysteresis, a global 'any-zone critical' output, cross-zone sensor disagreement detection, and built-in test routines. Require a verification plan covering deterministic behavior under load, alarm race-condition tests, and timing conformance at 5 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.

Create a simple overheat monitor: read ambient temperature [degC] and turn on a red alarm output whenever it exceeds 40 degC. Use 2 degC hysteresis (clear the alarm only when below 38 degC) to avoid chattering.
Monitor relative humidity [%] and drive a buzzer when RH drops below 30 %. Silence the buzzer automatically once RH rises to 35 %.
From a pressure sensor reading in kPa, light a warning indicator if pressure falls below 95 kPa. No other behavior is needed.
Use a light sensor (lux) to activate a 'dark' LED when illuminance is under 100 lux, and turn it off when at or above 150 lux.
Trigger a solid red LED if PM2.5 concentration exceeds 35 µg/m³; otherwise keep the LED green.
Turn on a 'ventilate' output when CO2 exceeds 1000 ppm, and turn it off when CO2 drops under 800 ppm.
Indicate 'comfort' by lighting a blue LED only when temperature is between 18 degC and 22 degC inclusive; otherwise keep the LED off.
Drive a dehumidifier relay whenever humidity is above 85 %, and release the relay when it falls to 80 %.
Sound a short beep once every minute while TVOC index is above 5, and stop beeping once it drops below 3.
Activate a frost warning output when temperature is below 0 degC; clear it when temperature rises to at least 2 degC.
Assert a 'bright sunlight' indicator when light level exceeds 50,000 lux; otherwise deassert it.
Raise a high-pressure alert if pressure exceeds 110 kPa and keep it on until pressure returns below 108 kPa.
Validate the humidity sensor reading and if it is outside 0–100 % or not-a-number, set a 'sensor fault' LED; clear the fault once readings become valid for 10 consecutive samples.
Turn on a hazard alarm output whenever the Air Quality Index (AQI) reported by the sensor exceeds 150 and turn it off when AQI is below 100.
Detect rapid temperature spikes: if the temperature increases by more than 5 degC compared to the previous reading, flash an indicator for 10 seconds.
Combine temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%] to drive three LEDs: 'Comfort' (20–24 degC and 40–60 %), 'Too Dry' (RH < 40 %), or 'Too Humid' (RH > 60 %). Ensure only one LED is on at a time.

Design a small state machine for air quality with states Good, Moderate, and Unhealthy based on PM2.5 (Good < 12 µg/m³, Moderate 12–35 µg/m³, Unhealthy > 35 µg/m³) and CO2 (Good < 800 ppm, Moderate 800–1200 ppm, Unhealthy > 1200 ppm). Drive a tri-color LED for each state and require 10 seconds of stable data before transitioning between states.
Use a light sensor in lux to control a three-level brightness output: Low (< 100 lux), Medium (100–1000 lux), High (> 1000 lux). Sample at 10 Hz and limit output changes to at most once per second.

Analyze barometric pressure (hPa) trend over the last 15 minutes to classify Rising, Falling, or Stable. Update an icon output accordingly and require at least a 1 hPa change to declare Rising or Falling.

Create an alarm that triggers if either temperature exceeds 50 degC or humidity exceeds 90 %. Include a user 'silence' input that mutes the buzzer for 5 minutes, but reactivates it immediately if temperature exceeds 55 degC or humidity exceeds 95 %.

Validate temperature [degC], humidity [%], and CO2 [ppm] against plausible ranges; if any sensor is invalid, enter a Fault state and turn on a fault LED for that sensor while keeping alarms inhibited until valid data resumes for 30 seconds.

Implement a latching hazardous PM2.5 alarm: when PM2.5 exceeds 150 µg/m³, sound a siren and light a red LED. Require a manual reset input to clear the latch, which is only allowed after PM2.5 has been below 100 µg/m³ for 2 minutes.

Switch between Day and Night modes based on light level (Night when < 50 lux for 30 s). In Night mode, when CO2 is high (> 1200 ppm) use a low-volume buzzer output instead of the normal loud buzzer used in Day mode.

Control two relays to maintain relative humidity between 45 % and 55 %: engage the humidifier if RH < 45 % and engage the dehumidifier if RH > 55 %. Enforce mutual exclusion so both relays can never be on at the same time, and add 30 s minimum on/off times to reduce wear.

Compute a heat index category using temperature [degC] and humidity [%] and map it to four outputs: Safe, Caution, Extreme Caution, Danger. Sample once per second and do not change the category more often than once every 10 seconds.

Add rate-of-rise detection for temperature: if temperature increases faster than 2 degC per minute, raise a pre-alarm; if absolute temperature exceeds 60 degC, raise a full alarm. Clear the pre-alarm when the rate falls below 1 degC per minute.
Monitor T [degC], RH [%], and PM2.5 [µg/m³]. Blink distinct patterns to indicate which variable is out of range, with the priority order PM2.5 > Temperature > Humidity when multiple are bad.
If the light sensor has not seen above 500 lux for 7 days, set an 'obstructed sensor' indicator. Clear it after the sensor reads above 1000 lux for at least 10 minutes.

Provide a 'test' pushbutton that forces all alarm indicators on for 3 seconds without changing any latches. Also, detect stuck sensors by flagging a fault if any reading (T, RH, CO2) changes by less than 1 unit over 1 hour.

Ventilation control based on CO2: turn on a fan output if CO2 > 1200 ppm sustained for 2 minutes; turn it off only after CO2 < 800 ppm sustained for 5 minutes. Indicate 'Active Ventilation' while the fan is on.

Map AQI to buzzer patterns: Good (0–50) silent, Moderate (51–100) short beep every 60 s, Unhealthy (101–150) beep twice every 30 s, Hazardous (> 150) continuous alarm. Ensure rate limits to avoid pattern overlap.

Use indoor and outdoor temperature sensors plus indoor CO2 to drive a 'Open Window' suggestion: if indoor temp is more than 3 degC above outdoor and CO2 exceeds 1000 ppm, turn on the suggestion indicator. Turn it off otherwise.
Sample temperature, humidity, and CO2 at 5 Hz and ensure processing completes within 2 ms WCET per cycle. If an overrun is detected, switch to a Fault state and light a system fault LED.

Assess condensation risk by comparing dew point (computed from air temperature [degC] and RH [%]) with a window surface temperature sensor [degC]. Indicate Safe when dew point is at least 2 degC below the surface, Warning when within 1–2 degC, and Condensation Likely when equal or higher. Hold each state for at least 60 s before changing.
Track cumulative exposure to heat: accumulate minutes when temperature exceeds 30 degC, and raise an alert after 120 cumulative minutes in a 24-hour period. Reset the counter at midnight local time.

Maintain a small thermal chamber at 25 degC using a heater output with a PID controller. Sample at 10 Hz, clamp output 0–100 %, and include anti-windup. Safety: hard cutoff and latched alarm if temperature exceeds 60 degC or the sensor fails; default heater off on any fault.

Regulate humidity to 50 % using two actuators: a humidifier and a dehumidifier. Use PID for the humidifier (when RH < 50 %) and simple proportional control for the dehumidifier (when RH > 50 %). Enforce a 30 s minimum off time between activations and never energize both simultaneously. Enter a safe state on sensor fault.

Fuse temperature [degC], RH [%], and CO2 [ppm] into a composite comfort score from 0 to 100 using filtered signals. Drive graded alerts based on thresholds (e.g., < 40 Poor, 40–70 Fair, > 70 Good). Guarantee a WCET of 2 ms at 10 Hz and flag a timing fault if exceeded.

Implement robust pressure monitoring with a 5-sample median filter and step-change detection. If pressure jumps more than 5 hPa within 1 second, mark the reading as outlier, hold the last good value, and raise a transient fault indicator for 30 seconds.

Detect hazardous air quality by combining PM2.5 [µg/m³], CO2 [ppm], and TVOC index. Trigger an emergency alarm if any two of the three exceed their limits (PM2.5 > 150, CO2 > 2000, TVOC > 8). Require 10 minutes below all limits before allowing manual reset.

Compute dew point using the Magnus formula from temperature [degC] and RH [%], then modulate a ventilation output proportionally to the difference between air temperature and dew point to minimize condensation risk. Sample at 5 Hz with a WCET of 1 ms; fail safe (vent off) on invalid inputs.

Schedule a nightly light-sensor baseline calibration when ambient light stays below 10 lux for at least 30 minutes. During calibration, suppress alarms; abort calibration immediately if any environmental alarm activates. Persist the new baseline and resume normal monitoring.

Use dual redundant temperature sensors for safety. If their readings differ by more than 2 degC, enter a Discrepancy state, raise a fault, and use the higher reading for safety decisions. If one sensor fails, continue with the other while logging the fault; if both fail, force outputs to a safe state.

Predict CO2 levels using linear regression over the last 5 minutes of data. If the projected value 10 minutes ahead exceeds 1200 ppm, pre-emptively enable ventilation. Prevent oscillation by enforcing a minimum 5-minute on time and 5-minute off time.

Create a thermal runaway detector with three criteria: absolute temperature > 70 degC, rate-of-rise > 5 degC/min, or sustained temperature > 60 degC for 10 minutes. Escalate from Warning to Shutdown with latching alarms. Run at 100 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 ms.

Build a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes Normal, Quiet Hours, Calibration, and Emergency. Monitor temperature [degC], humidity [%], CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [µg/m³], and light (lux). Each mode has specific thresholds and alarm behaviors (e.g., reduced buzzer at night, stricter limits in Emergency). Include persistent latches, a manual acknowledge input, sampling at 5 Hz, WCET ≤ 2 ms, and a safe fallback on any fault.

Design a control panel state machine with phases Startup Self-Test, Operate, Fault, and Service for an indoor air-quality station. During Self-Test verify sensor ranges and indicators; in Operate, enforce alarm logic for CO2, PM2.5, and temperature with hysteresis; in Fault, place outputs in a predefined safe state. Specify watchdog behavior, sampling rates, WCET, and test cases for sensor disconnection and stuck-at values.

Implement a multi-zone environmental monitor for four zones, each with T [degC], RH [%], CO2 [ppm], and light (lux). Provide Day, Night, and Emergency modes with different averaging windows, thresholds, and indicator behaviors. Ensure per-cycle WCET ≤ 3 ms at 5 Hz despite scaling to four zones, and define priority rules for global alarms.

Create a greenhouse monitoring and control module with modes Germination, Growth, and Night. Maintain target ranges for temperature [degC] and humidity [%] using PID where appropriate, compute vapor pressure deficit (from T and RH) for plant stress indication, and raise alarms on limit violations. Include safety cutoffs, sensor fault handling, and a verification plan with boundary and failure-injection tests.

Specify an outdoor air-quality monitoring station with modes Operation, Maintenance, Calibration, and Fault. Fuse PM2.5 and PM10 to compute AQI, validate CO2 and TVOC readings, and enforce alarm thresholds with hold times. Require traceable units, timestamps on samples, WCET ≤ 2 ms at 5 Hz, and a comprehensive test matrix including timing overruns, noisy data, and reboot persistence.
Turn on a warning buzzer whenever ambient temperature exceeds 45 degC, and turn it off only after it drops below 43 degC to provide hysteresis.
Illuminate a DRY indicator if relative humidity falls below 30%, and clear it when humidity rises above 35%.
Raise a HIGH PRESSURE alarm when barometric pressure is greater than 1030 hPa and clear the alarm when it falls below 1025 hPa.
Turn on a LOW LIGHT LED when illumination is under 50 lux and switch it off when light exceeds 80 lux.
Trigger a POOR AIR alarm if PM2.5 concentration exceeds 35 ug/m3; clear the alarm when it drops below 25 ug/m3.
Enable a cooling fan whenever temperature is above 30 degC and disable it when temperature goes below 28 degC.
While temperature is greater than 60 degC, flash a red LED at 2 Hz; keep the LED off otherwise.
If relative humidity stays above 85% continuously for 10 minutes, emit a short beep once per minute until humidity falls below 80%.
Activate a FREEZE warning when temperature is below 2 degC and clear it when temperature rises above 4 degC.
Light a COMFORT LED only when relative humidity is between 40% and 60% inclusive; turn it off outside this range.
Turn on a SUNLIGHT indicator when light exceeds 10000 lux and turn it off when light falls below 8000 lux.
Assert a STORM ALERT when barometric pressure drops below 990 hPa and clear it once pressure rises above 995 hPa.
Log a single Overheat event message each time the temperature goes above 80 degC, and do not repeat until it has first fallen below 75 degC.
Map humidity percentage to a green LED brightness so that 0% equals off and 100% equals full brightness, updating once per second.
Sound a continuous alarm when the air quality index (AQI) exceeds 150 and stop the alarm when AQI returns below 120.

Create a comfort status indicator with four states (COLD, COMFORT, HUMID, HOT) based on temperature in degC and relative humidity %, with clearly defined thresholds and priority when both are abnormal.

Control a dehumidifier so it turns on when relative humidity is above 70% and temperature is above 20 degC, and turns off only after humidity falls below 65%; include a 60 s minimum on/off time to prevent rapid cycling.
When air quality is poor (PM2.5 > 25 ug/m3), issue alarms visually and audibly; during nighttime (light < 10 lux) suppress the buzzer and use only the visual alarm.

Design a small state machine with states IDLE, MONITORING, and ALARM that enters ALARM if PM2.5 > 50 ug/m3 or CO2 > 1500 ppm, latches until levels are safe for 60 s, and requires a user acknowledge to clear.
Compute a heat stress indicator from temperature in degC and relative humidity %, and trigger a HEAT WARNING when the computed value exceeds a configurable threshold; update once per second.
Show barometric pressure trend as RISING, STEADY, or FALLING by comparing the change in hPa per hour, updating every minute with thresholds of plus or minus 1 hPa per hour.

If temperature > 35 degC and light > 50000 lux, raise a DIRECT SUN OVERHEAT alarm; if temperature > 35 degC and light is less than or equal to 50000 lux, raise an ENCLOSURE OVERHEAT alarm; otherwise no alarm.

Implement two-level CO2 alarms: CAUTION at 1000 ppm or above (yellow LED) and WARNING at 1500 ppm or above (red LED plus buzzer), with 100 ppm hysteresis and an alarm silence button that mutes the buzzer for 10 minutes.
Control ventilation: turn the fan on when AQI > 100 or relative humidity > 80%, and turn it off only after both AQI < 80 and humidity < 70% have been sustained for 5 minutes.

Adapt the sampling rate based on ambient light: sample sensors at 1 Hz when light is greater than or equal to 10 lux and at 0.2 Hz when light is below 10 lux, ensuring the maximum interval between samples never exceeds 6 s.

Add sensor plausibility checks: if temperature is outside -40 to 125 degC or relative humidity outside 0% to 100%, assert a SENSOR FAULT alarm and inhibit control outputs until readings return to plausible ranges.
Monitor both temperature and dew point sensors and trigger a CONDENSATION RISK alert when temperature is within 2 degC of the dew point for more than 2 minutes; clear after a 5 minute safe margin.
Apply a 10-sample moving average to PM2.5 readings at 1 Hz before comparing to thresholds, to reduce false alarms from noise.
Support seasonal setpoints: when in WINTER mode, raise a FREEZE alert below 2 degC; when in SUMMER mode, raise a HEAT alert above 35 degC; mode is selectable via an input flag.
Indicate RAIN LIKELY when relative humidity is above 90% and barometric pressure has been falling faster than 1 hPa per hour over the last 2 hours; clear when either condition is no longer true.
Adjust a display’s brightness in discrete steps based on ambient light, and rate-limit changes to no more than once every 2 s to prevent flicker.
Escalate an AQI alarm: start with fast blinking when AQI > 150, and if AQI remains > 200 for more than 5 minutes change to steady on plus buzzer; revert when AQI < 120.
Use both indoor and outdoor temperature sensors to raise a DRAFT RISK alert if the difference exceeds 10 degC for more than 3 minutes.
Implement humidity alarm debounce: require relative humidity to be at or above 70% for 30 s before setting the alarm, and at or below 65% for 30 s before clearing it.
Only enable ventilation when poor air quality is detected (AQI > 100) and the room is likely occupied (light > 100 lux); otherwise keep the fan off.

Use a PID controller to regulate fan speed to maintain ambient temperature at 25 degC, sampling at 10 Hz; include anti-windup, output limiting, and a safety override that forces full speed and raises an alarm if temperature exceeds 60 degC.

Fuse readings from two temperature sensors to produce a robust temperature estimate: reject outliers if they differ by more than 3 degC, average otherwise, and use the fused value for threshold alarms.

Compute absolute humidity (g/m3) from temperature in degC and relative humidity %, and control a dehumidifier to keep absolute humidity below a configurable target; trigger a safety alarm if absolute humidity exceeds target by 20% for 10 minutes.

Implement fault detection, isolation, and recovery for a PM2.5 sensor: detect stuck readings, excessive noise, or out-of-range values; switch to a degraded mode using a secondary sensor if available and raise a SENSOR FAULT alarm.

Combine PM2.5, PM10, TVOC, and CO2 readings to compute a composite air quality score, with weighted contributions and capped influence of any single pollutant, and drive multi-level alarms with hysteresis.

Apply temperature compensation to the humidity reading using a calibration curve based on current temperature in degC, then evaluate alarms using the compensated humidity; log both raw and compensated values.

Predict barometric pressure 1 hour ahead using linear regression over the last 3 hours of data sampled every minute; raise an EARLY STORM ALERT if the predicted pressure will fall below 990 hPa; ensure each regression computation completes within a WCET of 5 ms.

Control a variable-speed ventilation fan to keep CO2 below 800 ppm using PID at 5 Hz; if CO2 exceeds 2000 ppm, trigger an immediate full-speed override and an audible alarm; cap computation WCET at 4 ms.

Monitor for thermal runaway by tracking both absolute temperature and its rate of rise; if temperature > 85 degC or the slope exceeds 20 degC per minute, cut outputs to a safe state, latch an alarm, and require manual reset after cooldown.

Use three redundant temperature sensors with 2-out-of-3 voting; if any sensor deviates by more than 3 degC from the median, flag a fault on that channel, compute a fused value from the remaining sensors, and degrade gracefully if only two sensors remain.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes NORMAL, ENERGY_SAVE, and EMERGENCY; define sampling rates (for example 1 Hz, 0.2 Hz, and 5 Hz), WCET limits per cycle (no more than 3 ms), alarm modalities per mode, and strict safety thresholds for temperature in degC, humidity %, pressure in hPa, and AQI; include a test plan with threshold crossing, hysteresis, and sensor fault injection cases.

Build a cold chain supervisor with states PRECOOL, STABLE, DOOR_OPEN, and ALARM; maintain temperature between 2 and 8 degC and humidity below 70%; if temperature exceeds 8 degC for more than 5 minutes or drops below 0 degC, enter ALARM and latch until manual acknowledgment; specify timing with a 1 Hz loop and WCET no more than 2 ms, and provide acceptance tests for transitions and alarms.

Create a smart ventilation controller with modes AUTO (PID on CO2 to maintain below 800 ppm), MANUAL (fixed speed), and SAFE (full speed on any alarm such as AQI > 200 or temperature > 60 degC); include sensor fault handling, alarm latching rules, rate limits on setpoint changes, and a verification plan with step tests and fault scenarios.

Develop a comprehensive indoor environment monitor that fuses temperature (degC), relative humidity (%), barometric pressure (hPa), PM2.5 (ug/m3), and CO2 (ppm) into multi-level health advisories; include redundancy checks, state-based diagnostics (OK, DEGRADED, FAULT), strict safety thresholds with hysteresis, a 1 Hz update rate, WCET no more than 5 ms, and a detailed test matrix covering normal, boundary, and failure cases.

Specify an early smoke and heat detection state machine that monitors rapid increases in particulate concentration (PM2.5 ug/m3) and temperature rise rate (degC per minute) alongside absolute thresholds, minimizes false alarms with debounce and multi-sensor corroboration, enforces EMERGENCY mode behavior on alarm, and includes a comprehensive set of unit tests and logged events for certification.
Monitor a single temperature input in degC and turn on a 'overheat_alarm' output when it exceeds 50 degC, and turn it off only after it falls below 48 degC (2 degC hysteresis). Sample at 1 Hz.
Watch relative humidity (%) and assert 'high_humidity' when RH > 80%, clearing only when RH < 77% (3% hysteresis).
Set 'low_pressure' true if ambient pressure drops below 95 kPa, and keep it latched until pressure rises above 96 kPa.
Create a 'too_dark' indicator that becomes true when illuminance is below 100 lux and clears when it rises above 110 lux.
Raise an 'co2_alarm' whenever CO2 exceeds 1000 ppm; otherwise keep it off.
Generate a 'freeze_alarm' when temperature goes below 0 degC and clear it only after temperature rises to at least 1 degC.
Drive a 'dry_air' warning if relative humidity falls under 30%, clearing it when RH returns to 32% or more.
Set 'voc_bad' to true when the VOC index is greater than 150; otherwise false.
Turn on 'pm25_alarm' if PM2.5 exceeds 35 ug/m3, and turn it off only after it drops below 30 ug/m3.
Expose a 'comfort_temp_ok' flag that is true only while temperature stays between 18 degC and 26 degC inclusive.
Create a 'glare_warning' when illuminance is above 8000 lux.
Assert 'high_pressure' whenever pressure is greater than 103 kPa; clear it when it falls below 102 kPa.
If the temperature reading has not updated within 2 s, set 'temp_sensor_fault' and suppress other temperature-based alarms until data is fresh again.
Raise a 'condensation_warning' when relative humidity is at or above 95%.
Provide a 'bright_enough' signal that is true when illuminance is at least 400 lux and false otherwise.

Build a three-state temperature monitor with states Normal (18–26 degC), Warning (15–18 or 26–30 degC), and Critical (<15 or >30 degC). Downgrade between states only after 30 s stable in the lower severity band. Drive separate outputs for each state and a common 'temp_alarm' that is true in Warning or Critical.

Use temperature (degC) and relative humidity (%) to compute a heat index and assert 'heat_alert' if the index exceeds 32 degC, clearing below 31 degC. Run at 1 Hz with a worst-case execution time under 2 ms.
Flag 'plant_stress' when temperature > 35 degC or relative humidity < 25%. While stressed, blink an 'alarm' output at 2 Hz; otherwise keep it off.

Create an air quality status with three levels: Green (CO2 <= 800 ppm), Yellow (801–1200 ppm), Red (>1200 ppm). Apply a 30 s moving average for level decisions but switch immediately to Red if CO2 exceeds 2000 ppm.
Implement day/night detection from illuminance with thresholds Night < 200 lux and Day > 300 lux (hysteresis). Require the condition to hold continuously for 5 minutes before changing state.
Detect barometric trend by comparing pressure readings 10 minutes apart: output 'rising', 'steady', or 'falling' based on a +/-1 hPa deadband. Update the trend once per minute.
Compute dew point from temperature (degC) and relative humidity (%) and raise 'condensation_risk' when the dew point is within 2 degC of a provided surface temperature input.

Provide two-stage humidity alarms: 'rh_warning' above 70% (clear below 65%) and 'rh_critical' above 85% (clear below 80%). Require manual reset input to clear 'rh_critical' after it has been triggered.
If CO2 stays above 1000 ppm continuously for 10 minutes, set 'ventilate_now'. Clear it only after CO2 remains below 800 ppm for 5 minutes.
Drive a 'dehumidify_request' when RH > 60% and temperature > 22 degC. Clear the request when RH < 55% or temperature < 20 degC. Sample at 1 Hz.
When PM2.5 exceeds 55 ug/m3, generate an 'alarm_beeper' pattern: three short pulses followed by 1 s silence, repeating while the condition persists.
For illuminance, ignore spikes that change by more than 2000 lux within one 100 ms sample interval. Use the despiked value for all alarm decisions.
Set 'comfort_band_ok' true only when all of the following hold: 21–24 degC, 40–60% RH, CO2 < 900 ppm, and PM2.5 < 12 ug/m3. Evaluate once per second.
Assert a 'shutdown_request' if temperature > 60 degC or RH > 95%. Latch this request until a 'manual_reset' input is held true for 2 s and both parameters have returned below safe thresholds.
Issue a 'storm_warning' when pressure < 980 hPa and the trend is falling; require 30 minutes of steady or rising pressure to clear.
Integrate illuminance over time to estimate daily exposure in kilolux-hours; set 'overexposed' when the daily total exceeds 40 klx·h and reset the total at a daily 'midnight' trigger.
Implement humidity alarm with rate limiting: trigger above 85% (clear below 80%), but do not change alarm state more than once per minute.
Provide two temperature high alarms: High1 at 40 degC (clear at 38 degC) and High2 at 50 degC (clear at 48 degC). Drive separate outputs and a combined 'any_high' flag.
Monitor temperature, RH, and CO2 for data freshness. If any channel is stale for more than 3 s, assert 'data_stale' and temporarily inhibit all severity alarms until all channels are fresh.

At startup, learn ambient light baseline over the first 5 s and set a 'glare_threshold' to twice that baseline. Provide a 'recalibrate' input that restarts this learning. Raise 'glare' when illuminance exceeds the current threshold.

Fuse three temperature sensors sampled every 100 ms using a median filter to produce 'fused_temp'. If the spread (max - min) exceeds 3 degC, set 'temp_disagree' and use the minimum value for safety-related alarms. Ensure WCET <= 1 ms.

Combine two relative humidity sensors with a weighted average (favor sensor A 60/40). If their absolute difference exceeds 10% for more than 60 s, assert 'rh_fault'. Use the fused RH to drive 'mold_risk' when RH > 85% for 30 minutes.

Implement a PID controller that outputs a 0–100% 'dehumidifier_command' to maintain RH at 55%. Sample at 2 Hz, include anti-windup and output limiting, and force the command to 0% with an 'sensor_fail' alarm if RH data is stale > 2 s or out of 0–100% range.

Provide a PID-based 'fan_command' (0–100%) to keep CO2 near a 900 ppm setpoint. Include rate limiting on command changes (max 10% per second), integral anti-windup, and a failsafe that clamps to 0% if CO2 is invalid or stale for > 3 s.

Predict condensation risk by computing dew point from temperature (degC) and RH (%) and extrapolating 5 minutes ahead using recent trends. If predicted dew point will be within 1 degC of surface temperature, assert 'preemptive_condensation_alarm'.

Compute an overall air quality score (0–100) from CO2 (ppm), VOC index, and PM2.5 (ug/m3) using weighted contributions. Flag 'air_quality_poor' when the score < 40. Validate each sensor against plausible ranges and saturate inputs. Sample at 1 Hz with WCET <= 3 ms.

Use two redundant CO2 sensors and perform a 1-out-of-2 voter: when both are healthy, use their average; if they differ by > 150 ppm for more than 120 s, declare 'co2_drift' and automatically select the lower reading for safety. Enter 'co2_sensor_fault' if both are invalid.

Aggregate readings from three pressure sensors with a median filter to produce a stable pressure estimate and compute altitude. Raise 'pressure_disagree' if any sensor deviates by > 2 hPa from the median for > 30 s.

Create a safety interlock that monitors temperature (>70 degC), RH (>98%), CO2 (>3000 ppm), and PM2.5 (>150 ug/m3). Trigger 'EmergencyShutdown' when any two parameters are in Critical for 10 s, or immediately if temperature > 85 degC. Latch until manual reset and conditions are safe.

Implement online calibration for the primary temperature channel using a periodic reference measurement. Limit offset changes to +/-2 degC per day and raise 'calibration_fault' if the required offset magnitude ever exceeds 5 degC.

Build a four-zone monitor that ingests per-zone temperature (degC) and RH (%) to compute zone averages, detect hotspots (>3 degC above average), and flag 'zone_discomfort' if any zone is outside 20–25 degC or 40–60% RH. Support modes 'EnergySaving' and 'ComfortPriority' with slightly different thresholds. Provide a test plan covering threshold edges, missing sensor data, and ensuring end-to-end latency < 50 ms at 10 Hz.

Develop a redundant sensing framework with 2x temperature, 2x RH, and 2x CO2 per location. Implement 1-out-of-2 voting with hysteresis per signal, cross-channel plausibility checks, automatic channel deselection on persistent faults, and a 'degraded_mode' indicator. Include self-test routines and specify WCET, sampling rates, and acceptance tests for fault injection scenarios.

Create a multi-mode environmental controller that primarily monitors but can regulate conditions during heat waves: Normal mode monitors and alarms; Heatwave mode targets 26 degC and 50% RH using PID requests (0–100%) for cooling and dehumidification; Safety mode overrides everything to maximize ventilation if CO2 > 2000 ppm. Define state machine transitions, safety thresholds, and comprehensive tests (step responses, sensor dropouts, WCET 3 ms).

Specify a safety-certified air quality monitoring application that fuses CO2 (ppm), VOC index, PM2.5 (ug/m3), temperature (degC), and RH (%). Define an alarm state machine with levels Info/Advisory/Warning/Critical, sampling at 2 Hz, WCET <= 1 ms, a watchdog heartbeat, and deterministic behavior under noisy inputs. Require unit tests, boundary tests, latching rules, and documented behavior under stale or failed sensors.
Turn on an alarm LED whenever the measured air temperature exceeds 45 degC, and turn it off when temperature falls back below 45 degC. Sample at 2 Hz.
Trigger a buzzer if relative humidity drops below 30 %, and clear the buzzer only after humidity rises to at least 35 % (hysteresis).
Control a lamp using a light sensor: if ambient light is below 100 lux, turn the lamp ON, otherwise turn it OFF. Add a 1 s minimum ON time to avoid flicker.
Raise an alarm when barometric pressure falls below 95 kPa, and keep the alarm active until pressure returns above 96 kPa.
Switch a ventilation relay ON when CO2 concentration exceeds 1000 ppm, and switch it OFF when CO2 falls below 900 ppm.
Activate a warning indicator if PM2.5 exceeds 35 ug/m3, and deactivate it when PM2.5 is under 25 ug/m3.
When daylight exceeds 20000 lux, close a shade actuator; reopen it when illuminance drops below 15000 lux.
Issue a freeze protection alarm if temperature goes below 0 degC, with a manual reset required to clear the alarm.
Turn on a high humidity warning if relative humidity is above 85 %, and turn it off when humidity is below 80 %.
If a sudden light spike above 5000 lux is detected, blink a status LED for 1 s, then return to normal.
Latch an overpressure alarm when pressure exceeds 105 kPa; require a manual reset input to clear the latched alarm.
Sound an alarm siren when the air quality index (AQI) is above 150, and silence it when AQI drops below 120.
If any sensor reading is invalid or out of range, illuminate a fault LED and suppress normal alarms until readings recover.
Illuminate a 'comfort' indicator only when temperature is between 20 and 24 degC and relative humidity is between 40 % and 60 %.
Immediately cut power to a heater output if temperature exceeds 60 degC to ensure safety, with no automatic restart.
Control a two-speed ventilator from CO2: engage LOW speed above 800 ppm and HIGH speed above 1200 ppm, with 100 ppm hysteresis on each threshold and a 60 s minimum run time per speed.
Indicate thermal comfort only if temperature is between 20-25 degC and humidity is 30-55 %, otherwise show 'not comfortable'. Use separate LEDs for comfort and not-comfort.
Map ambient light to a 0-100 % dimming output: 0 % at 0 lux and 100 % at 20000 lux, clamped to those limits.
Detect rapid overheating: if temperature rises faster than 3 degC per minute, assert a pre-emptive warning; clear the warning when the rate falls below 1 degC per minute.
Monitor weather tendency: if pressure drops more than 2 kPa within 10 minutes, set a storm alert; reset it when the 10-minute drop is less than 1 kPa.
Build a small state machine for PM2.5 with states: NORMAL, ALERT, ALARM based on thresholds 12, 35, and 55 ug/m3, with 30 s entry and exit delays; sample at 1 Hz.
Track and display the minimum and maximum temperature (degC) observed over the last hour, and light a warning LED if either exceeds a safety range 0-50 degC.
When humidity exceeds 70 %, run a dehumidifier in a 5 min ON / 5 min OFF duty cycle until humidity drops below 60 %, then stop.
Use a moving average of the last 5 light samples to decide ON below 200 lux and OFF above 300 lux; sample at 10 Hz to prevent flicker.
Turn on ventilation when either VOC index is 'high' or CO2 is above 1200 ppm, and enforce a 30 s cooldown after turning OFF to avoid rapid cycling.
Read two temperature sensors; if they differ by more than 2 degC, raise a sensor fault; otherwise display the average temperature on a 0-100 % gauge representing 0-50 degC.
Adjust humidity alarm thresholds based on ambient light: at night (light < 50 lux) trigger high humidity at 90 %, in daytime trigger at 80 %; include 5 % hysteresis.
Implement three temperature alarm stages: WARNING at 35 degC, ALARM at 45 degC, and EMERGENCY cutoff at 55 degC with latching cutoff; add 2 degC hysteresis between stages.
If PM2.5 stays above 25 ug/m3 for a cumulative 8 hours within any 24-hour window, flash a service reminder LED until acknowledged.
When CO2 exceeds 1200 ppm, beep a buzzer for 1 s every 10 minutes until a user acknowledges; stop beeping once CO2 is below 1000 ppm.
Sample humidity at 2 Hz, ignore any single-sample jumps greater than 10 %, compute a 10 s average, and alarm if the average exceeds 75 %.
Trigger a high-priority combined alarm only when both temperature is above 40 degC and humidity is above 70 %; otherwise, use separate lower-priority alerts.
Control a corridor light with hysteresis: turn ON when illuminance is below 150 lux and turn OFF when it exceeds 250 lux; check the sensor at 5 Hz.
Create a state machine for air quality indicator with states GOOD, MODERATE, and POOR using AQI bands; require a 30 s dwell time before any downgrade or upgrade.
After power-up, ignore all sensor readings for 30 s as a warm-up phase, then enable normal temperature and humidity alarms with the thresholds provided.

Implement PID control to maintain 22 degC with a heater output limited to 0-100 %, sample at 10 Hz, include anti-windup, and immediately cut and latch a fault if temperature exceeds 50 degC; ensure WCET <= 2 ms.
Regulate relative humidity to 50 % using a fan with PID control at 2 Hz, clamp the duty cycle between 20-100 %, enforce a minimum 30 s off-time, and guarantee WCET <= 1 ms.

Fuse two humidity sensors into a single estimate using a filtered median; if their readings disagree by more than 8 %, flag a sensor fault and use the lower reading; if both are invalid, fall back to a safe default of 45 %.

Combine three temperature sensors with outlier rejection by ignoring values more than 1.5 degC from the median, then compute a weighted average; limit the fused rate of change to 5 degC/min and enforce safety at 0 degC and 60 degC.

Compute dew point from temperature (degC) and relative humidity (%) to predict condensation risk; if dew point is within 2 degC of a measured surface temperature, start dehumidification; run at 2 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.
Control ventilation level based on both CO2 (ppm) and VOC index using a 0-100 % output; guarantee at least 20 % ventilation above 2000 ppm CO2 and raise an emergency alarm at 5000 ppm.

Calculate sea-level pressure from measured pressure and temperature, maintain a bias estimate over time, and assert a storm warning when a sustained drop of >4 hPa occurs within 3 hours; sample at 1 Hz with WCET <= 3 ms.

Adapt the light alarm threshold using a 5-minute moving average baseline so the trigger is 30 % below the baseline; fall back to a fixed 200 lux threshold if data are insufficient and keep WCET <= 1 ms.

Filter PM2.5 with exponential smoothing and raise a high alarm only when the 15-minute average is >35 ug/m3 and the instantaneous value is >55 ug/m3; latch the high alarm for 10 minutes once triggered.

Use cascade control for humidity: an outer loop targets 40 % RH by adjusting a dew point setpoint, and an inner PID loop controls temperature to that dew point; cap temperature at 28 degC, latch a fault on humidity sensor failure, run at 5 Hz with WCET <= 4 ms.

Design a multi-mode air quality controller with modes NORMAL, HIGH_POLLUTION, EMERGENCY, and MAINTENANCE. Use CO2 (ppm), PM2.5 (ug/m3), and VOC index to determine mode transitions with hysteresis and 60 s dwell times. In EMERGENCY, sound alarms and force ventilation to 100 %. Provide manual ACK and RESET handling, fail-safe defaults on sensor loss, a 2 Hz update rate, and WCET <= 2 ms.

Specify a redundant environmental monitor using dual temperature and dual humidity sensors with cross-checking and majority voting. Provide a fused temperature (degC) and humidity (%) output, flag discrepancies >2 degC or >5 %, and switch to a degraded but safe mode if any sensor fails. Include a power-up self-test, a periodic 1-hour sensor sanity test, 10 Hz sampling, and WCET <= 1 ms.

Create a greenhouse environment supervisor with modes GERMINATION, GROWTH, and DORMANCY that enforce target ranges in degC and %. Use PID loops for heating and humidification where needed, raise staged alarms for deviations, and drop to a safe fallback mode on sensor faults. Define timing (2 Hz control, WCET <= 3 ms) and manual override behavior.

Develop a safety-certified sampling and alarm module that measures temperature (degC), humidity (%), pressure (kPa), and light (lux) at a fixed 10 Hz rate with WCET <= 2 ms. Clamp inputs to physical limits, reject glitches, timestamp samples monotonically, and issue alarms when any signal exceeds configurable safety thresholds.

Implement a comfort index fusion algorithm that combines temperature (degC), humidity (%), and CO2 (ppm) into a 0-100 % comfort score, with a state machine for NORMAL and ENERGY_SAVER modes. Enforce safety cutouts at >45 degC or >80 % RH, include watchdog handling, specify transition criteria and timing (1 Hz, WCET <= 1 ms), and list the required tests for thresholds, state transitions, and fault handling.
Write logic that turns on an alarm output when ambient temperature exceeds 30 [degC] and turns it off when temperature is 30 [degC] or lower.
Control a dehumidifier output: enable it when relative humidity is above 70 [%] and disable it otherwise. Add a visible 'dehumidifying' indicator.
Raise a 'low pressure' alarm when barometric pressure drops below 95 [kPa]; clear the alarm when pressure returns to at least 95 [kPa].
Set a 'dark' flag when illuminance is below 60 [lux], and unset it when illuminance is 60 [lux] or higher.
Activate a ventilation alert if CO2 concentration exceeds 1200 [ppm]. Turn the alert off when CO2 is at or below 1200 [ppm].
Trigger a 'dust warning' whenever PM2.5 rises above 35 [ug/m3]. Clear the warning when PM2.5 returns to 35 [ug/m3] or below.
Raise a 'condensation risk' alert whenever relative humidity exceeds 85 [%].
Trigger a 'glare' warning when measured light level exceeds 80000 [lux].
Set a 'cold' indicator if temperature falls below 10 [degC]; clear it when temperature rises to 10 [degC] or above.
Set a 'heat' indicator when temperature rises above 40 [degC], and clear it when temperature is 40 [degC] or below.
Compute a 'comfort_ok' boolean that is true only when relative humidity is between 40 [%] and 60 [%] inclusive; otherwise false.
Turn on an air quality alarm if ozone exceeds 100 [ppb]; turn it off when ozone is at or below 100 [ppb].
Issue a 'storm_warning' when barometric pressure is below 90 [kPa]; clear the warning once pressure is back to 90 [kPa] or higher.
Set 'good_light' true when illuminance is within 300 to 1000 [lux] inclusive; set it false otherwise.
Raise an alarm if the storage temperature is outside 2..8 [degC]; clear the alarm when it returns to within 2..8 [degC].
Implement temperature-driven fan control with hysteresis: fan ON above 28 [degC], fan OFF below 26 [degC]. Sample at 10 Hz and raise an alarm if the temperature sensor is unavailable.
Create dual-level humidity alarms: 'warning' when RH > 60 [%], 'alarm' when RH > 80 [%]. Apply 2 [%] hysteresis to avoid chatter and drive distinct outputs.
Build a day/night state machine using light in [lux]: enter Day after >= 2000 [lux] for 30 s; enter Night after < 200 [lux] for 30 s. Expose the current state and time of last transition.
Detect rapid pressure drops: if barometric pressure falls by more than 2 [kPa] within 10 minutes, raise a storm_alert. Clear only after 30 minutes without further drop.
Compute a 30 s moving average of CO2 at 1 Hz. Raise a high_CO2 alarm when the average exceeds 1000 [ppm], ignoring spikes shorter than 5 s.
Calculate dew point from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]; assert a condensation_warning if dew point is within 2 [degC] of ambient.
Cross-check two temperature sensors: if their difference exceeds 2 [degC] for over 10 s, raise a sensor_mismatch alarm. Publish the median value as the fused temperature.
Categorize PM2.5 into three states: green (<12 [ug/m3]), yellow (12..35 [ug/m3]), red (>35 [ug/m3]). Require 10 s persistence before changing state and drive matching indicator outputs.
Adjust sampling rates based on light level: in Night (<100 [lux]) sample at 1 Hz; in Day (>1000 [lux]) sample at 5 Hz. Use hysteresis between 100 and 1000 [lux].
Every 60 s, report the minimum and maximum temperature [degC] and humidity [%] observed in that window, sampled at 1 Hz. Ensure values are reset safely at each window start.
For high CO2, require the threshold to be exceeded for 5 s before raising the alarm, and require 10 s below the threshold before clearing it. Provide both raw and debounced alarm signals.
Detect a stuck sensor: if any environmental reading (temperature, humidity, pressure, light) is unchanged for more than 60 s while time advances, assert a sensor_stuck fault.
Add a warm-up period for air quality sensors: ignore TVOC/PM alarms during the first 30 s after startup, then enable normal alarm logic.
Compute a simple heat index from temperature [degC] and humidity [%] and classify as Safe, Caution, or Extreme. Raise an alarm in the Extreme category.
Estimate relative altitude from barometric pressure and raise an alarm if climb or descent rate exceeds 5 [m/min]. Provide both current altitude and rate outputs.
Implement a latching cold-chain alarm: if temperature goes outside 2..8 [degC], latch the alarm until a reset input is commanded. Keep measuring and reporting while latched.
Publish both raw and low-pass filtered illuminance [lux]. Use the filtered value to control a 'dim_light' alarm at 200 [lux].
Raise a mold_risk alert when relative humidity exceeds 70 [%] while temperature is below 20 [degC]. Clear the alert when either condition is not met.
