Fuse three temperature sensors with outlier rejection: compute the median, discard any reading deviating by more than 3 [degC] from the median, and average the remaining; if fewer than 2 valid readings remain, enter a fail-safe alarm state.

Estimate ambient temperature using a complementary filter that blends measured temperature [degC] with a slow thermal model, sampling at 5 Hz; expose the filtered estimate and use it for alarm decisions.

Combine CO2 [ppm] and VOC [ppb] into a composite indoor air quality score from 0 to 100 [%] using weighted normalization, and drive green, yellow, and red alarms based on score thresholds of 70 [%] and 40 [%].

Analyze barometric pressure trend using exponential smoothing to compute a 3 hour tendency in [hPa]; assert a storm warning if the drop rate exceeds 2 [hPa]/h for at least 1 h; implement in fixed-point and bound numeric overflow.

Monitor two humidity sensors for redundancy, track slow drift via a moving offset estimate, vote the more conservative value for safety, and declare a fault if disagreement exceeds 5 [%] for more than 60 s.

Implement safety interlocks such that if temperature exceeds 70 [degC] or PM2.5 exceeds 200 [ug/m3], an emergency alarm is asserted immediately and latched until manual reset, independent of other logic; include a watchdog for stale sensor data.

Detect condensation onset by correlating a rise in humidity [%] with a simultaneous drop in temperature [degC] over a 2 minute window; require both conditions with hysteresis and minimum 30 s persistence before alarming; sample at 2 Hz.

Add an online sensor diagnostics task that periodically injects a synthetic step into the processing chain to verify filter settling; if the system does not return to baseline within 5 s, raise a maintenance required alarm and enter a safe mode.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes Normal, Energy-Saving, Alert, and Calibration; define state transitions, per-mode sampling rates for temperature [degC], humidity [%], CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [ug/m3], and light [lux]; enforce latching safety thresholds and fail-safe outputs on any sensor fault; declare WCET limits per mode and run self-tests on mode entry; provide clear acceptance criteria.

Create a system that fuses indoor and outdoor temperature [degC], humidity [%], and pressure [hPa] to produce a ventilation recommendation 0..100 [%]; include outlier rejection, operation with missing sensors, dew point and absolute humidity calculations, and a thorough test plan with unit tests for all computations.

Develop a fire and smoke detector using PM2.5 [ug/m3], carbon monoxide [ppm], and temperature rate-of-rise [degC/min] with two-out-of-three voting; include a latching siren output, a manual silence input, periodic reminder chirps, a deterministic 100 ms main loop with WCET under 5 ms, and a verification plan including fault injection.

Specify an air quality guardian that manages multi-threshold alarms for CO2 [ppm], VOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3], escalating from visual to audible to relay trip; implement hysteresis, persistence timers, daily exposure counters, and provide full requirements traceability with a list of acceptance tests.

Define an environmental monitoring station that schedules sensors at different rates (temperature 10 Hz, humidity 2 Hz, pressure 1 Hz, light 5 Hz, CO2 0.2 Hz), guarantees per-task deadlines and jitter bounds, maintains 24 h rolling min and max, runs startup BIST and periodic online tests, and includes comprehensive test procedures and WCET measurements.
Create a simple overheat alarm: if the measured temperature exceeds 60 [degC], assert an alarm output; clear the alarm when temperature falls back below 58 [degC].
Monitor relative humidity and turn on a warning indicator whenever RH is below 30 [%] or above 70 [%]; turn it off when the value returns within 35–65 [%].
Watch barometric pressure and raise a low-pressure alarm if pressure drops below 950 [hPa].
Turn on a low-light indicator when illuminance falls below 50 [lux]; turn it off when illuminance is at least 80 [lux].
Issue an air quality alarm if CO2 concentration exceeds 1200 [ppm]; clear the alarm when CO2 falls below 1000 [ppm].
If TVOC exceeds 500 [ppb], activate a warning light; deactivate when TVOC is below 300 [ppb].
Trigger a particulate matter alert when PM2.5 exceeds 35 [ug/m3]; clear the alert below 25 [ug/m3].
Provide a freeze warning: assert an alarm if temperature is below 5 [degC], deassert when above 7 [degC].
Control a fan with simple hysteresis: turn ON if temperature exceeds 28 [degC], and turn OFF when it drops below 26 [degC].
Drive a dehumidifier output: turn ON when RH > 65 [%] and turn OFF when RH < 55 [%].
Use a light sensor to switch an indicator: ON when ambient light < 100 [lux], OFF when >= 150 [lux].
Raise an oxygen deficiency alarm if O2 percentage falls below 19.5 [%]; clear when O2 recovers to at least 20.0 [%].
Beep whenever CO2 is at or above 1000 [ppm]; remain silent otherwise.
Show a “bright sun” indicator when illuminance exceeds 50000 [lux]; hide it when below 45000 [lux].
Turn on a “drying” indicator whenever relative humidity is below 40 [%]; turn it off at 45 [%] or higher.
Implement a 3-state humidity monitor: Normal (< 60 [%]), Warning (60–80 [%]), Alarm (> 80 [%]). Latch the Alarm until RH drops below 70 [%]. Sound a buzzer in Alarm.
Control ventilation with CO2 thresholds: Off when CO2 < 800 [ppm], Medium for 800–1200 [ppm], High when > 1200 [ppm]. Raise a high CO2 alarm if > 2000 [ppm].
Sample temperature at 5 Hz and raise a rapid-change alert if rate-of-change exceeds 3 [degC/min]. Ensure WCET per cycle ≤ 2 [ms].
Classify ambient light into Night (< 20 [lux]), Indoor (20–500 [lux]), or Outdoor (> 500 [lux]). Only change class if the value stays in the new range for at least 3 s to prevent chatter.

Combine temperature [degC] and RH [%] to compute comfort levels: OK, Caution, Danger (use your chosen threshold table). Trigger a siren in Danger and require RH or temperature to return to safe levels before clearing.
Detect a storm front: compute pressure trend over a rolling 10 min window; if pressure drops by more than 6 [hPa], assert a storm warning until the drop condition clears for 15 min.
Monitor humidity sensor health: flag a sensor fault if the reading is out-of-range (< 0 [%] or > 100 [%]) or remains unchanged for 30 s. In fault, inhibit dehumidifier control.
Use two temperature sensors to improve reliability: if their difference exceeds 2.0 [degC], raise a sensor disagreement alarm; otherwise output the average temperature.
Add minimum ON/OFF times to dehumidifier control: ON above 65 [%], OFF below 55 [%], with minimum ON time of 2 min and minimum OFF time of 1 min.
Map particulate readings to LED colors using the worse of PM2.5 and PM10: Green if both below safe thresholds, Yellow for moderate, Red for high. Include threshold values in [ug/m3].

Implement an adjustable low-light trigger using a lux threshold parameter and an offset: turn ON when lux < (threshold - offset) and OFF when lux > (threshold + offset). Validate parameters for sane ranges.
Sample CO2 every 2 s. If 3 consecutive samples exceed 1500 [ppm], assert an alarm; clear only after 5 consecutive samples are below 1200 [ppm].
Implement a thermostat with a configurable setpoint [degC] and a 1.0 [degC] deadband to drive a relay. Enter a safe state if the temperature sensor is missing or invalid.
Detect mold risk conditions: raise a persistent alarm if RH > 80 [%] for more than 6 hours; raise a warning if RH > 70 [%] for more than 1 hour.
Smooth illuminance with a first-order low-pass (time constant ≈ 1 s) to avoid flicker and drive a PWM dimmer accordingly. Update at 50 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 [ms].
Estimate altitude [m] from pressure [hPa] using a standard atmosphere approximation and trigger an alert if altitude change rate exceeds 5 [m/s].
Assert an evacuation alarm if temperature > 45 [degC] OR carbon monoxide exceeds 50 [ppm]. Latch the alarm until both return to safe levels for at least 1 min.
Create a simple state machine for VOC levels: Safe (< 250 [ppb]), Alert (250–500 [ppb]), Alarm (> 500 [ppb]). Alert clears below 220 [ppb], Alarm latches until below 300 [ppb].
During a configured quiet period input, raise a light intrusion alert if ambient light exceeds 30 [lux] for more than 10 s; otherwise keep the system silent.
If temperature < 0 [degC] and RH > 90 [%], assert an ice risk warning; clear it when temperature ≥ 1 [degC] or RH ≤ 85 [%].

Implement a PID controller to maintain ambient temperature at a setpoint [degC] using a variable-speed fan output. Include anti-windup, output limits, and a safety cutoff if temperature exceeds the setpoint by more than 10 [degC]. Run at 10 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 [ms].

Fuse two humidity sensors to produce a robust RH estimate: use the median when their difference ≤ 5 [%]; otherwise flag a sensor disagreement and hold the last valid output. Drive a dehumidifier based on the fused value and detect stuck sensors.

Compute dew point [degC] from temperature [degC] and RH [%]. If dew point is within 2 [degC] of a provided surface temperature input, assert a condensation alarm. Compute at 2 Hz, bound inputs, and handle invalid readings gracefully.

Create a multi-criteria air quality evaluator that combines CO2 [ppm], TVOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3] into an Air Risk score. Trigger staged alarms (Info/Warning/Critical) with latching behavior; any single critical measurement forces Critical.

Add a pressure calibration routine: on a 60 s stability request, compute a baseline [hPa] and apply offset correction. Abort calibration if variance > 0.5 [hPa]. After calibration, alarm if corrected pressure < 960 [hPa].

Implement adaptive sampling for temperature: run at 1 Hz normally; increase to 20 Hz when rate-of-change > 4 [degC/min]. Enforce WCET < 0.8 [ms] at high rate, revert after 2 min of calm, and ensure safety checks are never skipped.
Perform PID humidity control to maintain 50 [%] RH with integral clamping, a derivative filter, and a minimum actuation step. If RH exceeds 60 [%], raise a hard alarm and force the actuator closed.

Implement redundant CO2 monitoring with three sensors: use majority voting; if all three differ by more than 200 [ppm], enter a Fault state and inhibit ventilation. Otherwise use the median to control fan speed. Immediately alarm if any sensor > 5000 [ppm].

Combine two illuminance sensors with different ranges to form a continuous lux estimate. Auto-select the most appropriate range and ensure smooth transitions. Trigger an emergency lighting alarm if combined lux < 10 [lux].
Compute a heat stress index from temperature [degC] and RH [%]. Escalate to Warning at ≥ 32 and Danger at ≥ 40. Log entry and exit timestamps, and require manual acknowledgment to clear Danger.

Develop a multi-mode air quality monitor with modes Normal, HighSensitivity, and Calibration. Monitor CO2 [ppm], TVOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3], with mode-specific thresholds and latching alarms. Only allow entering Calibration via a secure command and auto-exit after 120 s. Include a power-on self-test and periodic BIST every 10 min without exceeding a 2 [ms] WCET.

Design an environmental supervisor that schedules temperature [degC] at 10 Hz, RH [%] at 2 Hz, pressure [hPa] at 1 Hz, and lux [lux] at 5 Hz using a time-triggered table. Specify WCET budgets, detect overruns and stale data, raise a system-level alarm, and enter a safe degraded mode upon violations.

Create a dual-channel temperature safety system with two independent sensors and a voter. States: Safe, Warn (≥ 55 [degC]), Shutdown (≥ 65 [degC]), and a rate-of-rise trigger (≥ 5 [degC/min]). Perform plausibility checks, emit a heartbeat, latch Shutdown until manual reset, and provide verification tests for all transitions.

Implement a greenhouse environment controller with Day, Night, and Manual modes. Fuse temperature [degC], RH [%], CO2 [ppm], and lux [lux] into a comfort metric; run PID loops for temperature and CO2 tracking per-mode targets. Enforce hard limits (max 35 [degC], max 70 [%] RH, max 2000 [ppm] CO2) that override control. Specify control at 5 Hz, sensing at 10 Hz, WCET ≤ 1.5 [ms], and include a suite of scenario tests.

Create an air quality alarm system with rigorous safety: define hazard assumptions, implement redundant sensing (two CO2 and one VOC) with diagnostics, and a mode manager (Init, Normal, Fault, Maintenance). Include fault injection tests (stuck-at, noise bursts, out-of-range) to verify Critical alarms issue within 500 [ms] when CO2 > 5000 [ppm] or VOC > 1000 [ppb], and that alarms clear only after safe levels are sustained for 60 s.
Read ambient temperature in [degC] and turn on a red alarm LED when temperature exceeds 40 [degC], otherwise turn it off; sample at 2 Hz.
Monitor relative humidity in [%]; if humidity is below 30 [%], sound a buzzer, else keep it silent; run once per second.
Measure barometric pressure in [hPa] every second and display the value; if pressure is less than 950 [hPa], blink an alarm LED to warn of low pressure.
Check light level in [lux] at 10 Hz; if lux is below 50 [lux], turn on a dark indicator LED, else turn it off; ensure WCET under 1 ms.
Read CO2 concentration in [ppm] at 0.5 Hz and assert an alarm output when it exceeds 1000 [ppm]; clear the alarm once it falls back to 1000 [ppm] or below.
Monitor PM2.5 concentration in [µg/m3] at 1 Hz; if it exceeds 35 [µg/m3], activate a buzzer for 2 seconds then silence it.
Read VOC in [ppb]; light a yellow LED when VOC is greater than 500 [ppb], otherwise keep the LED off.
Read temperature in [degC] at 2 Hz; if temperature is below 5 [degC], turn on a blue cold LED, else turn it off.
Monitor relative humidity in [%]; turn on a dehumidifier relay when humidity exceeds 70 [%], and turn it off when it is 70 [%] or below.
Sample barometric pressure in [hPa] at 1 Hz; if pressure is below 980 [hPa], turn on a storm warning LED, else turn it off.
Read CO2 in [ppm] every 2 seconds; enable a ventilation relay when CO2 exceeds 1500 [ppm], otherwise disable the relay.
Monitor temperature in [degC] at 1 Hz; when temperature is between 18 [degC] and 26 [degC] inclusive, turn on an OK LED, otherwise turn it off.
Read humidity in [%]; if it exceeds 85 [%], assert a high humidity alarm line; deassert it when humidity is 85 [%] or below.
Measure light in [lux] at 5 Hz; if lux is above 700 [lux], turn on a bright LED, else turn it off.
Poll PM10 in [µg/m3] every 10 seconds; if PM10 exceeds 50 [µg/m3], set an alarm LED solid on, else turn it off.

Monitor temperature in [degC] and humidity in [%] at 2 Hz. Turn on an Overheat siren if temperature > 50 [degC] or humidity > 90 [%]; keep it on until temperature < 48 [degC] and humidity < 88 [%]. Ensure loop WCET < 2 ms.

Create a 3-state CO2 alarm: NORMAL when CO2 <= 800 [ppm], WARN when 801 to 1200 [ppm] with yellow LED flashing at 1 Hz, and ALARM when > 1200 [ppm] with continuous buzzer. Include a pushbutton acknowledge that silences the buzzer for 5 minutes while ALARM state persists.

Read barometric pressure in [hPa] at 2 Hz and detect rapid drops. If pressure decreases by more than 6 [hPa] within 10 minutes, enter STORM_WARN and flash an LED at 2 Hz; return to NORMAL when the slope is at or above -1 [hPa] per 10 minutes.
Implement a night guard using light in [lux] and a boolean isNight input. When isNight is true and lux exceeds 200 [lux], trigger an alarm after a 3 second entry delay indicated by a countdown LED.
Monitor PM2.5 and PM10 in [µg/m3]. If PM2.5 > 35 or PM10 > 50, assert an alarm output and record which pollutant caused it; store and expose the last cause string.

Humidity control with hysteresis and protection: when humidity in [%] > 70, turn on a dehumidifier relay, and turn it off when humidity drops below 60 [%]; enforce a minimum on-time of 2 minutes to protect the relay.
Sample temperature in [degC] at 5 Hz and estimate rate of change using a 10 second rolling average. If dT/dt exceeds 2 [degC/min] or temperature > 55 [degC], flash an alarm LED.
Compute dew point in [degC] from temperature [degC] and humidity [%], update once per second, and light a warning LED when dew point exceeds 20 [degC].

At startup, calibrate the light sensor by averaging readings for 2 seconds and subtracting that baseline from subsequent lux values; flash an LED during calibration. In normal operation, if corrected lux > 900 [lux], raise an alarm.

Use two light sensors in [lux] to control a shared lighting relay: if any zone is below 100 [lux], turn the relay on; if both are at or above 100 [lux], turn it off. Enforce a minimum off-time of 30 seconds.

Estimate altitude in [m] from barometric pressure in [hPa] and detect events where altitude changes by more than 50 [m] within 60 seconds; log the event and flash an LED; sample at 5 Hz with WCET < 3 ms.

Combine CO2 in [ppm] and VOC in [ppb] with simple logic: if CO2 > 1500 or VOC > 800, run a fan relay; if both exceed thresholds, also sound a buzzer; include a 5 second debounce to reject sensor spikes.

Implement a comfort indicator: if temperature 20 to 24 [degC] and humidity 40 to 60 [%], set green LED; otherwise set yellow LED; if temperature > 30 [degC] or humidity > 80 [%], set red LED and beep the buzzer 1 second every 10 seconds.

Create a finite state machine for air quality based on PM2.5 in [µg/m3] averaged over the last 60 seconds. States GOOD, FAIR, POOR drive a tri-color LED. Require 5 seconds of persistence before changing states to avoid oscillation; update at 1 Hz.

Detect humidity sensor faults: if reading is below 0 [%], above 100 [%], or not updated for 5 seconds, enter FAULT state, disable actuators, and blink an error at 4 Hz; otherwise operate normally controlling a dehumidifier with a simple threshold.
Light-adaptive sampling: when light in [lux] is below 50 [lux], sample temperature in [degC] at 1 Hz; when it is 50 [lux] or above, sample at 5 Hz; raise an alarm if temperature exceeds 45 [degC].
Create an occupancy-aware CO2 alarm: if occupancy flag is false, use 1500 [ppm] threshold; if true, use 1000 [ppm]; add 100 [ppm] hysteresis. Limit audible alarm to a maximum of 30 seconds per hour.

Use two temperature sensors and compare readings. If absolute difference exceeds 3 [degC], set SENSOR_MISMATCH and suppress temperature alarms; otherwise use the average and alarm if average exceeds 60 [degC].
Compute a 5 minute moving average for barometric pressure in [hPa]; indicate falling if current is 3 [hPa] below the average, rising if 3 [hPa] above, else steady.
Maintain daily min and max for temperature in [degC] and humidity in [%], resetting at midnight. If max temperature > 35 [degC] or max humidity > 90 [%], assert an alarm latch until manually cleared.

Closed-loop temperature stabilization using PID to maintain 22 [degC]. Sample at 10 Hz, include anti-windup, output limiting, and a safety cutoff that forces the heater off and alarms if temperature exceeds 60 [degC]; enforce WCET < 2 ms per loop.

Humidity regulation with time-proportioned PI or PID: hold 50 [%] with a 10 second control period; add a deadband of ±5 [%], anti-windup, and lockout with alarm if humidity exceeds 95 [%] or falls below 5 [%].

Fuse three temperature sensors using median-of-three. If one sensor deviates by more than 4 [degC] from the median for over 10 seconds, flag it faulty, exclude it, and raise a fault alarm; alarm overheating if fused temperature exceeds 70 [degC]. Run at 5 Hz with WCET < 3 ms.

Apply a Kalman filter to barometric pressure in [hPa] to estimate trend; trigger storm alert when filtered slope is below -0.5 [hPa/hour] for 3 hours. Add watchdogs for stale data and a fail-safe fallback to a moving average if covariance exceeds a threshold; log filter fallback events.

Compute dew point in [degC] from temperature [degC] and humidity [%] and control a dehumidifier with a PI controller to keep dew point below 18 [degC]. Safety rules: do not run the dehumidifier if temperature < 10 [degC]; enforce minimum compressor off-time of 3 minutes; alarm if dew point stays above 22 [degC] for more than 10 minutes.

Fuse CO2 [ppm], VOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [µg/m3] into an air quality index scaled 0 to 1 using weighted normalization. Drive fan PWM proportionally when AQI > 0.7. If any pollutant exceeds emergency thresholds (CO2 > 2000, VOC > 1200, PM2.5 > 80), force full speed and raise an alarm. Update at 1 Hz with WCET < 5 ms.

Implement redundant humidity monitoring with two sensors and plausibility checks. If their difference exceeds 8 [%] for 30 seconds, enter DEGRADED mode, choose the lower reading for safety, limit humidifier duty to 30 percent, and light an amber warning. Return to NORMAL when agreement is within 3 [%] for 5 minutes.

Use inlet and outlet temperature sensors in [degC] to compute gradient. If gradient > 20 [degC] or outlet > 80 [degC], immediately cut a power relay and log a critical alarm. Otherwise control outlet temperature to 60 [degC] with a PID, honoring the safety override.

Adaptive light monitoring: maintain a rolling 24 hour baseline in [lux] and compute a dynamic threshold of baseline + 300 [lux]. If lux exceeds the dynamic threshold for more than 60 seconds during quiet hours, flag INTRUSION and start an escalating alarm sequence; bound memory usage and keep per-update WCET below 4 ms.

Fuse barometric pressure in [hPa] with temperature in [degC] to estimate density altitude in [m]. Detect icing risk when density altitude deviates by more than 300 [m] from pressure altitude while temperature < 0 [degC] and humidity > 80 [%]; raise a high priority alarm and log the event at 2 Hz.

Implement a resilient, testable CO2 and VOC supervisor with modes NORMAL, VENTILATE, EMERGENCY, and SENSOR_FAULT. Thresholds: CO2 1000 or 1500 [ppm] with hysteresis, VOC 500 or 1000 [ppb] with hysteresis. Control fan PWM and buzzer with escalation timers. Include rolling median and spike rejection. Provide a built-in test suite feeding scripted input traces for steps, spikes, dropouts, and drifts, asserting correct states and outputs. Enforce WCET < 3 ms at 10 Hz.

Create a comprehensive state machine for heat stress using temperature [degC], humidity [%], and light [lux] to estimate exposure risk. States SAFE, CAUTION, DANGER, RECOVERY with graded buzzer patterns. Prevent re-entry to SAFE until indices remain below thresholds for 15 minutes. Include configuration parameter bounds checking, persistent storage of last DANGER event, and a test harness with boundary value cases.
Turn on a red alarm output whenever ambient temperature is at or above 60 degC; turn it off when below 60 degC.
If relative humidity drops below 30%, assert a 'dry_air_alert' signal; otherwise keep it deasserted.
Drive a low_pressure_alarm output high when barometric pressure falls under 95 kPa; clear it when pressure returns to or above 95 kPa.
When ambient light exceeds 2000 lux, set a glare_warning flag; clear it for values at or below 2000 lux.
If CO2 concentration exceeds 1500 ppm, activate a ventilation_request signal; deactivate it otherwise.
Set an air_quality_alarm when PM2.5 concentration is greater than 35 ug/m3; clear the alarm when it is 35 ug/m3 or less.
Turn on a 'temp_in_range' indicator when temperature is between 2 degC and 8 degC inclusive; turn it off if outside that range.
If the temperature reading is invalid or out of plausible bounds (below -40 degC or above 125 degC), assert a sensor_fault signal; otherwise keep sensor_fault cleared.
Set a night_mode flag when measured illuminance is under 50 lux; clear the flag when illuminance is 50 lux or higher.
If VOC level exceeds 500 ppb, pulse a buzzer for 3 seconds and then stop; do nothing if VOC is 500 ppb or below.
Turn on a dehumidify_request output when relative humidity goes above 85%; turn it off when humidity is 85% or less.
Compare two temperature sensors; if their absolute difference exceeds 3 degC, assert an inconsistency_alarm; otherwise clear it.
Assert a high_pressure_alarm when barometric pressure is above 105 kPa; clear it when at or below 105 kPa.
If ambient temperature is below 0 degC, set a freeze_alert; clear it when temperature is 0 degC or above.
Detect a sudden bright event: if illuminance rises from below 100 lux to above 1000 lux within 1 second, latch a sudden_bright_alert until manually cleared.
Implement humidity alarm with hysteresis sampled at 2 Hz: turn alarm on when RH exceeds 80%, and only turn it off after RH falls below 75%.
Compute a rolling 10-second average of PM2.5 [ug/m3]; if this average stays above 25 ug/m3 for at least 30 seconds, assert an air_quality_alarm; otherwise keep it cleared.
Create a simple temperature state machine sampled at 5 Hz with states COOL (<18 degC), WARM (18–27 degC), and HOT (>27 degC), and drive three status LEDs accordingly.
From temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%], compute a heat index estimate (degC) and set a heat_warning output whenever the index exceeds 32 degC for at least 15 seconds.
Monitor barometric pressure at 1 Hz and estimate rate of change over the past 10 minutes; if pressure drops faster than 2 hPa/hour, assert a storm_alert until the rate recovers.
Implement light-based hysteresis control: request_lighting when illuminance is below 100 lux, and clear the request only after illuminance rises above 200 lux.

Create a two-level CO2 alert: WARN at >=1000 ppm and CRITICAL at >=2000 ppm. Latch the CRITICAL buzzer until an acknowledge input is received, but keep the visual indicator on until CO2 remains below 900 ppm for 60 seconds.
Estimate dew point from temperature [degC] and RH [%]; if dew point is within 2 degC of the measured air temperature, set a condensation_risk flag and clear it otherwise.

Use a 1-minute rolling average to filter CO2 [ppm]. If instantaneous CO2 exceeds 2000 ppm but the 1-minute average is below 1500 ppm, treat as a transient and suppress the alarm; otherwise assert the alarm when either metric is high persistently.
Map temperature to three indicators: green for 18–24 degC, yellow for >24–30 degC or 15–<18 degC, and red plus buzzer for <=14 degC or >=31 degC.
Classify comfort: set a 'comfortable' flag only when temperature is between 20 and 24 degC and RH is between 40% and 60%; clear otherwise.
Detect a stuck humidity sensor: if RH changes by less than 0.1% over any 5-minute window while temperature varies by more than 2 degC, assert sensor_fault; clear when normal variation returns.

On startup, enter a 3-second calibration phase for the light sensor to capture an ambient baseline. After calibration, define night/day using a threshold equal to baseline + 100 lux and set a daylight flag accordingly.
Detect a door-open event using pressure: if pressure drops by more than 0.5 hPa within 2 seconds, set door_event for 10 seconds; otherwise leave it cleared.
Raise a heat_stress_alert only when temperature exceeds 35 degC and RH exceeds 70% simultaneously; clear the alert when either metric falls below those thresholds.
Combine CO2 [ppm], VOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3] to classify air quality as GOOD, MODERATE, or POOR using specified threshold bands; drive three distinct outputs for the categories.

Schedule sampling with timing constraints: read temperature and humidity at 10 Hz and pressure at 2 Hz, ensuring each processing step completes with WCET <= 1 ms. If any deadline is missed, assert a timing_fault.
Implement PM2.5 alarms with hysteresis and levels: WARN when >=25 ug/m3 (clear below 20 ug/m3) and CRITICAL when >=50 ug/m3 (clear below 40 ug/m3).
Smooth illuminance using a simple low-pass filter; if the smoothed value remains above 800 lux for at least 10 seconds, assert a bright_room signal; otherwise clear it.
Validate humidity readings: if RH is outside [0%, 100%], clip to bounds and assert a plausibility_fault; clear the fault when readings return to valid range for 30 seconds.

Implement a PID controller to regulate ventilation_fan_cmd (0–100%) to maintain CO2 near 900 ppm. Sample at 5 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms, clamp the integral term to avoid windup, and enter a failsafe driving fan to 100% if the CO2 sensor fails or CO2 exceeds 5000 ppm.

Fuse two temperature sensors: reject outliers when their difference exceeds 2 degC by using the nearer value; otherwise average them. If the discrepancy persists for more than 60 seconds, assert sensor_disagree. Use the fused temperature for over/undertemp alarms at 0 degC and 50 degC with 2 degC hysteresis.

From temperature [degC] and RH [%], compute dew point and absolute humidity [g/m3]. If dew_point is within 1 degC of a provided surface_temp input, assert condensation_protection to prevent moisture damage; clear once the margin exceeds 2 degC for 60 seconds.

Create a composite indoor air quality (IAQ) score from CO2 [ppm], VOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3] using weighted contributions. Classify into five bands (Excellent, Good, Fair, Poor, Hazardous) and drive corresponding indicators; use a 15-minute rolling average for reporting while instantaneous values govern safety alarms.

Detect pressure transients: sample at 20 Hz, estimate the derivative, and assert storm_warning if the fall rate exceeds 5 hPa/min continuously for 10 seconds. Apply basic noise suppression to avoid false positives.

Control humidity to 50% RH with a PID generating a dehumidifier command (0–100%). Sample at 2 Hz, WCET <= 2 ms, disable control and raise alarm if temperature is below 5 degC (icing risk) or if the RH sensor reports a fault.

Fuse two light sensors of different ranges to produce a single high-dynamic-range illuminance [lux]. Blend readings in the overlap region; if overlap disagreement exceeds 20%, assert a light_sensor_fault. Use the fused lux to trigger glare_alarm above 20000 lux.

Infer stale_air by combining CO2 rise rate and VOC concentration into a single score. If the score stays above a threshold for 5 minutes, request ventilation; clear the request only after the score remains below threshold for 2 minutes.

Implement 2-out-of-3 voting across three temperature sensors. If any sensor deviates by more than 5 degC from the median, isolate it and flag a fault. Use the voted temperature to drive a 65 degC overtemperature alarm with 3 degC hysteresis; sample at 10 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

Estimate heat stress using a WBGT-like metric from temperature [degC], RH [%], and illuminance [lux] as a proxy for radiant load. Warn above 28 degC equivalent and issue a severe alarm with a repeating beep pattern above 32 degC; include smoothing and require 30 seconds persistence before changing levels.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor (STARTUP, NORMAL, EMERGENCY) tracking temperature [degC], RH [%], and pressure [kPa]. Startup performs 2 s sensor stabilization; Normal logs and checks thresholds; Emergency latches alarms if temp > 60 degC or pressure < 95 kPa. Run at 10 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms. Provide tests for threshold crossings, sensor faults, and all mode transitions.

Cold-chain monitoring for a refrigerated chamber: maintain a continuous temperature [degC] and humidity [%] watch. Alarm if temp leaves 2–8 degC for more than 30 s; enter EMERGENCY if temp > 8 degC for > 2 minutes. Detect door-open via pressure drop > 0.5 hPa in 2 s and suppress alarms for a configurable grace period. Include latched alarms, manual acknowledge, and test cases covering power-up, door events, and prolonged out-of-range conditions.

Indoor air quality supervisor with modes NORMAL, PURGE, and FAULT. Monitor CO2 [ppm], VOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [ug/m3]. Enter PURGE when any two exceed their WARN thresholds or the 5-minute IAQ score exceeds a limit; run a PID to drive fan duty to restore air quickly. If any sensor fails, go to FAULT and force fan to 100%. Sample at 5 Hz, WCET <= 2 ms. Provide unit tests and simulated traces for mode entry/exit and fault handling.

Cleanroom monitor: track temperature [degC], RH [%], and pressure differential [Pa]. Maintain positive pressure > 12 Pa; generate three alarm levels with distinct audio/visual patterns for temperature and humidity excursions. Include a CALIBRATION mode with maintenance lockout and require a deterministic schedule (10 Hz) with WCET <= 1 ms. Specify acceptance tests for thresholds, hysteresis, and calibration behavior.

Develop a heatwave safety monitor that fuses temperature [degC], RH [%], and illuminance [lux] to compute a heat stress risk score. Operate in NORMAL/ALERT/EMERGENCY with hysteresis and persistence (e.g., 60 s) and latch EMERGENCY until manual reset. Include periodic self-tests, bounded processing time (WCET <= 2 ms at 5 Hz), and a comprehensive test suite with edge cases for sensor noise, sudden spikes, and recovery.
Read ambient temperature in [degC] once per second and turn on an alarm output if it exceeds 40 [degC]; turn it off when it drops below 38 [degC] (hysteresis).
Monitor relative humidity in [%] and activate a dehumidify warning when humidity is above 70 [%]; clear the warning below 65 [%].
Sample barometric pressure in [kPa] at 2 Hz and raise a high-pressure alert if above 110 [kPa]; otherwise keep alert off.
Measure light level in [lux] and switch a low-light indicator on when below 50 [lux]; switch it off when at or above 100 [lux].
Track air quality CO2 in [ppm]; sound an alert if CO2 exceeds 1500 [ppm] for more than 10 s.
If temperature falls below 5 [degC], assert a freeze warning; cancel it when temperature rises above 7 [degC].
Poll volatile organic compounds (VOC) in [ppb] every second; trigger a poor-air indicator if VOC exceeds 500 [ppb]; clear below 300 [ppb].
Check particulate matter PM2.5 in [µg/m^3]; raise a health alert if PM2.5 > 35 [µg/m^3], otherwise keep idle.
Turn on a heat warning when temperature reaches 60 [degC]; it must latch until temperature is below 50 [degC] for 5 s.
Blink an indicator at 1 Hz whenever humidity drops below 20 [%] (too dry); solid off otherwise.
If ambient light exceeds 20,000 [lux], set a glare warning; clear when it falls below 18,000 [lux].
Raise a low-pressure warning if pressure drops below 95 [kPa] for 3 consecutive samples.
Sound a short beep every 10 s while CO2 is between 1000 and 1500 [ppm]; beep continuously above 1500 [ppm].
Activate an alarm if temperature is outside 10 to 30 [degC]; clear when back inside range for 5 s.
At 1 Hz, check CO [ppm]; if above 30 [ppm], turn on an alarm indicator; turn it off below 25 [ppm].

Implement a three-state temperature monitor with states: Normal (<35 [degC]), Warning (35–45 [degC]), and Critical (>45 [degC]). Use hysteresis of 1 [degC] on transitions and drive outputs: green for Normal, yellow for Warning, red and buzzer for Critical.
Combine temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%] to compute heat index; issue a caution alert when heat index > 32 [degC] and a danger alert above 40 [degC], with 2 [degC] hysteresis.
Monitor light [lux] and pressure [kPa]; if light < 100 [lux] and pressure drop > 2 [kPa] within 10 minutes, log a weather change event and flash an indicator for 5 s.
Sample CO2 [ppm] and VOC [ppb] at 2 Hz; set air quality level as Good, Moderate, or Poor using configurable thresholds for each metric, where Poor if either exceeds its high threshold.
Create a state machine for humidity control with states Dry (<30 [%]), Comfortable (30–60 [%]), and Humid (>60 [%]), with 5 [%] hysteresis and an alarm if in Humid for longer than 15 minutes.
Compute dew point from temperature [degC] and humidity [%] and activate a condensation alarm if surface temperature input [degC] is within 1 [degC] of the dew point for 30 s.

Implement sampling at 10 Hz with a moving average window of 1 s for temperature [degC], and raise an overtemp alarm at 85 [degC] based on the filtered value; ensure the alarm output is debounced to avoid rapid toggling.
Detect rapid pressure changes: if pressure [kPa] decreases faster than 0.5 [kPa/min] over a 2-minute window, raise a storm warning; clear when the rate is above -0.1 [kPa/min].
Fuse two independent temperature sensors [degC] by averaging when they agree within 1 [degC]; otherwise, trust the lower reading and flag a discrepancy alarm.
Monitor PM2.5 [µg/m^3] and PM10 [µg/m^3]; set an air quality alarm if either exceeds its limit (35 and 50 [µg/m^3] respectively) for at least 60 s, with a 30 s delay before clearing.
Implement hysteresis-based light control: Low (<100 [lux]), Medium (100–1000 [lux]), High (>1000 [lux]). Output a corresponding level and prevent transitions more often than once every 2 s.
Read temperature [degC] at 5 Hz and detect sensor fault if two consecutive readings differ by more than 10 [degC]; upon fault, force alarms to safe state (on) until readings stabilize for 10 s.

Create an alarm that triggers when the combination of high temperature (>30 [degC]) and high humidity (>75 [%]) persists for more than 5 minutes; independent single-condition violations should not trigger.
Implement a latching CO2 alarm with three thresholds: 1000 [ppm] (Advisory), 1500 [ppm] (Warning), 2000 [ppm] (Critical). Latch Warning and Critical until CO2 remains below 900 [ppm] for 10 minutes.
Integrate temperature [degC] and light [lux]: if temperature exceeds 35 [degC] while light is below 200 [lux], classify as enclosed heat risk and trigger a special alarm pattern.
Monitor pressure [kPa] and temperature [degC]; compensate pressure readings for temperature using a linear coefficient and trigger an alarm on corrected pressure below 90 [kPa].
Calculate a comfort score from temperature [degC] and humidity [%] (0 to 100 [%]); illuminate green if 70–100 [%], yellow if 40–69 [%], and red if below 40 [%]; update at 1 Hz.
If ambient light [lux] is low and VOC [ppb] is high, activate a ventilation reminder; otherwise, do nothing. Include 10 s persist-before-alarm and 20 s persist-before-clear.

Implement an alarm mute feature: when in Warning (e.g., CO2 > 1500 [ppm]), allow a mute input that silences buzzer for 5 minutes while keeping visual indication; muting is ignored in Critical (>2000 [ppm]).
Monitor temperature [degC] and humidity [%] at 2 Hz; if dew point exceeds 20 [degC] and surface is below dew point by more than 3 [degC], assert a condensation risk and log duration.

Maintain indoor CO2 below 1000 [ppm] by driving a ventilation output using a PID controller on CO2 error; sample at 1 Hz, limit output slew rate, and force a hard alarm if CO2 exceeds 2000 [ppm] regardless of controller state.

Fuse three temperature sensors [degC] with median filtering and outlier rejection (ignore any reading deviating >2 [degC] from median); compute fused temperature and trigger overtemp alarm at 70 [degC]; declare sensor fault if fewer than two valid sensors.

Estimate absolute humidity [g/m^3] from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%], then compute dew point; trigger an equipment protection alarm if dew point > 22 [degC] for 60 s; include a safety requirement that the detection task WCET is ≤ 2 ms at 10 Hz.

Implement a state machine for air quality with Good, Fair, Poor, and Hazardous modes based on CO2 [ppm], VOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [µg/m^3]; transitions must enforce hysteresis and minimum dwell time of 60 s; in Hazardous, assert a latched alarm requiring manual reset.

Use a Kalman filter to estimate ambient temperature [degC] combining a fast noisy sensor and a slow accurate sensor; generate an alarm if the estimate exceeds 45 [degC]; detect divergence and fall back to the slow sensor if filter residuals exceed limits.

Control a dehumidifier output with a PID loop to maintain 50 [%] relative humidity; enforce actuator saturation limits, integral anti-windup, and a safety cutoff if humidity sensor reports invalid data.

Perform sensor plausibility checks among pressure [kPa], temperature [degC], and altitude input [m]; raise a fault if the implied barometric formula residual exceeds a threshold; while faulted, inhibit normal alarms and assert a safety fault indicator.

Detect thermal runaway by monitoring temperature [degC] rate-of-rise; if the derivative exceeds 5 [degC/min] for 30 s or absolute temperature exceeds 80 [degC], trigger an immediate critical alarm and log peak temperature; sampling at 5 Hz with a WCET of 1 ms.

Compute Illuminance comfort using light [lux] with a PID-driven dimming recommendation output; also monitor UV index and issue a safety alert if UV index > 8, prioritizing UV alerts over comfort recommendations.

Implement sensor fusion for air quality by combining CO2 [ppm] and VOC [ppb] into an indoor air quality index (0–500); escalate alarms at thresholds 100, 200, and 300 with latching at 300; include fault handling for stale data (>10 s).

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes: Normal, Energy-Save, and Calibration. In Normal, sample temperature [degC], humidity [%], pressure [kPa], light [lux], and CO2 [ppm] at 2 Hz with full alarm logic. In Energy-Save, reduce sampling to 0.5 Hz and widen hysteresis by 50%. In Calibration, disable alarms and expose raw readings. Provide clear transition rules and ensure safety alarms still trigger on Critical thresholds in all modes.

Create a building comfort supervisor with two zones (Zone A and Zone B). Monitor temperature [degC], humidity [%], and CO2 [ppm] per zone, compute per-zone status and an overall building status that is the worst of zones. Include cross-zone consistency checks and a global Critical alarm that latches if any zone exceeds 2000 [ppm] CO2.

Specify a comprehensive state machine for air quality with Normal, Advisory, Warning, Critical, and Fault states driven by CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [µg/m^3], and VOC [ppb]. Include hysteresis, minimum dwell times, manual reset handling, and a self-test sequence at startup. Provide timing constraints: sampling at 2 Hz, WCET ≤ 3 ms, alarm latency ≤ 200 ms.

Develop a multi-sensor environmental safety monitor that supervises heat stress using temperature [degC], humidity [%], and light [lux] to compute a heat stress index. Require unit handling, sanity checks, watchdog timers, and a fail-safe default that forces alarms on loss of any critical sensor, with acceptance tests describing edge cases.

Define a robust environmental monitoring subsystem with Normal monitoring, Emergency Shutdown, and Diagnostics modes. Monitor temperature [degC], pressure [kPa], light [lux], and CO2 [ppm]; enter Emergency Shutdown on any of: temperature > 90 [degC], pressure < 85 [kPa], or CO2 > 3000 [ppm]; Diagnostics mode shall support sensor self-test and simulated inputs. Provide detailed safety requirements, including latching logic, reset conditions, and verification tests.
Monitor ambient temperature [degC] once per second. If it rises above 60 degC, assert an alarm output; otherwise keep the alarm off.
Sample relative humidity [%] at 2 Hz. Turn on a warning indicator when humidity exceeds 85%.
Read barometric pressure [hPa] every 500 ms. If pressure drops below 980 hPa, raise a low-pressure alert.
Measure illuminance [lux]. When light level falls below 50 lux, enable a 'dark' indicator; turn it off when >= 80 lux.
Monitor CO2 concentration [ppm]. If it exceeds 1000 ppm, set a ventilation-needed flag.
Read temperature [degC] and humidity [%]. If temperature > 35 degC OR humidity < 20%, trigger a comfort alarm.
Check particulate matter PM2.5 [µg/m3] each second. If value > 35 µg/m3 for more than 10 seconds, assert an air quality alarm.
Continuously compute dew point [degC] from temperature and RH; if dew point > ambient temperature - 2 degC, set a condensation warning.
Monitor ambient temperature [degC]. If probe reads below -10 degC, raise a freezing hazard alarm.
Sample total volatile organic compounds (TVOC) [ppb]. If TVOC > 500 ppb, turn on alarm buzzer.
Log maximum temperature [degC] observed over the last minute and update a display once per minute; no alarms.
Please monitor ambient light [lux] and toggle a status LED when lux exceeds 1000.
Check differential pressure [Pa] across a filter every 200 ms. If > 500 Pa, raise 'filter clogged' alert.
Measure humidity [%]. If RH < 30% for 5 consecutive readings (1 Hz), set a dry-air warning.
Track temperature [degC]; blink an LED at 2 Hz when temp >= 80 degC; otherwise keep the LED off.
Create a two-level temperature alarm: sample temperature [degC] at 10 Hz; issue 'high' alarm at 45 degC and 'critical' alarm at 60 degC, each with separate outputs and 2 degC hysteresis.
Implement a humidity [%] alarm with rate-of-change detection: if RH rises faster than 10% per minute, warn 'rapid humidity change', and if RH > 90%, assert 'saturation risk'. Evaluate at 1 Hz.

Combine light [lux] and a time-of-day flag to control a 'curtain close' signal: if lux < 100 and it's after sunset, set the signal; if lux > 200 or before sunset, clear it. Ensure decisions update at 2 Hz and WCET ≤ 3 ms.

State machine for air quality: states = Good, Moderate, Unhealthy based on PM2.5 [µg/m3] thresholds 0–12, 12.1–35.4, >35.4; transition only after 30 s of sustained readings; drive three colored indicators.
Monitor barometric pressure [hPa] and detect storm alert: if pressure drops by > 4 hPa within 3 hours, assert 'rapid drop' alarm; sample at 0.1 Hz and maintain rolling history.
Implement latch-and-reset logic: when CO2 [ppm] exceeds 1500 ppm, latch an alarm that persists until a reset input is pressed and readings are below 1200 ppm for at least 60 s.
Compute heat index from temperature [degC] and RH [%]; if heat index > 40 degC, command a 'heat stress warning' and a beep pattern; sample at 1 Hz with 1 degC hysteresis.
Cross-validate two temperature sensors [degC]. If they differ by more than 2 degC, flag a sensor fault; otherwise average them for display and for threshold checks.
Adaptive sampling: when air quality PM2.5 [µg/m3] is below 12 for 5 minutes, sample at 0.2 Hz; when above 12, increase to 2 Hz. Ensure no missed alarm detection.
Implement a humidity-controlled condensation warning: compute dew point [degC] and if dew point within 1 degC of a surface temperature input, set 'condensation imminent' alarm with 30 s persistence.
Create a light-level controller with hysteresis bands: low < 100 lux, mid 100–500 lux, high > 500 lux; update a three-state output accordingly and prevent chattering with a 5 lux deadband.
Detect sensor freeze: if temperature [degC] reading is unchanged to within 0.1 degC for 10 minutes while environment is active (light > 100 lux), flag a 'stuck sensor' fault.
Implement min/max tracking over a sliding 10-minute window for RH [%] and temperature [degC]; provide alarms if min RH < 25% or max temp > 35 degC.
Use an exponential moving average (time constant 10 s) for volatile organic compounds [ppb] to reduce noise; trigger alarm if filtered value > 400 ppb.
Multi-threshold CO2 [ppm] with escalating actions: warning at 1000 ppm, alert at 1500 ppm, hazard at 2000 ppm; ensure 60 s hysteresis per level and distinct outputs.
Compute absolute humidity [g/m3] from temperature [degC] and RH [%]; if AH > 20 g/m3 and temperature < 18 degC, issue a 'mold risk' warning. Evaluate every 5 s.
Implement a 'quiet hours' suppression: still record PM2.5 [µg/m3] alarms internally overnight, but delay buzzer activation between 22:00–06:00; ensure alarms are replayed at 06:00 if still active.

Safety requirement: if any sensor reports an invalid reading (NaN or out of range), enter a safe state that asserts a general fault output and disables nonessential indicators until values return to normal for 30 s.
Design a simple state machine for pressure [kPa]: Normal (95–105 kPa), Low (<95), High (>105). On transitions to Low or High, log an event and pulse an alarm for 5 s.
Detect condensation cycles: if RH [%] toggles across a 90% threshold more than 3 times in 10 minutes, raise an 'unstable humidity' maintenance alert.

Fuse two barometric pressure sensors [hPa] using a weighted average that downweights a sensor when it deviates by > 1 hPa from the other; output filtered pressure at 5 Hz; raise a 'sensor disagreement' fault when deviation persists > 60 s.

Implement a PID loop to maintain a test chamber temperature at 25 degC using a heater command output (0–100%), with anti-windup, rate limit 10%/s, and a safety cutout if measured temp exceeds 40 degC.

Estimate dew point [degC] via sensor fusion: combine temperature [degC] and RH [%] with a Kalman filter to reduce noise; alarm if estimated dew point comes within 0.5 degC of a surface temperature for > 15 s; run at 10 Hz with WCET ≤ 2 ms.

Perform multi-sensor air quality assessment: combine CO2 [ppm], TVOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [µg/m3] into an Air Quality Index score; classify into Green/Yellow/Red with tunable thresholds; enter fail-safe Red if any input sensor faults.
Design a humidity control PID for a small enclosure: target 50% RH with actuator output 0–100%; include integral clamp, a 2% deadband, and alarms for RH < 30% or > 70% persisting > 2 minutes.

Implement altitude estimation from barometric pressure [Pa] using a filtered model; alarm if altitude rate exceeds 5 m/s (improbable indoors), indicating sensor error; sample at 20 Hz and enforce WCET ≤ 1 ms.
Redundant temperature sensing: three sensors [degC] with median voting; if the spread exceeds 3 degC, declare 'temperature redundancy degraded' and enter a degraded mode that tightens alarms.

Thermal runaway protection: monitor temperature [degC] near electronics; if dT/dt exceeds 5 degC/min OR absolute temp > 85 degC, cut a power command and latch a fault requiring maintenance reset; run at 5 Hz.
Perform absolute humidity computation from RH [%] and temperature [degC] and control a dehumidifier output with a PI controller to maintain AH at 12 g/m3; add a safety alarm if AH > 25 g/m3.

Sensor drift compensation: periodically (every 24 h) calibrate baseline for TVOC [ppb] when an outdoor air flag is set; ensure calibration only occurs if PM2.5 < 5 µg/m3 and RH is 30–60%; raise 'calibration failed' alarm otherwise.

Develop a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes: Startup Self-Test, Normal, Power-Save, Degraded, Emergency. Inputs include temperature [degC], RH [%], pressure [hPa], light [lux], CO2 [ppm]. Define transitions: any out-of-range or sensor fault -> Degraded; critical thresholds (temp > 85 degC, CO2 > 3000 ppm) -> Emergency. Specify per-mode sampling rates (Normal 2 Hz, Power-Save 0.2 Hz, Emergency 10 Hz), WCET ≤ 4 ms, and ensure alarms are latched in Emergency.

Create a comprehensive state machine for indoor air quality supervision with three subsystems (CO2 [ppm], PM2.5 [µg/m3], TVOC [ppb]); each has Warning/Alarm/Critical states; the overall system mode reflects the worst subsystem. Include alarm escalation timers, acknowledgment handling, and a global fail-safe if any sampling deadline is missed.

Specify an environmental monitoring scheduler that deterministically polls sensors at fixed rates (temperature/RH 5 Hz, pressure 1 Hz, light 10 Hz, CO2 0.5 Hz), with per-task WCET budgets and overrun detection that forces a safe shutdown alarm.

Define a greenhouse monitor with combined control and monitoring: PID for temperature at 22 degC, humidity limit 70%, and light threshold 2000 lux for shading; include a Safety Manager that cuts all actuators if temp > 45 degC or pressure drops below 95 kPa, and provide test hooks to inject sensor faults and verify alarm behavior.

Write requirements for a certified air quality monitor: include startup BIST for all sensors, periodic built-in tests every 30 minutes, range checking with physical units, redundancy where available, timing constraints (end-to-end latency < 200 ms), and a verification plan with test cases for threshold crossings, hysteresis, latching, sensor dropout, and recovery.
Write ReflexScript to read a temperature sensor and turn on a red alarm LED whenever temperature exceeds 60 [degC]; turn it off when back below 55 [degC] (hysteresis). Sample every 200 ms.
Create a simple humidity monitor: if relative humidity rises above 85 [%], sound a buzzer for 2 seconds, otherwise stay silent. Check once per second.
Make a night indicator: read ambient light in [lux] and turn on a 'night' LED when below 20 [lux]; turn it off when at or above 20 [lux]. Update at 5 Hz.
Please set an air quality alarm flag if CO2 concentration exceeds 1200 [ppm], and clear it when CO2 drops below 1000 [ppm]. Run this at 1 Hz.
Monitor temperature [degC] and drive a digital output: 'OVERHEAT' when temperature >= 75 [degC], 'OK' otherwise.
Turn on a warning LED when air quality index (AQI) exceeds 150; turn it off when AQI is 150 or below. Sample at 2 Hz.
Report a 'bright' status true when illuminance > 10,000 [lux], false otherwise. Evaluate every 250 ms.
Assert an 'overpressure' alarm if pressure > 1050 [hPa] for more than 5 s; auto-clear once pressure <= 1045 [hPa].
If humidity exceeds 90 [%], play a short beep every 10 s as a high humidity warning; otherwise remain silent.
Publish a boolean 'freeze' flag that is true when temperature < 0 [degC] and false otherwise; update at 10 Hz.
Raise a 'dryness' warning when relative humidity falls below 30 [%]; clear the warning only after humidity rises above 35 [%]. Check each second.
Trigger an immediate critical alarm output whenever CO2 > 2000 [ppm]; otherwise no alarm. Sample at 1 Hz.
Log an event each time barometric pressure crosses the 1000 [hPa] threshold in either direction.
Publish an 'illuminance_ok' boolean that is true if light is within 300–1000 [lux] inclusive, and false otherwise. Update every 100 ms.
Raise a 'glare' alarm when light exceeds 50,000 [lux] and keep it active until illuminance drops below 45,000 [lux].

Create a state machine driven by temperature [degC] with states Normal (<70), Warning (>=70), and Critical (>=85). In Warning, blink an amber LED at 1 Hz. In Critical, hold a red LED steady and pulse a buzzer 0.5 s on/0.5 s off. Use 3 [degC] hysteresis between states. Sample at 10 Hz.

Monitor both temperature [degC] and humidity [%]. If humidity > 80 [%] and temperature > 30 [degC], raise a 'heat_stress' alarm. If humidity < 20 [%] and temperature > 30 [degC], raise a 'dry_heat' alarm. At most one alarm may be active at a time. Update every 500 ms.

Combine light [lux] and CO2 [ppm] to control ventilation: turn on a 'ventilate' output when CO2 > 1000 [ppm] and light > 200 [lux] (room likely occupied). Turn it off when CO2 < 800 [ppm] or light < 100 [lux].
Implement a latched pressure alarm: if pressure < 970 [hPa] continuously for 60 s, latch a red LED until a user 'ack' input is pressed and pressure has recovered above 975 [hPa].

Detect a stuck temperature sensor by flagging 'sensor_fault' if the reading does not change by at least 0.1 [degC] over any 120 s window. In fault, disable all alarms and turn on a blue fault indicator.

Drive a warning output if CO2 > 1500 [ppm] OR VOC index > 200, but inhibit the buzzer at night when light < 10 [lux]. In night mode, also lower the CO2 warning threshold to 1300 [ppm] for visual indication.
Provide a 3-color LED display for humidity [%]: green for 40–60, yellow for 30–40 or 60–70, and red for <30 or >70. Apply 2 [%] hysteresis between bands. Update at 2 Hz.
If temperature exceeds 50 [degC], start a 30 s timer; if still above 50 [degC] at expiry, issue an alarm. Cancel the timer if temperature drops below 48 [degC].

Build a light-level state machine with modes Day (>1000 [lux]), Twilight (200–1000 [lux]), and Night (<200 [lux]). Publish the current mode, and prevent mode changes more often than once every 10 s to avoid chatter.
Measure pressure [hPa] and compute sea-level corrected pressure given an altitude input [m]. Raise a 'low_pressure' warning when the corrected value is < 990 [hPa].
When humidity > 90 [%] for more than 5 minutes, assert a 'mold_risk' indicator and keep it latched for 24 hours unless humidity remains < 70 [%] for 1 hour, which clears it early.
Flash a status LED faster as light increases: 0.5 Hz below 1000 [lux], 1 Hz from 1000–5000 [lux], and 2 Hz above 5000 [lux]. Recalculate the rate at 1 Hz.

Implement an alarm inhibition window: after any CO2 > 2000 [ppm] event ends (falls below 1800 [ppm]), suppress further buzzer sounds for 10 minutes, but maintain a visual indicator if CO2 remains > 1000 [ppm].
Report a 'comfort' category from temperature [degC]: Cold (<18), Cool (18–22), Warm (22–26), Hot (>26). Only change category if the new level persists for 30 s (debounce).
Detect a storm trend: if pressure decreases faster than 1.5 [hPa]/hour for 3 consecutive hours, raise a 'storm_alert' and blink a warning LED at 0.5 Hz.
If sensor sampling at 20 Hz exceeds a WCET of 1 ms, enter a 'Degraded' state, reduce sampling to 5 Hz, and assert a 'maintenance_required' flag until reset.
Use temperature [degC] and humidity [%] to warn about condensation: compute dew point and turn on a 'condensation_risk' alarm when (temperature - dew point) < 2 [degC]. Update at 1 Hz.
Accept two redundant temperature sensors. If their absolute difference exceeds 3 [degC], set a 'sensor_disagreement' alarm; otherwise publish the average temperature. Sample at 5 Hz.
When CO2 > 1200 [ppm], start a ventilation output and keep it running for at least 2 minutes after CO2 drops below 900 [ppm] (minimum runtime).
Create a timed brightness decision: report 'bright_enough' true when light > 500 [lux] for 10 s; switch to false when light < 400 [lux] for 10 s. Apply both hysteresis and timing.

Implement a PID loop to maintain temperature at 25 [degC] using a heater command (0–100 [%]). Sample at 10 Hz, limit output slew to 20 [%]/s, include anti-windup, and raise an alarm if |error| > 5 [degC] for more than 60 s.

Fuse three temperature sensors [degC] using a median-of-three to reject outliers; publish the fused temperature and flag 'sensor_fault' if any sensor deviates by > 5 [degC] from the median for > 10 s.

Estimate dew point from temperature [degC] and humidity [%], and control a dehumidifier via PID to keep dew point below 16 [degC]. Include safety: cut output and alarm if the humidity sensor is missing or stuck.

Use a complementary filter to fuse a high-resolution barometer [hPa] with a fast, coarse pressure sensor to estimate pressure trend [hPa/hour]. Raise a storm alert if trend < -2 [hPa]/hour sustained for 30 minutes.

Validate two CO2 sensors [ppm]: compute a weighted average when they agree within 100 [ppm]; otherwise vote the lower value and raise 'CO2_sensor_disagree'. Include a fail-safe: if both read > 5000 [ppm], force an immediate critical alarm.

Run a cascaded controller where the outer loop maintains temperature at 22 [degC] and the inner loop limits humidity to <= 60 [%] by driving a dehumidifier. If both exceed limits simultaneously, prioritize humidity control and raise a 'thermal_load_high' alarm.

Perform sensor fusion of temperature [degC], humidity [%], and pressure [hPa] to compute a comfort metric (e.g., humidex). Alarm if the metric > 38 for 10 minutes, and enter 'safe_mode' if any input becomes invalid.

Design a rate-monotonic schedule: sample light at 100 Hz (WCET 0.5 ms), temperature at 10 Hz (WCET 0.8 ms), and CO2 at 1 Hz (WCET 1.2 ms). If any WCET is exceeded, shed lower-priority tasks and raise a 'timing_violation' alarm.

Implement a predictive CO2 alarm: compute the first derivative [ppm/min] over a 5-minute window; if CO2 is below 1000 [ppm] but rising faster than 200 [ppm]/min, pre-warn with an amber LED; escalate to red if it later crosses 1500 [ppm].

Develop an auto-tuning PID for temperature control: during commissioning, perform a bounded excitation to identify gains; limit the auto-tune to 5 minutes and ensure temperature never exceeds 35 [degC]; abort and alarm if limits are breached.

Create a dual-zone monitor for Zone A and Zone B, each with temperature [degC], humidity [%], and CO2 [ppm]. Provide per-zone alarms and a global alarm that triggers if either zone is Critical. Scheduling: per-zone tasks at 5 Hz (WCET 1 ms), coordinator at 1 Hz (WCET 0.5 ms). Implement deterministic global modes: Normal, One-Zone-Critical, Both-Critical, Sensor-Failure. Include acceptance tests for mode transitions and deadline monitoring.

Implement an environmental monitor with configurable profiles: Laboratory, Office, and Warehouse. Each profile defines thresholds (e.g., Laboratory: temp 18–25 [degC], humidity 40–60 [%], CO2 < 800 [ppm]; Office: temp 20–26, humidity 30–60, CO2 < 1000; Warehouse: temp 5–35, humidity 20–80, CO2 < 1200). Support live profile switching without missing a 10 Hz sampling deadline (WCET 1 ms) and perform safe revalidation of all current alarms on profile change.
Create a simple high-temperature alarm: if ambient temperature exceeds 45 degC, assert an alarm output; clear it once the temperature falls below 44 degC. Sample at 1 Hz.
Drive a heater output ON when ambient temperature is below 5 degC, and turn it OFF when temperature rises to 6 degC or higher to avoid chatter.
Control a dehumidifier output using relative humidity: turn ON above 70 %, turn OFF below 65 %. Include a status indicator that mirrors the output state.
Turn on a night light when illuminance is below 50 lux, and turn it off when illuminance reaches 60 lux or more.
Enable ventilation when CO2 concentration exceeds 1200 ppm and disable it when CO2 drops below 900 ppm. Include a CO2 high warning flag while ventilation is active.
Raise a low-pressure alert if barometric pressure is below 980 hPa; automatically clear the alert once pressure is 985 hPa or higher.
Set a PM2.5 air quality alarm when particulate concentration exceeds 35 ug/m3 and clear it when it falls below 30 ug/m3.
Trigger a VOC high warning when the VOC index is greater than 250; clear the warning when the index drops under 200.
Close a sunshade output when ambient light exceeds 20000 lux; open it otherwise. Add a simple fault flag if the sensor reading is invalid.
Assert a freeze alert if temperature is at or below 0 degC and clear the alert when temperature rises above 1 degC.
Indicate dry-air warning when relative humidity is below 30 %; clear the warning when humidity reaches 35 % or higher.
Sound a short periodic beep when illuminance is below 20 lux, and stop beeping when illuminance returns to at least 25 lux.
Activate an overpressure alarm if barometric pressure exceeds 1050 hPa; clear the alarm when pressure returns to 1045 hPa or below.
Raise a carbon monoxide alarm if CO concentration is above 30 ppm; clear the alarm when CO drops below 25 ppm.
Show an OK indicator when temperature is between 18 and 26 degC inclusive; otherwise assert an out-of-range alarm.
Implement temperature-based fan control with hysteresis: turn fan ON above 28 degC and OFF below 26 degC, enforcing a minimum ON time of 60 s to prevent short cycling.
Use two temperature sensors to control a cooling fan. If their difference exceeds 2 degC, assert a sensor disagreement alarm. Otherwise use their average: fan ON above 30 degC, OFF below 28 degC.
Create a latching high-humidity alarm: latch the alarm when relative humidity exceeds 85 %, and only clear it upon a manual reset input, provided humidity has dropped below 80 %.

Design a simple Day/Night state machine using illuminance. In Day mode, raise high-temperature alarm above 35 degC; in Night mode, use 32 degC. Switch modes at 200 lux (enter Night) and 300 lux (enter Day).
Alarm filtering: sample CO2 at 10 Hz and only assert the high CO2 alarm if readings exceed 1000 ppm continuously for 10 s. Clear the alarm after 10 s continuously below 900 ppm.
Detect rapid pressure drop: if barometric pressure decreases by at least 3 hPa within 15 minutes, raise a storm alert; clear it after 30 minutes of stable trend (change less than 1 hPa).
Drive a 3-color comfort indicator based on temperature and relative humidity: green for 20–24 degC and 40–60 %, yellow for mild deviations, red when temperature > 30 degC or humidity > 80 %.
Aggregate air quality: if any of CO2 > 1000 ppm, VOC index > 300, or PM2.5 > 50 ug/m3 is true, enable ventilation and assert an air quality alarm; otherwise disable both.
Implement sensor plausibility checks for temperature: treat values outside −40 to 120 degC as invalid, set a fault flag, and force outputs to a safe OFF state while invalid.
Compute a 30-second moving average of relative humidity (sample at 1 Hz). Assert a high humidity alarm if the average exceeds 75 %; clear it when it drops below 70 %.
Debounce a light-controlled lamp: only turn ON after 5 consecutive samples below 30 lux, and only turn OFF after 5 consecutive samples at or above 40 lux.
Create multi-severity temperature alarms with distinct beeps: 1 short beep every 5 s for 30–35 degC, 2 short beeps for 35–40 degC, and continuous tone for > 40 degC.
Adapt pressure sampling rate: if the standard deviation over the last 60 s exceeds 2 hPa, increase sampling from 1 Hz to 5 Hz; revert to 1 Hz when variability falls below 1 hPa.
Design a 3-state dehumidification controller (OFF, ON, COOLDOWN) using humidity thresholds (ON above 70 %, OFF below 60 %) and minimum ON/OFF durations of 2 minutes each.
Inhibit all alarm outputs for the first 10 s after power-up while still sampling temperature, humidity, and pressure. After the delay, enable normal alarm logic.

Run hourly sensor sanity checks: verify humidity is within 0–100 %, pressure within 300–1100 hPa, and temperature within −40 to 120 degC. If any check fails, assert a fault and freeze control outputs in a safe state.
Implement CO2 dual-threshold logic: Warning at 1000 ppm (yellow indicator) and Critical at 2000 ppm (red indicator with latched alarm that requires manual reset).
Reduce power when ambient light is very low: if illuminance < 5 lux and no active alarms, sample all sensors at 0.2 Hz; otherwise sample at 2 Hz. Ensure transitions are glitch-free.

Estimate dew point from temperature (degC) and relative humidity (%) using a simple approximation. If dew point exceeds 18 degC, enable dehumidification; disable it when dew point drops below 16 degC.
At startup, calibrate the light sensor offset by averaging readings for the first 2 s and subtracting that offset thereafter. Provide a flag indicating calibration complete.

Implement a PID controller to maintain ambient temperature at 22 degC using a proportional output (e.g., fan speed). Sample at 10 Hz, clamp output limits, and include anti-windup. Enforce WCET ≤ 1 ms for the control update.

Fuse two humidity sensors: compute the median of the pair, then apply a first-order IIR filter. If their difference exceeds 5 %, raise a disagreement alarm; if either is invalid, use the other; if both invalid, enter a safe state.

Use two barometric sensors to improve pressure stability: estimate each sensor’s variance online and compute a weighted average (lower variance => higher weight). If one variance exceeds a threshold, exclude that sensor and flag a fault.

Derive a ventilation demand from CO2 (ppm) and VOC index using a piecewise linear map. Issue an immediate evacuation alarm if CO2 exceeds 5000 ppm, overriding other logic and latching until manually reset.

Create a mode-based air quality controller with Normal, High Pollution, and Purge modes based on PM2.5 (ug/m3) and CO2 (ppm). Include entry/exit thresholds, a minimum Purge duration of 10 minutes, and mode-specific alarm behavior.
Add sensor health monitoring: detect stale data if updates stop for more than 3 s, assert a fault, and gracefully degrade outputs to a safe default until data is fresh again.

Estimate barometric pressure trend using a simple Kalman filter updated at 1 Hz. Raise an early storm warning when the filtered trend indicates a drop faster than 1 hPa per 10 minutes. Ensure WCET ≤ 2 ms.

Implement safety interlocks: if temperature > 60 degC or humidity > 90 % persists for more than 30 s, shut down nonessential outputs, assert a continuous alarm, and require a manual reset after levels return to safe values.
Compute dew point (degC) and absolute humidity (g/m3) from temperature and relative humidity. If dew point is within 2 degC of a configurable surface temperature, assert a condensation risk alarm.

Regulate relative humidity to 50 % using a PID controller for a humidifier/dehumidifier output. Sample at 2 Hz, enforce output saturation and anti-windup, and include a high humidity safety cutoff at 85 %.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with Normal, Energy-Saving, and Emergency modes. Monitor temperature (degC), humidity (%), pressure (hPa), light (lux), CO2 (ppm), and PM2.5 (ug/m3). Use mode-specific sampling rates (e.g., 10 Hz fast tasks, 1 Hz slow tasks), thresholds, and prioritized alarms. Emergency mode latches on critical limits. Specify WCET budgets per task and deterministic scheduling.

Create a system with a Commissioning/Calibration mode at startup to establish sensor offsets/scales (temperature in degC, humidity in %, light in lux). Include built-in self-tests, fail-safe fallbacks if calibration fails, and a transition to Monitoring mode with documented acceptance tests and fault injection cases.

Implement an indoor air quality manager that fuses CO2 (ppm) and VOC index into an IAQ score with four alarm levels. Control a multi-level ventilation output accordingly. Enforce hard safety: immediate evacuation alarm if CO2 > 5000 ppm. Provide timing constraints (update at 5 Hz, WCET ≤ 2 ms) and define verification test vectors.

Develop a safety-critical overtemperature protection using triple modular redundancy across three temperature sensors (degC). Perform majority voting, detect sensor faults, and degrade to dual/solo operation with clear fault states. Define mode transitions, alarm latching, and timing constraints (vote at 20 Hz, WCET ≤ 1 ms).

Specify an environmental monitoring subsystem with real-time logging, rate-limited alarm outputs, and field diagnostics. Monitor temperature (degC), humidity (%), pressure (hPa), light (lux), CO2 (ppm), and PM2.5 (ug/m3). Include unit tests, HIL simulation hooks, data validation rules, sampling at 10 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 ms, and explicit acceptance criteria for each alarm.
Simple overheat indicator: sample temperature at 2 Hz and turn the red alarm LED on whenever temperature exceeds 50 degC. Use 48 degC as the clear threshold to provide hysteresis and prevent chatter.
Monitor relative humidity and sound a buzzer if RH goes above 80%. Keep the buzzer off until RH falls below 75% to clear the alarm. Update once per second.
Use ambient light to control a night indicator: if illuminance drops below 50 lux, turn the night LED on; otherwise keep it off. Evaluate at 5 Hz.
Raise a ventilation warning output when CO2 exceeds 1200 ppm. Clear it only after CO2 remains below 1000 ppm for 10 seconds.
Set a pressure alert LED when absolute pressure is below 95 kPa. Turn it off when pressure is at or above 96 kPa. Check at 1 Hz.
Freeze warning: if temperature drops below 0 degC, flash a blue LED at 1 Hz; otherwise keep the LED off.
Control a particulate fan output based on PM2.5: turn the fan on when PM2.5 exceeds 35 ug/m^3 and turn it off when PM2.5 drops below 25 ug/m^3.
If relative humidity falls below 30%, illuminate a 'humidify' indicator. Keep it off otherwise. Poll at 2 Hz.
Comfort light: show green when temperature is between 20 degC and 25 degC (inclusive), otherwise show red. Update once per second.
Glare warning: when illuminance exceeds 10000 lux, emit a 2 s beep followed by 8 s silence, repeating while the condition holds; silence when below the limit.
VOC alarm logic: if VOC exceeds 500 ppb, assert an alarm output; clear the alarm when VOC is below 400 ppb.
High-pressure indicator: turn on a 'HIGH' LED whenever pressure is greater than 103 kPa; turn it off when at or below 103 kPa.
Condensation alert: if relative humidity is 95% or higher, turn on a 'CONDENSATION RISK' LED; otherwise keep it off. Evaluate at 1 Hz.
Low-light warning: if illuminance stays below 5 lux continuously for 10 s, turn on a warning indicator; clear as soon as it rises to 10 lux or higher.
Critical cold alarm: assert a critical alert output when temperature falls below -10 degC; deassert when temperature is at or above -8 degC.

Create a two-level temperature alarm. Warning at 40 degC and Critical at 50 degC, each with 2 degC hysteresis. Drive a yellow LED for Warning and a red LED plus intermittent buzzer for Critical. Evaluate at 10 Hz.
Detect mold risk: if RH > 80% and temperature < 18 degC, assert a 'MOLD RISK' alarm. If RH > 60% and 18–25 degC, show 'CAUTION'. Otherwise 'OK'. Update each second.
Pressure threshold with persistence: only change the output when pressure remains above or below 100 kPa for at least 3 s to avoid chatter. Blink a heartbeat LED at 1 Hz. Run the loop at 20 Hz.

Implement a day/night state machine using illuminance with hysteresis and dwell: enter DAY when > 300 lux for 30 s; enter NIGHT when < 100 lux for 30 s. Provide distinct DAY and NIGHT indicators. Sample at 2 Hz.
Tri-color air quality indicator: show red if CO2 > 1000 ppm or VOC > 400 ppb, yellow if within 10% below either limit, otherwise green. Update at 1 Hz.
PM2.5 alarm with rate limiting: when PM2.5 crosses above 25 ug/m^3, emit a single alarm pulse and suppress repeats for 5 minutes. When it falls below 15 ug/m^3, emit a single clear pulse.

Compute a 60 s moving average of temperature (degC) and assert an 'OVERHEAT' alarm if the average exceeds 30 degC. Keep showing the instantaneous temperature on a separate output channel. Sample at 2 Hz.
Humidity condensate latch: trigger an alarm when RH >= 95% for 15 s. Latch the alarm until RH <= 85% for 30 s or a manual reset input is pressed. Include visual and audible outputs.
Storm warning: raise an alert if pressure drops by more than 2 kPa within 10 minutes. Clear the alert when the pressure stabilizes (change < 0.5 kPa over 10 minutes). Update once per minute.
Light level classification: low (< 50 lux) -> blue LED; normal (50–300 lux) -> green; glare (> 20000 lux) -> red LED plus a 1 s beep every 10 s while glare persists.

Sensor diagnostics: monitor temperature (degC), humidity (%), and pressure (kPa) for out-of-range or missing values. If any sensor is invalid, raise a 'SENSOR FAULT' and suppress environmental alarms until readings are valid again. Poll at 5 Hz.

CO2 ventilation logic: request ventilation when CO2 > 800 ppm, assert high alarm when CO2 > 1500 ppm. Clear ventilation when < 700 ppm and high alarm when < 1200 ppm. Provide separate outputs for each.

Air filter status state machine using PM10 (ug/m^3): CLEAN, CAUTION, CLOGGED. Require sustained levels (e.g., > 75 ug/m^3 for 10 min to enter CLOGGED) and similar persistence to clear. Drive distinct indicator outputs. Loop at 1 Hz.
Overheat escalation: when temperature exceeds 45 degC, start a 60 s timer. If still above 45 degC at timeout, activate a sustained alarm; cancel if temperature falls below 43 degC before timeout.
Greenhouse advisory: if RH < 40% and illuminance > 5000 lux, show 'HIGH EVAP' warning. If RH < 30% regardless of light, raise 'WATER NOW' alarm. Otherwise show 'OK'.

Dual temperature sensors with fault handling: use the primary sensor unless it fails self-check or differs from the backup by > 2 degC for more than 10 s. In that case, flag a fault and switch decisions to the backup sensor.

Apply an exponential moving average to CO2 (time constant ~10 s) before comparing to a 1000 ppm threshold. Use the filtered value for alarms but continue to publish the raw value as a separate output.
Pressure-based leak detection: assert an alarm if pressure stays below 90 kPa for 5 s or if it drops by more than 5 kPa within 2 s. Require pressure > 92 kPa for 10 s to clear.

Manage two independent CO2 channels (Room A and Room B), each with its own threshold and alarm output. Drive a shared buzzer only when at least one room is in high alarm; if both are alarming, ensure the buzzer pattern reflects the highest severity.

Add a calibration mode for pressure: on a long-press input, capture the current pressure as a reference baseline. Provide RUN and CALIBRATE states, with clear indicators, and ensure normal alarms are suspended during calibration.

Closed-loop temperature control: regulate enclosure temperature to 25 degC using a fan output with a PID controller. Include anti-windup and a hard safety cutoff that forces the fan to 100% and asserts a critical alarm if temperature exceeds 60 degC. Run at 20 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.

Humidity control with duty cycling: maintain relative humidity at 55% using a dehumidifier controlled by a 60 s duty window (0–100%). Implement a PI controller with integral clamp, and raise an alarm if RH remains > 70% for more than 2 minutes. Update every 1 s.

Compute heat index (degC) from temperature and RH. Raise 'HEAT STRESS' if heat index > 35 degC, with a pre-alarm when the 5 min average exceeds 33 degC. If either sensor fails, degrade gracefully and use available data with a fault indicator.

Estimate dew point from temperature (degC) and RH (%). Trigger condensation protection when dew point is within 2 degC of a measured surface temperature; issue a pre-alarm when within 4 degC. Add hysteresis and persistence to avoid rapid toggling.

Fuse CO2 (ppm), VOC (ppb), and PM2.5 (ug/m^3) into a composite IAQ score using weighted normalization. Define three alarm bands (Good, Moderate, Poor) and clamp the score to valid ranges. Sample at 2 Hz with WCET <= 3 ms, and flag sensor faults.

Filter pressure with a robust estimator to reject spikes and dropouts. Detect a rapid change condition when filtered pressure falls by > 3 kPa over 30 s and assert an alarm. Handle missing measurements by holding last good value for up to 5 s with a fault flag.

Implement 2-out-of-3 voting using three temperature sensors. Identify and isolate a sensor that deviates from the other two by > 3 degC for > 10 s. Use the voted temperature for warning at 45 degC and critical at 55 degC, and issue a 'SENSOR FAULT' if any channel is excluded.

Illuminance regulation: use a PID controller to adjust a dimmer output to maintain 500 lux at the sensor. Apply rate limiting to the control output, anti-windup, and raise an alarm if the target cannot be met and light stays above 2000 lux for 60 s.

Predictive CO2 alerting: estimate a linear trend from the last 2 minutes of CO2 data and raise a pre-emptive alert if the projection exceeds 1000 ppm within the next 5 minutes. Also raise a standard alarm when actually above 1000 ppm. Handle missing samples gracefully.

Compute a simplified heat stress index (e.g., WBGT approximation) using temperature (degC), RH (%), and light (lux). Warn when index > 29 degC and escalate at > 31 degC. Include sensor validation and fail-safe behavior if any input is invalid.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with NORMAL, QUIET, and EMERGENCY modes. Monitor CO2 (ppm), PM2.5 (ug/m^3), and temperature (degC). QUIET silences the buzzer but keeps visual alarms; EMERGENCY pre-empts all modes and drives continuous audible alarm when CO2 > 2000 ppm or PM2.5 > 100 ug/m^3 or temperature > 55 degC. Specify safety thresholds, mode priorities, and clear alarm logic.

Build a facility monitor with modes: STARTUP SELF-TEST, RUN, DEGRADED, SAFE SHUTDOWN. Validate temperature (degC), humidity (%), and pressure (kPa) on startup; if a sensor fails, enter DEGRADED with limited functionality and a fault alarm. Guarantee loop rate 10 Hz and WCET <= 4 ms. Define acceptance criteria for each mode and transitions.

Create a seasonal greenhouse controller with modes WINTER, SUMMER, and CALIBRATION. Fuse temperature (degC), RH (%), and light (lux). Use PID control to track temperature in WINTER and humidity in SUMMER. Define safety cutoffs, alarm thresholds, and a calibration routine for sensor offsets. Include a test plan covering setpoint tracking, saturation, and sensor loss.
