Implement a 4-room IAQ monitor. Each room has CO2, VOC, and PM2.5 thresholds and its own visual alarm. A shared buzzer is driven when any two rooms are in critical state. Specify deterministic arbitration of the buzzer, handling of sensor update jitter, and behavior under missed frames or overload.

Specify a safety-critical environmental monitoring system with redundant sensors, majority voting, hysteresis, and a maintenance mode. Include explicit limits (e.g., CO2 > 2000 ppm and PM2.5 > 100 ug/m^3) with maximum exposure times before EMERGENCY. Provide timing guarantees (control loop 50 Hz, WCET <= 1 ms) and a structured test suite with fault injection and corner cases.
Monitor ambient temperature in [degC]; turn on an overheat alarm when above 45 degC and clear only after it falls below 40 degC (hysteresis). Publish a boolean overheat flag.
Continuously read relative humidity in [%]; raise a 'too_dry' alarm when below 30% and a 'too_humid' alarm when above 70%. Ensure both alarms cannot be active simultaneously.
Track barometric pressure in hPa; assert a low_pressure alarm if pressure drops below 950 hPa and a high_pressure alarm above 1050 hPa.
Measure ambient light in lux; set a 'dark' flag when light is below 50 lux and clear it when above 100 lux to avoid chatter.
Monitor PM2.5 concentration in µg/m3; trigger an air_quality_warning when PM2.5 exceeds 35 µg/m3.
Read CO2 level in ppm; assert a ventilation_request when CO2 is greater than 1000 ppm.
Check UV index; if UV index is 8 or higher, assert a high_uv_alert until it falls to 6 or lower.
Ensure the workspace temperature stays within 15–30 degC; output a 'safe_temperature' flag that is true only within this range.
Evaluate comfort based on relative humidity [%]; set a 'comfortable_humidity' flag true when RH is between 40% and 60%, otherwise false.
Issue a freeze_warning when ambient temperature drops below 5 degC; clear the warning after the temperature rises to at least 7 degC.
Monitor differential pressure across a filter in Pa; assert filter_clogged when ΔP exceeds 200 Pa.
Track VOC index (unitless); set a voc_warning when the index is above 250.
Flag 'glare' when illuminance exceeds 7000 lux; clear when it falls below 6000 lux to add hysteresis.
Validate temperature readings; if measured temperature is outside -40 to 125 degC, mark sensor_fault and suppress all temperature-based alarms.
Validate humidity readings [%]; flag sensor_fault if RH is less than 0% or greater than 100%.

Compute heat index using ambient temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]; sample at 1 Hz and trigger a heat_stress alarm when heat index exceeds 40 degC for at least 10 s. Ensure alarm is raised within 2 s of sustained violation.
Design a state machine for air quality with states Good, Moderate, and Unhealthy using CO2 [ppm] and PM2.5 [µg/m3]. Include hysteresis bands and a 3-color status output. Sampling rate 1 Hz.
Detect rapid pressure drops: sample pressure at 0.2 Hz and raise storm_warning if pressure decreases by more than 3 hPa within 10 minutes. Guarantee WCET ≤ 5 ms per cycle.
Classify ambient light into Dark (<100 lux), Indoor (100–1000 lux), and Bright (>1000 lux). Require a condition to persist for 3 s before changing state to prevent flicker.
Calculate dew point from temperature [degC] and RH [%]; assert condensation_risk when (temperature - dew_point) < 2 degC. Update at 1 Hz.
Implement sensor health monitoring: if no new humidity sample arrives within 1 s, raise humidity_sensor_fault and inhibit humidity-based alarms until recovery.
Estimate altitude from pressure (hPa). Log a 'rapid_altitude_change' event if altitude changes by more than 50 m in 60 s. Sampling at 2 Hz with a 5-s moving average.
Fuse two temperature sensors: publish the median temperature [degC]. If their difference exceeds 2 degC, set temp_disagree fault and hold last known good fused value.
Compute a thermal comfort indicator (Humidex) from temperature [degC] and RH [%]; categorize comfort into Normal, Caution, and Danger with appropriate alarms and hysteresis.
Combine CO [ppm] and CO2 [ppm]: request ventilation if CO ≥ 9 ppm or CO2 ≥ 1200 ppm; escalate to critical_alarm if CO ≥ 35 ppm for over 60 s. Include latching until acknowledged_clear is received.
Maintain rolling min and max of ambient temperature [degC] over the last 60 minutes; update every minute and raise out_of_bounds if either crosses configurable safe limits.
Compute absolute humidity [g/m3] from temperature [degC] and RH [%]; warn if absolute humidity exceeds 20 g/m3, and mark reading_invalid if RH > 100%.
Detect sunrise: low-pass filter illuminance (lux) and assert sunrise_event when filtered value crosses above 300 lux with a positive slope > 50 lux/min. Sample at 2 Hz.
Humidity alarm debouncing: at 1 Hz, only assert too_humid when two consecutive samples exceed 70%, and only clear after two consecutive samples are below 65%.
State machine for pressure alarms with states Normal, Warning, and Critical based on absolute pressure [hPa] and 5-minute trend [hPa]. Include timed hysteresis for each transition.
Implement a stale-data watchdog for PM2.5 [µg/m3]: if no update within 5 s, set sensor_fault and force status to Unknown until data resumes. WCET for each cycle must be ≤ 3 ms.
Monitor combined light and UV exposure: compute lux-hours and UV dose over a 24-hour window; trigger overexposure when either exceeds configured limits. Update every minute.
Compare indoor and outdoor dew points [degC]; assert ventilation_allowed only when outdoor dew point is at least 2 degC lower than indoor, and outdoor temperature is between 5 and 25 degC.
Median filter PM2.5 readings using a 5-sample window at 2 Hz before thresholding. Raise unhealthy_air when filtered PM2.5 > 55 µg/m3 for at least 15 s.
Detect light sensor saturation: if measured lux equals the sensor's maximum scale value for more than 2 s, assert light_sensor_fault and ignore lux-based decisions.

Fuse three temperature sensors using a fault-tolerant 2-out-of-3 voting scheme with outlier rejection; compute a fused temperature [degC] and assert overheat if fused value > 60 degC. Flag sensor_disagreement if any pair differs by > 3 degC. Ensure fail-safe behavior on multiple faults.
Design a Kalman-filtered barometric pressure estimator (hPa) to suppress noise while tracking trends; detect sudden events when the innovation exceeds 5 hPa. Sampling at 1 Hz, WCET per update ≤ 4 ms.

Implement baseline-corrected CO2 monitoring: track nightly minima to adjust baseline drift, but never lower alarm thresholds below 800 ppm. Raise alarms at 1000 ppm (warning) and 1500 ppm (critical) with latching and manual reset input.

Create a PID-based humidity control signal to maintain 50% RH using RH [%] as feedback. Include anti-windup, output limits 0–100%, and a safety override that forces output to 0% if condensation_risk is true (dew point within 1 degC of temperature). Control loop at 1 Hz, WCET ≤ 2 ms.

Perform sensor fusion of PM2.5 [µg/m3] and VOC index (unitless) into a composite air_quality_score (0–500). Use weighted averaging with dynamic weights based on recent variance; declare score_invalid if either sensor_fault is set. Trigger alerts at 100, 200, and 300.

Implement redundancy management for two humidity sensors: compute a weighted average [%] using per-sensor quality factors; if their difference exceeds 8%, discard the lower-quality reading and flag mismatch. Maintain safe outputs during transitions.

Detect thermal runaway using a combination of absolute temperature [degC] and rate-of-rise [degC/min]. Raise level1 at 55 degC or 5 degC/min, level2 at 65 degC or 10 degC/min, and critical_shutdown at 75 degC. Rate computed over a 60 s window.

Design a multi-sensor air quality assessor that classifies air as Good, Fair, Poor, or Hazardous based on PM2.5 [µg/m3], CO2 [ppm], and VOC index. Include missing-data handling, per-sensor confidence, and conservative fail-safe defaults.

Implement pressure altitude smoothing with a complementary filter blending baro pressure and a slow-trend model; detect sensor stall (no change for 15 min) and raise sensor_fault. Sampling 1 Hz with WCET ≤ 3 ms.

Build an exposure budget system: integrate UV index and illuminance (lux) over time to compute daily dose; enforce hard safety thresholds and lockout further exposure signals when dose limits are exceeded until midnight_reset.

Develop a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes Startup_SelfTest, Normal, Degraded, and FailSafe. Inputs include temperature [degC], RH [%], pressure [hPa], light [lux], CO2 [ppm], and PM2.5 [µg/m3]. Define state transitions on sensor faults and out-of-range readings, latch critical alarms, and ensure in FailSafe all control outputs default to non-hazardous states. Sampling at 1 Hz with WCET ≤ 5 ms. Provide a comprehensive test plan with fault-injection cases.

Create a facility air quality supervisor for three redundant PM2.5 sensors using 2oo3 voting, stale-data detection, and drift monitoring. Compute a fused PM2.5 [µg/m3], map to AQI categories, and drive a 4-level alarm with hysteresis and latching. Specify deterministic timing (2 Hz processing, WCET ≤ 3 ms) and include verification steps for all edge cases.

Specify a condensation prevention controller with modes Monitor, PreAlert, Alert, and SafeHold. Use temperature [degC], RH [%], and dew point [degC]; transitions depend on (T - dew_point) thresholds and persistence times. Include formal invariants (no false clear while risk persists), bounded WCET (≤ 2 ms), and a detailed scenario-based test suite.

Design an adaptive PID temperature-tracking monitor with modes Warmup, Control, and Fault. Use temperature [degC] feedback; adapt gains based on error magnitude while enforcing rate limits and anti-windup. Override to Fault on sensor_fault or if temperature exceeds 80 degC. Define acceptance tests for setpoint tracking, disturbance rejection, and fail-safe behavior.

Define a comprehensive AQI fusion module combining PM2.5 [µg/m3], PM10 [µg/m3], CO2 [ppm], and VOC index into a single 0–500 score. Include missing-sensor handling, confidence weighting, and strict safety requirements: monotonic increases with any pollutant, alarms at 100/200/300 with latching, deterministic 1 Hz updates (WCET ≤ 4 ms), and exhaustive unit tests including boundary and saturation cases.
Turn on an over-temperature alarm when ambient temperature exceeds 35 degC and clear it only after it falls below 34 degC (1 degC hysteresis). Sample at 2 Hz.
Monitor relative humidity [%]. If it goes above 85%, light a 'high humidity' indicator; if it drops below 30%, light a 'low humidity' indicator; otherwise keep both off.
Raise a pressure drop alarm when barometric pressure goes below 980 hPa. Clear the alarm only when pressure returns above 985 hPa.
Use the light sensor to set indicators: if lux < 50, turn on a 'dark' lamp; if lux > 50000, assert 'overexposure' alarm; otherwise keep indicators off.
If CO2 concentration exceeds 1200 ppm continuously for 10 s, sound an air quality alarm. Silence the alarm only when CO2 stays below 900 ppm for 30 s.
Set a particulate alert when PM2.5 exceeds 35 µg/m³ and clear it when PM2.5 drops below 25 µg/m³. Sample at 1 Hz.
Trigger a freeze alarm if temperature falls below 0 degC and clear it when temperature rises above 2 degC.
Detect rapid humidity change: if relative humidity changes by more than 10% within any 2 s window, assert a 'humidity spike' alarm and auto-clear after 10 s of stability.
Monitor the freshness of temperature data. If no new measurement arrives within 1 s, set a 'sensor stale' alarm; clear immediately on next valid update.
Track the highest temperature observed within each minute and trigger an alarm if the minute peak exceeds 40 degC. Reset the peak at minute rollover.
Drive a cooling relay based on temperature: on when > 30 degC, off when < 28 degC. Include an 'overheat' alarm at 45 degC.
If the light sensor reading reaches its saturation level, raise a 'sensor saturated' alarm and keep it latched until the reading returns to a valid range and a reset request is received.
Assert a high-pressure alert when barometric pressure rises above 1040 hPa and clear it once it drops below 1035 hPa.
Monitor total volatile compounds (TVOC). If TVOC exceeds 500 ppb for 5 s, assert an air quality alarm; clear when TVOC remains below 300 ppb for 20 s.
Check temperature step changes: if the difference between consecutive temperature samples at 10 Hz exceeds 5 degC, raise a 'sensor glitch' alarm.

Create a temperature state machine with states 'NORMAL' (<= 30 degC), 'WARN' (30-40 degC), and 'CRITICAL' (> 40 degC). Enter 'CRITICAL' with a latched alarm requiring manual reset, and hysteresis of 1 degC on all transitions.

Monitor temperature [degC] and humidity [%] for heat stress: if temp > 32 degC and RH > 60% for 60 s, assert 'heat stress' warning; clear only after both remain below those thresholds for 60 s. Run at 2 Hz.
Detect possible storm onset: assert an alarm if barometric pressure drops by more than 6 hPa over 3 hours and temperature drops by more than 3 degC in the same period. Update once per minute.

Implement a light-level state machine with hysteresis: enter 'DARK' if lux < 100 for 10 s, enter 'BRIGHT' if lux > 300 for 10 s, else 'NORMAL'. Flash an indicator on each transition. Execute at 10 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.

Use CO2 (ppm) and TVOC (ppb) to control an air quality relay: activate if CO2 > 1000 ppm OR TVOC > 400 ppb. Deactivate only when CO2 < 800 ppm AND TVOC < 300 ppb for 120 s. Include an alarm while active.

Compute apparent temperature (heat index) from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]. Trigger a 'heat advisory' alarm when apparent temperature exceeds 40 degC. Sample at 1 Hz and debounce for 5 s.

Estimate dew point from temperature [degC] and humidity [%]. If dew point is within 2 degC of a provided surface temperature input, assert a 'condensation risk' alarm; clear with 1 degC hysteresis. Run at 5 Hz.
Cross-check two humidity sensors: if their readings differ by more than 7%, raise a 'sensor disagreement' alarm; otherwise publish the average humidity for display.
Track daily min/max for temperature [degC] and humidity [%], resetting at midnight. Assert a 'record high' alarm when the day's max temperature reaches or exceeds 45 degC.
Map PM2.5 [µg/m³] into air quality categories: 'GOOD' (0-12), 'MODERATE' (12.1-35.4), 'UNHEALTHY' (> 35.4). Drive three outputs for the category and assert an alarm in 'UNHEALTHY'. Sample at 1 Hz.
Use barometric pressure [hPa] and temperature [degC] to estimate altitude change. Raise an alarm if descent rate exceeds 1 m/s for more than 5 s. Update every 200 ms.
Detect light flicker: if lux varies by more than 20% at 50-60 Hz, raise a 'flicker hazard' alarm. Ensure a 500 Hz sampling rate with WCET <= 0.5 ms.
Implement a latching particulate alarm: if PM2.5 > 100 µg/m³ for 30 s, enter 'ALARM' state. Do not clear until PM2.5 remains below 50 µg/m³ and a manual reset is requested.
Switch between 'DAY' and 'NIGHT' modes based on lux with hysteresis and 20 s delay. In NIGHT mode, set the CO2 alarm threshold to 800 ppm; in DAY mode, 1000 ppm. Sample at 1 Hz.
Create a temperature window alarm: if temperature leaves [18 degC, 26 degC] for more than 5 minutes, assert an alarm; provide a pre-alarm when within 0.5 degC of either bound.

Monitor humidity trend: if relative humidity rises by more than 5% over 10 minutes and exceeds 60%, issue a 'moisture rising' warning; if it exceeds 70%, escalate to 'critical'. Filter with a 1-minute moving average.
Implement a multi-sensor watchdog: if temperature, humidity, or pressure data age exceeds 2 s, raise a 'stale data' alarm and log which sensor failed. Run at 10 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.
Create a brightness adaptive threshold: compute the 90th percentile of lux over the last 60 s and alarm when current lux exceeds that value by 20%. Update at 5 Hz.
Adjust PM2.5 alarm thresholds based on humidity: when RH > 90%, increase the PM2.5 'UNHEALTHY' threshold by 20%; otherwise use the nominal threshold. Log which threshold policy is active.
Compute absolute humidity [g/m³] from temperature [degC] and RH [%]. Assert a 'high moisture' alarm above 15 g/m³ with 1 g/m³ hysteresis. Handle invalid sensor data safely.

Maintain room temperature at 24 degC using a PID to modulate a fan output (0-100%). Safety: if temperature exceeds 45 degC, force output to 0% and assert a critical alarm. Sample at 10 Hz with anti-windup.

Regulate relative humidity to 50% with a PID controlling a humidifier drive. Clamp output to 0-100%, implement soft-start, and enter emergency shutdown if RH > 80% or temperature < 5 degC. Run at 20 Hz, WCET <= 2 ms.

Fuse three temperature sensors into a single estimate using weighted averaging with outlier rejection. If any sensor deviates by more than 3 degC from the fused value for over 30 s, raise a 'redundancy failed' alarm.

Filter barometric pressure [hPa] to estimate sea-level pressure and trend using a Kalman-like approach. Alarm on drop > 8 hPa within 1 hour. Handle intermittent sensor data without destabilizing the estimate. Run at 1 Hz, WCET <= 1 ms.

Compute an IAQ score from CO2 (ppm), TVOC (ppb), and PM2.5 (µg/m³). Drive a 3-color alarm: green (good), yellow (moderate), red (poor). Latch in red when any: CO2 > 1500 ppm, TVOC > 600 ppb, or PM2.5 > 55 µg/m³ for 60 s; manual reset required.

Prevent condensation by keeping dew point at least 3 degC below a measured surface temperature. Estimate dew point from air temperature [degC] and RH [%], and use a PID to modulate a dehumidifier. On any sensor fault, go to safe OFF and assert an alarm.

Implement triple-redundant humidity sensing: compute the median of three RH [%] inputs. If two do not agree within 5%, enter SAFE state and latch a 'sensor fault' alarm until maintenance reset. Run at 5 Hz.

Integrate light exposure: accumulate daily dose in klux·h from lux readings. Raise an exposure alarm when the dose exceeds a configurable limit and reset the accumulator at midnight, preserving counts across power cycles.
Estimate vertical speed from barometric pressure [hPa] and temperature [degC] using a complementary filter. Raise an alarm if ascent or descent exceeds 2 m/s for more than 3 s. Sample at 10 Hz.

Detect thermal runaway by monitoring temperature slope dT/dt in degC/min. If dT/dt > 20 degC/min and absolute temperature > 60 degC, assert immediate critical alarm and command safe shutdown. Run at 20 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes 'STARTUP', 'NORMAL', 'ALERT', and 'FAIL-SAFE'. On STARTUP, perform self-tests of temperature, humidity, pressure, light, and CO2 sensors. NORMAL enforces: temp 18-26 degC, RH 40-60%, pressure 990-1030 hPa, light 100-10000 lux, CO2 < 1000 ppm. Enter ALERT if any metric breaches for > 60 s; enter FAIL-SAFE on sensor faults. Include latching alarms, manual reset, 5 Hz sampling, WCET per cycle <= 2 ms.

Create a comprehensive indoor air quality state machine with modes 'ECO', 'COMFORT', and 'PROTECT' using CO2 (ppm), PM2.5 (µg/m³), RH (%), and temperature (degC). Define distinct thresholds per mode with hysteresis, a priority resolver for multiple simultaneous alarms, and a supervisor task deadline of 10 ms (WCET <= 3 ms) at 100 Hz.

Develop a redundant sensor framework for two temperature sensors, two humidity sensors, and one barometer. Implement plausibility checks, dew point consistency cross-checks, and automatic isolation of faulty sensors. Provide diagnostic fault codes, 50 Hz sampling, WCET <= 1 ms, and end-to-end alarm latency < 20 ms. Include acceptance test criteria.

Specify an environmental safety envelope: temperature [-10, 50] degC, RH [20, 90] %, pressure [960, 1040] hPa, light [0, 80000] lux, CO2 < 1500 ppm. Implement graded alarms 'INFO'/'WARN'/'CRIT', latch 'CRIT' with manual acknowledge, monitor data age watchdog, and run built-in self-tests at startup and hourly. Provide test cases and fault injection scenarios.

Implement a mission profile-driven monitor with profiles 'LAB', 'WAREHOUSE', and 'OUTDOOR'. Each profile sets thresholds for temperature (degC), humidity (%), pressure (hPa), light (lux), and PM2.5 (µg/m³). Include schedule-based automatic profile switching, persistent storage of thresholds, timing constraints (10 Hz loop, WCET <= 1 ms, jitter < 0.2 ms), and a verification plan covering boundaries, hysteresis, and alarm latching/reset.

Create a simple controller that reads ambient temperature [degC] at 2 Hz and turns on an alarm output whenever the value is >= 60 degC, otherwise turns it off. Include a 1 degC hysteresis to avoid chatter.
Switch a dehumidifier output on when relative humidity rises above 70 [%] and switch it off when it falls below 65 [%]. Sample every 1 s.
Turn on a light indicator if barometric pressure drops below 95 kPa, and turn it off when pressure recovers above 96 kPa. Poll the pressure sensor every 500 ms.
Control a lamp based on illuminance: if light is under 100 lux, turn the lamp on; if over 200 lux, turn it off. Check 5 times per second.
Sound a buzzer whenever CO2 concentration exceeds 1000 ppm, and silence it when it goes back below 900 ppm. Update rate: 1 Hz.
Show a 'freeze' warning output for 10 s when temperature goes below 0 degC; reset the warning if temperature stays above 2 degC. Read temperature once per second.
Drive a cooling fan output on when temperature is above 35 degC and off when it drops below 33 degC. Sample interval 1 s.
If relative humidity is below 25 [%], enable a humidifier output; disable it once humidity rises to 30 [%]. Check at 1 Hz.
Activate a warning LED if PM2.5 exceeds 35 ug/m3; deactivate it when PM2.5 is below 25 ug/m3. Sampling period: 2 s.
Turn on a status LED when ambient light exceeds 20,000 lux for at least 3 seconds; turn it off if it falls below 18,000 lux. Check 10 Hz.
Latch an overpressure alarm if pressure exceeds 110 kPa; clear the latch only after pressure stays below 105 kPa for 5 seconds. Update at 5 Hz.
Show a red indicator if air quality index (AQI) > 150, otherwise show a green indicator. Refresh each second.
If CO concentration exceeds 35 ppm, engage a high-priority alarm; cancel when CO falls below 25 ppm. Sampling at 1 Hz.
Compute a 5-second moving average of temperature [degC] and display a 'too cold' warning if the average is below 15 degC. Update every 200 ms.
Trigger a low-humidity alarm if humidity stays below 20 [%] for more than 30 seconds; auto-clear when humidity is above 25 [%]. Readings every second.

Build a controller that monitors temperature [degC] and humidity [%] to compute the heat index and drives a fan in three steps: off below 27 degC HI, medium between 27–32, and high above 32. Add 1 degC hysteresis on each step. Update at 2 Hz.

Implement a two-state machine (Normal, Alert) for barometric pressure: enter Alert if pressure < 95 kPa for over 10 s; return to Normal if it rises above 96 kPa for 10 s. Toggle an alarm output in Alert at 2 Hz. Sampling rate 5 Hz.

Monitor illuminance and temperature to protect light-sensitive equipment: if light > 15,000 lux AND temperature > 30 degC, close a shade; reopen when light < 12,000 lux OR temperature < 28 degC. Check every 200 ms.

Create logic that escalates air quality alarms using CO2 [ppm] and PM2.5 [ug/m3]: green when both below 800 ppm and 25 ug/m3; yellow when either exceeds those; red when CO2 > 1200 ppm or PM2.5 > 55 ug/m3. Update once per second.
Add a safety cutout that immediately disables a heater if temperature exceeds 80 degC, and latches the fault until temperature is below 60 degC for 60 s. Sample at 10 Hz.
Implement humidity control with anti-chatter: turn humidifier on when RH < 40 [%] for 5 s; turn off when RH > 45 [%] for 5 s. Provide an 'alarm' output if RH < 30 [%]. Check 2 Hz.

Design a simple calibration routine: on startup, average 50 pressure samples at 1 kHz to establish a baseline in kPa, then monitor and raise an alarm if pressure deviates by more than 2 kPa from baseline for longer than 3 s.

Create a controller that dims a light output proportionally with ambient light using a 0–100% duty command, but enforces a minimum of 10% when light < 50 lux and maximum of 90% when light > 5000 lux. Update at 20 Hz.

State machine with three modes (Normal, Drying, Fault) driven by humidity [%]: enter Drying when RH > 70% for 30 s; in Drying, run fan; go back to Normal when RH < 60% for 60 s; enter Fault if sensor value is out of 0–100% range; in Fault, stop everything and assert alarm. Loop at 5 Hz.
Add a rate-of-change detector on temperature: if dT/dt exceeds 5 degC/min, assert a 'thermal runaway' warning; clear when the rate returns below 2 degC/min for 120 s. Sampling at 2 Hz.

Monitor CO [ppm] and trigger two-stage alarms: Stage 1 at 35 ppm sustained 60 min, Stage 2 at 200 ppm immediate. Stage 2 overrides Stage 1. Provide timed beeping patterns for each stage. Update once per second.

Use both temperature [degC] and humidity [%] to detect condensation risk: if air temperature is within 2 degC of calculated dew point, assert 'condensation risk' and drive a fan; clear when margin exceeds 4 degC. Update 1 Hz.
Implement a watchdog on the sensing loop: run at a strict 50 ms period with a WCET budget of 5 ms; raise a timing fault and go to a safe output state if the task overruns.
Create logic that averages PM2.5 [ug/m3] over 1 minute (rolling) and uses the average for alarm decisions, but also asserts a transient alarm if any sample exceeds 150 ug/m3. Update at 2 Hz.
Monitor light and pressure together: if sudden light drop (> 5000 lux in 1 s) coincides with pressure drop (> 2 kPa in 1 s), flag an 'enclosure open' event for 10 s. Check at 10 Hz.
Implement a humidity comfort band controller: keep RH between 45–55 [%] using a humidifier and dehumidifier outputs with 2% hysteresis and minimum on/off times of 2 minutes. Update 1 Hz.

Create a temperature alarm with daily min/max tracking: sample at 1 Hz, track the minimum and maximum temperatures [degC] observed over the last 24 hours, and expose them as outputs along with a high-temp alarm at 40 degC.

Build a sun-protection controller that closes blinds when light exceeds 30,000 lux for 60 s or temperature exceeds 32 degC for 60 s, whichever comes first; open blinds when both fall below thresholds for 5 minutes. Update 1 Hz.

Add sensor plausibility checks: treat humidity [%] values outside 0–100 as faults and force outputs to a safe state; when faulted, blink an indicator at 2 Hz and ignore control actions until values return to range for 10 s. Run at 10 Hz.

Monitor CO2 [ppm] and temperature [degC] to implement a ventilation logic: open vent at 800 ppm or 28 degC, close when CO2 < 700 ppm and temperature < 26 degC; include 30 s minimum open/close times to prevent hunting. Update 2 Hz.

Implement a PID controller to regulate humidity to a setpoint of 50 [%] using a fan output (0–100%). Sample at 2 Hz, use anti-windup, and clamp output. Add a safety override that forces output to 100% if RH > 80% and to 0% if sensor is invalid.

Create a temperature control loop holding 22 degC using PID on a heater (0–100%), with rate-limited setpoint changes (max 1 degC/min) and an over-temperature safety that cuts output and latches a fault if temperature exceeds 50 degC. Control period 100 ms, WCET <= 5 ms.

Fuse two temperature sensors [degC] with outlier rejection: if their difference is <= 3 degC, use the average; if greater, use the last valid value and raise a 'disagreement' warning. Use this fused temperature to control a heater with 0.5 degC hysteresis. Update at 5 Hz.

Estimate indoor air quality from CO2 [ppm] and VOC index with a weighted formula that increases weight on VOC when temperature > 30 degC. Drive three-stage ventilation (low/medium/high) based on the estimate, and assert a hard alarm if CO2 > 2000 ppm regardless of the estimate. Loop at 1 Hz.

Implement a complementary filter to smooth barometric pressure [kPa] using a fast noisy channel and a slow stable channel; output a stable pressure estimate used to detect sudden drops > 3 kPa in 10 s. Raise an alarm and keep it latched until pressure is stable for 60 s. Update at 20 Hz.

Perform triple-redundant temperature sensing with majority voting across three sensors [degC]. If any sensor deviates by > 5 degC from the other two, mark it faulty and exclude it. Use the voted value to control a cooling fan with proportional output 0–100%, and go to a safe state if fewer than two sensors are valid. Run at 2 Hz.

Implement exposure-based alarms for CO [ppm]: compute both 8-hour TWA and 15-minute STEL using rolling windows, assert warnings when TWA > 9 ppm and STEL > 35 ppm, and a critical alarm at any instantaneous reading > 200 ppm. Sampling at 1 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.

Design a thermal safety supervisor that monitors absolute temperature [degC] and dT/dt. If T > 70 degC or dT/dt > 10 degC/min, cut power and latch a fault; provide a timed cool-down requirement (T < 50 degC for 10 minutes) before allowing reset. Update 5 Hz.

Control a greenhouse vent using PID on CO2 [ppm] to maintain 900 ppm during the day, but switch the setpoint to 600 ppm when light < 200 lux (night). Include bumpless transfer, output saturation, and a hard safety that opens vent fully if CO2 > 2000 ppm. Period 500 ms.

Fuse humidity [%] and temperature [degC] to compute dew point and control a dehumidifier via PID to keep dew point at least 3 degC below surface temperature input. Include sensor validation, anti-windup, and a fault state if dew point calculation overflows. Run at 2 Hz.
Monitor ambient temperature at 1 Hz and light a red alarm LED if it rises above 45 degC; clear the LED only after temperature returns below 43 degC.
Read relative humidity in % once per second and sound a buzzer if humidity drops below 20%; stop the buzzer when humidity climbs back above 25%.
Continuously measure barometric pressure in hPa and turn on a warning LED if pressure goes below 980 hPa; add a 5 hPa hysteresis for clearing the alarm.
Sample light level in lux at 2 Hz and turn on a night indicator if the level stays under 50 lux for 10 seconds.
Trigger an alarm LED if CO2 concentration exceeds 1000 ppm; the LED should auto-clear when CO2 falls below 900 ppm.
Monitor PM2.5 concentration in ug/m3 and activate a red LED if the value exceeds 35 ug/m3; deactivate when it falls below 25 ug/m3.
Enable a warning buzzer when VOC index indicates poor air quality (index >= 5) for more than 15 seconds; silence when index < 4.
Detect freezing conditions: if temperature is below 0 degC for 5 consecutive samples, turn on a freeze alarm LED; clear once above 2 degC.
Raise a condensation risk alarm if relative humidity exceeds 85% for at least 30 seconds; show the alarm on a dedicated LED.
If ambient light exceeds 10000 lux, blink an overbright indicator at 2 Hz; stop blinking when lux drops below 9000.
Turn on a high-pressure warning if barometric pressure rises above 1030 hPa, and clear it when pressure returns below 1025 hPa.
Compute temperature change rate and sound a buzzer if the slope exceeds 2 degC per minute; silence the buzzer when the slope falls below 1 degC per minute.
Monitor humidity drift and illuminate an alert LED if relative humidity changes by more than 10% within 5 minutes.
Continuously read carbon monoxide and activate an alarm if CO exceeds 30 ppm for at least 10 seconds; auto-clear after 60 seconds below 25 ppm.
If the air quality index exceeds 100 for more than 20 seconds, turn on a warning LED; clear the LED when AQI remains below 80 for 60 seconds.

Implement a small state machine with states Monitoring, AlarmLatched, and Acknowledged for temperature safety: trigger AlarmLatched if temperature exceeds 50 degC; keep the LED on until a user button acknowledges; return to Monitoring only after temperature is below 45 degC.

Compute heat index from temperature (degC) and relative humidity (%) at 2 Hz, smooth with a 5-sample moving average, and start a buzzer if heat index exceeds 40 degC; include a 2 degC hysteresis before stopping the buzzer.
Calculate dew point in degC from temperature and humidity; if dew point is within 2 degC of ambient temperature, assert a condensation alarm LED; sample at 1 Hz.
Create a multi-level CO2 alarm: at 1000 ppm blink slowly, at 1500 ppm blink fast, above 2000 ppm steady red LED and buzzer; sample at 1 Hz and hold each alarm for at least 30 seconds.
Track barometric pressure trend and raise a storm alert if pressure drops more than 4 hPa over 3 hours; blink a yellow LED at 1 Hz until the trend reverses.
Use light level to choose day or night thresholds for temperature alarms: during day alarm at > 35 degC, at night alarm at > 30 degC; sample light and temperature at 2 Hz.
Compute a 60-second running average of PM2.5; if average > 25 ug/m3 show yellow, if > 35 ug/m3 show red; clear to green when average < 20 ug/m3.
From temperature and relative humidity, compute absolute humidity and warn if absolute humidity exceeds 15 g/m3 while temperature is below 18 degC.

Read two temperature sensors; if their difference is greater than 2 degC, set a sensor fault LED; otherwise display the average temperature and assert an overtemp alarm if the average exceeds 50 degC.
Implement a three-color air quality status using CO2 and PM2.5: green when CO2 < 800 ppm and PM2.5 < 12 ug/m3, yellow for moderate exceedance, red if CO2 > 1500 ppm or PM2.5 > 55 ug/m3.
Sample temperature, humidity, and pressure at 5 Hz with a processing WCET not exceeding 2 ms per cycle; compute Humidex and trigger an alarm if Humidex > 35 degC with a 2 degC clear hysteresis.
Implement sunrise and sunset detection using light sensor hysteresis (sunrise at 300 lux, sunset at 200 lux) and enable a high humidity alarm only during night mode when RH > 80%.
Track min and max temperature values in degC and provide a button to reset them; trigger an alarm if min < -10 degC or max > 50 degC.
Apply a configurable calibration offset to humidity readings in % stored in nonvolatile memory; use calibrated values for alarm thresholds at 30% low and 80% high.
Filter barometric pressure with a 5-sample median to reject spikes and assert a low-pressure warning when the filtered value drops below 985 hPa for at least 20 seconds.
For CO2 alarms, add a debounced acknowledge button that silences the buzzer for 10 minutes while keeping the alarm LED latched until CO2 remains below 900 ppm.
Implement sensor health monitoring: if no new temperature sample arrives within 2 seconds, raise a sensor fault LED distinct from the overtemperature alarm.
Use threshold hold times for humidity: trigger alarm if RH > 80% for 30 seconds; clear only after RH < 75% for 60 seconds.
Compute a 1-minute moving average of light in lux and if the average is below 100 lux while temperature is below 18 degC, assert a chill warning LED.
Create multi-threshold light alarms: below 50 lux blink slowly for low light, above 20000 lux blink fast for glare, otherwise steady green; ensure transitions are hysteretic by 10%.

Design a PID loop to maintain enclosure temperature at 25 degC using sensor feedback; implement a hard safety cutoff with an emergency alarm if temperature exceeds 55 degC or climbs faster than 5 degC per minute; sample at 5 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.
Control humidity with a PID targeting 50% RH; enforce safety limits so RH never exceeds 65% or falls below 30%; include integral windup protection and sample at 2 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

Fuse two CO2 sensors into a single estimate using outlier rejection and variance-based weighting; raise an alarm if the fused CO2 exceeds 1200 ppm; if a sensor fails or disagrees by > 400 ppm, isolate it and report a fault.

Perform sensor fusion on two humidity sensors and one temperature sensor to produce a bias-corrected relative humidity estimate; trigger a high humidity alarm if fused RH > 80% for 60 seconds and enter a degraded mode if estimated uncertainty is high.

Implement triple modular redundancy for temperature using three sensors with majority voting; declare sensor fault if spread exceeds 3 degC, and use the voted temperature for an overheat alarm at 60 degC.

Compute an air quality status from PM2.5 (ug/m3) and CO2 (ppm); choose the worst category and drive a multi-tone buzzer pattern accordingly; add a minimum 60-second dwell time before downgrading the alarm.

Adapt light alarm thresholds based on a rolling 24-hour baseline; raise an anomaly alarm if current lux deviates by more than 5 times the baseline standard deviation during daytime; bound sampling jitter and keep loop WCET under 2 ms.

Issue a storm warning if the exponentially smoothed derivative of barometric pressure is less than -1.5 hPa per hour for at least 2 hours; ensure numerical stability over a 24-hour buffer and a WCET of 2 ms.

Detect thermal runaway by combining absolute temperature and slope: trigger an emergency alarm and latch it if temperature exceeds 50 degC or if the slope stays above 5 degC per minute for 2 minutes; manual reset required.

Verify physical units and ranges on every sample: reject and flag a fault if humidity is outside 0% to 100%, temperature outside -40 degC to 125 degC, or pressure outside 800 hPa to 1100 hPa; sample at 10 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

Create a multi-mode environmental monitor with states Normal, Alert, Emergency, and Maintenance that supervises temperature (degC), humidity (%), CO2 (ppm), PM2.5 (ug/m3), and light (lux); define thresholds and latching rules for each mode, acknowledge behavior, and ensure deterministic execution at 5 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.

On startup, run a sensor warm-up and self-test sequence for temperature, humidity, pressure, light, and CO2; only enter Monitoring state after all tests pass or else enter Maintenance; include explicit pass criteria and a timed abort after 30 seconds.

Implement strict environmental limits for a sensitive room: temperature 22 to 26 degC, humidity 40% to 60%, CO2 < 800 ppm, PM2.5 < 12 ug/m3, and light between 100 and 1000 lux; provide multi-tier alarms with escalation to Emergency if any limit is violated for more than 5 minutes; sampling at 2 Hz with WCET <= 2 ms.

Design a configurable monitoring system with profiles Office, Workshop, and Greenhouse; each profile specifies thresholds for temperature (degC), humidity (%), light (lux), CO2 (ppm), and PM2.5 (ug/m3); support scheduled profile changes and verify profile-specific alarms with a test checklist; enforce WCET <= 2 ms.

Implement an air quality safety controller with modes Normal, Boost, and Emergency: regulate CO2 toward 900 ppm using PID-based demand while enforcing hard overrides if PM2.5 > 55 ug/m3 or CO > 30 ppm; include built-in self-test, deterministic 10 Hz scheduling, WCET <= 1 ms, and a comprehensive alarm logic with latching and manual reset.
Turn on a red alarm indicator whenever ambient temperature exceeds 60 degC. Sample at 5 Hz and clear the alarm when the value falls back below 55 degC.
If relative humidity rises above 70%, switch on a warning LED; turn it off when humidity drops below 65%.
Sound a short buzzer alert if light level falls below 20 lux for more than 2 s.
Set an overpressure flag when barometric pressure is greater than 1050 hPa; clear it when pressure is back under 1040 hPa.
Keep it simple: activate ventilation output when CO2 concentration exceeds 1000 ppm; deactivate when it falls below 800 ppm.
Latch an overheat fault when temperature reaches 85 degC; keep the fault asserted until system reset.
If VOC index exceeds 300, turn on an air quality alarm; show green when below 150.
Blink a status LED at 1 Hz while PM2.5 stays above 35 µg/m³; solid off when below 20 µg/m³.
Trigger an alert if humidity drops below 30% for longer than 10 s to indicate overly dry air.
Report a sensor fault if no new temperature sample arrives within 2 s (watchdog on the data stream).
Indicate 'too bright' when illuminance goes over 50,000 lux; clear when under 45,000 lux (include hysteresis).
Raise a 'freezing risk' warning when temperature is below 0 degC.
Set an alarm when AQI exceeds 150; automatically clear when AQI < 100 for at least 30 s.
If pressure drops below 95 kPa, assert a low-pressure alarm.
Toggle a yellow LED whenever temperature returns to the safe range 18–25 degC after being out of range.

Create a two-state controller for a greenhouse: MONITOR and ALARM. In MONITOR, sample temperature [degC] and humidity [%] at 10 Hz. Enter ALARM if temperature > 35 degC or humidity < 30%. In ALARM, flash a red LED at 2 Hz until both readings are back in the safe band (temp 20–30 degC and humidity 40–60%), then return to MONITOR.
Compute comfort level from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%], and drive a 3-color LED: blue for 'cool/dry', green for 'comfortable', red for 'hot/humid'. Update at 2 Hz.

Monitor CO2 (ppm) and VOC index together; if either exceeds its threshold (CO2 > 1200 ppm or VOC > 400), open a ventilation output and keep it on for at least 3 minutes (minimum on-time) before reevaluating.
Implement a simple light-based day/night detector with hysteresis using lux and UV index; enable 'DAY' when lux > 10,000 or UV > 1.0, else 'NIGHT'.
Sample pressure (hPa) at 1 Hz and compute a rolling average over 60 s. If the instantaneous reading deviates by more than 15 hPa from the average, raise a 'rapid change' alarm.

Build a state machine for freezer monitoring with states: NORMAL, WARNING, CRITICAL. Use temperature [degC]: WARNING if -15 degC < temp <= -10 degC for 5 min, CRITICAL if temp > -10 degC; revert to NORMAL only after temp <= -18 degC for 10 min. Drive LEDs per state.
When humidity [%] is high (>70%) and temperature [degC] is above 25, enable a dehumidify signal; otherwise disable it. Include 5% hysteresis on humidity to prevent chattering.

If PM2.5 (µg/m³) is unhealthy (>55), and PM10 (µg/m³) is also high (>150), assert a 'poor air quality' alarm and record the start time; clear only after both are below 'moderate' thresholds for 10 minutes.

Combine two temperature sensors (indoor and outdoor) to detect open window events: if indoor temp drops by >1.5 degC within 2 minutes while outdoor temp is at least 5 degC lower than indoor, raise a 'draft' warning.
Implement an alarm inhibit window: after a temperature over-limit alarm (temp > 70 degC) clears, suppress new alarms for 60 s to reduce nuisance alerts.
Drive a fan speed output with three discrete levels based on CO2 (ppm): Low at 800–1200 ppm, Medium at 1200–1800 ppm, High above 1800 ppm; include 100 ppm hysteresis between bands.
Monitor illuminance (lux) and occupancy input; only raise a glare warning when lux > 30,000 and occupancy is true.
Add plausibility checks: if relative humidity reading is outside 0–100% or temperature outside -40..120 degC, set a sensor_fault flag and inhibit all control outputs.
Implement a humidity 'too wet' alarm that requires two independent sensors to agree (both > 80%) before triggering; clear when both read < 70%.
Monitor pressure and temperature and compute a simple density altitude estimate; if the estimated density altitude exceeds 2500 m under current readings, assert a high-altitude warning.
Create a timed exposure alarm: if UV index > 6 for cumulative exposure time exceeding 30 minutes within a 24 h window, raise an overexposure alert.
Publish a 'comfort band' status that is true only when all conditions are met: 21–24 degC temperature, 40–55% humidity, CO2 < 900 ppm, and PM2.5 < 12 µg/m³; otherwise false.
Implement a short-term AQI trend indicator: compute the slope of AQI over the last 5 minutes and light an arrow LED up if slope > +5 per minute, down if < -5, neutral otherwise.
Detect sensor staleness per channel: if any of temperature, humidity, or pressure has not updated for more than 3 s, set a 'data_stale' alarm and do not update outputs until fresh data arrives.

Run a periodic monitor of temperature [degC], humidity [%], pressure (hPa), and light (lux) at 50 Hz with a WCET budget of 1 ms; if the cycle overruns, toggle an overload indicator, otherwise process thresholds and alarms normally.

Implement a PID controller to maintain room temperature at a configurable setpoint (e.g., 22 degC), using heater power as output. Include anti-windup, output limits, and a safety cutoff that disables heating if measured temperature exceeds setpoint by >5 degC or absolute temp > 60 degC.

Control relative humidity to 50% using a PID loop driving a humidifier/dehumidifier output selection (positive for humidify, negative for dehumidify). Ensure the controller runs at 10 Hz and includes integral windup protection and a dew point safety: if dew point approaches within 2 degC of ambient, limit output to prevent condensation.

Fuse two redundant temperature sensors with a median filter and plausibility check; if their difference exceeds 3 degC for more than 10 s, enter a fail-safe mode that disables heating/cooling and raises a fault.

Apply a complementary filter to estimate ambient light dynamics by fusing fast lux readings with a slower rolling average; use the estimate to avoid false alarms when clouds pass. Alarm only when the filtered light exceeds 40,000 lux for at least 30 s.

Implement sensor fusion for indoor air quality: compute an overall index from CO2 (ppm), TVOC (ppb), and PM2.5 (µg/m³) using weighted normalization. Raise staged alarms at thresholds Index > 0.6 (warning) and > 0.8 (critical), with a mandatory acknowledgment to clear critical.

Calculate dew point from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%] and raise a condensation risk alarm when surface temperature (from a separate probe) is within 1 degC of dew point; include a 2 degC hysteresis to clear.

Implement an adaptive threshold for pressure-based storm warning: track sea-level corrected pressure (hPa) and its 3-hour trend; alert when absolute pressure < 995 hPa and trend < -4 hPa/3h, but suppress if temperature drop suggests a frontal passage already flagged (prevent duplicate alerts).

Design a respirable dust monitor that filters PM2.5 readings with a 1-minute exponential moving average and rejects outliers beyond 3 standard deviations; alarm if EMA > 35 µg/m³ for 10 minutes, and fail-safe if data variance suggests sensor instability.

Run the environmental monitor task at 20 Hz with WCET 2 ms and deadline 10 ms. Within each cycle, perform sensor sanity checks, outlier rejection via median-of-5, and compute a heat index from temperature [degC] and humidity [%]; trigger 'heat stress' warnings at thresholds 27, 32, and 41 degC.

Implement a safe PID-based barometric chamber controller to track a pressure setpoint (hPa) while monitoring temperature [degC] to avoid overheating. Clamp rate of change to 2 hPa/s and abort to a safe state if temperature exceeds 40 degC or if pressure error remains > 50 hPa for 10 s.

Create a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes: STARTUP_SELFTEST, NORMAL, ENERGY_SAVING, ALERT, and FAULT. Monitor temperature [degC], humidity [%], pressure (hPa), light (lux), CO2 (ppm), and PM2.5 (µg/m³). Define mode transitions, per-mode sampling rates (e.g., 20 Hz NORMAL, 5 Hz ENERGY_SAVING), WCET budget 2 ms, and strict safety rules (e.g., critical alarms in any mode force ALERT). Include requirements for unit tests of transitions and alarms.

Specify a dual-loop climate controller with coordinated PID loops for temperature (degC) and humidity (%). Include cross-interlocks to prevent actions that would cause condensation (e.g., heating with very high humidity) and fail-safe behavior on sensor disagreement > 5% RH or > 3 degC. Provide a test plan covering step responses, sensor fault injection, and timing (10 Hz loops, WCET 1.5 ms).

Design a fault-tolerant sensor fusion module that combines three temperature sensors and two humidity sensors using a weighted median and voting logic. The system shall enter DEGRADED mode when one sensor fails, FAULT mode when two or more fail. Specify comprehensive diagnostics, heartbeat monitoring, and a verification plan with boundary/robustness tests.

Develop a building air quality supervisor with modes NORMAL, WARNING, CRITICAL, and EVACUATE. Inputs: CO2 (ppm), PM2.5/PM10 (µg/m³), VOC index, and AQI. Outputs: staged alarms, ventilation demand, and an EVACUATE signal. Include rate limits, hysteresis, latching for CRITICAL, watchdogs for stale data, and formal acceptance criteria including maximum detection latency (<5 s) and WCET (<2 ms).

Specify a comprehensive environmental safety monitor for a server room that enforces thermal, humidity, and air cleanliness limits. Modes: INIT, MONITOR, LIMITING, EMERGENCY_SHUTDOWN. Include a requirements section for safety thresholds (e.g., >35 degC, >80% RH, PM2.5 > 100 µg/m³), timing (monitor at 10 Hz, WCET 1 ms), redundancy checks (dual temperature sensors cross-checked), and a full test matrix covering normal operation, faults, and recovery.

Turn on an audible alarm when ambient temperature exceeds 38 degC and keep it on until temperature falls below 36 degC (hysteresis). Provide a visible indicator that shows when the alarm condition is active.
Control a dehumidifier relay: switch on when relative humidity rises above 85% and switch off when it drops below 75%. Include a status LED that reflects the relay state.
Light a warning LED if barometric pressure falls below 950 hPa. Clear the warning when pressure returns above 955 hPa to avoid chattering.
Turn on a lamp output when ambient light is below 50 lux and turn it off when above 80 lux. Use a small delay (e.g., 2 s) to avoid flicker from brief changes.
Flash a red LED at 1 Hz when CO2 concentration exceeds 1000 ppm; steady green LED otherwise. Ensure the flashing stops automatically when CO2 returns below 900 ppm.
Trigger an alarm output if PM2.5 exceeds 35 µg/m³. Reset the alarm only when PM2.5 stays below 25 µg/m³ for 60 seconds.
Display a green OK indicator only when temperature is between 18 degC and 25 degC inclusive; turn the indicator off outside that range.
Show a comfort indicator: green if relative humidity is within 40% to 60%, yellow if 30% to 40% or 60% to 70%, and red otherwise.
Close a shade output when ambient illuminance exceeds 8000 lux; open it when illuminance falls below 3000 lux.
Set a high-pressure indicator on when pressure is greater than 1030 hPa, and clear it when pressure drops below 1025 hPa.
Turn on a frost warning LED when temperature is below 0 degC; turn it off when temperature rises above 2 degC.
Activate a continuous siren while CO levels exceed 15 ppm. Silence the siren when CO falls below 9 ppm.
Illuminate a dry-air alert when relative humidity is below 20%. Clear the alert once humidity rises above 25%.
Immediately disable the heater control signal if temperature equals or exceeds 70 degC and assert a safety alarm. Re-enable only after temperature remains below 60 degC for 30 seconds.
Turn on a ventilation fan when total volatile organic compounds (TVOC) exceed 400 ppb; turn it off when TVOC drops below 250 ppb.
Implement a three-level temperature status: GREEN below 30 degC, YELLOW from 30 to 40 degC, RED above 40 degC. Sound a buzzer in RED. Update at 10 Hz with 200 ms debounce on state changes.
Maintain relative humidity between 45% and 55% by toggling humidifier and dehumidifier outputs with 3% hysteresis. Run a fan whenever either is active. Sample at 2 Hz.
Adjust a dimmable lighting output in steps to keep illuminance near 500 lux, but freeze adjustments for 5 s if measured light changes faster than 200 lux/s to prevent oscillations.
Compute a 15-minute rolling average of pressure. If pressure drops more than 6 hPa within 3 hours, raise a storm warning and blink a LED until the trend stabilizes.
Control ventilation based on CO2: turn fan on above 1200 ppm and off below 800 ppm. If the sensor reading is invalid or stale for >5 s, assert a fail-safe alarm and turn fan on.
Set an air quality alarm if PM2.5 exceeds 35 µg/m³ or CO exceeds 9 ppm. Clear the alarm only after both stay below half their thresholds for at least 5 minutes.

Create a state machine with states NORMAL, WARN, and ALARM driven by temperature and humidity. Enter WARN if temp > 35 degC or RH > 85%; enter ALARM if temp > 45 degC or RH > 95%. Use hysteresis and a minimum dwell time of 10 s per state.

Compute dew point from air temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]. If a surface temperature sensor reports within 2 degC of the dew point, enable an anti-condensation heater. Disable it once the margin exceeds 4 degC.
Control curtains based on light: open when illuminance > 4000 lux for 2 minutes; close when < 800 lux for 5 minutes. Ignore fluctuations shorter than 10 seconds.
Detect a pressure leak by sampling at 10 Hz and measuring for a sustained drop > 5 kPa over 60 s. If detected, close a shutoff valve and assert an alarm after a 1 s confirmation window.
Drive a tri-color LED to reflect thermal comfort: green if temperature is 18–26 degC and RH is 40–60%, yellow if slightly outside, red otherwise. Update once per second with WCET below 5 ms.
Log temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%] every 1 s. If temperature > 50 degC or RH > 95%, trigger an alarm and record a timestamped event, rate-limited to at most one alarm every 30 s.
Detect glare: if illuminance exceeds 8000 lux and increases by more than 3000 lux within 1 s, assert a glare flag and deploy shading. Otherwise, adjust lighting slowly to avoid abrupt changes.
Implement a three-speed CO2-based fan controller: low above 800 ppm, medium above 1200 ppm, high above 2000 ppm. Drop to lower speeds only when CO2 falls below 700, 1100, and 1800 ppm respectively.

Detect temperature sensor faults: if readings are out of range (below -40 or above 125 degC) or stale for more than 2 s, enter a FAULT state that disables actuators and flashes an error code until recovery.
Compute a 10-sample moving average of relative humidity at 5 Hz and compare against a 70% threshold to control a dehumidifier with 5% hysteresis. Guarantee WCET under 1 ms.
Convert pressure [hPa] to altitude [m]. Suppress pressure alarms while altitude rate exceeds 5 m/s for up to 30 s to reduce false positives, then resume normal monitoring.
Implement a temperature watchdog: if the rise rate exceeds 2 degC/min, assert a pre-alarm; if also above 60 degC, trigger main alarm and cut heater. Use an exponentially smoothed rate estimate.

Coordinate ventilation based on light and CO2: at night (lux < 1000), open a passive vent when CO2 > 1500 ppm; during daytime (lux >= 1000), run an active fan instead. Include 2-minute persistence before switching.

Map PM2.5 concentration [µg/m³] to AQI categories and drive a color indicator: green for Good, yellow for Moderate, orange for Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups, red for Unhealthy or worse. Raise an alarm if category is Unhealthy or above.

Use PID control to maintain air temperature at 25 degC with a heater output. Enforce a hard safety cutoff at 60 degC, detect sensor faults, limit output slew rate, and constrain integral windup. Sample at 10 Hz.
Regulate humidity to 50% using PID on a humidifier, with a feed-forward term when temperature changes by more than 2 degC. For safety, inhibit humidification if calculated dew point exceeds 20 degC.

Fuse readings from two temperature sensors into a single estimate using weighted averaging with outlier rejection. Use the fused value for control and alarms; if one sensor fails, degrade gracefully to the other and flag a fault.
Estimate true barometric pressure and its trend using a simple Kalman filter. Alarm on rapid drops exceeding 2 hPa/min. Run at 50 Hz with WCET below 2 ms.

Compute a composite air quality risk score from CO2 [ppm], TVOC [ppb], and PM2.5 [µg/m³], with staged alarms and proportional fan control. Include plausibility checks for each sensor and a safe fallback mode.
Implement PID-based light control to maintain 300 lux using a dimmable output. Include anti-windup, output saturation at 0–100%, and a safety cap on maximum change per update. Sample at 20 Hz.

Fuse two RH sensors to produce a robust humidity estimate with drift compensation via a slow calibration offset. Use the fused value for control; for alarms, select the safer (higher risk) reading. Flag sudden jumps > 10%/s.

Estimate altitude from pressure and temperature using the barometric formula, detect stuck-sensor conditions, and raise pre-emptive alarms during rapid descents. Update at 25 Hz with WCET under 1.5 ms.

Control ventilation with a PID loop to keep carbon monoxide below a 9 ppm target. If CO exceeds 35 ppm, immediately drive full ventilation and latch an alarm until manual clear; reset integrator upon latch clear.

Compute a simplified heat index [degC] from air temperature and relative humidity, and use PID to regulate fan speed to maintain a 26 degC comfort target. Override with a high-temperature alarm and full fan above 45 degC.

Design a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes STARTUP-SELF-TEST, NORMAL, ENERGY-SAVE, and EMERGENCY. Monitor temperature [degC], humidity [%], CO2 [ppm], and PM2.5 [µg/m³]. Include latching alarms, safe outputs in EMERGENCY, loop rate 10 Hz, and WCET per cycle < 2 ms. Specify built-in diagnostics and acceptance checks.

Create a cleanroom controller with modes CALIBRATE, CONTROL, ALARM, and SAFE-SHUTDOWN. Maintain 22 ± 0.5 degC and 45 ± 2% RH via PID loops, alarm if PM2.5 > 10 µg/m³ or pressure differential falls below a threshold, and enforce WCET budgets per task. Provide a concise test plan.

Develop a classroom air quality system with modes NORMAL, HIGH-VENT (during breaks), and NIGHT. Manage CO2 [ppm] and PM2.5 [µg/m³] using sensor fusion and PID fan control. Define safety thresholds, deterministic scheduling with cycle time 5 Hz and WCET 1 ms, and include validation scenarios and edge cases.

Implement redundant monitoring with dual temperature and dual humidity sensors using 2-out-of-2 voting for safety. If disagreement exceeds 2 degC or 5% RH, enter FAULT mode, force safe outputs, run periodic self-tests, apply drift compensation, and provide a detailed test plan.

Specify a comprehensive system supervising temperature [degC], humidity [%], pressure [hPa], light [lux], and CO [ppm] with modes INIT, MONITOR, ALARM, and MAINTENANCE. Include sensor fusion for robustness, PID loops for temperature and ventilation, safety interlocks, a loop rate of 50 Hz with WCET 1 ms, and a verification checklist of expected behaviors.
Monitor ambient temperature in degC; turn on a red alarm indicator when the reading exceeds 50 degC and turn it off when it drops below 45 degC (hysteresis).
Read relative humidity in [%]; if it falls below 20% or rises above 80%, activate an audible alarm; otherwise keep alarms off.
Check barometric pressure in hPa; raise a warning output when pressure is below 950 hPa; clear when it is at or above 955 hPa.
Monitor light level in lux and switch on a 'low light' warning if it goes under 100 lux; clear above 150 lux.
Observe indoor CO2 concentration in ppm; assert a 'ventilate' alarm when CO2 > 1200 ppm and only clear when CO2 < 900 ppm.
Watch PM2.5 concentration in µg/m3; if PM2.5 ≥ 35 µg/m3, sound a steady buzzer and light a warning LED; stop both when it goes below 25 µg/m3.
Create two-tier temperature alarms: caution at ≥ 40 degC and critical at ≥ 60 degC with distinct outputs; clear caution below 38 degC and critical below 58 degC.
Issue a freeze warning whenever ambient temperature is ≤ 0 degC; while active, pulse a buzzer once per second.
Detect excessive brightness: if light exceeds 80,000 lux, activate a glare alarm; clear when under 70,000 lux.
Trigger a 'dry air' alert when humidity drops below 30% for at least 5 seconds; auto-clear when humidity returns to ≥ 35%.
Raise an 'air quality poor' indicator when total volatile organic compounds (TVOC) exceed 500 ppb; clear when TVOC < 300 ppb.
Flag a sensor fault if barometric pressure is outside 300–1100 hPa; in fault, force all alarms to a safe state and expose a fault output.
Annunciate 'heat warning' when temperature stays above 32 degC for 10 seconds; clear immediately when below 31 degC.
Turn on a 'comfortable humidity' green indicator when 40% ≤ RH ≤ 60%; otherwise turn on a yellow 'out of range' indicator.
Sound a 'stale air' chime if CO2 rises above 1500 ppm; rate-limit the chime to one beep every 15 seconds while the condition persists.

Compute a simple heat index from temperature [degC] and humidity [%] (use a standard approximation acceptable for room conditions) and raise an alarm if the heat index exceeds 35 degC; sample at 2 Hz and require the condition to hold for 3 consecutive samples.

Implement a CO2 alert state machine with states NORMAL, ALERT, and ALARM based on ppm thresholds (NORMAL < 800, ALERT 800–1200, ALARM > 1200). Use 10 s minimum dwell time per state and hysteresis of 100 ppm at transitions.
Use two temperature sensors; if their difference exceeds 2 degC, enter SENSOR_FAULT and assert a safe alarm; otherwise average them and compare to a 55 degC overheat threshold with 3 degC hysteresis.
Monitor pressure trend at 1 Hz; if pressure drops by more than 4 hPa within any 30-minute window, issue a 'storm warning' alarm. Reset the alarm when the trend reverses for 10 minutes.
Create a day/night detector using light in lux with hysteresis (day ≥ 500 lux, night ≤ 300 lux) and minimum dwell of 60 s. Expose the current state and toggle a night alarm only during NIGHT.

Supervise humidity comfort band 40–60%; if below 40% for more than 2 minutes, assert 'dry' alarm; if above 60% for more than 2 minutes, assert 'humid' alarm; ensure only one alarm is active at a time.

Combine PM2.5 [µg/m3] and PM10 [µg/m3]; map each to a quality category, then select the worst category to drive a multi-level alarm output with 3 levels (GOOD, MODERATE, UNHEALTHY). Include 5 µg/m3 hysteresis between levels.
Detect stale sensor data: if no new reading for temperature or humidity arrives within 2 seconds, raise a SENSOR_STALE fault and force all environmental alarms into a safe default state.
Accumulate exposure to high temperature: compute degree-minutes above 30 degC; raise an 'overexposure' alarm when cumulative exceeds 120 degree-minutes, and decay the accumulator when below 30 degC.

Apply a moving average (window 5 samples at 5 Hz) to CO2 ppm before thresholding at 1000 ppm; require 5 consecutive averaged samples above threshold to assert alarm; clear after 5 consecutive below 900 ppm.
Calculate dew point from temperature [degC] and relative humidity [%]; trigger a 'condensation risk' alarm if (temperature − dew point) < 2 degC for more than 15 seconds.
Read two humidity sensors; if they differ by more than 5%, mark the higher as suspect and use the lower for alarms; if they differ by more than 10%, enter fault and hold alarms in safe state.

Track lux-hours to detect overexposure of light-sensitive material: integrate lux over time; when cumulative exceeds 50,000 lux·hours in a day, assert an 'overexposed' alarm and reset the counter at midnight timer event.
While PM2.5 > 25 µg/m3, emit a repeating beep pattern (two short beeps every 10 s); if PM2.5 > 75 µg/m3, switch to a continuous tone. Ensure only one pattern plays at a time.

Compute an indoor air quality index from CO2 (ppm) and TVOC (ppb) using simple weighted thresholds; produce a 0–3 alarm level with 0=Good and 3=Severe; include hysteresis and a minimum 30 s dwell per level.
Run the environmental monitoring task at 10 Hz with a WCET of 3 ms. If a cycle overruns, raise a TIMING_FAULT alarm and shed noncritical computations until timing recovers.
Derive sea-level pressure from measured pressure and temperature; if sea-level pressure falls below 980 hPa for 20 minutes, assert a 'low pressure' alarm; clear after 10 minutes above 985 hPa.

Implement a watchdog for sensor update rates: temperature at least 2 Hz, humidity at least 1 Hz, CO2 at least 0.5 Hz. If any stream violates its minimum rate for more than 5 s, set a RATE_FAULT and suppress normal alarms.

Provide distinct visual alarms for three hazards—Heat (> 35 degC), Humidity (> 85%), and CO2 (> 1400 ppm)—ensuring only the highest-priority active hazard is indicated. Priorities: CO2 highest, then Heat, then Humidity.
Use a median filter on a 7-sample window for PM2.5 to reject spikes; assert a warning at ≥ 25 µg/m3 and a critical alarm at ≥ 100 µg/m3, each with 5 µg/m3 hysteresis and 10 s minimum dwell.

Fuse three temperature sensors using median selection followed by an outlier-resistant average; if any sensor deviates by > 3 degC from the fused value for 30 s, mark it failed and exclude it. Drive an overheat alarm at 70 degC with 2 degC hysteresis and fail-safe behavior on multiple failures.

Design a Kalman-filter-based estimator for true room temperature [degC] that accounts for sensor noise and slow dynamics; publish the estimate and its variance. Trigger a high-temperature alarm when the 95% upper confidence bound exceeds 45 degC for 5 s.

Implement a PID controller to keep CO2 below 1000 ppm by modulating a fan command (0–100%). Sample at 2 Hz, include anti-windup and output clamping. On CO2 sensor fault, force output to a safe fixed level and raise a control-failed alarm.

Control humidity to 50% using a PI controller that drives a dehumidifier enable (0/1) with pulse-width modulation at 0.5 Hz. Respect safety thresholds: never allow humidity to exceed 90% or drop below 20%, and alarm if violated.

Build a condensation prevention system: estimate dew point from T [degC] and RH [%]; when (T − dew point) < 1 degC, preemptively assert a 'protect surfaces' alarm and command a fan output proportionally to the risk level. Include rate limiting and safety cutouts.

Compute a robust pressure trend using linear regression over the past 3 hours sampled at 0.2 Hz, rejecting outliers beyond 3σ. Raise a storm alert if the slope is less than −1.3 hPa/hour for 30 minutes. Ensure task WCET ≤ 4 ms.

Perform sensor fusion of PM2.5 from two different instruments by bias-correcting one against the other during clean-air periods; during polluted periods, use the lower reading plus a safety margin. Drive multi-level alarms with conservative logic.

Execute an hourly self-test sequence for CO2 and TVOC sensors: switch to TEST state for 5 s, validate ranges (CO2 400–5000 ppm, TVOC 0–2000 ppb), then return to RUN. If validation fails, enter FAULT and latch a safety alarm until manual reset.

Implement a thermal comfort index (e.g., PMV-lite) using temperature [degC], humidity [%], and air velocity [m/s] inputs. Output a comfort band and raise an alert when discomfort exceeds a threshold for more than 10 minutes.

Design a redundant PM monitoring chain with two PM2.5 sensors and one PM10 sensor: cross-check ratios, detect clogging when PM10/PM2.5 < 1.1 for 15 minutes at moderate concentrations, and enter a fail-safe alarm state on suspected clogging.

Create a multi-mode environmental monitor with modes SAFE, ECO, and DIAGNOSTIC. Each mode sets different sampling rates (SAFE 20 Hz, ECO 2 Hz, DIAGNOSTIC 10 Hz) and alarm thresholds for temperature [degC], humidity [%], CO2 [ppm], and PM2.5 [µg/m3]. Include WCET limits per mode (SAFE 3 ms, ECO 2 ms, DIAGNOSTIC 4 ms), mode transition rules with hysteresis, and comprehensive safety behaviors on sensor faults.

Specify a cleanroom environmental supervisor that continuously checks temperature (20–22 degC), humidity (45–55%), pressure differential (+15 to +30 Pa), and PM2.5 (< 5 µg/m3). Implement a state machine with NORMAL, WARNING, and EMERGENCY; EMERGENCY latches until manual reset. Require dual-sensor voting for pressure, periodic self-tests every hour, and timing guarantees of 20 Hz sampling with 4 ms WCET.

Develop an advanced fire/overheat detection logic combining absolute temperature (> 60 degC), rate-of-rise (> 8 degC/min), and light scattering (sudden drop in lux due to smoke). Use sensor fusion to reduce false alarms, latch the alarm until reset, and include safety timeouts and test procedures.

Engineer a fault-tolerant indoor air quality system with multi-sensor redundancy (CO2, TVOC, PM2.5). Define a supervisory state machine with INIT, RUN, DEGRADED, and FAILSAFE; include voter logic, graceful degradation on single-sensor faults, safe outputs on multiple faults, and a formal set of invariants (e.g., never deassert alarm while any critical reading is beyond threshold).

Design a ventilation controller that maintains CO2 below 900 ppm using a PID with feed-forward from occupancy estimates derived from light and CO2 rate-of-change. Provide modes NORMAL and HIGH_LOAD with different gains, hard safety limits (never exceed 2000 ppm), WCET ≤ 3 ms at 5 Hz, and a thorough test plan with worst-case scenarios and step responses.
When an enable signal is true, spin the drive wheel at a constant 0.30 [mps]; when false, command 0.00 [mps]. Include a hard velocity limit at 0.50 [mps] for safety.
Move a rotary servo to the requested angle (0.00 to 1.00 [rad]) from a knob input. Clamp out-of-range requests and hold position once the knob stops changing.
Each time a momentary button is pressed, advance the stepper by +0.20 [rad]. If the button is held for more than 1 s, reverse by -0.20 [rad] on release. Debounce and ignore repeats within 200 ms.
Alternate the linear actuator direction every 5 s, inserting a 0.5 s stop between changes for gentle reversal. Cap travel speed at 0.40 [mps].
Ramp from 0.00 to 0.60 [mps] over 2 s when started, and ramp back to 0.00 [mps] over 2 s when stopped. Enforce maximum acceleration of 0.50 [mps^2].
On a start command, bring the conveyor up to 0.40 [mps]; on a stop command, decelerate smoothly to 0.00 [mps]. If emergency stop is active, cut motion immediately.
Drive a joint to home at 0.00 [rad] whenever an emergency input is asserted; otherwise hold the last commanded angle.
If position error exceeds 0.05 [rad], drive the servo toward the target; if within 0.05 [rad], hold without dithering. Allowed target range is -0.50 to +0.50 [rad].
Map a joystick input to wheel velocity in [-0.80, 0.80] [mps]. If a deadman switch is not pressed, force 0.00 [mps] regardless of joystick input.
Allow motion only while temperature is below 70 C; above that, command 0.00 [mps] and flag an overtemperature condition. Nominal set speed is 0.25 [mps].
If a forward limit switch is hit, stop motion and prevent further positive angle change; allow reverse movement back to within the allowed range [-1.00, +1.00] [rad].
Hold a joint at 1.20 [rad] with a simple proportional behavior. Allow a user to nudge ±0.10 [rad] using two buttons, with bounds checking.
Perform a one-shot move from the current angle to +0.80 [rad] with a fixed slew so the end-effector speed stays under 0.20 [mps]. Cancel the move if a stop input arrives.
Sweep a servo back and forth between -0.50 [rad] and +0.50 [rad], pausing 1 s at each end before reversing.
Command a constant travel speed of 0.35 [mps] while a run switch is on; drop to 0.00 [mps] immediately if a fault flag is raised.
Implement a door motion state machine with states: Closed, Opening, Open, and Closing. Use limit switches for transitions and drive along the track at 0.25 [mps], with soft stops near the ends.

On startup, home a rotary axis by rotating slowly toward a home sensor until it triggers, set that point to 0.00 [rad], then move to +0.30 [rad]. If homing does not complete within 10 s, enter a safe halt.
Track independent left and right wheel velocity commands in [mps], applying saturation, slew limits, and a deadband. If either wheel encoder fails, stop both wheels.
Move a joint to a sequence of angles [0.20, 0.60, -0.10] [rad], obeying a maximum tip speed of 0.30 [mps] and waiting 500 ms at each waypoint.
Accept an external velocity setpoint in [mps]. If no setpoint is received for 200 ms, hold the last value; after 1 s of silence, time out to 0.00 [mps] and raise a warning.
When an emergency stop arrives, transition to a Safe state that commands 0.00 [mps] and disables future motion until reset; otherwise operate normally with the current commands.
Index a stepper by 20 equal increments to reach +1.00 [rad], then return to 0.00 [rad]. Abort motion if any limit switch is hit during travel.
Reduce conveyor speed to 0.10 [mps] when a proximity sensor indicates an object is near; otherwise run at 0.45 [mps]. Add hysteresis to avoid speed chatter.
Provide a jog mode that nudges the actuator by ±0.05 [rad] per button press, with rate limiting to at most five presses per second.
Derate maximum allowable speed linearly from 0.60 [mps] at 40 C to 0.20 [mps] at 70 C; below 40 C, apply no derate. Prevent commands above the current limit.
At power-up, back off until the negative limit is found, set that to -1.00 [rad], then move to 0.00 [rad] and wait for commands. Stop if any fault occurs.
Implement a 100 Hz control loop for wheel speed in [mps]. Ensure WCET is under 2 ms; if the budget is exceeded, skip the update and log an overrun.
Maintain a position window: if |error| > 0.10 [rad], drive toward the target; if ≤ 0.10 [rad], hold and only correct drift when |error| exceeds 0.15 [rad].
Detect overspeed: if measured velocity exceeds the command by more than 0.20 [mps] for 100 ms, cut torque to zero and latch a fault until reset.
Generate a triangle wave angle command between -0.30 and +0.30 [rad] at 0.1 Hz for actuator testing. Ensure motion remains smooth and repeatable.
Synchronize two actuators so their angles remain matched within 0.02 [rad]. If the difference exceeds 0.05 [rad], stop both and report a synchronization fault.
Perform a timed move: drive at 0.40 [mps] for 0.80 s, then stop and hold position. Repeat the cycle every 5 s until disabled.
Allow manual override: while a manual flag is true, accept joystick velocities in [mps]; when false, follow autonomous velocities with a seamless handoff that avoids step changes.
Implement a latch: once angle exceeds +0.70 [rad], keep motion inhibited until the angle returns below +0.60 [rad].
Use a simple feedforward plus proportional term to track a velocity command in [mps]. Tune the proportional gain at runtime via a parameter with bounds checking.
Implement a PID controller to track linear velocity in [mps] at 200 Hz. Include integral anti-windup, output saturation, and a WCET budget of 1 ms.
Control a joint angle in [rad] with a PID loop, using derivative filtering and setpoint step smoothing to limit peak acceleration and avoid oscillations.
Fuse a rotary encoder with a gyro to estimate joint angle in [rad] via a complementary filter, and hold the joint at 0.00 [rad] under external disturbances.
Create a cascaded controller: inner loop regulates velocity in [mps], outer loop regulates position in [rad]. Limit commanded acceleration and jerk to protect the mechanism.

Develop a fault-tolerant motion state machine with Normal, Degraded, and Fault states. In Degraded, cap speed at 0.20 [mps] and ignore optional sensors; in Fault, command 0.00 [mps] and require manual reset.
Close the loop on a stepper using encoder feedback: track a position command in [rad] and detect missed steps. If slip exceeds 0.05 [rad], re-home automatically and resume.
Plan S-curve trajectories between arbitrary angles in [rad] while respecting max linear speed 0.50 [mps] and max acceleration 0.80 [mps^2].
Schedule controller gains based on speed: use one PID tuning for ≤0.20 [mps] and another for >0.20 [mps], blending smoothly across the boundary to avoid discontinuities.
Use two redundant encoders to estimate angle in [rad]. If disagreement exceeds 0.03 [rad] for more than 20 ms, enter a safe stop and latch a sensor disagreement fault.
Implement an emergency deceleration profile that brings velocity to 0.00 [mps] without exceeding 0.60 [mps^2] and with jerk limiting. Verify timing against a 2 ms WCET.

Design a multi-mode hoist controller with modes Manual, Auto, and Test. Specify transitions, interlocks, and safety constraints. Control hook travel speed in [mps], run the loop at 500 Hz with WCET ≤ 0.8 ms, and include comprehensive self-tests.

Create a multi-axis joint controller for a robotic arm with modes Safe, Teach, and Run. Each joint tracks angle in [rad] with PID, and end-effector linear speed is limited in [mps]. Define mode transitions, fault handling, and watchdog behavior.

Build a complete motion subsystem with trajectory generation, cascaded PID loops, and sensor fusion for angle in [rad] and velocity in [mps]. Include detailed diagnostics, parameter validation, and automated tests for edge cases and timing overruns.

Specify a dual-channel drive-by-wire wheel controller with cross-checked sensors, voting logic, and a fallback mode. Track command velocity in [mps], verify WCET ≤ 1 ms at 1 kHz, and define acceptance tests for faults and recovery.

Implement synchronized conveyor sections driven by multiple motors, with modes Idle, Start-up, Run, and Fault. Maintain section speeds in [mps], guarantee maximum skew between sections, enforce safety stops, and include a full test plan for timing and limit conditions.
When a momentary button is pressed, move a servo to 1.0 [rad]; when released, return to 0.0 [rad]. Limit motion to 0.0–1.2 [rad] and update at 50 Hz.
Read a rotary knob and map it to a servo angle 0.0–2.5 [rad]. Clamp to limits and ignore noise with simple hysteresis. Ensure the update loop WCET is below 1 ms at 100 Hz.
Run a motor at a fixed angular velocity of 10.0 [rad] per second while an enable signal is true; command 0 when false. Include a safety stop input that forces 0 speed immediately.
On each rising edge of a trigger, move a stepper by +0.314 [rad] from its current position; on a falling edge, move −0.314 [rad]. Debounce the trigger and do not queue overlapping moves.
Track a square-wave position command for a servo between 0.2 [rad] and 1.0 [rad] with 1 s dwell at each end. If an emergency stop becomes active, hold the current position.
Drive a motor forward at 8.0 [rad] per second unless a limit switch is active, in which case command 0 immediately. Provide a status flag when the limit is engaged.
Implement a dead-man timeout: if no heartbeat event is received for 200 ms, set motor command to 0 [rad] per second and latch a fault until acknowledged. Control loop WCET <= 0.5 ms.
Reverse a motor’s direction every 5 seconds, maintaining a magnitude of 5.0 [rad] per second. Start from rest at power-up and stop if a fault input goes high.
On start, ramp a servo from 0.0 to 1.2 [rad] linearly over 3.0 s, then hold. If a cancel input is asserted, ramp back to 0.0 [rad].
Map a joystick input in the range −1..+1 to a target motor speed in the range −12..+12 [rad] per second with a small deadband around zero and output saturation.
Move a stepper to an absolute position of 1.5708 [rad] when the move command is received, with a maximum speed of 3.0 [rad] per second. Ignore new commands until motion completes.
Maintain a conveyor belt at 0.5 [mps] when the run command is active; command 0 [mps] when stopped. Include a soft-start that reaches 0.5 [mps] in 1.5 s.
On power-up, set a servo to 0.0 [rad]. When a toggle command arrives, move to 0.8 [rad]; toggle again to return to 0.0 [rad]. Enforce mechanical limits 0.0..1.2 [rad].
Provide a soft-stop function that decelerates any spinning motor to 0 [rad] per second in 1.0 s when the stop input is pressed, instead of cutting immediately.
If an overtemperature flag becomes true, immediately command all motion outputs to zero and latch an alert. Otherwise, allow a fixed target speed of 6.0 [rad] per second.

Create a homing routine for a stepper: seek negative until a home switch closes, back off 0.05 [rad], approach slowly until it re-closes, then set position to 0.0 [rad]. After homing, accept absolute move commands in [rad] with speed and acceleration limits. Run at 200 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.
