When a momentary start input is pressed, run the motor at 0.18 [mps] for 5 s then stop. Ignore further presses while running. Always stop immediately if the emergency input is active. Control at 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Build a state machine for a linear actuator with states: Idle, Extend, Retract, Fault. Use two limit switches for ends of travel. On command, move to the other end at 0.12 [mps]; stop at the switch or fault if motion times out after 6 s. Update at 200 Hz with WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Close the loop on wheel linear velocity using PID to track a setpoint in [mps]. Include integrator anti-windup via output clamping. Saturate the speed to ±0.5 [mps]. Run the controller at 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Synchronize two servos so they both reach the same target angle in [rad] while never differing by more than 0.05 [rad]. If the difference exceeds the limit for more than 200 ms, enter a Fault state. 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Implement a homing sequence for a stepper with a home switch: search negative at 0.3 [rad]/s until the switch closes, back off 0.05 [rad], then approach slowly at 0.05 [rad]/s to re-latch home = 0.0 [rad]. Timeout at 10 s to Fault. 200 Hz control, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Create a trapezoidal motion profile for a stepper to move from current angle to a target in [rad] with max velocity 1.0 [rad]/s and acceleration 2.0 [rad]/s^2. Respect soft limits of [−3.2, 3.2] [rad]. 200 Hz loop; WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Design a simple two-mode controller: Manual (jog at ±0.1 [mps] while buttons held) and Auto (move to 0.35 [mps] for 4 s then 0). Include a Fault mode that latches on emergency stop. Update at 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Follow a sequence of servo waypoints: [0.8, 1.3, 2.0, 1.1] [rad] with dwell times [0.5, 0.5, 1.0, 0.5] s at each point. Enforce a max slew of 0.7 [rad]/s and a hard range of [0.2, 2.4] [rad]. 50 Hz, WCET <= 0.25 ms.

Drive a belt to a commanded speed in [mps] with a first-order smoothing filter (time constant 0.3 s) to reduce jerk before applying limits of ±0.6 [mps]. Immediately force 0 [mps] on safety stop. Loop at 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Implement yaw control with angle wrapping: command a servo to the shortest-path angle to reach a target in [rad] on a circle, keeping within soft limits of [−2.8, 2.8] [rad]. Report error wrapped to [−π, π] [rad]. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Build a three-state H-bridge control: Coast, Drive, Brake. In Drive, regulate to 0.2 [mps]; in Brake, command 0 [mps] and rapidly decelerate; Coast leaves output inactive. Transition to Brake on emergency stop. Cycle at 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Implement a simple jam detector: if commanded speed exceeds measured speed by >0.15 [mps] for more than 500 ms, stop the motor and latch a Fault. Normal operation tracks a setpoint in [mps]. Run at 100 Hz with WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Create a move-until-switch routine: move at 0.1 [mps] until a target sensor is triggered, then hold position. If not triggered within 8 s, enter Fault. Enforce maximum speed of 0.2 [mps]. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Coordinate two linear actuators so their average speed matches a setpoint in [mps] while limiting the difference in extension speed to 0.03 [mps]. If the difference exceeds the limit for 300 ms, raise a Fault. 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Add a soft-stop zone near position limits: within 0.2 [rad] of either end, scale down the servo command proportionally to avoid hitting the hard limit at [0.0, 2.6] [rad]. Control rate 50 Hz, WCET <= 0.25 ms.

Implement cruise control for a wheel: PID on linear velocity [mps] with a setpoint from 0 to 0.5 [mps]. Add a speed safety cap at 0.55 [mps] and a timeout to Fault if error stays >0.2 [mps] for 2 s. Run at 200 Hz; WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Create a scheduler that runs a fast velocity loop at 200 Hz and a slower supervisory state machine at 20 Hz for an actuator. The supervisory layer enables/disables the 0.3 [mps] setpoint and handles Faults. Enforce WCET: fast <= 0.35 ms, slow <= 0.2 ms.

Build a retract-on-fault behavior: if any sensor indicates obstruction, immediately ramp the actuator back by 0.1 [rad] at 0.5 [rad]/s and enter Fault. Normal operation: go to commanded [rad] with max slew 0.8 [rad]/s. 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Implement a queued motion system: accept up to five queued target positions in [rad] and execute them sequentially with 0.2 s dwell between each. Enforce position limits [0.1, 2.5] [rad]. Loop at 100 Hz; WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Control a differential drive’s wheels from a linear speed command in [mps] and a turn command in [rad]/s, producing left/right wheel targets in [mps]. Saturate each wheel to ±0.6 [mps] and preserve the commanded curvature when saturated. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Create a heat-aware speed cap: reduce the maximum allowed belt speed from 0.6 [mps] down to 0.3 [mps] as a linear function of temperature between 40–70 °C. Never allow commands above the current cap. 50 Hz loop; WCET <= 0.25 ms.

Design a cascaded controller for a rotary joint: outer position loop tracks a target in [rad], inner velocity loop tracks a computed velocity in [mps] (through wheel radius). Include PID in both loops with anti-windup and saturate the final output. Inner loop 500 Hz (WCET <= 0.4 ms), outer loop 100 Hz (WCET <= 0.25 ms).

Fuse encoder-derived linear velocity [mps] with an accelerometer-based velocity estimate using a complementary filter (blend factor 0.8/0.2) and use the fused value for PID speed control. Fail safely to encoder-only if accelerometer data invalid. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Track a time-parameterized trajectory for a servo: given desired position in [rad] and velocity bounds, generate a jerk-limited profile and follow it with PID. Enforce hard limits [0.0, 2.7] [rad] and abort if error >0.3 [rad] for >0.5 s. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Implement soft-limit compliance: as the joint approaches [0.1, 2.5] [rad] limits, add a virtual spring-damper that increases opposing torque command, preventing hitting the hard stops. Use PID for position and saturate outputs. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Create a slip detector for a drive wheel: if commanded speed minus fused measured speed (in [mps]) exceeds 0.2 [mps] for 300 ms, reduce the target speed by 30% and ramp back up slowly. Maintain safety cap at 0.7 [mps]. Run at 200 Hz; WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Develop a multi-axis synchronization: keep two rotary actuators in phase, maintaining a constant phase offset of 0.4 [rad] using PID on phase error. Limit each axis to [−3.0, 3.0] [rad]. 200 Hz control, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Implement PID autotuning on a velocity loop (in [mps]) using a relay test during a maintenance mode, then lock parameters for normal operation. Ensure test runs only at 50 Hz in a safe speed range ±0.2 [mps]. WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Add feedforward to a position controller: compute a velocity feedforward term from the desired trajectory in [rad] and combine with PID feedback. Saturate output and include anti-windup. Run at 200 Hz; WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Implement a watchdog on sensor freshness: if encoder velocity data (in [mps]) is older than 50 ms, hold the last safe command and enter a Degraded mode; if older than 200 ms, stop and Fault. Control loop 200 Hz; WCET <= 0.35 ms.

Create a dual-rate controller: inner velocity PID at 1 kHz (WCET <= 0.45 ms) using [mps], outer position PID at 100 Hz (WCET <= 0.25 ms) using [rad]. Include integrator clamping, output saturation, and a safety stop that preempts both loops.

Specify a multi-mode motion system with modes: Boot, Self-Test, Idle, Manual, Auto, Fault. Self-Test sweeps a servo through [0.3, 2.3] [rad] within 3 s and verifies feedback. Manual provides jog at ±0.15 [mps]; Auto executes a trapezoid move to a target [rad]. Include safety stop handling in all modes. Define rates: control 200 Hz (WCET <= 0.35 ms), supervisor 20 Hz (WCET <= 0.2 ms).

Design a redundant velocity sensing scheme for a wheel with two encoders. Implement a voter that compares [mps] readings, accepts if within 0.05 [mps], otherwise choose the healthier sensor and enter Degraded; if both disagree persistently, stop and Fault. Include built-in self-test at startup. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Create an end-to-end testable motion controller: position loop in [rad] with PID, soft limits [0.0, 2.6] [rad], and a velocity cap of 0.9 [rad]/s. Define acceptance tests for step response overshoot (<10%), settling (<1.0 s), and WCET budget (<= 0.35 ms at 200 Hz). Include a simulated fault injection for limit switch failure.

Build a multi-axis gantry coordinator for two linear stages with modes Idle, Align, Track, and Fault. Align brings both to zero [rad] reference; Track follows a streaming path while keeping both axes within 0.02 [rad] of each other. Set per-axis speed limits at 0.6 [mps] equivalent. Schedule control at 200 Hz (WCET <= 0.4 ms) and supervision at 25 Hz (WCET <= 0.2 ms).

Define a safety-critical motion subsystem with comprehensive requirements: dual-loop PID (position in [rad], velocity in [mps]), emergency stop, limit switch interlocks, soft-limit zones, and overrun detection. Provide mode management (Idle/Run/Degraded/Fault), rate constraints (inner 500 Hz, outer 100 Hz), WCET budgets (0.4 ms/0.25 ms), and a test plan covering step response, saturation behavior, sensor dropout, and timing overrun handling.

Make a simple control that moves a single servo to 1.0 [rad] while a boolean command is true and returns it to 0.0 [rad] otherwise. Clamp the output to the safe range 0.0–1.2 [rad], run at 50 Hz, and guarantee WCET <= 0.5 ms.

On each press of a forward or reverse button, jog a stepper by +0.05 [rad] or −0.05 [rad]. Enforce a hard travel limit of −1.0 to +1.0 [rad] and ignore jogs that would exceed it. Control loop 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Command a motor to ramp its linear speed smoothly from 0 to 0.40 [mps] over 2.0 s, then hold. If a stop input is asserted, decelerate to 0 [mps] over 0.5 s. Always saturate between 0 and 0.50 [mps]. Update at 200 Hz with WCET <= 0.2 ms.

When a start flag is set, move a servo from its current angle to 0.80 [rad] using a simple trapezoidal position profile, respecting a max slew of 0.5 [rad/s]. Mark movement complete when within 0.02 [rad]. Loop 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.25 ms.
Map an analog knob (0.0–1.0) to a servo command of 0.0–2.50 [rad] with linear scaling. Clip the command at the limits, and update at 100 Hz. Ensure WCET <= 0.1 ms.

Implement a deadman control: drive the conveyor motor at 0.30 [mps] only while a hold-to-run input is true; otherwise command 0 [mps]. Reaction time to drop to 0 [mps] must be <= 50 ms. Control loop 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Create a test routine that dithers a servo around 1.00 [rad] by ±0.05 [rad] at 0.2 Hz. Limit the peak angular rate to 0.3 [rad/s]. Provide a boolean flag that goes true when the dither cycle completes. WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Drive a servo to 0.70 [rad] when a limit sensor is not active, and to 0.00 [rad] when the sensor is active. Debounce the sensor by 20 ms. Enforce a safe angle range of 0.0–1.2 [rad]. Run at 50 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Accept a numeric setpoint in [mps] from 0.0 to 0.60 and pass it to a motor command with saturation. Provide a rising-edge start input and a stop input; when stopped, command 0 [mps]. Update 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.15 ms.
On emergency stop, immediately command zero velocity for a single motor (0 [mps]) and latch a fault flag. The flag clears only on a reset input. Normal updates run at 200 Hz with WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Implement start/stop control for a motor at a fixed speed of 0.20 [mps] with a linear deceleration of 0.40 [mps^2] to stop. Ensure output saturates between −0.20 and +0.20 [mps]. Loop 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Hold a servo at 0.50 [rad] during normal operation, but if a thermal alert input is asserted, move to a safe park at 0.00 [rad] and hold. Limit the slew rate to 0.4 [rad/s]. Update 50 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.
Command a servo to 1.20 [rad] and expose a movement_complete flag when the absolute error is < 0.02 [rad] for at least 100 ms. Control loop 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.15 ms.
Generate a constant incremental step for a stepper: at 200 Hz, advance +0.005 [rad] per tick while run is true, otherwise hold. Enforce a travel range of 0.0–2.0 [rad]. WCET <= 0.2 ms.

If a reverse command arrives while the motor is moving faster than 0.10 [mps], ignore the command; otherwise allow setting −0.20 [mps]. Always saturate commands to ±0.30 [mps]. Update 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Implement differential drive kinematics: given a requested linear velocity v [mps] and yaw rate r [rad/s], compute left and right wheel commands in [mps]. Constrain each wheel to ±0.80 [mps] and apply a 0.50 [mps^2] acceleration limit. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.5 ms.

Build a small state machine for a servo with states: Idle, MoveToA (0.4 [rad]), MoveToB (1.0 [rad]). Transitions occur on button A/B presses, and return to Idle when within 0.03 [rad] of target. Enforce 0.0–1.2 [rad] limits. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Create a homing routine for a stepper: move negative at 0.6 [rad/s] until the home switch asserts or a 5 s timeout, back off 0.05 [rad], then re-approach slowly at 0.2 [rad/s] to set zero. Respect travel bounds −2.0 to +2.0 [rad]. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Drive a conveyor motor to a requested speed in [mps] but monitor a tachometer input. If commanded > 0.20 [mps] and tach feedback remains < 0.05 [mps] for 500 ms, declare a jam fault and command 0 [mps]. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Coordinate a wrist servo and a gripper servo: when a close command arrives, first move the wrist to 0.6 [rad]; once within 0.02 [rad], move the gripper to 1.1 [rad]. Abort and return both to 0.0 [rad] if a cancel input is asserted. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Implement a position command interface for a pan servo with soft limits −1.2 to +1.2 [rad], a max rate of 0.8 [rad/s], and an in-position flag at < 0.015 [rad] error. Control loop 250 Hz, WCET <= 0.25 ms.
Add a rate limiter to velocity commands in [mps]: limit acceleration to 0.30 [mps^2] and deceleration to 0.50 [mps^2]. Provide both raw and limited command signals. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Create an indexer for a stepper that advances through N slots, each 0.20 [rad] apart. Provide Start, Next, and Reset inputs, and a slot_reached flag when within 0.01 [rad]. Respect travel limits 0.0–(N*0.20) [rad]. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Blend manual jog and auto position modes for a single servo. In Auto, move to a target in [rad]; in Manual, apply jog rate commands with a 0.6 [rad/s] cap. Mode switches must ramp to zero rate before changing. Limits −1.0 to +1.0 [rad]. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.4 ms.

Run a take-up motor at 0.25 [mps] until a limit switch asserts, then stop and latch complete. If the switch does not assert within 10 s, stop and latch a timeout fault. Update at 100 Hz with WCET <= 0.2 ms.
Sweep a servo between 0.3 [rad] and 1.0 [rad] with 1.0 s dwell at each end. Cap angular velocity at 0.7 [rad/s]. Provide a boolean indicating end A or end B dwell. Loop 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.25 ms.
Hold a target position for a servo but add a proportional correction based on measured position error (units [rad]) with gain Kp. Clamp command to −1.2 to +1.2 [rad]. 200 Hz update, WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Implement a faulted stop: when a fault input arrives, decelerate the motor from its current speed [mps] to 0 [mps] at 0.6 [mps^2]. If speed is not 0 [mps] within 1.0 s, force the command to 0 [mps] and latch a fault. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.25 ms.

Given wheel radius R [m], convert requested wheel angular speed [rad/s] to linear surface speed [mps] for a motor command. Saturate to ±0.70 [mps] and provide both commanded and limited values. 250 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.
Report in-position for a rotary axis when absolute error is < 0.010 [rad] continuously for 100 ms; otherwise report moving. Provide a separate error magnitude output [rad]. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.15 ms.

Compensate for backlash on direction reversals: insert a short pre-move of +0.020 [rad] when changing from negative to positive motion and −0.020 [rad] for the opposite. Respect overall position limits −1.0 to +1.0 [rad]. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Generate a stepper motion to reach a target position in [rad] with a trapezoidal speed profile. Abort if an endstop asserts. Provide motion_complete when within 0.01 [rad]. Control at 1 kHz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Switch between coast and brake behavior for a motor based on commanded deceleration. If decel > 0.4 [mps^2], engage brake mode; otherwise coast. Ensure speed commands stay within ±0.50 [mps]. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.

Apply a two-stage velocity limiter: normal limit ±0.40 [mps], but if a high-speed enable is true, allow up to ±0.60 [mps]. Always enforce acceleration limit 0.35 [mps^2]. Provide a flag when high-speed is active. 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.2 ms.
Filter a noisy velocity command in [mps] with a first-order low-pass (time constant 0.2 s). Publish both raw and filtered commands. Enforce output saturation ±0.5 [mps]. 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.15 ms.

Design a PID position controller for a rotary joint using encoder feedback in [rad]. Include anti-windup, output saturation to ±1.2 [rad] equivalent command, and a velocity clamp of 1.0 [rad/s]. Run at 1 kHz with WCET <= 100 µs and provide a tracking error output [rad].

Implement a cascaded control: outer PID on position [rad] generates a velocity target [rad/s]; inner PID tracks velocity and outputs a motor command. Limit velocity to ±1.2 [rad/s] and linear speed to ±0.60 [mps] via geometry. 1 kHz loop, WCET <= 120 µs.

Fuse an incremental encoder and a gyro to estimate joint velocity [rad/s] with a complementary filter. Use this fused estimate for a velocity PID that tracks a target profile. Provide a fallback to encoder-only if gyro is faulted. 1 kHz, WCET <= 120 µs.

Synchronize two rotary actuators so their angles remain within 0.05 [rad] of each other while following a shared target [rad]. Use cross-coupling compensation and stop both if mismatch exceeds 0.08 [rad] for >100 ms. 500 Hz, WCET <= 150 µs.

Execute jerk-limited motion between two angles (start/end in [rad]) with specified max velocity [rad/s], acceleration [rad/s^2], and jerk [rad/s^3]. Output the position command vs time, enforce soft limits, and expose motion_complete. 1 kHz, WCET <= 150 µs.

Track a time-stamped trajectory for a servo (position in [rad]) using PID with velocity feedforward. Clamp the command to ±1.2 [rad], limit rate to 1.0 [rad/s], and flag if the tracking error exceeds 0.05 [rad] for more than 200 ms. 1 kHz, WCET <= 120 µs.

Detect motor stall: if current estimate is high while encoder motion stays < 0.01 [rad] over 300 ms under a nonzero speed command, declare stall, command 0 [mps], and latch a fault. Provide auto-clear only on reset. 500 Hz, WCET <= 150 µs.

Implement a velocity PID for a conveyor to hold a setpoint in [mps] under load changes. Include integral windup prevention, derivative filtering, and acceleration limiting at 0.5 [mps^2]. Control loop 500 Hz, WCET <= 120 µs.

Close the loop on two drive wheels: use encoder feedback to regulate each wheel to its target [mps] with individual PIDs, and a supervisor that limits total linear speed to 0.80 [mps] and yaw rate to 1.2 [rad/s]. 1 kHz, WCET <= 140 µs.

Augment a position PID (units [rad]) with a static friction offset that fades out as velocity approaches 0 [rad/s]. Ensure smooth transitions and no overshoot beyond ±1.2 [rad] limits. 1 kHz update, WCET <= 120 µs.

Create a multi-mode joint controller with modes: Safe, Homing, PositionHold, Trajectory, Fault. Enforce angle limits −1.5 to +1.5 [rad], max velocity 1.2 [rad/s], and emergency stop to 0 [rad/s]. Include homing with switch, PID in PositionHold, jerk-limited trajectories, and a Fault mode that latches until reset. Provide a 1 kHz scheduler with WCET <= 120 µs per cycle and built-in self-tests for limit enforcement and homing timeout.

Build a two-axis gantry controller (X and Y motors) with modes Idle, Jog, and Auto Path. Accept velocity commands in [mps], cap resultant speed to 0.90 [mps], and enforce per-axis acceleration limits. Implement coordinated stops on e-stop, and provide conformance tests that verify path tracking error < 0.01 [m] equivalent and WCET <= 150 µs at 1 kHz.

Implement redundant angle sensing for a servo using two encoders. Fuse readings to produce a best estimate in [rad]; if disagreement > 0.03 [rad], enter Degraded mode with reduced velocity (<= 0.5 [rad/s]) and raise an alarm. If > 0.06 [rad], enter Fault and command hold at 0 [rad/s]. 1 kHz loop, WCET <= 130 µs, and include a test routine that injects sensor mismatch.

Design an adaptive controller for a wheel drive that switches between two PID gain sets based on speed: LowSpeed for |v| < 0.20 [mps], HighSpeed otherwise. Ensure bumpless transfer, saturation to ±0.80 [mps], and verify with tests that step response overshoot is < 5% and WCET <= 120 µs at 1 kHz.

Specify a comprehensive servo axis module that includes: initialization checks, watchdog, modes (Idle, Hold, Trajectory, Fault), PID position control in [rad], soft and hard limits, emergency stop to 0 [rad/s], and diagnostic telemetry. Require timing: control rate 1 kHz, WCET <= 100 µs, fault response < 20 ms. Include acceptance tests for limit enforcement, fault latching, and trajectory tracking error < 0.02 [rad].

Set a servo to 1.57 [rad] when an enable flag is true, and to 0.0 [rad] otherwise. Clamp the commanded angle within 0.0–3.14 [rad]. Run at 50 Hz with WCET ≤ 0.5 ms. Include a simple timeout that resets to 0.0 [rad] if no updates arrive for 200 ms.

Drive a conveyor motor at a constant linear speed of 0.25 [mps] whenever a run command is active. If a stop command is received, ramp down linearly to 0 [mps] over 0.5 s. Enforce WCET ≤ 1 ms at 100 Hz.
Implement a simple deadband: if the requested angle is within ±0.02 [rad] of the current angle, command no motion; otherwise command the target. Run at 100 Hz with WCET ≤ 0.3 ms.

When a button is pressed, increment a stepper’s target position by +0.10 [rad]; when another button is pressed, decrement by −0.10 [rad]. Limit the absolute position to ±1.0 [rad]. Update at 50 Hz and ensure WCET ≤ 0.7 ms.

Keep a wheel’s linear surface speed at exactly 0.10 [mps] while a hold switch is on; otherwise let it coast to 0 [mps] with a fixed deceleration. Include a speed clamp at 0.15 [mps]. Run at 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.

Make a servo sweep between 0.0 [rad] and 2.0 [rad] at a steady rate of 0.5 [rad] per second while a test mode flag is true. Halt immediately at the current angle when the flag goes false. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.

Command a linear actuator to a target displacement provided in [rad] (assume rotary to linear linkage has already converted to [rad]). If the target exceeds 1.2 [rad], clamp it and raise a warning. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.

Implement a simple on/off controller that drives a motor to reach 0.2 [mps]. If measured speed < 0.19 [mps], drive on; if > 0.21 [mps], drive off. Add a 50 ms minimum on/off time to avoid chattering. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.3 ms.

When a start signal arrives, move a joint to 0.785 [rad] and hold it there; when a stop signal arrives, move to 0.0 [rad]. Respect a maximum slew of 0.8 [rad]/s implemented as a rate limiter. 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.6 ms.
Toggle between two preset speeds, 0.0 [mps] and 0.30 [mps], each time a pulse input rises. Include a soft-start ramp to reach 0.30 [mps] in 0.75 s. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.
Drive a gimbal axis to a target in [rad] and publish a boolean in_position when |error| < 0.01 [rad] for at least 100 ms. Control loop at 250 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.
Create a simple jog control: while jog_plus is held, increase position by 0.4 [rad]/s; while jog_minus is held, decrease by 0.4 [rad]/s. Clamp absolute position to 2.5 [rad]. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.
Implement a watchdog that forces motor speed to 0.0 [mps] if no command has been received for 300 ms. Normal operation holds commanded speed within 0.5% of target. 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.
Set a servo’s neutral offset at startup to 0.05 [rad], then add incoming setpoints to it. Limit total commanded angle to ±1.0 [rad]. Run at 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.3 ms.
When an emergency flag is asserted, immediately command all outputs to safe values: 0.0 [mps] for motors and 0.0 [rad] for servos. Ensure this decision path has WCET ≤ 0.2 ms and runs at 500 Hz.

Create a two-state controller (Idle, Run). In Run, ramp a wheel from 0.0 to 0.40 [mps] with acceleration ≤ 0.5 [mps^2], then hold. Transition back to Idle if stop is pressed. Control at 200 Hz; WCET ≤ 0.6 ms; enforce speed clamps.

Implement a homing routine for a rotary axis. State machine: SeekNeg (move −0.6 [rad/s] until home switch), BackOff (+0.2 [rad] away), SlowSeek (−0.1 [rad/s] to edge), SetZero, then Ready. Final position command is 0.0 [rad]. 250 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.8 ms.

Add acceleration and jerk limiting to a position target in [rad]. Given a stream of targets, generate a smooth profile with max accel 1.0 [rad/s^2] and max jerk 5.0 [rad/s^3]. Track at 500 Hz with WCET ≤ 0.9 ms.

Design a finite state machine for a feeder: Idle, Start, Run, Jam. In Run, maintain 0.20 [mps]. If the measured speed drops below 0.05 [mps] for >300 ms, go to Jam and stop. Provide a manual reset back to Idle. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.6 ms.

Create a position latch: when a trigger input rises, capture the current angle [rad] and hold it for reporting while continuing to drive toward the ongoing setpoint. Ensure capture latency ≤ WCET of 0.4 ms at 250 Hz.

Build a stepper indexer that moves exactly +0.314 [rad] per command pulse with acceleration limiting to 2.0 [rad/s^2]. Ignore new pulses while motion is active; buffer one pending command. 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.6 ms.

Implement a dual-speed mode. In Eco mode cap speed at 0.15 [mps]; in Boost mode cap at 0.35 [mps]. Switch modes only when speed < 0.05 [mps]. Provide a 0.3 s ramp when leaving Boost. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.

Create a position hold with a deadzone: maintain the last target [rad], but if a disturbance moves the axis by less than 0.02 [rad], do not correct. If it exceeds the deadzone, recenter with a 0.6 [rad/s] rate limit. 250 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.

Add soft limits to a joint: forbid commands below −1.4 [rad] or above +1.4 [rad]. If a request exceeds limits, clamp and raise a fault flag. Ensure fault flag clears only after 1 s within limits. 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.
Implement a reversible conveyor with commands: forward 0.25 [mps], reverse 0.25 [mps], stop. Enforce a 100 ms coast-to-stop before changing direction to protect mechanics. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.6 ms.

Design a simple scheduler that updates a velocity controller at 500 Hz and a supervisory state machine at 50 Hz, both meeting WCET ≤ 0.9 ms aggregate. The velocity uses [mps] units; the supervisor handles safe stop.

Create a torque proxy by limiting the rate of change of angle command: max 1.2 [rad/s]. When an overload flag is set, drop the limit to 0.3 [rad/s] until the flag clears for 2 s. 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.

Add a calibration routine that linearly maps an input knob to a target speed in [mps] with endpoints recorded at setup. Store endpoints on request, and clamp runtime speeds to the calibrated range. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.
Implement a motion sequencer: go to 0.0 [rad], then 1.0 [rad], then −0.5 [rad], holding each for 2 s. Abort immediately to 0.0 [rad] if an abort signal arrives. 250 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.7 ms.
Monitor for overspeed: if measured linear speed exceeds 0.50 [mps] for >50 ms, cut the command to 0.0 [mps] and latch a fault. Fault clears only via a reset input. Control loop 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.
Create an angle snap feature: round incoming target to the nearest 0.05 [rad] step before commanding motion. Provide a bypass input to use raw targets. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.3 ms.
Add warm-up logic: for the first 5 s after power-on, limit speed to 0.10 [mps]. After that, allow up to 0.30 [mps]. This applies to both forward and reverse. 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.

Implement a hold-to-run interlock: only drive the actuator to the target angle [rad] while a hold switch is continuously pressed. Releasing it commands a return to 0.0 [rad] with 0.8 [rad/s] slew limit. 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.
Create a simple anti-oscillation filter on velocity commands in [mps]: first-order low-pass with 5 Hz cutoff, applied before rate limiting. Control loop 250 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.5 ms.
Add position windowing: declare success when the axis stays within ±0.015 [rad] of the target for 250 ms, else continue commanding. Publish a success flag. 200 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.4 ms.

Implement a PID velocity controller to hold 0.30 [mps] using encoder feedback. Include anti-windup via integral clamping, output saturation, and a configurable slew rate on the command. Run at 500 Hz with WCET ≤ 0.8 ms. Provide a safety stop if error > 0.25 [mps] for >200 ms.

Create a PID position loop for a joint in [rad] with feedforward for a known constant load. Limit maximum position error rate to 1.5 [rad/s]. Specify gains and ensure stability; overshoot must be <5%. 1 kHz loop, WCET ≤ 0.9 ms.

Develop a cascaded controller: outer position loop in [rad] generating velocity in [mps] via a known radius mapping, inner velocity loop tracks that [mps] command. Include anti-windup and saturation. 1 kHz inner, 200 Hz outer; WCET ≤ 0.9 ms total.

Fuse a rotary encoder angle [rad] with a rate gyro to estimate angular rate. Use a complementary filter and drive a velocity controller to 0.25 [mps] equivalent at the rim. Detect sensor dropout and freeze the integrator on loss. 500 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.8 ms.

Implement a safety-limited PID: position control in [rad] with a dynamic limit that reduces max allowed error correction if a thermal headroom metric drops. Ensure smooth derating and fail-safe to 0.0 [rad] if headroom is exhausted. 500 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.7 ms.

Create a motion profile generator that tracks a time-parameterized trajectory (angle in [rad] vs time) with PID tracking and feedforward (velocity/acceleration terms). Enforce accel ≤ 2.0 [rad/s^2]. 1 kHz, WCET ≤ 0.9 ms. Abort safely on missed deadlines.

Design a synchronization controller for two rotary axes to maintain angle difference within ±0.02 [rad] while both track a shared position command. Use cross-coupling in the PID and clamp differential torque. 500 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.8 ms.

Build a velocity estimator by differentiating encoder angle [rad] with a derivative filter, then regulate speed to a setpoint in [mps]. Provide a stall detector if estimated speed < 0.02 [mps] while command > 0.20 [mps] for >300 ms. 1 kHz, WCET ≤ 0.8 ms.

Implement auto-tuning hooks for a PID position controller in [rad]: allow runtime step tests (limited to ±0.2 [rad]) and compute basic Ziegler–Nichols estimates, but apply them only within safe gain bounds. 500 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.9 ms.

Create a safety supervisor around a PID velocity loop in [mps]: monitor overspeed, watchdog, and limit switch status. On any fault, ramp to 0.0 [mps] within 200 ms and latch a diagnostic code. Ensure supervisor WCET ≤ 0.3 ms at 500 Hz.

Specify a multi-mode actuator controller with modes: Boot, Homing, Manual, Auto, Fault. In Auto, follow angle setpoints in [rad] with PID; in Manual, jog with fixed rates. Define all transitions, safe outputs, and timing: control at 1 kHz, supervisor at 100 Hz, WCET ≤ 1.2 ms combined. Include a complete safety requirement set.

Develop a coordinated dual-axis move: both joints must reach their targets in [rad] at the same time using synchronized trapezoids with shared end time. Enforce accel/jerk limits and a mid-move pause/resume capability. 1 kHz, WCET ≤ 1.0 ms. Provide verification metrics for simultaneity.

Create a fault-tolerant velocity control in [mps] with sensor fusion (encoder + model-based observer) and degraded-mode operation if the encoder fails. Requirements: bounded error in degraded mode (<0.08 [mps]), safe decel to 0.0 [mps] if both sources fail, 1 kHz loop, WCET ≤ 1.0 ms.

Define a comprehensive test harness for a PID position controller [rad]: step, ramp, and sinusoidal tests; injected noise and latency; fault injection (overspeed, limit breach). Include acceptance criteria (settling time, overshoot, steady-state error), log signals, and assert WCET never exceeds 0.9 ms at 1 kHz.

Engineer a safety-rated motion subsystem for a pick axis: modes (SafeStop, ReducedSpeed, FullSpeed), certified emergency stop, online monitoring of WCET, and periodic self-test of sensors. Control angle in [rad] and linear end-effector speed in [mps]. Specify all interlocks, transition guards, and recovery procedures. Inner loop 1 kHz, supervisor 100 Hz, WCET margins ≥ 20%.
Make a servo go to 0.75 [rad] when the start button is pressed, and return to 0.0 [rad] when released. Clamp output within [0.0, 1.0] [rad].
Run a wheel motor at 0.4 [mps] while enable is true; otherwise stop. Add a max speed limit of 0.6 [mps].
When a limit switch triggers, stop the actuator immediately and hold position.
On each rising edge of a trigger, step a stepper motor forward by 0.10 [rad], but never exceed 1.20 [rad] total travel.
Continuously sweep a servo between 0.20 [rad] and 1.00 [rad] at 0.15 [rad]/s until a stop command arrives.
If an emergency stop input becomes active, cut power to all actuators and latch an 'E-STOP' status until reset.
Map a joystick forward axis to linear wheel velocity in [mps] with a deadband of 0.05 and saturate at +/-0.80 [mps].
Apply a simple rate limiter so commanded servo angle cannot change faster than 0.30 [rad]/s.
Toggle a conveyor motor on/off with a pushbutton; enforce a minimum off-time of 1 s before it can turn on again.
Drive a linear slide towards a target speed of 0.25 [mps] until a done signal is true, then stop smoothly.
Keep a servo within safe mechanical limits: never command below -0.50 [rad] or above 0.90 [rad].
Start a motor at 0.20 [mps] and ramp to 0.50 [mps] over 3 s; on stop, ramp down over 1 s.
If motor temperature alarm is high, immediately disable motion and indicate 'overheat' until cleared.
When the home sensor becomes active, zero the joint position at its current angle in [rad].
Invert a servo control: a positive input results in negative angle, with output clamped to +/-1.20 [rad].
Create a state machine with states: Idle, Homing, Ready. On start, go to Homing, drive the joint at -0.40 [rad]/s until the home switch closes, set position to 0.00 [rad], then enter Ready.
Accept desired linear velocity in [mps] and turning rate in [rad]/s, compute left/right wheel speeds in [mps] with saturation +/-1.00 [mps].
Implement a simple position hold: if the wheel stops receiving commands for >500 ms, hold its last position using proportional control, limited to +/-0.60 [rad] error.
Command a stepper to move to N target angles (in [rad]) in sequence with 0.5 s dwell at each, abortable by a cancel input.
Add a watchdog that stops all actuators if the command heartbeat hasn't arrived within 200 ms.
Low-pass filter the measured wheel speed and use it to control a conveyor at a desired 0.30 [mps]. Update at 100 Hz; WCET must be <2 ms.
Use a state machine: Parked, Driving, Braking. In Driving, follow a velocity command in [mps] with acceleration limit 0.40 [mps]/s; in Braking, decelerate to 0 [mps] within 0.8 s.
Homing routine for a rotary joint: move at -0.20 [rad]/s until home sensor, back off 0.05 [rad], then re-approach at -0.05 [rad]/s to refine zero.
Mirror control: make servo B track servo A angle with a scale of 0.8, clamped to [-1.0, 1.0] [rad], updated at 200 Hz (WCET 1 ms).
Implement a soft start for a motor: limit d/dt of speed command to 0.20 [mps]/s and enforce a max speed of 0.70 [mps].
Add slew rate limiting on a yaw joint so commanded angle changes no faster than 0.40 [rad]/s and jerk is capped to 1.00 [rad]/s^2.
When approaching a target angle, switch from velocity mode to position hold inside a 0.02 [rad] window to eliminate overshoot.
Drive two actuators in opposition: when one goes to +0.60 [rad], the other goes to -0.60 [rad]; include safety clamps and a hard stop override input.
Configure a periodic control loop at 250 Hz with WCET of 1.5 ms to regulate belt speed to a setpoint in [mps] using proportional control and saturation.
Build a jog mode: while a jog button is held, move at 0.10 [mps]; on release, stop with a decel limit of 0.30 [mps]/s.
Implement stick-to-wheel mixing: map two joystick axes to left/right track speeds in [mps] with an expo curve and hard limits +/-1.20 [mps].
Create an anti-windup actuator command clamp: if output saturates at limits (+/-1.00 [mps]), freeze any integrator until back within range.
When following a position trajectory (angles in [rad]), pause automatically if the current or torque limit is exceeded, and resume when safe.
Add a motion-complete flag that becomes true when both velocity <0.02 [mps] and position error <0.01 [rad] for 100 ms.
Create a fault latch that triggers if commanded velocity exceeds 1.50 [mps] or angle beyond +/-1.50 [rad], requiring a reset action.
Design a PID speed controller for a wheel to track a setpoint in [mps] with anti-windup and output saturation. Run at 500 Hz; WCET must stay under 0.5 ms.
Implement a cascaded PID: outer loop tracks desired linear speed in [mps], inner loop tracks motor angular velocity in [rad]/s. Enforce max acceleration 0.60 [mps]/s.
Fuse encoder-derived speed with an accelerometer to estimate belt speed in [mps] via a complementary filter; feed this to a PID to hold 0.50 [mps].
Create a joint position PID controller (angle in [rad]) with feed-forward velocity, friction compensation, and anti-windup. Control loop 1 kHz, WCET <= 300 us.
Generate a trapezoidal trajectory in angle ([rad]): vmax 1.20 [rad]/s, amax 2.50 [rad]/s^2; follow with a PID position loop and respect soft limits +/-1.50 [rad].
Implement stall detection: if commanded speed >0.40 [mps] but measured speed <0.05 [mps] for 500 ms, declare fault and cut torque.
Design a wheel speed PID (in [mps]) with a notch filter to suppress a 30 Hz vibration. Enforce output rate limit and a watchdog timeout of 100 ms.
Create a two-motor synchronization controller: keep their angles matched within 0.02 [rad] using cross-coupled control while tracking a common velocity in [mps].
Implement safe torque-off and motion inhibit interlocks with a PID position controller (in [rad]). Verify timing at 400 Hz with WCET margin >=25%.
Use sensor fusion between two encoders on a joint to reject slippage and produce a robust angle estimate (in [rad]). Use that with a PID to hold 0.00 [rad].

Build a multi-mode motion controller with Manual, Auto, and Fault modes. Manual maps joystick to [mps] with limits; Auto follows a position trajectory in [rad]; Fault forces zero output. Include clear mode transitions, a latched E-stop, and per-mode WCET budgets (Manual 1 ms, Auto 0.8 ms) at 500 Hz.

Implement a dual-redundant speed sensing scheme for a wheel (two sensors), perform cross-checking, vote, and degrade to a safe mode if disagreement >0.10 [mps]. Provide PID speed control and verify watchdog and WCET constraints.

Create a coordinated two-joint controller for a planar arm: mode 1 performs joint-space moves (angles in [rad]); mode 2 accepts end-effector feed-forward speed in [mps] with joint limits. Include safety envelopes, soft/hard stops, and safe mode transitions.

Specify a comprehensive test plan for a PID velocity controller (in [mps]): step response bounds (overshoot <5%), saturation behavior, sensor loss test, watchdog timeout test, and WCET measurement under worst-case load.

Design a fault-tolerant trajectory follower with Cruise, Avoid, and SafeStop modes. Cruise tracks commanded [mps] within +/-2%; Avoid caps speed to 0.30 [mps]; SafeStop ramps to 0 [mps] within 0.6 s on any fault. Include acceptance criteria, transition coverage, and WCET <= 0.7 ms at 1 kHz.
When the start button is pressed, drive the motor to a fixed position of 1.20 [rad] and hold there; release the button to stop applying torque.
Command a wheel to spin at a constant linear velocity of 0.50 [mps]; stop immediately when the stop input goes high.
Map an analog knob (0 to 100%) to a servo angle from 0.00 [rad] to 2.50 [rad], updating at 50 Hz.
On a rising edge of a trigger, move a stepper to absolute angle 1.00 [rad] using a simple constant speed, then idle.
Limit the commanded speed so it never exceeds 1.20 [mps] in either direction, saturating any request beyond that bound.
Ramp a drive from 0.00 [mps] to 0.80 [mps] over 2.0 s, then hold speed.
Pulse the conveyor at 0.40 [mps] for exactly 3.0 s when a sensor trips, then stop.
If the temperature sensor reads above 60 C, immediately stop all motion; otherwise hold 0.00 [rad].
Implement a deadman: only drive at the requested 0.30 [mps] while the enable input is true; otherwise command 0.00 [mps].
Hold a servo at 0.00 [rad] with high stiffness; if disturbed, return promptly to 0.00 [rad].
When the cycle button is pressed, move from 0.20 [rad] to 1.80 [rad] and back once, then stop at 0.20 [rad].
On a stop command, decelerate linearly to 0.00 [mps] within 300 ms (no overshoot).
Reject any position command outside 0.00 [rad] to 2.00 [rad]; clamp to the nearest limit and report the clamp.
Drive a servo with a sine wave position: amplitude 0.50 [rad], frequency 0.20 Hz, centered at 1.00 [rad].
Publish the measured wheel velocity in [mps] at 20 Hz while the wheel runs at 0.60 [mps].
Create a homing state machine for a rotary axis: seek negative until the home switch closes, back off 0.05 [rad], re-approach slowly, then set zero and move to 1.50 [rad].
Convert joystick forward and turn inputs into left and right wheel commands in [mps], with a max of 1.00 [mps] per wheel and acceleration limited to 0.50 m/s^2.
If the range sensor reports distance less than 0.30 m, smoothly reduce the current target to 0.00 [mps]; otherwise follow the commanded speed.

Generate a trapezoidal position profile from the current angle to 3.14 [rad] with maximum angular velocity 1.50 rad/s and maximum angular acceleration 3.0 rad/s^2; start when triggered and stop at target.
Sweep a servo continuously between 0.20 [rad] and 1.80 [rad] at 200 Hz control rate; ensure WCET of each cycle is below 200 microseconds.
Implement a three-state controller (Idle, Run, Fault): Idle waits for enable, Run holds 1.20 [rad], Fault stops motion and latches if an overtravel is detected.
Follow velocity setpoints received at 100 Hz; if no new setpoint arrives within 100 ms, command 0.00 [mps] and signal a timeout.
Move two servos in sync to the same setpoint in [rad], limiting skew between them to less than 0.02 [rad].
Keep a wheel within ±0.10 [mps] of the target speed; if the error exceeds this for more than 1.0 s, raise a warning flag.
Use two normally-closed limit switches to allow motion only away from an active limit; prevent commanding past 0.00 [rad] and 2.20 [rad].
Apply a jerk-limited ramp when changing speed commands in [mps] so acceleration changes are smooth; jerk limit 1.0 m/s^3.
Add a simple feedforward term proportional to target speed in [mps] and saturate the output to safe bounds.
Rate-limit position commands to at most 0.30 [rad] per update; split larger steps into smaller increments at 100 Hz.
When reversing direction, apply a 0.02 [rad] backlash compensation offset to the commanded position.
Implement a deadband of ±0.05 [mps] around zero for a joystick input; below this, command 0.00 [mps].
At startup, move slowly toward the home switch, set position to 0.00 [rad] when it closes, then wait for a go command.
Execute a list of waypoint angles in [rad] with specified dwell times; repeat until stopped.
If two consecutive control cycles are missed, enter a Fault state and set the target to 0.00 [mps] immediately.
Log target and measured speed in [mps] at 50 Hz during a step from 0.20 to 0.80 [mps]; stop logging after 10 s.
Blend between manual joystick speed [mps] and an autonomous speed command using a gain from 0 to 1; saturate the result to ±0.90 [mps].
Implement cascaded PID control with an outer position loop in [rad] and an inner velocity loop in [mps]; include anti-windup, output saturation, and run at 1 kHz with WCET under 150 microseconds.
Fuse incremental encoder data and a hall sensor to estimate wheel velocity in [mps] using a complementary filter; drive a PID velocity loop to track commands while rejecting noise.
Add friction compensation and feedforward to a PID speed controller in [mps]; enforce overspeed protection at 2.00 [mps] with immediate safe stop.
Keep two joints phase-locked using cross-coupled PID so their angle difference stays within ±0.02 [rad] during motion profiles.
Schedule PID gains as a function of speed in [mps] (low, medium, high ranges) to maintain stable response across the operating envelope.
Fuse an absolute encoder with an incremental encoder to produce a robust angle estimate in [rad]; handle dropouts by freezing the estimate and limiting commanded velocity.
Integrate a notch filter at 40 Hz with the position PID (in [rad]) to suppress resonance; verify no command causes position to exceed 2.20 [rad].
Generate time-optimal, jerk-limited motion to a target at 2.50 [rad], then regulate with a velocity PID in [mps]; guarantee the control loop WCET stays below 120 microseconds.
Require two independent emergency stop inputs to be clear (2oo2) before enabling motion; continuously check them at 1 kHz and force 0.00 [mps] on any disagreement.
Implement thermal derating: above 65 C reduce max speed linearly from 1.00 [mps] to 0.20 [mps]; above 75 C, stop and latch a fault until manual reset.

Design a multi-mode joint controller with Position [rad], Velocity [mps], Hold, and Fault modes; define transitions, PID gains per mode, hard limits at 0.00 to 2.60 [rad], and enforce a 1 kHz loop with WCET <= 150 microseconds.
Create a learn mode that identifies speed feedforward gain by running step tests between 0.20 and 0.80 [mps]; accept the gain only if overshoot < 5% and settling time < 0.8 s, otherwise flag a fault.

Coordinate three axes to execute queued segments with jerk-limited trajectories, respecting per-axis limits (angle in [rad], speed in rad/s); schedule deterministically with WCET budgets for each axis.

Use redundant sensors (dual encoders and an IMU) to estimate wheel speed in [mps]; apply voting and degrade to a conservative safe mode if disagreement exceeds thresholds; include a verification test plan and timing limits.

Implement an autonomous winch controller with three modes: Manual Jog (velocity in [mps]), Tension Hold (position/velocity PID in [rad] and [mps]), and Emergency Retract; include safety limits, a detailed fault tree, and comprehensive test cases with WCET constraints.

On a rising edge of a start button, command a servo to move to 1.20 [rad]; on the next press, return to 0.00 [rad]. Limit angular velocity to 0.8 [rad]/s and angular acceleration to 2.0 [rad]/s^2. Run the control loop at 200 Hz with WCET per cycle <= 500 us. Abort any motion immediately if an emergency input is active.

Use a potentiometer to set a conveyor’s linear speed from 0.00 to 0.60 [mps]. Implement a soft-start/stop ramp of 0.10 [mps^2], and halt when an E‑stop is asserted. Enforce the 0.60 [mps] limit even if the input exceeds range. Control at 100 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

While a footswitch is held, drive a motor forward at 0.25 [mps]; when released, stop. Add a 50 ms debounce, clamp velocity, and include a 0.05 [mps] deadband to avoid chatter. If the fault input is high, ignore commands and force zero speed. Loop rate 250 Hz, WCET 400 us.

Home a rotary axis by rotating negative at 0.3 [rad]/s until the home switch triggers, then move to 0.00 [rad]. If homing takes longer than 5 s, enter a fault state. Use position units in [rad]. Supervisor at 50 Hz, motion control at 500 Hz, WCET <= 300 us for control.

On a start signal, index a stepper one full revolution (6.283 [rad]) and then return to the starting angle. Limit step rate so surface speed stays below 0.40 [mps]. Stop immediately if a limit switch is active. Implement a simple state machine: Idle, RunFwd, RunRev, Fault.

Map a rotary knob to a servo angle command from 0.0 to 1.5 [rad]. Apply a slew limit of 0.4 [rad]/s. If the measured angle deviates by more than 0.10 [rad] from command for >300 ms, assert an alarm output and inhibit further motion. Run at 200 Hz; WCET <= 600 us.

Provide jog controls: pressing + or − moves a linear actuator at ±0.20 [mps]. If both are pressed, stop. Respect endstop sensors and enforce an acceleration limit of 0.5 [mps^2]. Update at 100 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

A three-position toggle selects belt speeds 0.00, 0.15, or 0.30 [mps]. Ramp changes at 0.08 [mps^2] to limit jerk. If actual speed exceeds 0.35 [mps], cut drive and latch a fault until a reset input arrives. Control at 250 Hz; WCET <= 300 us.

When a trigger input pulses, move a rotary actuator to 0.785 [rad], hold for 2 s, then return to 0.00 [rad]. Clamp commanded angle between 0.0 and 0.9 [rad]. Ensure timing jitter < 1 ms with a 200 Hz scheduler, WCET per tick <= 0.5 ms.

Command a wheel to maintain 0.40 [mps] using a proportional controller with output saturation. If velocity error stays above 0.20 [mps] for longer than 200 ms, assert a fault and ramp to zero. Control tick 500 Hz, WCET <= 200 us.

Generate a back-and-forth sweep between 0.20 [rad] and 1.00 [rad] with 0.5 s dwell at each end. Limit angular velocity to 1.0 [rad]/s. A stop input halts motion and moves to the nearest endpoint. Update at 100 Hz, WCET <= 750 us.

Implement a brake interlock: engage the brake when commanded speed is 0.00 [mps] and measured speed < 0.02 [mps]; release the brake when command exceeds 0.05 [mps]. Enforce a 100 ms brake release delay before motion. Run at 100 Hz; WCET <= 300 us.

Convert pulses-per-revolution to linear belt speed and report in [mps]. If measured speed exceeds 0.50 [mps], assert a limit output and request a controlled deceleration to 0.30 [mps]. Update at 50 Hz, WCET <= 1 ms.
On startup, wait 2 s and then move a servo to a park angle of 0.35 [rad]. Clamp angles between 0.00 and 1.20 [rad]. No other behavior is required. Task runs at 20 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

Each press of a button indexes a stepper by 0.50 [rad]. Ignore presses faster than 10 Hz (debounce + rate limit). Stop if an endstop is active. Blink a status LED while moving. Scheduler 200 Hz; WCET <= 400 us.

Create a state machine for a rotary axis with states: Idle, Homing, Ready, Run, Fault. Home to a switch, then accept absolute angle commands in [rad]. Include timeouts, limit enforcement, and an E‑stop that forces Fault. Supervision 100 Hz; control 1 kHz; WCET <= 150 us (control) and 500 us (supervision).

Synchronize two linear actuators to follow the same trapezoidal profile with target velocity up to 0.40 [mps]. Keep position skew under 0.005 [m] by adjusting individual commands. If skew persists >200 ms, enter Fault and ramp both to zero. Control at 500 Hz, WCET <= 300 us.

Implement a velocity PID to hold a belt at 0.50 [mps] with integral anti-windup and output saturation. Gains are adjustable via inputs but must remain within safe ranges. If overspeed >0.60 [mps], cut drive and latch a fault. Run at 1 kHz; WCET <= 200 us.

Design a position PID for a servo driven by an analog setpoint. Constrain the angle to [0.0, 1.5] [rad] and limit rate to 0.6 [rad]/s. An E‑stop halts motion and holds position. Control at 500 Hz with WCET <= 250 us.

Execute a sequence of angular waypoints (in [rad]) on a stepper with acceleration and jerk limits. Pause for specified dwell times at each waypoint. Stop on any limit switch or timeout, and allow resume from the last completed waypoint. Scheduler 200 Hz; WCET <= 600 us.

Add backlash compensation to a rotary axis: when direction reverses, insert a 0.020 [rad] take-up move before tracking the new command. Ensure mechanical limits are not violated. Verify compensation only occurs on direction changes. Control 1 kHz; WCET <= 150 us.

Implement teach-and-playback: record up to 10 keyframes of angle [rad] with dwell times, then play them back with constant-velocity segments. Enforce angle bounds and allow a stop input to safely decelerate to rest. Update at 200 Hz; WCET <= 500 us.

Sweep a rotating arm from 0.30 to 1.00 [rad] while keeping tip linear speed near 0.20 [mps]. Adjust angular velocity accordingly but cap it at 1.2 [rad]/s. Stop if any fault input is active. Control at 200 Hz; WCET <= 600 us.

Create an S-curve motion profile generator for a linear axis with limits vmax 0.45 [mps] and amax 0.7 [mps^2]. Provide target position and velocity outputs for tracking. Clamp all commands to safety limits. Compute at 250 Hz with WCET <= 700 us.

Detect a stall: if commanded speed >0.20 [mps] but measured speed <0.02 [mps] for >500 ms, declare a fault, ramp to zero, and require manual reset. Include a recovery timer and ensure no oscillation. 100 Hz supervisory loop; WCET <= 400 us.

Output a sinusoidal velocity command v(t) = 0.15 [mps] * sin(2π*0.2 Hz*t) to a motor for 20 s, with 1 s ramp-in and ramp-out. Enforce saturation and ensure deterministic timing. Controller at 1 kHz; WCET <= 200 us.

Implement soft limits for a rotary joint: decelerate before reaching 1.20 [rad] to avoid hitting the hard stop. If a command would exceed [0.00, 1.20] [rad], clamp it and log a limit event. Control at 500 Hz; WCET <= 300 us.

Create a handwheel jog: encoder input adjusts position in [rad] with two sensitivity modes (coarse/fine). A button toggles the scale. Respect limit switches and provide a smooth 0.5 s decel when the button is released. Update 250 Hz; WCET <= 500 us.

Implement a trapezoidal motion planner for angular moves with vmax 1.5 [rad]/s and amax 3.0 [rad]/s^2. Track using velocity feedforward plus a small proportional term. Verify no overshoot beyond [0.0, 1.6] [rad]. Control 1 kHz; WCET <= 200 us.

Set up two periodic tasks: a speed control loop at 1 kHz (WCET <= 150 us) and a supervision task at 50 Hz (WCET <= 500 us). Ensure both meet deadlines with bounded jitter, and prioritize the control loop to maintain stable 0.30 [mps] tracking.

Derate maximum belt speed based on temperature: allow 0.50 [mps] up to 60 C, linearly reduce to 0.20 [mps] at 80 C, and stop with fault above 85 C. Ensure transitions are smooth and logged. Update at 10 Hz; WCET <= 1 ms.

Implement a deadman switch: motion to a commanded velocity up to 0.40 [mps] is allowed only while a hold-to-run input is active. If released, ramp to zero within 0.5 s; if speed remains >0.02 [mps] after 0.7 s, enter Fault. Loop 200 Hz; WCET <= 400 us.

Manage direction changes on a conveyor: before reversing, decelerate to |v| < 0.02 [mps], wait 200 ms, then accelerate in the opposite direction. Reject rapid toggles (<300 ms apart). Max speed 0.35 [mps]. Control at 250 Hz; WCET <= 300 us.

Normalize multi-turn joint angles to [-π, π] [rad] for command processing, and move along the shortest path. Enforce hard bounds at [-2π, 2π] [rad]. If a command would exceed bounds, clamp and log. Control 500 Hz; WCET <= 250 us.
Validate redundant limit switches (two channels). If both agree, allow motion; if they disagree, stop and flag a fault. Sample at 1 kHz with WCET <= 100 us, and debounce each channel by 5 ms.

Implement cascaded PID control for a rotary joint: an outer position loop (in [rad]) generates a velocity setpoint, and an inner velocity loop tracks it. Provide anti-windup, rate limits, and saturation. Inner loop 2 kHz (WCET <= 100 us), outer loop 200 Hz (WCET <= 150 us).

Fuse a wheel encoder with an accelerometer using a complementary filter to estimate linear speed in [mps]. Use the fused estimate for a velocity PID to hold 0.60 [mps]. If sensor disagreement exceeds 0.15 [mps] for >100 ms, fall back to the trusted source and de-rate. Run at 1 kHz; WCET <= 250 us.

Define a safety envelope: joint angle must remain within [0.10, 1.40] [rad] and tip linear speed under 0.35 [mps]. If any limit is violated, engage braking, log the cause, and require a manual reset. Ensure deterministic execution at 500 Hz with WCET <= 300 us.

Generate a jerk-limited trajectory for a slider with vmax 0.50 [mps], amax 0.80 [mps^2], and jmax 2.0 [mps^3]. Track the trajectory with a PID and guarantee no overshoot. Compute at 200 Hz with WCET <= 700 us and enforce output saturation.

Use redundant velocity measurements (tachometer and encoder) for a belt. Perform plausibility checks, select the trusted source, and degrade gracefully on failure. Clamp actuator commands if inconsistency >0.10 [mps]. Run at 1 kHz; WCET <= 250 us.

Plan a time-optimal rest-to-rest move for a rotary axis under torque limits, while respecting angle bounds 0.00–1.60 [rad] and keeping tip speed under 0.45 [mps]. Include a watchdog and E‑stop handling. Execute at 500 Hz with WCET <= 400 us.

Implement an automatic tuning routine for speed control: perform a safe relay-based test to estimate PID gains for holding 0.30 [mps]. Keep test speed below 0.35 [mps], monitor for anomalies, and abort safely if detected. Provide tuned gains and logs. WCET <= 300 us at 1 kHz.

Add a disturbance observer to augment a velocity PID, improving rejection of sudden load changes. Validate stability margins, enforce output saturation, and record step response metrics for a 0.40 [mps] command change. Run at 1 kHz; WCET <= 300 us.

Synchronize two wheels to maintain equal linear speeds within 0.01 [mps] while following a commanded profile. Apply cross-coupling to correct skew, and limit total angular travel to ±6.28 [rad]. On E‑stop, decelerate both channels safely. Control 1 kHz; WCET <= 200 us.

Combine model-based feedforward with PID to track a 1.00 [rad] step on a rotary joint. Use inertia and friction estimates to pre-shape control, then correct with PID. Include anti-windup, saturation, and safety angle clamps. Inner loop 2 kHz; WCET <= 150 us.

Build a multi-mode motion system: Manual (jog at up to 0.25 [mps]), Auto (sequence of angles in [rad] with profiles), and Fault (latched safe state). Include homing, interlocks, and acceptance criteria: ±0.02 [rad] position accuracy and ±0.02 [mps] speed error. Specify WCET budgets for control (200 us) and supervision (600 us).

Design a dual-channel speed controller with voting: two independent computations of the [mps] command are compared each cycle. If mismatch >0.05 [mps], enter a fail-safe state; otherwise, use the voted output. Define a degraded mode and periodic self-tests. Control at 1 kHz with WCET <= 250 us per channel.

Coordinate three axes to execute a synchronized trajectory with blended corners. Enforce per-joint angle limits in [rad] and per-axis velocity limits in [mps]. Support an emergency stop that guarantees safe deceleration on all axes. Allocate WCET <= 300 us per axis at 1 kHz.

Implement a safety interlock chain for motion: if a guard input opens or temperature exceeds 75 C, disable drive within 10 ms and verify speed falls below 0.02 [mps] within 200 ms. Provide fault latching, reset logic, and timing verification. Scheduler 1 kHz; WCET <= 200 us.

Deliver a complete control and verification plan for a cascaded position ([rad]) and velocity ([mps]) system: include unit tests, fault injection (sensor loss, overspeed), worst-case load scenarios, schedule analysis with jitter budgets, and WCET guarantees for all tasks.
When the start input is high, drive a motor to a fixed angular velocity of 30 [rad/s]; when low, stop. Clamp the command within ±30 [rad/s].
Set a servo to 1.57 [rad] while a trigger is pressed, otherwise hold 0.0 [rad]. Include 20 ms input debounce.
On each rising edge of a button, move a stepper exactly 200 microsteps forward, then ignore further presses until motion completes. Limit top speed to 15 [rad/s].
On a run command, ramp a motor from 0 to 10 [rad/s] over 2 seconds, then hold; on cancel, decelerate to 0. Use a linear ramp.
Pass through a velocity command to the driver but hard-limit it to ±5.0 [mps] and zero it if the enable input is false.
When a pulse is detected, run the actuator at 5 [rad/s] for 3 seconds, then stop. Ignore new pulses during the run.
Each time a button is pressed, toggle a servo between 0.0 [rad] and 2.0 [rad]. Add a 100 ms guard against double presses.
Only allow the motor to run when an enable line is high; map an analog input to a target velocity up to 20 [rad/s] with saturation.
Map a joystick axis to a servo angle in [rad] with a deadband of ±0.05 [rad] around center and a hard limit of ±1.2 [rad].
If the limit switch is active, immediately command zero motion regardless of any other inputs.
Generate a 0/0.5 [rad] square wave on a test servo at 0.5 Hz to verify basic motion.
Disable the motor and hold zero output whenever temperature exceeds 70 C; re-enable only when it falls below 65 C.
Implement an emergency stop: upon e-stop input, drive outputs to zero within 10 ms.
Convert a linear velocity command in [mps] to wheel angular velocity using a wheel radius of 0.05 m; clamp to ±20 [rad/s].
Hold a joint at 0.0 [rad] with proportional control at 100 Hz. Keep the control effort within safe bounds and avoid oscillation.
Create a homing sequence for a stepper: seek negative until the home switch closes, back off 0.1 [rad], then approach slowly to re-latch and set position to 0. Run the state machine at 200 Hz.

Given linear and angular velocity commands (v in [mps], w in [rad/s]), compute left/right wheel velocities, apply ±3.0 [mps] limits and 1.0 [mps^2] acceleration limits, and update at 200 Hz with WCET <= 0.4 ms.
Make a servo follow a commanded angle with a slew rate limit of 0.5 [rad/s] and a soft range of -1.0 to +1.0 [rad]. Ignore new commands while an in-motion flag is true.
Drive a two-axis pan-tilt using a joystick: map axes to angles in [rad], add a deadzone, enforce axis limits, and update at 100 Hz.
Control a conveyor: when sensor A detects a part, accelerate to 1.0 [mps]; when sensor B is active, decelerate to a stop. If the guard input opens, stop immediately.
Execute a position sequence for a servo: move to 0.5 [rad], then 1.0 [rad], then 0.2 [rad], each with a 1 s dwell. Abort the sequence on a cancel input.
Implement a valve actuator state machine with states Closed, Opening, Open, Closing. Use an encoder to detect motion; if no movement is detected for 500 ms during Opening/Closing, go to Fault.
Generate step pulses for a stepper with a trapezoidal speed profile up to 20 [rad/s]. Ensure pulse timing jitter stays under 50 us and WCET per tick <= 0.2 ms.
When a force-threshold signal is true, limit actuator velocity to 0.2 [mps]; otherwise allow up to 0.8 [mps]. Switch limits without causing a step change in output.
Index a rotary table by 2*pi/8 [rad] per cycle upon a start command, wait for a clamp input before proceeding, and retry up to 2 times if the in-position sensor fails.
Apply a soft-start to a drive: ramp from 0 to 8 [rad/s] at 2 [rad/s^2] when enabled, and ramp down at the same rate when disabled.
Control a gate with two endstops. Allow Open and Close commands, but never energize both directions simultaneously. If an endstop is active, inhibit motion toward it.
Operate a winch with Up/Down buttons at 0.5 [mps]. Inhibit Up when the upper limit is active and Down when the lower limit is active.
For a robot joint, accept position commands in [rad], apply velocity and acceleration limits, and enforce soft position limits. Run the control at 500 Hz with WCET <= 0.2 ms.
Set a treadmill belt speed from a remote setpoint with a soft limit of 2.0 [mps], an acceleration cap of 0.5 [mps^2], and an immediate stop when the e-stop input is true.
Coordinate two axes so they reach their targets at the same time using synchronized trapezoidal profiles. Both axes have angle limits in [rad].
Make Motor B follow Motor A's measured velocity in [rad/s]. If the mismatch exceeds 2.0 [rad/s] for 100 ms, raise a fault and disable both.
Control a clutch servo with states Disengaged, Engaging, Engaged, Disengaging, including fixed delays for settling and a timeout to Fault if no position change is seen.
Regulate fan speed based on temperature with hysteresis. Map temperature to a target speed in [rad/s], applying a minimum speed to avoid stall and a safe maximum.
Automate a door: on Open command, move to 1.2 [rad]; hold for 5 s; then Close to 0 [rad]. If an obstruction sensor trips while closing, reverse and reopen.

Implement cascaded PID control for a rotary joint: outer position PID outputs a velocity [rad/s]; inner velocity PID drives the actuator. Include anti-windup, limit velocity to ±15 [rad/s] and acceleration to 50 [rad/s^2]. Stop on temperature > 80 C. Run at 1 kHz with WCET <= 0.15 ms.

Estimate wheel speed by fusing encoder and gyro rate, then use PID to track a linear velocity command in [mps] (given wheel radius 0.06 m). Update at 500 Hz; if either sensor times out for 50 ms, enter SafeStop.
Stabilize a gimbal axis using rate feedback: PID on gyro [rad/s] to hold commanded angle. Clamp integrator, limit servo angle to +/- 1.2 [rad], and disable if the encoder is lost. Loop at 1 kHz.
Run a closed-loop stepper with an encoder: PID position control in [rad], auto-rehome on missed-step detection, and reduce max speed after two consecutive faults. Provide limits on jerk and speed.
Control a linear actuator with PID position and a jerk-limited trajectory generator. Enforce endstop switches, soft limits, and a watchdog that zeros output if WCET is exceeded.
Use feedforward plus PID to regulate two wheel velocities at up to 3.0 [mps]. Include friction compensation, saturation handling, and a watchdog that disables outputs if the control loop overruns.
Implement an elevator-like lift with setpoints per floor. Plan motion with jerk-limited profiles, apply velocity PID in [mps], and enforce door interlocks, top/bottom limits, and overspeed detection.

Add torque limiting to a joint: estimate torque from current, reduce the velocity limit when torque exceeds a threshold, and pause motion if high torque persists for 200 ms. Position control remains PID in [rad]. Loop at 2 kHz, WCET <= 0.1 ms.
Fuse motor and output encoders to estimate backlash and compensate it in a position PID loop. Adapt gains when backlash grows beyond a threshold, and raise a maintenance flag.
Design a disturbance-observer-augmented velocity controller: PID plus disturbance estimate to hold 10 [rad/s] under load changes. Ensure stability by limiting observer gain and clamping integrator.

Build a multi-mode drive controller with modes Manual, Auto, SafeStop, and Fault. Manual maps joystick to [mps] with limits; Auto tracks a trajectory; SafeStop ramps down within 200 ms; Fault latches. Specify the mode state machine, run control at 1 kHz with WCET <= 0.2 ms, and include a power-on self-test.

Implement redundant speed sensing using an encoder and Hall sensor. Fuse them for nominal operation; if disagreement exceeds 10% for 100 ms, switch to Degraded mode with reduced speed limits. Define watchdogs, WCET budgets, and a test plan with fault injection.

Create a four-axis coordinated motion system with modes Idle, Homing, Ready, Run, Pause, and Fault. Use synchronized trapezoidal planning so all joints (in [rad]) finish together. Servo loops at 1 kHz (WCET <= 0.2 ms); planner at 200 Hz (WCET <= 0.5 ms). Provide unit and HIL test requirements.

Specify a servo arm controller with startup calibration, periodic re-zero on index pulses, and multi-rate control (inner velocity 2 kHz, outer position 200 Hz). Include comprehensive timing constraints, safety interlocks, and a verification plan with stress tests and coverage goals.

Develop a multi-machine conveyor cell controller with two belt drives and a diverter servo. Modes: StartupSelfTest, Run, JamRecover, EStop, Fault. Use PID speed control in [mps] for belts and position control in [rad] for the diverter, with safety interlocks, jam detection, and WCET budgets. Define acceptance tests and logging.
When a toggle input is ON, move a servo to 1.2 [rad]; when OFF, move to 0.0 [rad]. Limit angular velocity to 1.0 [rad]/s and clamp position within [-1.5, +1.5] [rad].
Drive a conveyor motor at a constant 0.50 [mps] when enabled and stop when disabled. Ramp speed changes at no more than 0.10 [mps]/s and enforce a max speed limit of 0.60 [mps].
On a start command, index a stepper to +3.14 [rad] from home and hold position; on cancel, return to 0.0 [rad]. Abort motion if the move exceeds 4 s.
At power-up, center a servo to 0.0 [rad]. If a fault input asserts, immediately move to a safe park at -0.5 [rad] and inhibit further commands until reset.
Implement a deadman interlock: output motion only while the deadman is pressed. Cap linear velocity at 0.8 [mps] and decelerate at 0.3 [mps]/s when the deadman is released.
Read a knob that sets a target angle in [rad] for a servo. Map input to [-1.0, +1.0] [rad], apply a 0.2 s smoothing filter, and ignore commands outside the clamp.
Each time a button is pressed, toggle wheel speed between 0.20 [mps] and 0.40 [mps]. Limit rate of change to 0.10 [mps]/s and stop after 5 minutes of inactivity.
Maintain a belt speed of 0.30 [mps], but if temperature exceeds 60 Celsius, stop and hold until it cools below 55 Celsius. Provide a 2 s cooldown before resuming.
On start, move a joint to 0.70 [rad], wait 2 s, then return to 0.0 [rad]; repeat the cycle every 5 s. Ensure the joint never exceeds ±1.0 [rad].
Command a servo to follow a square wave position: amplitude 0.5 [rad], period 4 s, centered at 0.0 [rad]. Saturate output at ±0.6 [rad] and ensure smooth transitions.
Generate continuous step pulses to achieve approximately 1.0 [rad]/s shaft speed when enabled, and stop immediately when disabled. Target loop rate 1 kHz with WCET ≤ 100 us.
Monitor an encoder and if the absolute position exceeds 2.5 [rad], cut motion output and hold position. Require manual reset to clear the limit.
When a start signal is received, ramp a motor from 0 to 0.50 [mps] over 3 s and hold. If a stop signal is received at any time, decelerate to 0.0 [mps] within 2 s.
Implement jog controls: while JOG+ is held, increase angular position at +0.05 [rad]/s; while JOG- is held, at -0.05 [rad]/s. Clamp the position to [-1.2, +1.2] [rad].
At 50 Hz, read a speed command and drive a wheel 0–0.60 [mps]. If the command is unchanged for 5 s, ramp to zero at 0.15 [mps]/s.
Use PID to control joint position in [rad]. Setpoint from an external input in [-1.5, +1.5] [rad]. Sample at 1 kHz with WCET ≤ 200 us, limit output to avoid more than 2.0 [rad]/s.
Synchronize two motors to the same linear velocity of 0.30 [mps]. If the measured difference exceeds 0.05 [mps] for more than 100 ms, reduce both to 0.20 [mps] and signal a warning.
Create a homing state machine for a stepper with states Idle, SeekHome, Backoff, Latch, Done. Use a limit switch to home, then move to +1.57 [rad]. Abort if homing exceeds 3 s.
Plan a trapezoidal move from current angle to 2.0 [rad] with max velocity 1.0 [rad]/s. Update at 200 Hz with WCET ≤ 300 us and enforce soft limits at ±2.2 [rad].
Control wheel speed at 0.50 [mps] using PID with simple feedforward. If supply voltage is low, cap speed at 0.30 [mps]. Never allow commanded speed to exceed 0.60 [mps].
Implement master-slave following: the slave joint tracks a master encoder angle 1:1 in [rad]. Limit the tracking rate to 2.0 [rad]/s and constrain angles to ±2.5 [rad].
Command a pan-tilt with two servos. Accept yaw and pitch setpoints in [rad] within ±1.0 [rad]. Emergency stop input overrides all and drives both to 0.0 [rad].
Blend two setpoint sources (manual and remote) for a joint. When switching sources, slew the effective setpoint so angular velocity never exceeds 0.8 [rad]/s.
Estimate wheel velocity in [mps] from an encoder using a low-pass filtered derivative, and use PID to track 0.40 [mps]. Limit acceleration to 0.20 [mps]/s.
Apply soft limits to an axis in [rad] between 0.0 and 3.14 [rad]. If a command exceeds the window, decelerate and stop at the boundary, then lock out new moves for 2 s.
Every 60 s, perform a stiction compensation nudge: move +0.02 [rad] then back to the current setpoint, but only when angular speed is below 0.05 [rad]/s.
Run a pair of rollers at 0.70 [mps]. If a jam is detected (no encoder motion for 200 ms), reverse at 0.20 [mps] for 1 s and retry up to 3 times before entering Fault.
Hold position at a commanded angle in [rad] using PID. Require overshoot after a step to be less than 0.10 [rad]. Sample at 500 Hz with WCET ≤ 250 us.
On Start, accelerate to 0.60 [mps]; on Stop, decelerate to 0.0 [mps]. An emergency stop must force immediate zero output. Normal decel rate is 0.20 [mps]/s.
If position error exceeds 0.40 [rad], switch to a SafeStop mode that reduces angular velocity to 0.10 [rad]/s until error falls below 0.10 [rad], then return to Normal.
Account for a 3:1 gear ratio between motor and joint. Control joint position to 1.0 [rad] and compute corresponding motor angle and speed limits consistently.
Derate maximum conveyor speed based on temperature: 0.60 [mps] below 55 C, 0.30 [mps] between 55–65 C, and 0.0 [mps] above 65 C. Recover with 5 C hysteresis.
Create an indexer state machine: Idle, Move, Hold, Fault. Support MoveTo commands in [rad], Stop, and EStop. Include soft limits and a 2 s move timeout.
Mix joystick inputs to generate linear velocity [mps] and turn rate [rad]/s, then convert to left and right wheel speeds. Ensure neither wheel exceeds 0.90 [mps].
Engage a mechanical brake only when position error is within ±0.02 [rad]. Provide a 100 ms debounce on the brake command input and ensure a safe disengage sequence.
Implement cascade control: outer position PID in [rad], inner velocity PID in [rad]/s. Sample at 1 kHz with WCET ≤ 300 us. Enforce position limits ±2.0 [rad] and velocity limit 3.0 [rad]/s.

Fuse an encoder and a gyroscope to estimate joint velocity in [rad]/s. Use that estimate in a velocity PID to maintain 1.5 [rad]/s. If sensor disagreement exceeds 0.5 [rad]/s for 200 ms, fall back to encoder-only and flag a fault.
Synchronize two axes so their positions in [rad] remain equal using cross-coupled compensation. Stop and enter Fault if skew exceeds 0.10 [rad]. Run at 500 Hz with WCET ≤ 400 us.
Design a velocity controller for a wheel at 0.80 [mps] with gain scheduling across speed. Limit acceleration to 0.30 [mps]/s, include thermal derating, and support an emergency stop.
Generate an S-curve trajectory to a target angle in [rad] with max velocity 2.0 [rad]/s and max acceleration 4.0 [rad]/s^2. Track it with PID and keep WCET ≤ 350 us per update.
Perform precise homing using both a limit switch and an encoder index. After switch trip, back off and re-approach to detect index within 0.02 [rad]; fault if not found.
Use two redundant encoders on one joint. Select a trusted position via median or agreement; if disagreement exceeds 0.03 [rad], enter SafeMode: stop motion and hold position.

Implement a compliant mode that behaves like a virtual spring-damper in [rad]: velocity command proportional to position error with damping. Saturate to safe limits and stop if oscillation exceeds ±0.5 [rad].
Supervise commands against a combined limit surface of position [rad] and velocity [rad]/s. States: Normal, LimitClamp, Fault. Count violations and enter Fault after 3 within 10 s.
Detect wheel slip by comparing commanded and measured velocity in [mps]. If slip exceeds 0.20 [mps] for >150 ms, reduce command by 50% and restore gradually when slip <0.05 [mps].

Create a multi-mode drive: Init, Homing, Manual, Auto, EStop, Fault. Control two actuators with velocity PID in [mps], soft limits, and a watchdog. Loop at 1 kHz with WCET < 400 us. Include built-in tests to validate encoder counts, direction, and limit switches; acceptance: reach target within ±0.05 [mps] in 0.5 s.

For a robotic arm joint, provide Position mode [rad] and Velocity mode [rad]/s with bumpless transfer. Safety: hard stops at ±2.5 [rad], rate limiter, EStop. Test requirements: step response metrics, saturation handling, and sensor fault injection. Loop at 2 kHz, WCET ≤ 300 us.

Coordinate four wheel motors to track a commanded linear speed [mps] and yaw rate [rad]/s under kinematic constraints. Modes: Disabled, Align, Drive, Crawl. Include anti-windup PID per wheel, skid compensation, overtemp derating, and slip detection. Provide a verification plan with ramp tests and worst-case load checks.

Implement a high-precision stepper axis with S-curve trajectory, absolute homing, and backlash compensation. Modes: Idle, Homing, Ready, Move, Fault. Update at 1 kHz with WCET ≤ 250 us. Conformance: final position error <0.01 [rad] after moves and no missed deadlines over 10 minutes.

Design a dual-redundant servo axis with two fused position sensors. Modes: Normal, Degraded, Fault, with fail-operational behavior on single-sensor failure. Include periodic calibration, online self-tests, and a test suite for fault transitions and latency. Targets in [rad], velocity limits in [rad]/s, loop at 500 Hz with WCET ≤ 200 us.
When the run switch is on, command the conveyor motor to 0.30 [mps]; otherwise stop. Limit acceleration to 0.10 [mps^2]. Update at 50 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

Hold a rotary joint at 1.57 [rad] using simple proportional control. Clamp the command to prevent overshoot, sample at 100 Hz, WCET <= 0.5 ms, and disengage drive immediately if a limit switch is hit.

Please toggle a servo between 0.0 [rad] and 1.0 [rad] when a button is pressed, with a 0.2 s dwell at each end. Clamp the allowable range to [0.0, 1.2] [rad]. Ensure loop rate 100 Hz and WCET <= 0.5 ms.
Soft-start a motor to 0.50 [mps] over 3 s on a start command, and decelerate to 0 in 1 s on stop. If an undervoltage flag is asserted, cut output immediately. Control at 100 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.

On a momentary press, advance a stepper exactly 200 steps at an equivalent 0.20 [mps] feed, then ignore further presses until done. Provide a 'done' output and guarantee WCET <= 2 ms at a 200 Hz update.
Position a servo to a target from a knob mapped linearly to 0.0..2.5 [rad]. Limit slew rate to avoid jerks, validate input range, run at 100 Hz, and keep WCET <= 1 ms.
Keep a wheel speed at or below 0.80 [mps]. If measured speed exceeds the limit by 10%, cut power and hold for 300 ms before allowing restart. Sample at 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.5 ms.
Control a door: hold closed at 0.0 [rad]; open to 1.2 [rad] when an open command is true; and stop immediately if an obstacle sensor trips. Run at 50 Hz and ensure WCET <= 1 ms.
Drive until angular position reaches 3.14 [rad], then stop. Never move if any limit switch input is active. Update at 100 Hz with WCET <= 0.5 ms.
Read a digital direction input; set linear actuator speed to +0.25 [mps] if high and -0.25 [mps] if low. Saturate to ±0.30 [mps]. Loop at 100 Hz with WCET <= 0.5 ms.
When 'enable' is true, ramp a linear actuator from 0 to 0.15 [mps] over 2 s and hold. Stop instantly when 'enable' is false. Run at 50 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.
Enforce a joint angle safety window of [0.0, 2.8] [rad]. Clamp any requested target to this range and report if clamping occurred. Update at 200 Hz with WCET <= 0.3 ms.
If a temperature alarm is true, immediately stop motion and set a safe zero command. Otherwise allow velocities up to 0.60 [mps]. Control at 100 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms.
Make the drive wheel cruise at 1.00 [mps] when a foot pedal crosses a threshold; otherwise command 0. Add a gentle 0.5 s soft-stop. Target 100 Hz and WCET <= 0.5 ms.
Use simple on/off control to keep angle between 0.90 and 1.10 [rad]. Stop the actuator if a hard-stop switch trips. Run at 200 Hz, WCET <= 0.3 ms.

Can you build a two-speed state machine with modes: Idle, LowSpeed (0.30 [mps]), HighSpeed (0.80 [mps])? Use two buttons with debounce for transitions and an e-stop that forces Idle. Rate 100 Hz; WCET <= 1 ms.
