Control a bathroom fan relay from a humidity sensor: switch ON when relative humidity exceeds 70%, and back OFF when it drops below 65% (hysteresis). Report the current state using an enum with values OFF and ON.
Create a staircase timer: when a button is pressed, turn a light relay ON for 90 seconds and ignore further presses until it times out. Initialize to OFF on boot and on watchdog expiration.
Pulse a solenoid relay ON for 500 milliseconds on each valid button press. Reject presses that occur within 1 second of the previous pulse.
Make a simple light with ambient sensor assist: if ambient light level is below a threshold and the user switch is ON, drive the relay ON; else OFF. Add a 1 second sampling rate.

Turn on a water valve relay for exactly 15 minutes when scheduled maintenance is triggered by a virtual command. If the command repeats during the period, extend the timer to the full 15 minutes again.

Build a simple two-position enum control for a heater relay: MODE=DISABLED or ENABLED. In DISABLED the relay is always OFF; in ENABLED the relay mirrors a thermostat input (above 24 Celsius -> OFF, below 22 Celsius -> ON).
Create a nightlight timer: between 21:00 and 05:00, if a hallway switch is toggled ON, keep the relay ON for 5 minutes then turn it OFF automatically.
When a leak sensor is triggered, cut power to a pump relay immediately and keep it OFF for at least 10 minutes (lockout) before allowing it to be turned back ON.
Implement a garage light with auto-off: ON when the door is open, and remain ON for 3 minutes after the door closes, then OFF. Use a simple two-state machine.
Add a watchdog that must be kicked every 100 ms; if it ever expires, set all controlled relays to a safe OFF state and stop any running timers until manual reset.
Design a two-way stairwell light: two wall switches independently toggle a single light relay. Handle race conditions and debounce both inputs. Ensure the relay state persists across resets.

Create an AUTO/MANUAL enum mode for a garden irrigation relay. In AUTO, water every day at 05:00 for 20 minutes unless soil moisture is above 40%. In MANUAL, a button press starts a 10-minute watering cycle. Include a watchdog that fails safe (OFF).
Implement a weekday/weekend schedule controlling a coffee maker relay: Mon–Fri ON at 06:15 OFF at 07:00; Sat–Sun ON at 07:30 OFF at 08:15. Skip if a water level sensor indicates empty.

Develop a presence-simulated lighting rule: in VACATION mode, randomly turn a living room relay ON/OFF between 18:00 and 23:00 with ON durations 5–20 minutes and OFF gaps 3–10 minutes. In NORMAL mode, do nothing.

Create a window fan controller with three enum modes: OFF, AUTO, and BOOST. In AUTO, turn the fan relay ON when indoor temperature exceeds 26 Celsius and OFF below 24 Celsius; in BOOST, keep ON for 15 minutes then revert to AUTO.

Build a child-safe outlet: the outlet relay only turns ON if a guardian switch is enabled and a local button is pressed twice within 2 seconds (double-tap). Any overcurrent alarm must force immediate OFF and start a 60-second lockout.

Program a hallway light that steps between power levels using two relays (LOW/HIGH). Use a small state machine to ramp from OFF to LOW for 10 seconds, then to HIGH on sustained motion, and back down after inactivity.

Create sunrise/sunset offset scheduling using an ambient light sensor proxy: when light level transitions from day to night, turn porch light ON and keep it until 22:30. If it becomes bright again, turn it OFF immediately.
Interlock two heater relays so they can never be ON simultaneously. Provide MANUAL and SCHEDULE modes; in SCHEDULE, alternate them every hour from 08:00 to 20:00.

Implement a garage exhaust fan with timeout and safety: a switch starts the fan for 15 minutes; if a CO sensor indicates high level, extend runtime to 30 minutes. Ensure the fan cannot be restarted more than twice within 1 hour.

Develop a state machine for a gate latch solenoid: states IDLE, ARMED, ACTUATE, and COOLDOWN. A valid keypad event moves to ACTUATE for 300 ms, then COOLDOWN for 5 seconds before returning to ARMED. Include watchdog recovery to IDLE.

Write automation rules that ensure a water heater relay only energizes during off-peak hours (22:00–06:00) and never if a leak sensor is active. Provide a manual override that times out after 30 minutes.

Create a bedroom lamp with tap gestures: single tap toggles; double tap turns ON for 20 minutes; long press enters NIGHT mode that limits ON to a low-power relay path. Track mode with an enum and debounce inputs.

Schedule a dehumidifier relay with duty cycling: in AUTO mode, run 10 minutes every hour but skip cycles if humidity is already below 55%. In OFF mode, do nothing; in BOOST, run continuously for 1 hour.
Set up a pet feeder motor relay to run for 8 seconds at 07:00 and 18:00. Add a safety interlock so it cannot run more than 4 times in any 24-hour period.
Implement a bathroom fan controller that waits 2 minutes after the light switch turns OFF before stopping the fan relay, unless humidity is still above 65%, in which case extend by 5 minutes.
Create a scene controller with three modes (RELAX, BRIGHT, NIGHT) that maps to different combinations of two relay-controlled circuits. A button cycles modes, and the mapping is applied atomically.

Develop an outdoor irrigation valve controller with rain delay: when a rain sensor is active, suspend all scheduled runs for 24 hours and resume automatically afterward. Include watchdog fallback to keep valves closed on faults.
Design a hot water recirculation pump automation: run the pump relay for 3 minutes when a bathroom switch is turned ON, but limit to at most once every 30 minutes per bathroom.

Build a heater with frost protection: in AWAY mode keep temperature above 8 Celsius by turning relay ON/OFF with hysteresis; in HOME mode use schedule 06:00–08:00 and 18:00–22:00 at 20 Celsius. Use enums for modes and a state machine for control.

Implement a thermostat using PID control for a radiant floor heater relay. Target 21.0 Celsius, sample temperature at 1 Hz, and constrain relay actuation to minimum ON/OFF times of 3 minutes to prevent short cycling. Include a watchdog that forces a safe OFF and latches an error if the loop overruns its 100 ms WCET.

Create a ventilation controller that fuses occupancy (motion), CO2 ppm, and humidity to decide fan relay operation. If any two out of three indicate poor air quality (CO2 > 1000 ppm, humidity > 65%, recent occupancy within 10 minutes), run the fan for 15 minutes. Use a state machine to manage RUN, HOLD, and IDLE.

Design a load-shedding system for a home energy setup: if total load exceeds 3000 watts, shed low-priority relays in order until below 2800 watts, but never drop essential circuits. Restore in reverse order with 60-second gaps. Watchdog must revert to essentials-only.

Build a greenhouse controller with PID temperature loop (setpoint 24 Celsius) that decides when to open a vent actuator via a relay and when to turn on a heater relay. Prevent both from being ON simultaneously. Prioritize safety: if temperature exceeds 35 Celsius, force vent ON and heater OFF.

Create a smart water boiler with enum modes OFF, ECO, and BOOST. Use a PID to maintain 55 Celsius in ECO and 60 Celsius in BOOST with a heater relay, with anti-boil safety that trips at 75 Celsius and requires manual reset. Evaluate control at 2 Hz with WCET under 2 ms.

Implement sensor fusion for security lighting: combine ambient light, door contact, and motion. Use a confidence score to decide when to turn exterior relays ON for 5 minutes, and adapt thresholds at night (21:00–05:00). Include a watchdog that clears confidence to zero on fault.

Create an HVAC damper relay controller that uses a PI loop on zone temperature error to time-proportion a damper relay with 30-second windows. Enforce a maximum actuation rate of 1 change per 30 seconds and guarantee a worst-case execution time under 1 ms per cycle.

Develop a water leak mitigation system with a main shutoff valve relay and a sump pump relay. Use a state machine with NORMAL, LEAK_DETECTED, DRAIN, and LOCKOUT states. If multiple sensors agree, enter LOCKOUT and require a manual clear. All watchdog failures must force the valve CLOSED and pump OFF.

Implement a solar hot water controller that fuses roof panel temperature and tank temperature. If the panel is at least 8 Celsius hotter than the tank, run the circulation pump relay; otherwise stop. Add freeze protection that pulses the pump 10 seconds every 30 minutes when panel < 2 Celsius.

Create an adaptive lighting scheduler that learns typical occupancy windows and shifts relay ON times accordingly, but always respects quiet hours 23:00–06:00. Constrain learning updates to once per day and ensure the rule evaluation loop runs at 10 Hz with WCET under 1 ms.

Specify a whole-home mode manager with enums HOME, AWAY, SLEEP, VACATION, and EMERGENCY that coordinates multiple relays (lights, outlets, fan). Define a formal state machine for transitions, including manual overrides and time-based transitions. Include a watchdog strategy and require unit tests for all transitions and fail-safe behaviors.

Design a multi-zone irrigation controller with modes OFF, AUTO, MANUAL, and MAINTENANCE. Schedule up to 8 zones with sequential non-overlapping runs, rain delay, and flow-sensor fault detection that halts all zones. Provide detailed timing constraints (control tick at 50 ms, WCET <= 5 ms) and specify test cases for normal, edge, and fault states.

Create an energy-aware load controller for a smart home with three modes: NORMAL, SAVINGS, and CRITICAL. Map appliances to priority tiers and automate shedding/restoring relays based on a power budget updated every minute. Require a watchdog, persistence of mode across reboots, and a comprehensive simulation plan covering 24-hour schedules.

Develop a smart boiler room supervisor with multiple interlocks: pump relay, burner relay, and safety cutoff. Modes: IDLE, PREHEAT, RUN, COOL, and FAULT with clear transition conditions and timing. Guarantee that WCET is under 2 ms at a 20 Hz loop, add a heartbeat watchdog, and include acceptance criteria with test steps for each mode.

Specify a comprehensive lighting automation framework that supports scenes, per-room schedules, manual overrides, and an emergency path that forces egress lighting ON. Use enumerated modes per room, a central watchdog, and require both static analysis constraints and scenario-based tests (daylight saving switch, power loss, sensor failure).

Turn on a light relay whenever the wall switch is pressed; turn it off automatically after 10 minutes. Debounce 30 ms. Add a watchdog that forces the relay off if no main loop tick occurs within 500 ms.
When a dry contact input closes, energize the relay; release when it opens. Ignore any bounce shorter than 20 ms. Blink a heartbeat LED at 2 Hz and use a 1 s watchdog that drops the relay on expiry.
Button single press toggles the outlet relay; a long press longer than 2 s forces it off. For safety, ensure the relay cannot remain on for more than 2 hours continuously.
I need a simple timer switch: pressing the button starts a 15 minute countdown with the relay on; pressing again cancels and turns it off immediately.
Make a dusk-activated switch. If ambient light falls below 50 lux, turn the relay on; when it rises above 80 lux, turn it off. Sample at 5 Hz and apply a 10 s minimum on time.
Daily schedule: turn the sprinkler valve on at 06:00 for 20 minutes, every day. Skip the watering if a boolean 'rain' input is true at start time.
Motion-activated stair light: when motion is detected, turn on the light relay for 30 s. Retrigger to extend the timer; otherwise turn off.
Fan timer with safety: when commanded on, run for the requested number of minutes, but if an overcurrent alarm is seen, shut off immediately and latch off until a manual reset input is pressed.
Doorbell chime driver: on any press, energize the chime relay for exactly 1 s, then ignore repeats for a 3 s refractory period.
Tap logic for a smart switch: treat a double-tap within 400 ms as an immediate toggle; otherwise perform a single-tap toggle after the 400 ms window closes.
Pulse pump control: a momentary input should trigger the pump relay for exactly 0.5 s, regardless of input duration.
Status indication: blink an LED at 1 Hz while the main relay is on; keep it off when the relay is off. Run the control loop at 100 Hz with a WCET below 1 ms.
Provide a simple latch. First button press turns the relay on, second press turns it off. Power-up defaults off. Add a watchdog that forces off on timeout.
Thermostatic switch: if temperature is below 18 C, close the heater relay; open it when the temperature exceeds 21 C. Sample once per second.
Sunset-to-bed schedule: turn a lamp on at a supplied 'sunset' timestamp and off at a supplied 'bedtime' timestamp; if either time is invalid or missing, keep the lamp off.

Create a state machine for a hallway light with enum modes Auto, ManualOn, and ManualOff. Auto uses a PIR sensor to keep the light on for 2 minutes after motion; ManualOn holds on until 1 hour or a manual off; ManualOff keeps off until sunrise. Include a watchdog that forces Off on fault.

Programmable timer switch: user selects duration from an enum {5m, 15m, 30m, 60m}; three LEDs indicate the current selection; a start/cancel button cycles choices and starts the timer. Add a 500 ms watchdog and safe-off on reset.

Water heater schedule with safety interlock: heating allowed 05:00-09:00 and 17:00-22:00 only; inhibit if tank temperature exceeds 60 C. Provide an overrun cap of 90 minutes and a state machine with states Idle, Heating, and LockedOut.

Bathroom fan automation with humidity and temperature: if humidity > 70% or temperature > 28 C, turn on; keep running at least 5 minutes. Add a Quiet enum mode that reduces duty by cycling 30 s on/30 s off. Include a watchdog timer.

Scene switch with three buttons and enum scenes Relax, Work, Night. Map each scene to specific combinations of relays A, B, and C. A long press on any button enters a Config state to remap scenes. Use a state machine with debouncing and timeouts.

Window blind controller: Up and Down inputs drive two interlocked relays; estimate position from run time. Modes include Normal, Calibrate, and Error; calibration runs to endpoints to learn times. Add a watchdog that drops both relays if the main loop stalls.

Garden lights with holiday override. Daily on at 19:30 for 4 hours; on specified holiday dates, keep on until 02:00. Provide enum modes Auto, ForceOn, and ForceOff, a state machine, and ensure event handling WCET under 2 ms.

Rule-based smart plugs: three plugs share a 1500 W budget. If a new request would exceed the limit, defer and queue for up to 10 minutes. Each plug has a priority enum High, Normal, or Low. Watchdog should shed all loads on failure.

Two-way stairwell switches driving one light: implement a state machine that tracks virtual light state from edge events with 30 ms debounce. Add an inactivity timer to turn off after 15 minutes unless a presence sensor is active.

Irrigation sequencer: run Zone1, then Zone2, then Zone3 with configurable durations and a 5 s pause between zones. Provide modes Schedule, ManualZone, and RainDelay. Watchdog forces all zones off if the tick gap exceeds 250 ms.

Vacation mode for a lamp: randomly turn on between 18:00 and 23:00 for 10-40 minutes with at least 5 minutes between activations. Enum modes Off, Vacation, and Schedule. Use a deterministic PRNG seed parameter and a state machine.

Entryway light: turn on when door opens or motion occurs after sunset; turn off 2 minutes after the last activity. Include a child-lock enum that disables manual toggles. Add a watchdog and a 100 Hz control rate.

Bathroom fan controller with modes Auto, Manual, and Lockout. Auto triggers on rising humidity rate; Manual runs for selected minutes; Lockout prevents operation during 23:00-06:00. Provide a state machine with explicit transitions and timers.
Two-stage heater: Stage 1 on below 19 C, Stage 2 on below 17 C, all off above 20 C. Include a frost-protect mode at 8 C. Add a watchdog heartbeat LED and de-energize relays on any fault.
Smart dimmer with tap patterns. Single tap toggles, double tap sets 100% on, hold > 1 s ramps up in steps; store the level persistently on change. Use enum dim levels and include a watchdog.

Power-fail recovery: on boot, restore the last known relay state if the previous shutdown was clean; otherwise default Off. State machine with Boot, Restore, Run, and SafeOff. Add a 1 s startup inhibit for safety.
Lighting schedule with sunrise/sunset offsets. Compute on/off times given daily offsets in minutes (clamp to 0-1440). Modes Auto, OverrideOn, and OverrideOff. Watchdog 1 s, safe state Off.
Garage dehumidifier: run when humidity > 60% and temperature > 10 C; stop when humidity < 55%. Add a daily 10 minute exercise run at 12:00. Include an Inhibit state if the door is open.
Two-circuit relay box with mutual exclusion. Provide enum modes AOnly, BOnly, and Auto. Auto selects based on schedule and occupancy. Enforce a 1 s dead-time when switching. Watchdog required.

Childroom nightlight: softly fade on after 20:00 and fade off at 07:00; bump to full on if noise > 70 dB for 5 s. State machine with SoftOn, FullOn, SoftOff, and Off. Ensure a 50 Hz loop and WCET below 1 ms.

Maintain 300 lux at a desk using a PID loop that time-proportions a solid-state relay over a 10 s window. Include anti-windup, adjustable setpoint, and a state machine with modes Off, AutoPID, and Manual. Watchdog must cut output to 0% if the sample interval exceeds 200 ms.

Thermostat with PID: regulate room temperature in Celsius by time-proportioning a heater relay with a 5 minute cycle. Add frost protection at 5 C and overtemperature cutout at 28 C. Provide enum modes Off, Heat, and Schedule, plus a watchdog.

Occupancy sensor fusion: combine PIR, door contact, and microphone level to decide Occupied vs Vacant. Use a small state machine with confidence and decay. Control a light relay accordingly, and for safety never keep it on more than 2 hours without reconfirmed occupancy.

Water pump safety controller: detect a stuck-on relay using a flow sensor; if commanded off yet flow exceeds 0.2 L/min for more than 3 s, enter Fault and flash an alarm relay. Provide modes Auto, Manual, and Fault, and include a watchdog that drops the pump on failure.

Smart power strip with four outlets and a current sensor: enforce a 1,800 W limit by shedding lower-priority loads first. Implement a state machine with Brownout, Recovery, and Normal. Run a 100 Hz loop with WCET under 1.5 ms and a 250 ms watchdog.

Greenhouse coordinator: use temperature and humidity to choose vent (relay A) or heater (relay B). Prevent both active at once. Include preheat and precool timers, a watchdog, and safety ranges of 5-35 C and 30-90% RH.

Hot water recirculation pump that learns usage: build a schedule from recent manual activations and pre-run 10 minutes before typical times. Provide modes Learn, Auto, and Off. Rate-limit flash writes; include a watchdog and fail-safe Off.

Dimmable stair lights reacting to approach speed: estimate person velocity in m/s from a time-of-flight sensor and fuse with PIR for reliability. Faster approach yields quicker ramps. Provide a state machine and ensure tasks meet 200 Hz loop and 2 ms WCET.

Transfer relay supervisor for backup power: monitor mains presence and battery voltage; switch to backup when mains is lost, and return after 2 s of stable mains. Add brownout hysteresis, a watchdog, and a Fault mode if chatter occurs more than 3 times in 1 minute.

Leak mitigation system: use a moisture sensor and flow meter to shut a valve relay and latch in Leak state, plus assert an alarm contact. Provide enum states Armed, Leak, and Bypass. Run a startup self-test by pulsing the valve and verifying flow. Watchdog enforces valve closed on failure.

Whole-home lighting scheduler with per-room modes Auto, Manual, Vacation, and Nightlight, coordinated by a global state machine that resolves conflicts and prioritizes safety scenes. Include sunrise/sunset offsets, quiet hours, and occupancy overrides. Require a watchdog, a 100 Hz supervisor with WCET under 1 ms, and ensure no relay toggles more than 6 times per minute.

Multi-mode energy saver for six smart relays controlling heaters and appliances. Modes: Normal, PeakShave, Critical, and Blackout. Use a tariff schedule to shed loads by priority while enforcing minimum on/off durations. Include a watchdog and provide a comprehensive test plan including missed ticks and stuck-relay fault injection.

Comprehensive corridor automation: multiple doors, motion sensors, and an emergency override. Build a hierarchical state machine with BuildingMode enum Normal, Cleaning, and Emergency. Guarantee egress lighting on during Emergency within 500 ms. Include a 50 Hz loop, WCET under 1 ms, a watchdog, and timing assertion hooks.

Smart irrigation controller for eight zones with rain sensor, soil moisture, and water budget. Per-zone schedules, seasonal adjustment, and a system state machine with modes Off, Schedule, Manual, RainDelay, and Fault. Add a watchdog, flow-leak detection, and a test harness simulating a week to validate timing and safety.

Multiroom HVAC relay coordinator with heating, cooling, and fan relays plus room thermostats. Provide enum modes Off, Heat, Cool, Auto, and EmergencyHeat. Implement conflict resolution, compressor anti-short-cycle timers (3 minutes), and a watchdog. Require unit tests for state transitions, 100 Hz WCET checks, and safety verification for temperature limits in Celsius.

When a wall switch is pressed, energize a relay to turn on a lamp, with 200 ms debounce and an auto-off after 60 s. Implement a simple two-state machine (OFF, ON_TIMED) and include a watchdog timer that must be kicked at 10 Hz.
Make a smart plug that toggles on each button press, with an enum mode OFF/ON and an LED that mirrors the state. Require a watchdog that resets the system if not serviced within 500 ms.

Create a staircase timer: pressing the pushbutton turns the relay on for 90 s; pressing again cancels early. Use states IDLE and TIMING, ensure maximum execution time per cycle is under 1 ms, and include a watchdog.
Drive a doorbell relay for exactly 1 s when the button is pressed, then ignore further presses for 2 s. Include a simple state machine and a watchdog.

Control a bathroom fan: in AUTO mode turn on when humidity rises above 65% RH and off below 60% RH; in MANUAL mode follow the switch. Use an enum for modes, sample humidity once per second, and include a watchdog.
Switch on a night light when ambient light drops below a threshold and off when it rises above it, with 5% hysteresis. Model as DAY and NIGHT states and include a heartbeat task for a watchdog.
Add an energy-saving auto-off: any time the relay is on, force a shutdown after 30 minutes continuous operation. Include a watchdog kick every 100 ms.

Turn on a garage light when a door contact opens and keep it on for 5 minutes, with a manual override switch to turn off immediately. Use a small state machine, timing accuracy ±100 ms, and a watchdog.
Control three outlets from one master switch, but stagger relay activations by 100 ms each to reduce inrush. Include a watchdog reset on stall.
Operate a window blind with two relays for up and down. Accept a single switch input: short press toggles up/down, long press stops. Ensure relays are never on together and add a watchdog.
Daily schedule for garden lights: turn on at 19:00 and off at 23:00, with manual override switch taking precedence. Keep a simple OFF/ON/SCHEDULED state machine and a watchdog.
Only trigger a buzzer if the button is held for at least 2 s; shorter presses do nothing. Add a watchdog timer and ensure debounce of 50 ms.
Turn off a heater relay immediately if temperature exceeds 60 C. In AUTO mode hold between 18–22 C using simple thresholds; include an ERROR state if sensor reads invalid. Use a watchdog.

Motion-activated lamp: when motion is detected, turn on for 30 s and retrigger to extend time; ignore additional triggers during the first 500 ms to avoid chatter. Add an ENABLED/DISABLED enum and a watchdog.
Detect a double-click within 400 ms to toggle a relay; single clicks are ignored. Include a watchdog and ensure WCET of the event handler is under 0.5 ms.

Implement a weekday/weekend schedule for a water pump relay with a holiday override input. Create enum modes OFF, MANUAL, SCHEDULE and a state machine that enforces the active plan. Persist the last mode, maintain timing accuracy within ±100 ms, and include a watchdog serviced at 20 Hz.

Create four lighting scenes selected by four buttons; use an enum Scene and map each to a combination of three relays. Transitions should occur with a 250 ms stagger between relays. Include a watchdog and an ALL_OFF safety state.

Design a thermostat smart socket with modes OFF, HEAT, COOL, AUTO. Sample temperature in Celsius every 2 s, use a 0.5 C deadband, and include a SENSOR_FAULT state that disables the relay if readings are out of range. Add a watchdog.

Sequential irrigation for three zones: when started, run Zone1 for 10 min, Zone2 for 8 min, Zone3 for 6 min, then stop. If a rain sensor is active, pause and resume where left off. Model as a clear state machine and keep WCET under 2 ms per tick; include a watchdog.
Keypad-controlled door strike: IDLE, AUTH_PENDING, UNLOCKED, and LOCKOUT states. After three failed attempts, enter LOCKOUT for 60 s. Unlock holds the relay for 5 s. Watchdog required.

Blind controller with top and bottom limit switches. Commands UP, DOWN, and STOP set via a single button (short=toggle direction, long=stop). Ensure mutual exclusion of relays and a CALIBRATE state on power-up. Add a watchdog.

Presence-based lighting: if motion is detected and ambient lux is below threshold, turn lights on for 120 s. Disable during a sleep schedule (23:00–06:00) unless a safety override input is active. Use enum modes and a watchdog.

Energy-saver outlet: if measured power falls below 5 W continuously for 10 min, turn off. Wake immediately on button press. Apply 10% hysteresis on power and model the logic in a small state machine. Include a watchdog.

Fan with three speeds driven by three relays; use an enum SPEED = OFF, LOW, MED, HIGH. A long press cycles speeds upward, wrapping around, and only one relay may be active at a time. Watchdog required.
Two-way wall controls: two toggles control one light relay and must stay consistent even after power cycles. Implement edge detection and a small state machine, with a watchdog.
Vacation mode scheduler: base on a daily on/off schedule but randomize each event within ±15 minutes when in VACATION mode. Enum modes NORMAL and VACATION; watchdog must be kicked every 200 ms.

Hot-water recirculation pump: on motion near kitchen or bath, run pump for up to 2 min; inhibit if water temperature exceeds 45 C. Use states IDLE, RUNNING, INHIBITED. Sample temperature every 1 s and include a watchdog.
Dehumidifier control socket: maintain target humidity at 50% with a 3% hysteresis. Enforce compressor protection: minimum off 3 min, minimum on 2 min. Use enum modes AUTO and OFF and add a watchdog.

Greenhouse vent controller: open at 28 C, close at 24 C; if wind alarm is active, force CLOSE regardless of temperature. Limit actuator runtime to 30 s and detect stall if no limit reached. State machine plus watchdog.
Stairwell lights group: either of two buttons activates both relays for 3 min; pressing either during the timer turns both off. Include a timer state machine and watchdog.

Sump pump controller: when float switch closes, run pump; enforce minimum off time of 20 s to protect the motor, and alarm if runtime exceeds 5 min. Implement as states IDLE, RUNNING, COOLDOWN, ALARM, with a watchdog.
Smart outlet with child lock: require two buttons to be held simultaneously for 1 s to enable output; auto-disable at 22:00 daily. Use an enum LOCKED/UNLOCKED and a watchdog.

Message-driven relay: accept external text commands 'on', 'off', 'auto' via a command input channel to set enum Mode. In AUTO, follow a daytime schedule; in MANUAL, obey commands immediately. Include a watchdog and an ERROR state for invalid commands.

Alarm siren control: when alarm input latches, drive siren relay until a reset button is held for 2 s. Provide TEST mode that pulses for 1 s on request. Model with states SAFE, LATCHED, TEST and include a watchdog.

Water valve actuator for garden: open per schedule and close on leak sensor trigger. Manual override switch must take precedence. Ensure valve never remains powered more than 20 s continuously, and include a watchdog.

Whole-home load shedder: monitor two high-load request inputs and a total power estimate; only allow one of two relays ON at a time. If both are requested, alternate 15-minute slots. Provide enum modes NORMAL, FORCE_HEATER, FORCE_CHARGER, and SAFE_SHED. Include a watchdog and guarantee decision loop WCET under 1 ms.

Smoke and heat alarm integration: if smoke OR temperature exceeds 70 C, cut power to HVAC relay and enable alarm relay; require manual reset after triggers clear. Implement SENSOR_FAULT detection (stuck readings) and a 100 ms watchdog service rate.

Multi-room schedule engine: define up to four daily schedules for two relays (living and exterior) with per-day enable masks. Manual overrides temporarily suspend schedules for 60 min. State machine must handle DST changeovers without duplicate events. Include a watchdog.

Green energy optimizer: enable a heater relay only during cheap tariff times and when indoor temperature is below 20 C; pause if estimated load exceeds 2 kW. Implement a state machine with PENDING, ACTIVE, PAUSED, and INHIBITED; ensure transitions are glitch-free and WCET < 1 ms.

Access gate warning light: flash a beacon at 2 Hz when the gate is moving, steady on when open, off when closed. Use limit inputs to determine states and include a fault state if both limits are active. Watchdog and timing accuracy ±5%.

Water softener regeneration scheduler: run a regeneration cycle at 02:00 on selected days, locking a valve relay in a timed sequence of steps (e.g., BACKWASH 10 min, BRINE 30 min, RINSE 10 min). Abort if leak sensor trips. State machine with enum Steps and watchdog.

Redundant watchdog scheme: implement both an internal software watchdog (kicked at 50 Hz) and an external watchdog line toggled at 2 Hz via a heartbeat output, ensuring they stay in phase; on missed kicks, force all relays to a safe OFF state.

Safety interlocked dual-heater control: two heater relays with an overtemp sensor. Maintain 22 C target with staggered duty (prefer Heater A; enable Heater B only if A cannot maintain for 10 min). Enforce max ambient 28 C hard cutoff and a COOL_DOWN state. Include watchdog and sensor plausibility checks.

Elevator lobby light logic: when any of three call buttons are active, turn on lights; if power-save mode is scheduled, dim via a secondary relay for half power. Include emergency override to full power and a fault state if conflicting commands occur. Watchdog and WCET < 0.8 ms.

Aquarium automation: lights on schedule, feeder relay pulse once at 08:00 for 2 s, heater relay controlled to 25 C with 0.3 C hysteresis; if temperature sensor fails, disable heater and flash an alarm LED at 1 Hz. Enum modes NORMAL and MAINTENANCE; include a watchdog.

Design a multi-mode home automation hub for two lighting circuits and one fan: enum modes HOME, AWAY, SLEEP, and VACATION. Each mode enforces different schedules and automation rules (e.g., motion-enabled lighting only in HOME and SLEEP). Provide a top-level state machine coordinating per-output sub-states, a global SAFETY_OFF mode, a 100 ms watchdog service, and specify invariants: never more than one fan speed relay active; relays default OFF on boot; manual override wins within 200 ms.

Create a resilient sprinkler controller with modes OFF, AUTO, RAIN_DELAY, and MANUAL_PER_ZONE for up to four zones. Requirements: deterministic state machine with explicit per-zone timers, rain sensor and pressure sensor fusion to detect dry-run faults, WCET per control cycle < 1 ms, watchdog with 250 ms timeout, startup self-test of all relays (50 ms pulse each), and a fail-safe that closes all valves if any sensor is invalid.

Implement a comprehensive water leak mitigation system controlling three shutoff valves and a sump pump. Modes: NORMAL, LEAK_DETECTED, BYPASS, and TEST. Fuse inputs from multiple leak sensors and a floor tilt sensor to avoid false positives; require two independent confirmations within 500 ms to enter LEAK_DETECTED. Add periodic self-test, a watchdog, and traceable logs via an event counter. All transitions must be bounded; WCET 0.8 ms.

Develop a whole-home schedule and override engine: multiple daily schedules per device (up to five) for three relays, with per-day enable, temporary overrides that expire after a set duration, and a VACATION randomization layer. Provide explicit state machines per device and a coordinator that resolves conflicts. Include a hardware heartbeat output for an external watchdog at 1 Hz, internal watchdog at 20 Hz, and require unit-testable behaviors for edge cases like DST and overlapping events.

Specify a safety-critical boiler room controller for two pumps and one burner relay. Modes: OFF, HEAT_DEMAND, ANTI_FREEZE, and EMERGENCY_SHUTDOWN. Constraints: temperature in Celsius; anti-freeze runs pumps if ambient < 5 C; burner inhibited if any overtemp (>90 C) or low-water switch active; pump alternation weekly; brownout detection enters safe state. Include watchdog, startup self-check of inputs, bounded timers, and a formal list of safety requirements and acceptance tests.

Make a basic lamp controller: a single pushbutton toggles a relay on each short press. Debounce the button and prevent the relay from toggling more than once in 300 ms. Add a simple watchdog timer that must be kicked at least every 250 ms or the system should reset to a safe OFF state.

Implement a bathroom fan timer. When a user presses the fan switch, turn the relay on for 15 minutes, then off. If the switch is pressed again while running, extend the remaining time by another 5 minutes up to a 30 minute cap. Include a minimum off-time of 60 seconds to avoid relay chatter and a watchdog that resets if the timing loop stalls.

Create a hallway night-light rule: turn on a relay when ambient light is below 30 lux and motion is detected, and turn off 45 seconds after the last motion. Ignore motion between 08:00–18:00. Use a small state machine (Idle, Active, Cooldown) and include a watchdog timer that must be serviced every 200 ms.

Design a safety cutoff for a small heater. A toggle switch commands ON/OFF, but the relay must open immediately if temperature exceeds 45 C and remain locked out until temperature falls below 40 C. Include a red fault indicator output that latches on high temp events and clears on a 3-second long-press. Add a watchdog to ensure temperature is checked at least at 10 Hz.

Create a doorbell controller that drives a chime relay for exactly 500 ms on button press, with a 2-second refractory period that ignores repeats. Use a small state machine (Ready, Ringing, Refractory) and ensure the watchdog resets if the state machine isn't ticked within 100 ms.

Implement a staircase light: when motion is detected, turn on the light relay and keep it on for 30 seconds after the last motion. A manual wall switch overrides motion and forces ON while held. Ensure a minimum on-time of 5 seconds and include a watchdog that requires periodic kicks at 20 Hz.

Build a one-shot outlet timer. A button press starts a 10-minute countdown and energizes the relay; pressing again cancels and turns it off. The LED blinks once per second while active. Add a simple watchdog timer that defaults the relay to OFF if not serviced in 300 ms.

Schedule a garden pump to run daily at 06:00 for 10 minutes. Skip the run if a rain sensor indicates wet. Provide a manual trigger button that starts an immediate 5-minute run. Include a watchdog that ensures the scheduler tick executes at least once per second.

Write a small controller that prevents relay chatter: when a control input toggles, apply a 3-second deadband before allowing another toggle, and ensure the relay never switches more than 10 times in any 10-minute window. Include a watchdog that enforces the deadband timer integrity.

Implement a garage light rule: turn the light relay on when the door contact opens, and off 5 minutes after the door contact closes. Provide a manual override switch that forces OFF regardless of door state. Include a watchdog timer that must be stroked by the door state processing task every 100 ms.

Control a window blind with two relays (Up and Down). Never energize both relays simultaneously. Use limit switches to stop movement or a 20-second timeout if a limit is not reached. Implement a state machine (Idle, MovingUp, MovingDown, Fault) and a watchdog that drops both relays if the control loop misses two consecutive 50 ms ticks.

Create a holiday lighting schedule: turn on at local sunset plus 30 minutes and off at 23:00. If the schedule time is missed due to a reboot, evaluate and set the correct relay state on startup. Include a watchdog to ensure the daily schedule computation occurs at least once every 24 hours.

Implement a simple fan controller with enum modes Off, Low, High using two relays (Low uses relay A, High uses A+B). A button cycles through the modes. Enforce that switching between modes includes a 1-second all-off gap to protect contacts. Add a watchdog to ensure mode updates occur at 20 Hz.

Make a smart plug that powers down if no motion is detected in the room for 60 minutes. Provide a short-press to toggle and a long-press (3 seconds) to arm/disarm the auto-off feature. Add a watchdog that reverts to OFF after a missed 500 ms heartbeat.

Create a humidity-based bathroom fan rule: if humidity rises above 65% RH, turn on the fan relay and keep it on until humidity falls below 55% RH or 20 minutes have elapsed, whichever is later. Include a state machine and a watchdog to ensure humidity sampling at 5 Hz.

Build a thermostat fan controller with enum modes Auto and On. In Auto, run the fan relay when temperature exceeds 26 C and stop when below 24 C. Allow a manual override to On that ignores temperature. Use a state machine with explicit transitions and a watchdog to guarantee a 10 Hz control rate.

Implement load shedding for two heavy appliances: if total current exceeds 12 A, drop the lower-priority relay first and restore it only after current stays below 10 A for 60 seconds. Use enum modes Normal and Shed, a clear state machine, and a watchdog that trips to Safe mode if current isn't read within 200 ms.

Create a home presence lighting system with enum modes Home, Away, Night. In Away, randomly toggle two light relays within 18:00–23:00 at intervals of 10–30 minutes. In Night, ensure porch light is on from sunset to sunrise. Include a supervisor watchdog to reset to Home with all relays OFF if a timing task stalls.

Sequence a 4-zone irrigation controller: run one zone at a time, each for its programmed duration, with a 30-second pause between zones. Skip watering if a rain sensor is active. Use a zone state machine and include a watchdog that forces all relays off if the main loop misses two 100 ms ticks.

Implement a stairwell lighting control with two switches (top and bottom). Either switch toggles the light relay, but ensure a quiet-hours window (23:00–06:00) where motion triggers are ignored unless ambient light is below 20 lux. Include a watchdog and an event-driven state machine.

Create a curtain controller with states Up, Down, Stall, and Fault. Use current sensing to detect end-of-travel if limit switches fail, and stop after 25 seconds maximum. Provide a manual stop button. Add a watchdog timer that requires periodic servicing every 50 ms; if missed, drop all outputs.

Design a pet feeder scheduler: actuate a motor relay for 3 seconds at 07:30 and 18:30. If a jam is detected by overcurrent, retry up to two times with 5-second backoff, then raise a fault indicator. Use a state machine and a watchdog to ensure retries occur on schedule.

Create a laundry reminder: when a vibration sensor indicates the washer is running, turn on a status relay. When vibration stops for 5 minutes, pulse a buzzer relay for 1 second, three times, at 2-second intervals. Include a watchdog that checks the vibration sensor at 10 Hz.

Implement a fan controller with enum modes Off, Auto, Boost. Auto turns on above 25 C with 1 C hysteresis; Boost is a 10-minute high-speed override then returns to Auto. Add an overtemperature cutoff at 60 C that forces Off. Use a state machine and a 100 ms watchdog.

Develop a smart hallway controller: if motion occurs and ambient light < 50 lux, turn on the light for 90 seconds; within 00:00–05:00, limit on-time to 30 seconds. Add a Snooze state that ignores re-triggers for 10 seconds after turning off. Use a watchdog requiring a 20 Hz tick.

Create a sump pump safeguard. A float switch starts the pump relay; enforce a minimum off-time of 15 seconds between runs. If the pump cycles more than 10 times in an hour, activate an alarm relay. Include a watchdog that forces pump off on missed 100 ms deadlines.

Control greenhouse vents: two relays for Open and Close with interlock. Open when temperature > 28 C, close when < 22 C. Provide a manual enum mode Manual/Auto and respect endstop switches or a 20-second timeout. Add a watchdog that drops both relays on any control loop overrun.

Create a vacation scheduler for two relays with weekly programs. Log any missed events due to power loss and execute the current correct state at boot. Enforce an energy budget: skip low-priority events if accumulated ON time exceeds 3 hours per day. Include a watchdog to supervise the scheduler.

Implement a humidifier controller targeting 45% RH with 5% hysteresis. Lock out the relay if a window contact is open. Limit continuous run time to 2 hours, then force a 10-minute cooldown. Use a state machine and a watchdog that ensures sensor reads at 5 Hz.

Build an air purifier run-time tracker: energize the relay on command and accumulate hours of operation; after 500 hours, activate a service indicator relay. Provide a 5-second long-press to reset the counter. Include a watchdog that guarantees the hour counter increments are not skipped.

Control an electric door strike: when an authorized input is asserted, energize the strike relay for 750 ms. If the door remains open more than 30 seconds after actuation, pulse an alarm relay. Use a state machine and add a watchdog that forces strike OFF on any tick overrun.

Schedule a pool pump to run daily with a programmable duration and include a Backwash mode that runs a different relay for 3 minutes. Use a pressure sensor to prevent running dry; if low pressure is detected for 10 seconds, stop and raise a fault until manually cleared. Add a watchdog for the 10 Hz sampling loop.

Create master-aux smart outlets: when the master outlet relay turns on, turn on the aux outlet after a 2-second delay; when the master turns off, turn off the aux immediately. If undervoltage is detected, turn both off and enter a brownout state until voltage is normal for 5 seconds. Include a watchdog.

Implement sunset/sunrise lighting: compute civil sunset daily and turn on a relay at sunset minus 10 minutes; turn off at 22:30. Allow a user-configurable offset in minutes. If time service is lost, fall back to fixed times. Watchdog the daily computation and the 1 Hz scheduler.

Design a sauna heater controller with interlocks: only energize if the door contact is closed and a user timer is set. Auto-off after 45 minutes. If overtemperature > 90 C, cut power and latch a fault that requires a reset button. Implement a state machine and a watchdog that must be kicked every 100 ms.

Create a demand response controller with enum modes Normal, Shed, Critical. Shed lower-priority relays when total power exceeds a threshold and restore them with 30-second spacing once power is normal. Require a control loop rate of 20 Hz with WCET 2 ms. Include a hardware watchdog feed task and a safe fallback state.

Implement a dual sump system: alternate Pump A and Pump B on each cycle. If current sensing shows a pump did not start, fail over to the other and raise an alarm relay. Run a weekly 10:00 self-test by briefly energizing each pump. Use a robust state machine and watchdog supervision.

Coordinate greenhouse heater and vent relays: heat when below 18 C, ventilate when above 26 C, and never run both. Add FrostProtect mode that keeps at least 5 C overnight. Enforce 2-minute minimum dwell times to protect hardware. Implement a state machine and a 50 ms watchdog.

Create a fire-safe exhaust controller. When smoke is detected, turn on all exhaust fan relays and force off any heater relays; latch in Alarm until manually reset. Enter Fault if the smoke sensor is missing at boot. Sensor sampling rate 10 Hz, alarm actuation within 100 ms, WCET 5 ms. Use a watchdog and explicit fail-safes.

Implement multiroom lighting scenes with enum Scene Off, Evening, Reading, Nightlight controlling a set of light relays. Apply staggered on delays (100 ms between relays) to limit inrush. Allow a schedule to select scenes by time of day and a manual override that times out after 60 minutes. Supervise with a watchdog.

Design lobby lighting with levels: Idle -> Low -> High based on presence and time. Low uses one relay bank; High uses both. Degrade to Low if sensors fault. Ensure average relay duty does not exceed 80% per hour to limit heating. Include a state machine and watchdog monitoring for missed ticks.

Build an aquarium automation: schedule light and pump relays; inhibit feeding relay during 22:00–06:00; if water temperature exceeds 30 C, cut lights until below 28 C. Limit feeder activations to 4 per day. Implement a state machine and watchdog for the 2 Hz schedule executor.

Create a safety interlock for a kitchen range hood: if CO level exceeds 50 ppm, force the exhaust fan relay on and turn the gas valve relay off; latch an alarm that requires manual reset. Sample sensors at 10 Hz, actuate within 100 ms. Use a watchdog and default to safe outputs on reset.

Implement a transfer switch controller for a backup generator. State machine with Idle, Test, Transfer, Return. Enforce break-before-make timing between mains and generator relays, warm-up for 10 s before transfer, and cool-down for 30 s before return. Add watchdog supervision and safety invariants.

Control a group of rolling shutters with schedule and wind protection. Provide group and individual enum modes. On high wind, stop and disable movement until cleared. Ensure up/down relays are never driven together and apply per-shutter movement timeouts. Require a main loop WCET of 4 ms and a watchdog.

Create a home energy orchestrator with enum modes Eco, Comfort, Away, Storm. Manage 8 relays (HVAC, water heater, EV charger, dehumidifier, lights, pump, blinds, exhaust) using priorities and schedules. Include brownout detection and automatic shedding/restore, strict interlocks (no blinds movement during wind alarm), per-subsystem state machines, a supervising watchdog, main loop at 50 Hz and scheduler at 1 Hz with documented WCET budgets.

Develop a comprehensive sprinkler system: 8 zones, rain sensor and soil moisture input, weekly programs, manual mode, and seasonal adjustment. Only one zone may run at a time, with pressure fault detection and retry policy. Include a watchdog, a diagnostic mode, and enforce pump duty limits (max 20 min on, then at least 10 min off). Provide test cases for schedules, fault injection, and power-loss recovery.

Specify a whole-house safety controller with enum modes Normal, Alarm, Silence, Service. Coordinate sensors (smoke, CO, water leak, door) with relays for siren, gas valve, water main, and fans. Meet timing constraints: sensor scan 20 Hz, alarm actuation within 100 ms, WCET 3 ms. Include watchdog, failsafe defaults, a formal state machine, and acceptance tests for all mode transitions.

Create a lobby scheduler with multi-mode Weekday, Weekend, Holiday to control lighting, signage, and door lock relays by calendar and occupancy. Include curfew overrides and an emergency unlock. Provide a full timing plan, corner-case handling for DST and leap year, watchdog supervision, and test procedures covering schedule edges.

Design a resilient garage controller managing door motor relays, a light relay, and a lock. Modes Auto, Manual, Maintenance. Enforce interlocks with limit switches, detect jams via overcurrent and timeout, and include a heartbeat between motor logic and a supervisor. Require control loop 100 Hz, WCET 1 ms, watchdog monitoring, and detailed validation tests for brownouts and sensor faults.

Please implement a simple toggle: when the pushbutton is pressed, toggle the power relay. Debounce 50 ms. Add a one-shot auto-off after 2 hours. Use a minimal two-state machine (ON/OFF) and a watchdog that turns the relay OFF if the control loop stalls for more than 1 second.

Make a timer switch: a single press turns the relay ON for 10 minutes then OFF. Ignore presses while active. Include an enum for modes IDLE and TIMING and a watchdog that defaults the relay to OFF on timeout.

Create a night-light relay that turns ON if ambient light falls below 100 lux and turns OFF above 150 lux (hysteresis). Single light sensor input, single relay output. Include a simple state machine and a 2 s sample rate with WCET under 2 ms.
Implement a safety cutout: when current exceeds 8 A for more than 200 ms, open the relay; otherwise keep it closed. Single current sensor input. Use a watchdog that defaults to open on fault.

Build a delayed-on switch: when the button is held for 1 second, close the relay; release immediately opens it. Debounce 30 ms. Include states WAIT and ON, and a watchdog that forces OFF after 4 hours continuous ON.

Create a stairway timer: pressing the switch starts a 90-second countdown and energizes the relay. Each rapid double-press extends the timer by 30 seconds. Keep it single relay output; no other I/O. Watchdog should fail-safe to OFF.
Implement a pulse output: every time the button is pressed, drive the relay ON for exactly 250 ms then OFF, regardless of button hold duration. Debounce 20 ms. Include a simple state machine.

Make a quiet mode: if sound level exceeds 70 dB, turn OFF a relay for 10 minutes; otherwise keep it ON. Single microphone level input, single relay output. Include hysteresis and a watchdog that ensures ON after a clean restart.
Design a dawn switch: turn the relay ON at 06:30 and OFF at 08:00 daily. No other inputs. Include a schedule and a watchdog that recovers gracefully after a clock reset.

Create a vacation blinker: randomly turn a lamp relay ON for 10–30 minutes between 18:00 and 23:00. Single relay output. Use a deterministic pseudo-random seed on boot and a watchdog to force OFF on fault.
Build a garage fan switch: relay turns ON when temperature exceeds 28 °C and OFF below 25 °C. Single temperature sensor input. Include a 3-minute minimum ON time to avoid cycling and a watchdog.
Implement a moisture guard: if humidity goes above 80 %, turn ON a dehumidifier relay; turn OFF below 60 %. Single humidity input. Include a state machine and a 1 Hz loop with WCET < 1 ms.
Make a timer outlet: a long-press (>800 ms) of the button turns ON the relay for 45 minutes, short press cancels. Debounce 40 ms. Watchdog must default the relay to OFF.
Provide a breather relay: every hour, run the fan relay for 5 minutes. Simple schedule, no inputs. Include missed-tick compensation and a watchdog that clears the schedule on fault.
Create a tap-to-toggle lamp: single tactile switch toggles a relay with 200 ms debounce; ignore presses faster than 3 per second to prevent chatter. Include a two-state machine and a watchdog.

Design a porch light controller with three enum modes: AUTO, ON, OFF. AUTO turns the relay ON when motion is detected and ambient light < 50 lux, for 2 minutes; retrigger extends. Mode changes via a mode button. Implement a clear state machine and a watchdog that forces OFF on timeout.

Please implement a fan controller with modes LOW, HIGH, and OFF, selected by two buttons. The relay bank drives either low-speed contact or high-speed contact, never both (interlock). Add overcurrent protection and a 5 s cooldown state before switching speeds. Include a watchdog.

Create a laundry reminder: when the washer vibration sensor indicates activity, start a 2-hour inhibit period where the smart plug stays ON; after inactivity for 10 minutes, switch OFF. Provide a manual override button and a state machine with states IDLE, RUNNING, COOLDOWN.

Implement a garden pump control: pump relay turns ON when soil moisture < 30 % and a tank level switch indicates water present; turns OFF when moisture > 45 % or tank empty. Add a daily lockout window 12:00–16:00. Use enum modes AUTO and MANUAL and a watchdog.

Write a scheduler for a heater with a weekly program: different ON/OFF periods per day. Include a HOLIDAY mode that keeps it OFF regardless of schedule until midnight on the end date. Watchdog should default to OFF.

Build a bedroom light with soft sleep mode: enum modes NORMAL, NIGHTLIGHT, and DARK. Motion at night only triggers NIGHTLIGHT for 5 minutes if ambient < 30 lux. Manual toggle overrides for 15 minutes. Implement as a state machine; include a watchdog.

Create a bathroom fan controller: turn on the fan relay when humidity rises 10 % above a moving baseline, or when the light switch is on; turn off when humidity returns to baseline and light is off for 5 minutes. Add anti-stall: if the fan has been ON for 45 minutes, force OFF and lockout for 10 minutes. Watchdog required.

Implement a garage door courtesy light: open/close sensor starts a 3-minute light timer. If motion is detected, extend by 2 minutes, up to 10 minutes max. Provide manual OFF via button. Use explicit states and a watchdog.

Design a child-safe outlet: master switch enables the outlet; tamper switch immediately cuts power if opened. Include a timed unlock window: after entering a 4-digit sequence on a keypad input, allow ON for 30 minutes. Provide a watchdog that re-locks on timeout.

Please create an irrigation valve sequencer for two zones sharing a single water source: never allow both relays ON simultaneously. Each zone runs for its scheduled duration if soil moisture is below threshold. Add a purge state of 5 seconds between zones. Include a watchdog.

Make a sunrise alarm: starting at a scheduled time, step a lamp through brightness levels via three relays (LOW/MED/HIGH) over 20 minutes. Provide an OFF button that cancels. Ensure mutually exclusive relays and a watchdog.

Implement an away-mode simulator that alternates two lamp relays according to a randomized but repeatable pattern between 19:00 and 23:00, with no relay changing more frequently than once every 3 minutes. Add a watchdog and a state machine.

Create a hot water recirculation controller: if a proximity sensor near the faucet is triggered between 06:00 and 09:00 or 17:00 and 22:00, run pump relay for 3 minutes; inhibit for 10 minutes afterward. Manual ON button runs for 5 minutes. Watchdog should fail-safe to OFF.

Design a freezer power guard: maintain power unless temperature rises above −10 °C for over 5 minutes (alarm) or above −5 °C (cut power and retry after 15 minutes). Provide door-ajar input to suppress retries while open. Include a watchdog and a state machine.

Build a pet feeder outlet: enable relay at scheduled times; require lid-closed sensor before energizing; if lid opens during feed, cut power immediately. Add a missed-feed recovery that tries once after 2 minutes. Watchdog must cut power on timeout.

Implement a scene controller with enum modes MORNING, DAY, EVENING, and SLEEP, selected by a schedule and a manual button. Each mode drives two relays in different combinations. Transitions should be debounced to avoid rapid toggling. Include a watchdog.

Create a window fan controller: if outdoor temperature is at least 2 °C cooler than indoor temperature, turn fan ON; otherwise OFF. Inputs: two temperature sensors. Add a minimum run time of 7 minutes and a 3-minute post-off lockout. Include a watchdog.

Please program a pool pump timer with a weekly schedule and an ENERGY_SAVER mode that splits runtime into two shorter blocks during off-peak hours. Manual override button toggles ON for 60 minutes. Use a state machine and a watchdog.

Design a hallway lighting rule: when motion is detected after 22:00, turn ON relay for 90 seconds at LOW brightness via a dimmer enable relay; before 22:00, use HIGH brightness relay. Include a child-sleep QUIET mode that disables motion triggers. Watchdog required.

Implement a greenhouse vent controller: two relays drive OPEN and CLOSE actuators; never energize both. If temperature > 30 °C, OPEN; if < 24 °C, CLOSE. Include limit switch inputs to stop when reached and a 20 s safety timeout per move. Watchdog fail-safe to stop.

Implement a thermostat for radiant floor heating using time-proportioning control of a heater relay. Use a PID to compute a 10-minute window duty cycle based on room temperature (°C) and setpoint, with anti-windup. Enforce maximum relay switching no faster than once per 20 seconds. Safety: overtemp cutout at 35 °C, and watchdog fails OFF. Run control loop at 1 Hz with WCET < 2 ms.

Create a smart exhaust fan that fuses humidity rate-of-change and VOC sensor readings to decide when to turn ON. Use a simple sensor fusion approach that flags air stale if VOC above threshold or humidity rising >2 %/min while above 60 %. Add a state machine with BOOST mode lasting 15 minutes then reverting. Include a watchdog and noise rejection.

Design a water heater controller with enum modes ECO, NORMAL, and BOOST. Use PID to maintain outlet temperature at setpoint with a solid-state relay duty cycle; limit duty to 70 % in ECO. Requirements: thermal runaway protection via second sensor, relay stuck-ON detection, and a watchdog that trips to SAFE_OFF. Control period 500 ms, WCET ≤ 1 ms.

Program a whole-house fan controller that uses sensor fusion of indoor temperature, outdoor temperature, and door/window contacts. Only run when indoor > 26 °C, outdoor at least 3 °C cooler, and two windows are open. Use a ramp state to pre-spin for 10 seconds before full ON. Provide COOLDOWN after OFF for 60 seconds. Watchdog included.

Implement a sump pump supervisor controlling a pump relay from two float switches (LOW, HIGH). Use a four-state machine: IDLE, PUMPING, ALARM, LOCKOUT. Detect short-cycling and lockout if more than 6 cycles in 10 minutes. Safety: if HIGH float is stuck, alarm and inhibit after 5 minutes continuous run. Watchdog to force OFF on timeout.

Create a boiler circulation control with PID on differential temperature between supply and return sensors, modulating a pump relay via burst-fire (time-proportioned) with a 30 s window. Safety: do not exceed 45 % duty when return < 20 °C. Run at 2 Hz, WCET < 1.5 ms, watchdog required.

Design a greenhouse misting controller using sensor fusion of humidity and leaf-wetness sensors. Misting relay cycles using PID to maintain 70 % RH while preventing leaf wetness above threshold. Enforce a minimum 3-minute dry period between mist cycles. Watchdog and fail-safe OFF.

Implement a smart de-icing outlet that uses temperature and precipitation sensor fusion to decide activation. If temperature is between −10 °C and +3 °C and precipitation is detected, run with a PID-based duty cycle capped at 80 %. Safety: GFCI trip input immediately disables. Loop at 5 Hz, WCET ≤ 0.8 ms, watchdog.

Build a freezer defrost scheduler that uses compressor run-time and door-open events to estimate frost load (sensor fusion). Trigger a defrost relay for 12 minutes when estimated load exceeds a threshold, but skip if product temperature rises above −12 °C. Include a recovery state and a watchdog.

Develop a water softener regeneration controller: schedule regeneration at 02:00 based on estimated water usage from a flow sensor. Provide states: READY, REGENERATE, RINSE, and ERROR. Safety: interlock a brine valve and main valve relays, enforce step timeouts, and include a watchdog that forces valves closed on fault.

Specify a whole-home mode manager that orchestrates relays for lighting and outlets across modes HOME, AWAY, SLEEP, and VACATION. Each mode enforces different schedules and motion responses. Include a robust hierarchical state machine, a heartbeat and watchdog, and a test harness that simulates 48 hours of mode transitions and verifies no relay toggles faster than once per 2 seconds.

Design a safety-critical dual-relay heater controller with modes DISABLED, STANDBY, HEAT, and FAULT. Both a main and a safety relay must be closed to energize; either opens to de-energize. Include periodic self-test of relay consistency, stuck contact detection, and a watchdog that forces both relays open. Provide timing requirements: 10 Hz control rate, WCET ≤ 1 ms.

Create a multi-zone lighting scheduler for four rooms, each with its own enum mode (AUTO, MANUAL, OFF). AUTO uses motion and ambient light; MANUAL follows a per-room schedule. Prevent more than two relays switching in the same 50 ms window to limit inrush. Include a central watchdog and logging hooks for unit tests.

Produce a load-shedding controller for a smart home: manage up to six appliance relays with priorities and modes NORMAL, PEAK, and EMERGENCY. Shed lower-priority loads when total current exceeds thresholds, with hysteresis. Provide a comprehensive state machine, per-channel minimum ON/OFF times, WCET < 2 ms at 20 Hz, and a watchdog. Include acceptance criteria for simulation.

Develop an advanced irrigation master with modes RAIN_DELAY, WATERING, IDLE, and FAULT, coordinating up to four zone relays with interlocks and pump control. Integrate sensor fusion of soil moisture, rain sensor, and forecast input. Include a watchdog, schedule adherence checks, and a built-in diagnostics mode that runs self-tests on each relay and input with clear pass/fail outcomes.
Turn on a light relay while a momentary switch is pressed, and turn it off when released. Apply 30 ms debounce on the switch input to avoid chatter.
Toggle a power relay on each distinct button press. Drive a status LED to mirror the relay state. Ignore bouncing by requiring a clean 40 ms stable press.
Make a 'press-for-timer' outlet: one press turns the relay on for exactly 5 minutes then off; a second press during the countdown cancels and turns it off immediately.
Daily schedule: turn the relay on at 06:30 and off at 22:00 local time. A manual override button toggles the relay, but the schedule resumes authority at the next scheduled boundary.
Activate a hallway light for 30 seconds when motion is detected. Retriggering extends the timer. Only run this rule between 20:00 and 06:00.

Control a bathroom fan: turn the relay on when humidity exceeds 60% RH, and turn it off when it falls below 55% RH. Sample humidity every 1 s. If sensor data is stale for >5 s, fail safe to relay OFF.
Support two separate wall switches controlling the same relay: any rising edge toggles the relay. Debounce both inputs and enforce at least 100 ms between toggles to prevent races.
Make a hold-to-activate relay: the output stays ON while any of two pushbuttons are held; it turns OFF when both are released. Debounce each input by 25 ms.
On power-up, keep the relay OFF by default and inhibit any automatic turn-on for the first 2 seconds.
Add a simple watchdog: if the main loop fails to run within 300 ms, immediately force the relay OFF. Reset the watchdog every control cycle.
Implement a delayed turn-on: when the button is pressed, start a 3 s delay, then energize the relay; pressing again at any time turns the relay off immediately.
Require a double-tap within 400 ms to toggle the relay. Single taps do nothing. This prevents accidental toggles.
Door-activated lamp: when the door opens, turn the relay ON instantly; when it closes, wait 1 s before turning it OFF to avoid flicker.
Use a long-press gesture: holding the button for at least 1.0 s toggles the relay. Short presses are ignored. Include input debouncing.
Temperature safety interlock: if ambient temperature exceeds 70 C, immediately force the relay OFF and lock it out until temperature falls below 60 C.

Create an enum Mode { OFF, AUTO, MANUAL } with a mode button. In AUTO, follow two time windows (06:00–08:00 and 17:00–22:00) to keep the relay ON; in MANUAL, the button toggles the relay; in OFF, the relay always stays OFF. Implement the logic as a state machine with a 200 ms watchdog that fails safe to OFF.

Stairwell lighting: either of two motion sensors can turn the light relay ON for 90 s. In daylight (ambient > 200 lux), motion is ignored. Debounce all inputs and fail safe to OFF if the light sensor is stale > 10 s.

Frost-protection heater: maintain at least 5 C using a thermostat input. In an enum HeatMode { DISABLED, AUTO }, AUTO uses hysteresis (ON at <=4 C, OFF at >=6 C). Enforce a minimum 5 min OFF time between activations. Include a 500 ms watchdog.

Home/Away mode via a boolean flag: in AWAY, randomly cycle a lamp relay between 18:00 and 22:00 with ON durations 10–20 minutes and OFF durations 5–15 minutes; in HOME, the local button toggles normally. Use a deterministic pseudo-random sequence seeded from a configuration value.

Bathroom fan boost: if humidity rises by more than 5% RH over any 2-minute window, run the fan for 10 minutes. A 'BOOST' button also starts a 10-minute run. During night hours (23:00–06:00), limit boost runs to 5 minutes. Watchdog 250 ms.
Garage light rule: door open turns the light ON; when the door closes, keep it ON for 2 minutes more. A manual toggle extends the timeout to 10 minutes. Avoid timer wrap-around edge cases.

Interlock two relays so they are never ON at the same time. If both are requested, Relay A has priority and Relay B must be forced OFF. Implement prioritization as a small state machine and drop both to OFF on any error. Include a watchdog.

Irrigation zone scheduler: run Zone 1 relay for 12 minutes starting at 05:00 on Tue/Thu/Sat. Skip the run if a rain sensor is wet. A manual button starts an immediate 12-minute cycle. Always force the relay OFF on fault or watchdog expiry.

Two-stage heater using two relays for LOW/HIGH power. Create enum Power { OFF, LOW, HIGH }, with mutual exclusion and safe transitions: OFF->LOW->HIGH and reverse. Enforce at least 2 minutes between LOW and HIGH changes.

Occupancy lighting: combine motion and door sensors. Turn light ON on motion. If a door closes and no motion occurs for 30 s, turn OFF; otherwise, turn OFF 2 minutes after last motion. Implement as a state machine and reset to OFF on watchdog timeout.

Electronic strike: when a 'valid code' input pulses, energize the lock relay for 500 ms to unlock, then de-energize. If the door remains open more than 30 s, pulse a buzzer relay for 1 s and re-lock. Always fail safe to locked (relay OFF).

Night energy saver: between 22:00 and 06:00, limit a heater outlet to a maximum 50% duty in any rolling 10-minute window. Use a scheduler and a sliding window counter. Ensure output changes are spaced at least 15 s apart. Watchdog 300 ms.

Water heater modes: enum { ECO, NORMAL, BOOST }. ECO allows ON only 02:00–05:00; NORMAL allows ON 02:00–06:00; BOOST forces ON for 30 minutes then returns to the previous mode. Enforce a 10-minute minimum OFF time to avoid short cycling.

Workday schedule: keep a relay ON on weekdays from 08:00 to 17:00 and OFF otherwise. A manual override button forces the opposite state for 1 hour, after which the schedule resumes. Include a 250 ms watchdog.

Multi-function wall switch: single press toggles Relay 1, double press toggles Relay 2, long press (>=1.5 s) toggles both. Implement robust debouncing and gesture recognition, and ensure at least 200 ms between any output transitions.

Window blind controller using two relays (UP/DOWN) with strict interlock. Long press moves until a limit sensor is reached; short press stops. At 21:00, auto-close if not already closed. On any fault, both relays must be OFF and latched until a reset.

Ventilation control: if CO2 exceeds 1000 ppm for 5 minutes, turn the fan relay ON; turn it OFF after CO2 stays below 800 ppm for 3 minutes. Sample at 1 Hz. If sensor data is stale for >5 s, default to OFF. Include a 300 ms watchdog.
Safety timer: if a relay has been ON continuously for more than 8 hours, force it OFF and record a fault flag. A manual button clears the flag and restores normal operation. Watchdog 200 ms.

Occupancy modes enum { HOME, AWAY, SLEEP }. In AWAY, disable manual toggles and force all relays OFF. In SLEEP (22:00–06:00), motion may turn on only the nightlight relay for 2 minutes. Enforce transitions via a state machine and watchdog.

Design a central lighting automation manager as a hierarchical state machine with enum modes { NORMAL, PARTY, QUIET_HOURS, EMERGENCY }. Coordinate multiple relays with schedules, manual overrides, and conflict resolution. Specify a windowed watchdog (feed only between 20 ms and 150 ms after each 100 ms cycle), WCET <= 5 ms, and include a concise acceptance test plan covering mode transitions, schedule edges, and watchdog failure handling.

Implement multi-tap timing: single, double, and triple taps select timers of 5, 15, and 30 minutes for a smart outlet. The pattern timeout is 600 ms. State machine required for tap detection and timer management.

HVAC relay controller with enum Mode { OFF, HEAT, COOL, AUTO } and a FAN relay. Use a PID controller at 10 Hz to maintain a temperature setpoint in Celsius in HEAT and COOL, but enforce minimum ON/OFF durations (>=180 s between compressor-like starts, >=60 s minimum run). Implement anti-windup, WCET <= 5 ms, and a 200 ms watchdog that drops all relays to safe OFF on expiry.

Water heater relay using time-proportioned PID control over a 10-minute window to regulate tank temperature. Hard safety cutoff at 70 C and rate-of-rise limit of 2 C/min. On any sensor fault, force OFF and latch until reset. Watchdog period 100 ms.

Occupancy sensor fusion: maintain a probability estimate using motion, door, and sound level inputs. If probability > 0.6, keep lights ON; otherwise turn them OFF 2 minutes after dropping below threshold. Run at 5 Hz with WCET <= 4 ms. If an overrun or stale sensor is detected, fail safe to OFF and reset filters.

Load shedding for a home: when total power draw exceeds 1800 W, turn OFF lower-priority relays based on an enum Priority. Restore loads when power falls below 1500 W for 2 minutes. Rate-limit toggles to at most one change per relay per minute. Watchdog 150 ms; stale power data (>3 s) cancels shedding and restores baseline.

Smart irrigation with sensor fusion: combine two soil moisture sensors and a rain forecast score to decide whether to run the scheduled 10-minute watering at 05:30. Require agreement or a majority vote. Lock out watering for 24 hours after rainfall is detected. Implement as a state machine and include a 200 ms watchdog.

Three-zone radiant heating: each zone calls for heat using PID control to track its Celsius setpoint at 2 Hz. A pump relay runs whenever any zone demands heat. Enforce a maximum duty cycle of 70% per rolling hour per zone and a minimum 3-minute OFF time. Fail safe to all OFF on any sensor error.

Balanced ventilation with two interlocked relays (INTAKE/EXHAUST). Maintain CO2 between 600–900 ppm using integral control with slow adjustment. Add a 'PURGE' state that runs both cycles sequentially for 10 minutes. Include schedule rules for sunrise activation, WCET <= 3 ms, and a 120 ms watchdog.

Daylight-aware scene selection: fuse ambient lux and occupancy to choose enum Scene { DAY, EVENING, NIGHT }. Control relay groups accordingly and prevent chattering with hysteresis and minimum dwell times. Ensure transitions are glitch-free and provide a safe default if any sensor is stale.

Security state machine with modes { DISARMED, ARMED_HOME, ARMED_AWAY, ALARM }. Use door and motion sensors; on ALARM, activate a siren relay for 10 minutes and flash a light relay at 2 Hz. Provide entry/exit delays (30 s) and a 100 ms watchdog with safe fallback to DISARMED on persistent faults.

Tariff-aware water heater: read an hourly energy price input and preheat when price < 0.12 per kWh. Maintain 48–52 C using hysteresis. Enforce at most 2 starts per hour and a minimum 20-minute run when ON. Watchdog 200 ms and sensor-stale failsafe to OFF.

Design a whole-home automation core with multi-mode enum { HOME, AWAY, SLEEP, VACATION } coordinating lights, outlets, and fans across multiple relays. Specify detailed safety requirements (all relays default OFF on boot, interlocks respected, stale sensors force safe state), a windowed watchdog (feed allowed only in a 50–150 ms window each 200 ms cycle), WCET <= 5 ms, and a comprehensive test plan including unit tests for state transitions, schedule conflicts, and watchdog fault injection.

Build a smart load controller for up to 8 relays with priorities, schedules, and emergency overrides. Use a hierarchical state machine that arbitrates MANUAL vs SCHEDULE vs EMERGENCY. Include startup self-tests, configuration CRC verification, monotonic time checks, a 100 ms watchdog, and verification criteria for timing determinism and edge-case schedules (DST changes, month-end).

Integrate heating, dehumidifier, and ventilation with coordinated interlocks. Use PID on temperature and humidity setpoints, plus schedule windows. Enforce no-conflict rules (e.g., do not heat and dehumidify simultaneously), maximum starts per hour, and safe shutdown on any sensor fault. Provide WCET <= 4 ms, a 120 ms watchdog, and an acceptance test matrix covering mode combinations and fault cases.

Develop a safety-focused pool pump and heater scheduler. Only allow the heater relay when a flow sensor indicates circulation; shut both off immediately if flow is lost. Provide daily schedules, a 'super-clean' boost that runs the pump for 60 minutes, minimum 5-minute delays between heater starts, WCET <= 2 ms, a 100 ms watchdog, and exhaustive tests for boundary times and power-loss recovery.

Create a simple smart relay controlled by a single pushbutton: 50 ms debounce, LED mirrors the relay state, default Off on boot. Use a two-state machine (Off/On). Include a watchdog that forces Off if the control loop misses updates for 500 ms.
Implement a staircase light timer: pressing the wall switch turns the relay on for 90 seconds, then off automatically. A press during the countdown cancels and turns it off immediately.

Nightlight schedule: turn a lamp relay on daily at 18:30 and off at 23:00. Add a manual override button that toggles the relay but yields back to the next scheduled event. Use an enum for modes: Auto and Manual.

Control a bathroom fan using humidity: turn on when humidity > 60% RH, turn off when it drops below 55% RH (hysteresis). Run at 1 Hz. If the sensor read fails, enter SensorFault and force the relay Off as a safe state.
Doorbell controller: on button press, energize the chime relay for exactly 1.0 s regardless of press length. Ignore further presses while active.
Build a latching outlet: each press of a toggle switch alternates the relay between On and Off. Persist the last state so it restores correctly after a restart.
At 07:00 every day, pulse a lamp relay on/off with 1 s on and 1 s off for 2 minutes (wake-up alert). Ignore any button input during the pulse session.
Garage light aid: when the door sensor goes Open, turn the light On immediately. When it closes, keep the light On for 30 seconds, then turn Off.

Add a software watchdog to a heater relay: the main loop must service it at least every 200 ms. If it ever expires, force the heater relay Off and leave it Off until a button acknowledgment is pressed.
Press-and-hold control: only turn the outlet On if the user holds the button continuously for 2.0 seconds; releasing the button turns it Off immediately.
Vacation light blinker: between 19:00 and 22:00, randomly toggle a lamp with On durations 10–60 s and Off durations 5–30 s. Outside that window, ensure the lamp stays Off.
Simple timer outlet: pressing the button starts a 15-minute countdown and powers the outlet during that time. Pressing again restarts the 15 minutes.
Use an enum Mode with values Off and On. A pushbutton toggles Mode, and the relay state exactly matches Mode. Handle contact bounce deterministically so only a single toggle occurs per press.
Two-position switch mapping: position A maps to relay Off, position B to relay On. Ignore switch transitions shorter than 20 ms to prevent flicker.
Create a weekly pump schedule: run the pump every day at 06:00 for 5 minutes. A Stop button cancels the current run. Use a simple Idle/Running state machine.

Porch light automation combining motion and schedule: only act between sunset and 23:30. On motion, turn light On for 2 minutes (retriggerable). A wall switch engages Manual mode for 30 minutes. Enum modes: Auto, Manual, Off. Default to Auto on restart. Watchdog must fail safe to Off.

Control a three-speed ceiling fan using two interlocked relays. Buttons SpeedUp and SpeedDown navigate states Off → Low → High and back. Enforce a 500 ms dead-time between any relay change to avoid overlap. Indicate current speed via an LED.
Laundry room light: door opens → light On. If no motion is detected for 10 minutes, turn Off even if the door remains open. Any motion resets the timer. Implement an occupancy state machine.

Irrigation sequencing: at 05:00, run Zone1 for 7 minutes then Zone2 for 10 minutes using two relays. If the rain sensor is Wet, skip both. A Start button triggers today's sequence immediately. A Stop button halts all zones.

Heated towel rail control: maintain 35–40 °C using simple hysteresis. Active periods: 06:30–08:30 and 19:00–21:00. A Boost button runs for 30 minutes regardless of schedule. On sensor fault, enter a safe Off state.

Garage heater with Away/Comfort modes: Away setpoint 10 °C, Comfort 18 °C. Occupancy input toggles modes. Limit any continuous On time to 45 minutes followed by a 15-minute cooldown. If the watchdog expires, force Off.

Smart outlet with overcurrent protection: if current exceeds 8.0 A for more than 3 s, open the relay. Retry automatically after 60 s up to 3 attempts, then lock out until a reset button is pressed. Record the last trip cause in an enum.

Coffee maker schedule: Weekdays On at 06:15 for 12 minutes; Weekends On at 08:00 for 12 minutes. A Skip-Today button prevents the next run. Use LED blink patterns to show Idle, Scheduled, Running, or Skipped states.

Bathroom fan automation: fan follows the light switch On immediately. After the light turns Off, keep the fan running 5 minutes, or 15 minutes if humidity > 70% RH. Cap the maximum fan run to 30 minutes per cycle.

Greenhouse vent relay control: Open at 28 °C, Close at 24 °C. If wind alarm is active, force Closed. From 20:00 to 06:00, stay Closed (night mode). Long-press toggles ManualOpen/ManualClosed; default is Auto. Use an enum for Auto/ManualOpen/ManualClosed.
