Implement an on-off control for a relay using a simple switch input, with a safety requirement that the relay must default to off on startup and any detected fault. Add a minimal safety block and inline tests that verify startup state, normal operation, and fault fallback.

Create a periodic reminder: beep a buzzer for 0.2 s every 10 s. Run the scheduler at a fixed rate and state the WCET as 0.5 ms. Add a safety block to avoid back-to-back beeps under any condition, and include inline tests to check timing accuracy.

Program a simple traffic light with states Green, Yellow, and Red for one road, with a pedestrian button that requests the next cycle. Enforce minimum green of 10 s, yellow of 3 s, and never skip yellow. Include a safety block for conflicting outputs and inline tests that simulate button timing.

Build a quiz buzzer for two contestants: the first button pressed lights that contestant’s LED and locks out the other until reset. Handle near-simultaneous presses within 20 ms as a tie using a special indicator. Add a safety block for stuck buttons and inline tests for all outcomes.

Create a door chime: a magnetic switch triggers three short beeps unless a mute switch is enabled. Prevent chimes from repeating more than once every 5 s using simple state logic. Include a safety block for switch bounce and inline tests for open-close sequences.

Write a water tank controller using a level sensor: turn the pump on below 30% and off above 70% (hysteresis). Add a safety block that stops the pump if it has run continuously for 60 s without reaching 70%. Provide inline tests for normal and fault scenarios.

Implement a small thermostat with hysteresis: heater ON below 19.5 C and OFF above 20.5 C. Validate sensor readings in -10 C to 50 C and fail safe with heater OFF on invalid data. Include inline tests checking transitions at the boundaries.

Make a metronome: a knob selects tempo from 40 to 180 BPM, and the system flashes an LED and ticks a buzzer at the chosen rate. Clamp values in a safety block, quantize tempo to integer BPM, and add inline tests that verify timing at 60 BPM and 120 BPM.

Have two LEDs blink alternately. A button toggles the speed between slow (0.5 Hz) and fast (4 Hz). Ensure clean transitions without phase glitches using a small state machine, add a safety block for button debounce, and include inline tests.

Create a fan controller with two thresholds: set fan to medium when temperature exceeds 28 C and high when above 32 C; otherwise keep it low. Use 2 C hysteresis around each threshold to avoid rapid switching, with a safety block for sensor range checks, and inline tests.

Build an elevator door demo: a button command opens the door (LED on) for 3 s then closes (LED off). An obstruction input keeps the door open until clear. Include a safety state that stops any change if a fault is detected. Add inline tests for open, hold, and close sequences.

Write a basic stopwatch with start/stop and reset buttons. Show elapsed whole seconds using LED blinks once per second while running. Debounce inputs with a safety block and supply inline tests that exercise start, stop, resume, and reset.

Implement a night-light that fades an LED up when ambient light drops below a threshold and fades down when brighter, using a simple smoothing filter. Add a safety block to clamp fade steps to avoid flicker, and include inline tests for sudden and gradual light changes.

Create an ultrasonic distance beeper: beep faster as an object approaches within 10 cm, and slower as it moves away. Ignore out-of-range or invalid readings using a safety block. Provide inline tests with distances in cm to verify the beeping rate changes.

Design a traffic counter that increments each time an IR beam is broken but rejects triggers occurring within 200 ms of the previous one. Display the count using two LEDs as a 2-bit binary number. Include a safety block for sensor noise and inline tests for burst events.

Build a simple ventilation demo: read temperature and humidity, turn on a fan if temperature > 27 C or humidity > 65%, and if both are high, extend runtime to a minimum of 30 s. Add sensor validation in a safety block and inline tests for all combinations.

Create a mode selector with three modes indicated by LEDs. A single button advances to the next mode with wrap-around; a long press resets to mode 1. Implement a small state machine, add a debounce safety block, and include inline tests for short and long presses.

Implement a safe relay latch: pressing a Start button energizes a relay, pressing Stop de-energizes it, and an Emergency input forces it off immediately. Default to off at startup. Include a safety block to handle stuck inputs and inline tests for all paths.

Write a PWM dimmer that ramps brightness up over 2 s when a button is pressed and ramps down on the next press. Prevent abrupt jumps using a simple rate limiter, add debounce in a safety block, and include inline tests verifying ramp timing.

Program a two-direction traffic light with fixed phases and ensure mutual exclusion so both directions are never green at the same time. Add a safety block asserting exclusivity and provide inline tests that check all state transitions.

Create a CO2 indicator with three levels: green below 800 ppm, yellow below 1200 ppm, red otherwise. Validate sensor readings in 300–5000 ppm using a safety block, fall back to yellow on invalid data, and add inline tests covering boundaries and faults.

Design a classroom greenhouse misting controller: if soil moisture drops below a threshold, run a pump for 5 s, then lock out for 60 s to prevent overwatering. Add a safety block capping total runtime per hour, and include inline tests for repeated dry events.

Implement PID temperature control to maintain 37.0 C using a heater output. Include anti-windup, output limits of 0–100%, a sampling rate of 10 Hz, and a WCET of 1 ms. Add a safety block to detect sensor faults and inline tests with a simple first-order thermal model.

Create a PID speed controller for a small fan using tachometer feedback to hold 1500 RPM. Handle saturation, add a timeout that flags a fault if feedback pulses stop, and provide a safety block to disable output on fault. Include inline tests with simulated pulse trains.

Write a temperature fusion routine that reads two sensors, computes a weighted average, and rejects one sensor if it differs by more than 3 C from the other. Drive an alarm LED on any rejection. Add a safety block for range checks and inline tests with noisy and faulty inputs.

Estimate tilt angle using a complementary filter that fuses accelerometer and gyroscope readings at 100 Hz. Fall back to accelerometer-only if the gyro saturates or faults. Bound the output angle in a safety block and include inline tests with step and ramp motions.

Build a line tracking demo that reads two reflectance sensors, computes an error signal, and drives left and right LEDs proportionally using a simple PID to indicate correction. Rate-limit changes, add safety checks for sensor saturation, and include inline tests with path scenarios.

Implement a smart ventilation controller that fuses temperature and humidity into a comfort index, then sets fan speed low, medium, or high accordingly. Use a 5 Hz update rate, fail safe to medium on sensor faults via a safety block, and add inline tests that sweep conditions.

Create an advanced traffic light with pedestrian crossing support, minimum and maximum green times, an emergency cancel input, and a fault state that forces all-red. Include a safety block for mutual exclusion of greens and inline tests that verify timing constraints.

Write a battery safety monitor that reads voltage and temperature; if voltage is outside 3.0–4.2 V or temperature exceeds 45 C, disable charging and light an alarm. Debounce readings, latch faults until reset, and include inline tests for threshold crossings and recovery.

Develop a sensor validation block for any analog input that performs range checking, detects stuck values over 5 s, and substitutes a safe default value if a fault is detected. Demonstrate it with a light sensor input, and provide inline tests for normal, noisy, and stuck cases.

Fuse distance readings from an ultrasonic and an infrared sensor using a simple consistency check and weighted blending. Drive a bargraph LED level to reflect fused distance and ignore outliers. Add a safety block for range limits and inline tests with conflicting inputs.

Design a multi-mode incubator demo with modes Off, Warm-up, Hold, and Fault. Use PID to hold 37.0 C, limit heater duty cycle, add a watchdog, and set a WCET budget of 1 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests that cover all mode transitions, setpoint tracking, and fault recovery.

Implement a full intersection controller with two roads and pedestrian crossings on each side, including coordinated phases, emergency preemption, and a fail-safe all-red mode. Add a safety block asserting no conflicting greens, and include a suite of inline tests that prove minimum yellow times and safe preemption.

Create a classroom greenhouse controller with modes Manual, Auto, and Alarm. Manage fan, heater, and pump using temperature in C and soil moisture percent, and fuse two temperature sensors for reliability. Include safety interlocks, a watchdog, and thorough inline tests for edge cases.

Build a learning project for a balancing beam: estimate angle with a complementary filter and hold level using a PID loop. Add startup calibration, saturation guards, a Fault mode, and run at 200 Hz with WCET 0.8 ms. Provide exhaustive inline tests with simulated disturbances and recovery.

Develop a multi-mode energy demo that manages a battery charger and a DC load with modes Charge, Discharge, Idle, and Fault. Enforce safety limits on voltage, current, and temperature; estimate state of charge by fusing voltage and coulomb count; and include extensive inline tests for mode transitions and edge conditions.

Write a simple ReflexScript tutorial example: when the pushbutton is pressed, turn on the indicator light; otherwise keep it off. Use basic syntax only. Add a basic safety block that defaults the light to off if the input is invalid, and include inline tests for press and release.

Create a beginner-friendly program that reads an analog dial and sets an LED brightness from 0% to 100%. Clamp the output to a safe 0–90% range if the dial is out of bounds, and add inline tests for min, mid, and max readings.

Make a classroom demo: read a temperature sensor in Celsius and switch a fan on above 26 C and off below 24 C (hysteresis). Include a simple safety block to force the fan off if the sensor faults, with inline tests.

Build a blinker that flashes an LED at 2 Hz with a 50% duty cycle using basic constructs. State the target loop rate and a WCET budget of 0.2 ms, and include inline tests that verify the period within ±5%.
Program a buzzer to beep for 200 ms when motion is detected, with a 1 s lockout to avoid chatter. Add a safety section that mutes the buzzer on fault and inline tests for motion/no-motion cases.
Count button presses and show the count on a simple numeric output up to 9, then wrap to 0. Debounce the button, clamp invalid counts, and provide inline tests.
Create a basic traffic light sequence for a single intersection: Green 5 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 5 s, looping. Include a safety default that sets all lights Red on reset, and inline tests for timing.
Read a light sensor and categorize the environment as Dark, Dim, or Bright, updating an indicator accordingly. Add a deadband to reduce flicker and inline tests for boundary values.

Make a quiz-buzzer controller for three teams: the first button pressed locks out the others until reset. Include a safety block that forces a reset if two presses arrive within 10 ms, and add inline tests for tie and normal cases.
Implement a pulse counter that computes a rolling average frequency over the last 10 samples in Hz. Protect against overflow and provide inline tests with synthetic pulses.

Design a simple alarm: if temperature exceeds 30 C continuously for 5 s, turn on an alarm light; clear it when it falls below 29 C. Include a safety cutoff to silence on sensor fault and inline tests.

Create a reaction-time game: after a random delay (1–3 s), turn on a light and measure how many milliseconds until the button is pressed. Time out after 5 s, and include inline tests that simulate early and late presses.
Drive a positional actuator to three preset angles (0°, 45°, 90°) using three buttons. Ensure bounds checking and a safe stop state, with inline tests for each button.
Write a metronome that clicks at 120 BPM and allows tempo adjustment by ±10 BPM with two buttons. Keep the rate stable with a simple safety guard against invalid tempo, and add inline tests.
Build a door indicator: if the door switch reads Open, turn on a light; otherwise off. Fail-safe to light off on fault, and include inline tests for open/closed/fault.

Create a finite state machine for a water dispenser: Idle, Pouring, Timeout. A button starts Pouring for up to 8 s, then Timeout locks out for 3 s before returning to Idle. Add a tank_low interlock that immediately stops pouring, plus inline tests for all transitions.

Fuse two temperature sensors to get a reliable Celsius value: if they disagree by more than 2 C, use the lower reading and flag a warning; otherwise average them. Control a heater to reach 22 C with simple on/off logic, add a safety cutoff at 28 C, and include inline tests.

Build a simple line-follow demo using two light sensors and two motors: steer proportionally to the sensor difference and limit motor output to a safe range. Provide inline tests for left, right, and centered line cases.

Model a two-floor elevator: handle Up and Down calls, move only when door_closed is true, and manage door_open/close signals with timed delays. Add a safety stop if door stays open too long, and include inline tests.

Implement a fan controller with Day and Night modes selected by a toggle input: Day setpoint 24 C, Night setpoint 20 C. Use hysteresis, cap the fan speed at 80%, provide a manual override, and add inline tests.
Teach debouncing with a rotary encoder: adjust a brightness value from 0 to 100% with each detent. Prevent jitter, enforce bounds, and supply inline tests for clockwise and counter-clockwise steps.

Record timestamps (milliseconds) of button presses into a small buffer and expose the last 5 events. Ensure the clock is monotonic, handle buffer wrap, and add inline tests including overflow after 60 s.
Sample a sensor at 50 Hz with a loop period of 20 ms and a WCET budget of 0.5 ms. If a cycle overruns, skip publishing that sample. Include inline tests that verify timing behavior and skip logic.

Create a crosswalk controller: when the pedestrian button is pressed, complete the current vehicle Green, then give Walk 7 s, Flashing 5 s, then return to vehicles Green. Ensure no conflicting greens and add inline tests for button timing edge cases.

Build a mini greenhouse controller: maintain temperature between 18 C and 22 C with heater and vent outputs and 1 C hysteresis. Add an emergency cutoff at 28 C and inline tests for heating and cooling transitions.
Demonstrate hysteresis using a light sensor: turn an LED on above 500 lux and off below 400 lux. Provide inline tests that prove no chatter around the thresholds.
Map a joystick X/Y input to left and right motor outputs for a differential drive demo. Apply deadband, scale to limits, and include inline tests for forward, turn, and diagonal moves.
Create an alarm clock with Snooze: states Idle, Ringing, Snooze. Ring for up to 60 s, snooze for 5 min, with a maximum of 3 snoozes. Add inline tests to cover all transitions and timers.
Write a stopwatch with Start/Stop, Reset, and Lap buttons. Ensure the Lap freezes the displayed value while time keeps advancing. Tick at 1 kHz, include a WCET note, and provide inline tests.

Sequence two liquid valves for a mixing demo: open Valve A for 3 s, then Valve B for 2 s, ensuring they are never open together. Add an emergency_stop input that closes both immediately, with inline tests.
Implement a moving average filter over the last 5 samples for a noisy sensor. Handle initial fill with zeros or hold-last, and supply inline tests with a known input sequence.
Generate Morse code tones from a text input. Use dot = 200 ms, dash = 600 ms, and correct spacing. Provide inline tests that check the pattern for SOS.
Vibrate a small motor when tilt exceeds 15 degrees, with a simple low-pass filter to reduce noise. Limit vibration duty to 70% for safety and include inline tests.
Create a battery indicator: convert voltage to percent using a piecewise linear map and light up 1–4 bars. Trigger a low-voltage alarm at 3.3 V and write inline tests for boundary voltages.
Implement a simple security keypad: accept a 4-digit code via buttons, unlock on correct entry, and lock out for 30 s after 3 wrong attempts. Include safety default to locked and inline tests.

Design a PID temperature controller that holds 25.0 C. Sample at 10 Hz, clamp the heater output 0–80%, include anti-windup, and add a safety cutoff at 30 C. Provide inline tests for step response and disturbance.

Create a PID speed controller for a DC motor measured in RPM. Update at 100 Hz, detect sensor loss (no pulses for 200 ms) and fall back to safe coast. Include inline tests for setpoint changes and a sensor fault.

Combine two noisy distance sensors using a weighted average with outlier rejection: if readings differ by more than 10%, choose the smaller. Hold last good value on fault, and supply inline tests with synthetic data.

Control a tilting platform to keep its angle at 0 degrees using PID on the tilt sensor. Limit actuator to a safe range, stop if |angle| > 20 degrees, and include inline tests for recovery from a bump.

Implement a simple 1D state estimator for position using velocity (m/s) integration and occasional position fixes. Use a fixed time step of 0.02 s, reject NaN/inf inputs, and provide inline tests that verify convergence.

Fuse three temperature sensors with a median filter and control a heater with a PI loop to 22 C. Declare a fault if any sensor deviates by more than 3 C from the median, add a safety cutoff at 35 C, and include inline tests.

Build an auto-tuning PI demo: perform a bump test on a thermal load, estimate gains, then switch to closed-loop control with output limited to 60% duty. Add safety time limits and inline tests using a simple simulated plant.

Create a complementary filter for tilt: combine accelerometer angle and gyroscope rate at 200 Hz to output pitch in degrees. Saturate outputs to safe limits, handle sensor dropout, and include inline tests for drift and step changes.

Maintain a water level at 10 cm using a PID with an ultrasonic sensor. Sample at 20 Hz, stop the pump if the level changes faster than 5 cm/s, and write inline tests for setpoint tracking and fast-change safety.

Simulate an inverted pendulum lesson: states Play, Pause, Reset. Use a controller to keep the pendulum within ±5 degrees; if it exceeds 25 degrees, enter a safe stop. Provide inline tests for mode changes and limit behavior.

Specify a multi-mode classroom energy controller with modes Off, Manual, Auto, and Diagnostics. Auto holds 21 C using a PI loop; Manual accepts a setpoint from 18–24 C; Diagnostics logs sensor and actuator health. Safety: force Off if temperature exceeds 28 C. Include inline tests for all mode transitions, fault recovery, and a 50 Hz loop with 1 ms WCET.

Design an autonomous toy car demo with modes Idle, Follow-Line, and Avoid-Obstacle. Fuse two light sensors and a distance sensor to choose the mode, cap speed at 0.5 m/s, and support an emergency_stop input. Require inline tests that cover mode switching, sensor faults, and meeting a 100 Hz loop with 0.8 ms WCET.

Model a 3-floor classroom elevator: states DoorOpening, DoorOpen, DoorClosing, Moving. Schedule floor requests, enforce that movement only occurs when door_closed is true, and stop if the door fails to close within 2 s. Provide comprehensive inline tests for ordering, timeouts, and interlocks at a 200 Hz tick.

Create a lab incubator controller with modes Warmup, Hold, and Alarm. Use PID to reach and maintain 37.0 C within ±0.1 C, apply dual-sensor voting with failover, limit heater duty to 85%, and log status. Include inline tests for step response, sensor fault injection, saturation, and a 100 ms period with 2 ms WCET.

Build a two-zone greenhouse demo: each zone has Day/Night profiles for temperature and humidity. Fuse three sensors per variable using a median, prevent heater and humidifier from being on together due to power limits, rate-limit setpoint changes to 5 per minute, and run at 10 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 ms. Provide thorough inline tests for mode scheduling and interlocks.

Write a beginner-friendly ReflexScript that turns on an LED while a pushbutton is pressed and turns it off when released. Include a simple safety block to debounce presses (ignore transitions within 20 ms) and default the LED off if the input is invalid. Add inline tests covering press, hold, and release cases.

Create a 1 Hz LED blinker using basic syntax. Use a safety block to cap duty cycle at 50% and ensure the LED state is always boolean. Provide inline tests that verify a full on-off cycle is exactly 1 second within a small tolerance.

Make a simple temperature alarm: if the temperature sensor reads over 30 Celsius, light an LED; otherwise keep it off. Add a safety block that clamps sensor readings to the range −40 to 125 Celsius and defaults to off if a reading is out of range. Include inline tests around 29.9, 30.0, and 30.1 Celsius.

Build a proximity notifier: turn a buzzer on when an object is closer than 0.10 m, and off otherwise. Include a simple safety block that treats missing data as far away (buzzer off). Add inline tests exercising 0.09 m, 0.10 m, 0.11 m, and a sensor fault.

Map a knob input to LED brightness from 0% to 100% using basic syntax. Use a safety block to clamp out-of-range knob values and rate-limit brightness changes to avoid flicker. Provide inline tests for minimum, midpoint, and maximum inputs.

Create a toggle light: each rising edge on a button flips the LED state. Add a safety block to ignore bounces within 15 ms. Include inline tests for rapid double presses and a long hold that should not retrigger.

Write a simple night-light: if ambient light falls below 200 lux, turn on a lamp output; turn it off above 250 lux (hysteresis). Add a safety block that defaults the lamp off on sensor error. Include inline tests that sweep lux down and up to validate hysteresis.

When a switch changes state, beep a buzzer for 200 ms, then silence it. Add a safety block that enforces a maximum beep duration of 500 ms and prevents overlapping beeps. Provide inline tests to verify exact beep length and behavior on multiple quick toggles.

Drive a simple servo to an angle set by a knob (0 to 180 degrees). Include a safety block to clamp the angle and limit the slew rate to avoid jitter. Add inline tests for 0°, 90°, 180°, and a mid-range step.

Fade an LED smoothly up and down over a 2 second cycle using basic constructs. Add a safety block to ensure the update step never exceeds 10% per tick. Include inline tests that check the total cycle time and brightness bounds.

Implement a hold-to-activate: turn the LED on only if the button is held for more than 1.0 s; otherwise keep it off. Add a safety block that resets the timer if the input becomes invalid. Provide inline tests for holds shorter and longer than 1.0 s.

Read temperature in Celsius and update a numeric display every 500 ms. Use a safety block to hold the last good value if a reading fails. Include inline tests verifying the 500 ms update interval and correct display of 20.0, 25.5, and 30.0 Celsius.

Count button presses and turn on an LED on the 5th press, then reset the count. Add a safety block to clear the count after 10 seconds of inactivity. Provide inline tests with timed press sequences to ensure counting and auto-reset work.

Turn on a small fan output when humidity exceeds 70% RH, and turn it off when humidity drops below 65% RH. Include a safety block that forces the fan off on sensor fault. Add inline tests at 64, 65, 70, and 71% RH.

Flash an LED when sound level exceeds 80 dB and keep it steady off otherwise. Add a safety block that saturates any sound reading above 120 dB and treats negative values as 0 dB. Include inline tests at 79, 80, 100, and an invalid negative value.

Build a simple crosswalk controller using a two-state machine: Walk and Stop. A button requests Walk, which lasts 6 seconds, then returns to Stop. Add a safety block so Walk and Stop lights are never on together. Provide inline tests covering request timing and state transitions.

Two buttons control a tri-color LED: one cycles through red, green, blue; the other toggles the LED on/off. Use basic syntax and a small state machine. Add a safety block ensuring only one color channel is active when on. Include inline tests for cycling, toggling, and combined presses.

Create a temperature-controlled fan with hysteresis: fan on above 28 Celsius, off below 26 Celsius. Add a safety block to clamp readings to −40..125 C and force fan off on invalid data. Provide inline tests around the thresholds and for sensor faults.

Build a night security light: LED turns on only when it's dark (below 150 lux) and motion is detected; it shuts off 30 seconds after the last motion. Add a safety block that defaults the LED off if either sensor is faulty. Include inline tests for darkness without motion, motion in daylight, and motion at night.

Design a metronome that blinks an LED and ticks a buzzer at a tempo set by a knob (40 to 200 BPM). Add a safety block that clips the BPM and rejects sudden changes over 20 BPM per update. Provide inline tests checking periods for 60 and 120 BPM.

Make a simple code lock: accept a 4-digit keypad input; if the code matches, turn on an 'unlock' LED for 5 seconds. Add a safety block that limits attempts to 3 before a 10 second lockout. Include inline tests for correct code, wrong code, and lockout behavior.

Control a servo to one of two positions based on a switch; if temperature exceeds 35 Celsius, use an alternate pair of positions. Add a safety block to clamp servo angles and smooth transitions. Provide inline tests covering both temperature regions and switch changes.

Average two temperature sensors and show the mean in Celsius on a small display. Use a safety block to ignore any sensor value outside −40..125 C and average only valid inputs. Include inline tests with one invalid sensor and with both valid.

Create a simple timer: on button press, enter a Counting state and increment seconds up to 10, then stop and light an LED. Add a safety block that prevents counting past 10. Include inline tests for early release, reaching 10, and reset.

Build a reaction game: after a random delay between 0.5 and 3.0 seconds, turn on an LED; if the button is pressed within 250 ms, light a 'success' LED, otherwise a 'try again' LED. Add a safety block to bound the random delay. Provide inline tests with simulated reaction times.

Implement a simple motor speed control: the knob sets duty cycle (0–100%), and pressing a brake button forces duty to 0%. Add a safety block that ramps duty changes by at most 10% per 50 ms. Include inline tests for ramping and brake behavior.

Create a mini greenhouse controller: if humidity < 40% RH, turn on a mister; if temperature > 30 Celsius, turn on a fan. Add a safety block that prevents the mister and fan from running together if temperature < 15 Celsius. Provide inline tests for all combinations.

Write a sampler that reads a light sensor at 10 Hz and outputs both the raw reading and a 1-second rolling average. Add a safety block to limit sampling jitter and hold the last good reading on faults. Include inline tests for timing and average correctness.

Build a small alarm: if a door switch is open and a tilt sensor triggers, latch a buzzer on until a reset button is pressed. Add a safety block that auto-silences after 60 seconds. Provide inline tests covering latch, reset, and auto-silence.

Program a three-light traffic sequence: green for 3 s, yellow for 1 s, red for 3 s, then repeat. Add a safety block ensuring that only one light is active at any time. Include inline tests to verify exact phase durations and exclusivity.

Create a two-player button race: the first button pressed lights its player LED and locks out the other until a reset. Add a safety block for 20 ms debounce. Provide inline tests to confirm winner detection and lockout.

Make a motor direction controller: one button commands forward, another reverse, and an LED indicates the current direction. Add a safety interlock block so forward and reverse cannot be active simultaneously. Include inline tests for conflicting commands and transitions.

Set up two periodic tasks: blink LED A at 2 Hz and LED B at 0.5 Hz concurrently. Add a safety block to prevent drift by referencing a common timebase. Provide inline tests that run for 10 seconds and verify the correct number of blinks for each LED.

Detect a temperature trend: if the temperature rises more than 0.5 Celsius over 10 seconds, turn on an 'up' indicator; if it falls more than 0.5 C, turn on a 'down' indicator; otherwise both off. Add a safety block to ignore gaps in data. Include inline tests with synthetic ramps.

Create a timed sprinkler demo: when soil moisture is below 30%, run a pump for 10 seconds every minute; otherwise keep it off. Add a safety block that forces the pump off if a tank-level input says 'low'. Include inline tests for dry, wet, and low-tank scenarios.

Implement a PID temperature controller to hold 37.0 Celsius using a heater output. Run the control loop at 20 Hz. Add a safety block with output clamp (0–100%), anti-windup, and an overtemperature cutoff at 45 C. Provide inline tests for step changes and a simulated disturbance.

Write a PID speed controller for a small DC motor using an encoder for feedback. The setpoint is given in rpm by a knob. Run at 100 Hz and enforce WCET ≤ 1 ms. Add a safety block that limits acceleration and clamps duty cycle. Include inline tests for a 0→500 rpm step and a sudden load change.

Fuse two distance sensors to produce a robust distance estimate: compute a weighted average and reject outliers that differ by more than 20%. Use the fused value to set LED brightness inversely. Run at 50 Hz. Add a safety block that defaults to the nearer reading on disagreement. Provide inline tests with consistent and conflicting inputs.

Estimate tilt angle in degrees using a complementary filter that blends a gyro and an accelerometer. Drive a servo to keep the angle at 0°. Run at 200 Hz with WCET under 0.8 ms. Add a safety block that disengages the servo if vibration exceeds a threshold. Include inline tests with synthetic motion data.

Create a multi-sensor thermostat: take three temperature sensors, compute the median in Celsius, and drive a fan via a PID to maintain 25 C. Run the control loop at 10 Hz. Add a safety block to ignore any sensor out of −40..125 C and cut the fan if >50 C. Provide inline tests for sensor dropout and step response.

Design adaptive room lighting: combine a light sensor and a simple day/night input to set a target brightness, then follow it with a PI controller. Run at 20 Hz. Add a safety block to cap brightness and limit rate-of-change to prevent glare. Include inline tests for day→night transitions and sudden light changes.

Build a height hold demo: fuse barometric and ultrasonic readings to estimate altitude (in meters), then control a servo flap with a PID to hold a 0.5 m setpoint. Run at 50 Hz and ensure WCET ≤ 1 ms. Add a safety block that clamps servo angle and disables control if either sensor fails. Provide inline tests with simulated step changes.

Monitor motor current and speed to detect a stall: if estimated torque exceeds a threshold while speed is near zero, cut power within 50 ms. Run checks at 200 Hz. Add a safety block with a low-pass filter and a cooldown timer before re-enable. Include inline tests for normal load and stall conditions.

Implement cascaded control for a positioner: an outer loop holds a target angle in degrees and an inner loop controls motor velocity. Run both at 100 Hz with WCET budgeting. Add a safety block that limits maximum angle and velocity and applies anti-windup. Provide inline tests for step and ramp commands.

Perform simple sensor fusion for temperature using two sensors and known variances: compute a weighted average in Celsius and display it. Add a safety block that ignores any sensor with variance outside expected bounds. Include inline tests for equal and unequal variances and a sensor fault.

Create a multi-mode wind tunnel classroom controller with modes: Setup, Calibrate (zero sensors), Run (PID fan speed), and Emergency Stop. Run control tasks at 100 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 ms. Add a safety block to cap fan speed and immediately drop to Emergency on any fault. Provide comprehensive inline tests for all mode transitions, timing budgets, and fault recovery.

Build a student-friendly robot demo with three modes: Idle, Line-Follow, and Obstacle-Avoid. Use two light sensors for line following and a distance sensor for avoidance. Limit top speed to 0.3 m/s via a safety block. Include inline tests that simulate each mode, sensor handoff, and a sudden obstacle.

Design a climate chamber exercise with modes: Warm-up, Hold, Cool-down, Fault. Fuse two temperature sensors (median) and control heater/fan to meet setpoints in Celsius. Run at 20 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 ms. Add safety blocks for overtemperature (>50 C), sensor mismatch, and actuator exclusivity. Provide thorough inline tests including sensor dropout and stuck-at values.

Create a comprehensive FSM for a dosing pump: Prime, Dose, Pause, and Fault states. Track delivered volume in mL using a flow sensor, stop at the target, and alarm on flow mismatch. Add safety blocks for dry-run detection and maximum runtime per cycle. Include exhaustive inline tests covering transitions, invariants, and corner cases.

Implement a multi-mode data acquisition system: Standby, Record, and Playback. Schedule periodic tasks at 10, 50, and 100 Hz with an overall CPU budget and WCET checks. Add a safety block to stop recording if storage is full and to preserve data integrity on faults. Provide inline tests for jitter, mode switching latency, and storage edge cases.

Beginner task: turn an indicator light on when a pushbutton is pressed and off when released, with a clean debounce so brief bounces under 10 ms are ignored. Sample at 100 Hz. Keep the logic simple using basic variables and if statements. Include a simple safety block that discards impossible button states and a timer overflow check. Add inline tests that simulate press, hold, rapid taps, and release sequences to confirm the light follows correctly and that bounce does not cause flicker.

Map a knob input from 0 to 100 percent into LED brightness using a linear scale. Clamp the reading to 0 to 100 and handle missing input values with a default. Keep it beginner-friendly with basic syntax and comments. Include a simple safety block to limit output duty cycle to 0 to 100 percent. Add inline tests that check 0 percent gives off, 50 percent gives mid brightness, and 100 percent gives full brightness, plus tests for out-of-range inputs.

Create a simple thermostat demo: if temperature exceeds 30 Celsius, activate a fan output; if it drops below 28 Celsius, turn it off to add a small hysteresis. Use straightforward conditions and constants. Include a simple safety block that rejects sensor values outside -20 to 80 Celsius. Add inline tests to verify behavior just below, at, and above the thresholds and to confirm hysteresis prevents chatter.

Make a buzzer beep for 200 ms every 2 seconds until a button is pressed, then stay silent. Use clear timing logic with basic counters. Include a simple safety block to ensure the beep duty cycle never exceeds 20 percent over any 10 second window. Add inline tests that step through time to verify the beep pattern, the stop behavior on button press, and that duty limits are respected.

Use a light sensor to detect night versus day: if illumination falls below 200 lux for at least 1 second, turn on an indicator LED; otherwise keep it off. Keep the code simple and readable. Include a simple safety block that clamps sensor readings to 0 to 100000 lux and flags negative values. Add inline tests for steady bright, steady dark, and fluctuating light around the threshold to confirm the 1 second requirement.

Implement a heartbeat light that blinks at 1 Hz with a 50 percent duty cycle. Aim for timing accuracy within 5 percent. Use basic timers and conditionals. Include a simple safety block to detect and handle timer overflow gracefully. Add inline tests that measure on and off durations over several cycles and verify the frequency and duty cycle within tolerance.

Count how many times a button is pressed in a 10 second window and then pulse a buzzer that many times at 5 pulses per second. Ignore long presses longer than 1 second. Use straightforward counters and if statements. Include a simple safety block to cap the max buzzer pulses to 20 to prevent prolonged noise. Add inline tests for zero, few, and many presses, and ensure long holds do not increment.

Create a one-shot: when the button experiences a rising edge, turn an LED on for exactly 500 ms and then automatically turn it off; ignore retriggers while the LED is on. Keep logic minimal using basic state flags. Include a simple safety block that enforces a minimum 100 ms lockout between one-shots. Add inline tests for single press, rapid double press, and long press.

Use two buttons to control a lamp: the left button forces it on, the right button forces it off. Provide clear, beginner-friendly logic that avoids ambiguous states. Include a simple safety block that gives priority to the off command if both are pressed. Add inline tests covering left-only, right-only, both pressed, and rapid alternation.

Read a distance sensor and turn on a warning output when the distance is less than 0.30 meters. Clamp measured values to 0.00 to 4.00 meters. Use basic conditions and constants. Include a simple safety block that flags sensor stalls if the reading does not change for 5 seconds. Add inline tests with distances at 0.29, 0.30, and 0.31 meters, plus a frozen reading test.

Compute a 4-sample moving average of temperature in Celsius and output the smoothed value once per second. Keep the implementation simple with arrays or accumulators. Include a simple safety block that replaces missing or out-of-range readings with the last good value. Add inline tests that feed a step change and verify the average transitions as expected.

Use a motion sensor to trigger a short buzzer chirp of 100 ms, then enforce a lockout of 200 ms before the next chirp. Implement using clear timing and flags. Include a simple safety block to ignore motion rates above 50 triggers per second as noise. Add inline tests for isolated triggers, bursts within the lockout, and sustained motion.

Drive a 10 level LED bargraph from a knob that represents 0 to 100 percent. Light the correct number of LEDs with simple arithmetic and if statements. Include a simple safety block to cap the level at 10. Add inline tests that verify 0, 25, 50, 75, and 100 percent map to 0, 3, 5, 8, and 10 LEDs lit.

Generate a square wave on a digital output at 5 Hz with exactly 50 percent duty cycle. Keep the code straightforward and readable. Include a simple safety block to prevent frequencies above 100 Hz from being set by mistake. Add inline tests that measure period and duty cycle over several seconds and confirm correct timing.

Implement a delayed lighting effect: if ambient light is below 300 lux continuously for 3 seconds, turn on an LED; if it rises above 350 lux, turn it off immediately. Use basic timing and thresholds. Include a simple safety block to discard negative lux values. Add inline tests that emulate flickering light around the thresholds and verify the delay behavior.

Build a simple traffic light state machine for one direction with a pedestrian button: cycle Green 8 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 8 s; when the button is pressed, ensure a safe transition to Red and a Walk signal for 6 s. Use clear states and timers. Include a simple safety block that forbids illegal transitions. Add inline tests that step through time, press the button at different moments, and verify the sequence.

Create a two-speed classroom fan controller using temperature in Celsius: Low speed from 25 to 28, High speed at 28 and above, with 1 degree hysteresis to prevent chatter. Use straightforward conditions. Include a simple safety block that validates readings between 0 and 50 Celsius. Add inline tests for ramp-up and ramp-down cases and boundary values.

Use two light sensors to balance two LEDs so each LED tracks the brightness of its paired sensor; if the sensors disagree by more than 500 lux, raise a warning flag. Keep logic clean with basic math. Include a simple safety block to clamp lux values to a reasonable range. Add inline tests with matched and mismatched sensor inputs to verify outputs and the warning.

Implement a water level indicator with three LEDs showing Low, Medium, and High based on a level sensor in centimeters. Define thresholds at 10, 20, and 30 cm. Use simple if-else logic. Include a simple safety block to handle sensor saturation and negative readings. Add inline tests for values around each threshold and exactly at the boundaries.

Design a doorbell function: when the button is pressed, play a beep pattern on a buzzer for 1 second; ignore further presses until the pattern completes. Use a small state machine with clear states Idle and Playing. Include a simple safety block to ensure the buzzer does not run longer than 2 seconds. Add inline tests that press the button once, repeatedly during playback, and after completion.

Sample temperature and light at 10 Hz and compute running minimum and maximum over the last 60 seconds. Export the current, min, and max values. Keep the implementation readable with basic arrays or indices. Include a simple safety block to handle missing samples by skipping updates. Add inline tests that feed a scripted sequence of values and verify min and max evolution over time.

Create a crosswalk assistant: when Walk is active, tick a beeper at 2 Hz; ensure Walk stays active for at least 8 seconds once started, then switches back to Stop. Use a small state machine with timers. Include a simple safety block to prevent Walk from starting twice concurrently. Add inline tests for early button presses, mid-cycle presses, and end of cycle.

Build a plant moisture alert: if soil moisture stays below a threshold for 10 minutes, sound an alarm until a reset button is pressed; include a button students can press to record last watering time. Use basic timers and state flags. Include a simple safety block to debounce both inputs and cap alarm duration to 30 seconds for classroom comfort. Add inline tests simulating dry and wet periods and the reset action.

Make a simple line follower demo: two reflectance sensors drive left and right motor outputs on or off to steer toward a line. If an obstacle sensor detects something closer than 0.20 meters, stop both motors. Use clear conditional logic. Include a simple safety block to ensure both motors cannot be commanded forward if the obstacle is too close. Add inline tests covering on-line, off-line left, off-line right, and obstacle cases.

Create a two-floor elevator controller with states Idle, Moving, and DoorOpen. Handle calls from either floor, ensure doors open for 5 seconds at arrival, and never move when doors are open. Use a basic state machine. Include a simple safety block that enforces a maximum travel time timeout. Add inline tests for calls from each floor, back-to-back calls, and door safety.

Write a reaction time game: after a random delay between 1 and 3 seconds, turn on an LED and measure how quickly the player presses a button; output the time in milliseconds. Provide a way to seed the random delay for deterministic tests. Include a simple safety block that ignores button bounces under 20 ms. Add inline tests that seed the delay and simulate fast and slow reactions.

Implement a simple on off thermostat with hysteresis: turn heat on below 21 Celsius and off above 23 Celsius. Keep the structure clear with named constants. Include a simple safety block to detect sensor faults and force heat off. Add inline tests that slowly ramp temperature up and down and verify the switching points without chatter.

Create a dimmable room light controlled by two buttons: one increases brightness, the other decreases; implement long press to change faster. Use basic arithmetic and limits. Include a simple safety block to ensure brightness stays between 0 and 100 percent. Add inline tests for single taps, long presses, and boundary conditions.

Build a metronome: use a knob to set tempo from 60 to 180 beats per minute; tick a buzzer every beat with a short click. Enforce a WCET under 1 ms per loop. Include a simple safety block to clamp tempo. Add inline tests verifying beat intervals at 60, 120, and 180 BPM within a small tolerance.

Implement occupancy lighting: when motion is detected and ambient light is below a threshold, turn the light on for 30 seconds; if motion continues, extend the timer. Use straightforward timers and conditions. Include a simple safety block to ensure the light turns off after 10 minutes maximum. Add inline tests for single trigger, repeated motion, and bright room cases.

Detect a double clap using a sound sensor: two peaks above a threshold separated by 100 to 500 ms toggle an LED. Ignore single claps. Use a small state machine with timing windows. Include a simple safety block to cap the maximum toggle rate. Add inline tests with single clap, valid double clap, and too-slow or too-fast sequences.

Create a bike speedometer: measure wheel speed from pulse intervals and compute linear velocity in meters per second given wheel circumference in meters. Debounce pulses and handle zero speed. Use clear math and variables. Include a simple safety block that detects implausible speeds above 20 m s and sets speed to zero. Add inline tests with known intervals to verify calculated speed.

Write a stopwatch with start, stop, and reset buttons. Update elapsed time in milliseconds and output the value. Enforce WCET under 1 ms. Include a simple safety block to debounce buttons and prevent time overflow beyond 99,999 ms. Add inline tests for start stop sequences, reset behavior, and boundary near overflow.

Make a countdown timer: adjust minutes with up and down buttons, start the countdown, and sound a buzzer for 3 seconds at zero. Implement fast increment on long press. Use simple loops and conditions. Include a simple safety block to limit the maximum countdown to 30 minutes. Add inline tests for setting time, mid-count adjustment, and buzzer duration.

Design an RGB LED mixer controlled by three sliders for red, green, and blue intensities. Limit the total current by scaling down if the sum exceeds 100 percent. Keep the math readable. Include a simple safety block to ensure each channel stays within 0 to 100 percent. Add inline tests for various color combinations and the scaling behavior.

Control a small heating element to reach and hold 37 Celsius using a PID loop running at 10 Hz. Include anti-windup, a rate limiter on output changes, and a hard safety cutoff at 45 Celsius. Enforce WCET under 0.5 ms. Add inline tests that simulate a step from room temperature, verify settling within 60 seconds, overshoot less than 2 Celsius, and proper cutoff on fault.

Regulate motor speed to 300 RPM using pulse timing feedback and a PID controller at 100 Hz. Stop the motor if no pulses are seen for 500 ms. Include a simple safety block for output saturation and loss of feedback. Add inline tests for step changes from 150 to 300 RPM, a sudden load increase, and a sensor disconnect scenario.

Fuse two temperature sensors: if the readings differ by more than 2 Celsius, flag a fault and use the last trusted value; otherwise output their average. Keep fusion logic clear and commented. Include a simple safety block to handle stale data from either sensor. Add inline tests for matched readings, small differences, and large disagreement.

Estimate tilt angle using a complementary filter that blends gyroscope rate in degrees per second with accelerometer tilt, updating at 100 Hz. Drive an actuator toward level based on the estimate. Clamp the command between 0 and 180 degrees. Enforce WCET under 0.8 ms. Include a simple safety block for sensor timeout. Add inline tests for a tilt step and a constant rate motion.

Combine ultrasonic and infrared distance sensors into a robust estimate in meters: prefer ultrasonic for 0.2 to 3.0 meters, infrared for closer than 0.2 meters, and use a weighted blend where both are valid; flag conflicts if they differ by more than 0.2 meters. Include a simple safety block to handle timeouts. Add inline tests exercising each range and conflicting readings.

Maintain water level at 0.50 meters with a PID controller driving a pump at 20 Hz. Limit pump duty between 0 and 100 percent. Implement safety: stop the pump if level exceeds 0.70 meters or if the sensor fails. Add inline tests that simulate disturbances, setpoint changes, and a sensor fault.

Create a classroom ventilation controller that uses CO2 in ppm and temperature in Celsius. Increase fan speed via a PID when CO2 exceeds 1000 ppm, but reduce speed if temperature drops below 20 Celsius to maintain comfort. Include a simple safety block to enter a safe low-speed mode on any sensor fault. Enforce WCET under 1 ms. Add inline tests for high CO2, cold room, and combined scenarios.

Build a battery monitor that estimates state of charge in percent using measured voltage and integrating current at 10 Hz. Cut off load if voltage falls below 3.2 V to protect the battery. Include a simple safety block to filter spikes and handle negative or impossible values. Add inline tests for discharge and charge cycles, voltage sag events, and the cutoff behavior.

Implement position control of a rotary actuator to a 90 degree setpoint using encoder feedback and a PID loop. Limit maximum velocity to 60 degrees per second. Add a safety interlock to stop on a limit switch. Include inline tests for step response, respecting velocity limits, and correct behavior when the limit switch is triggered.

Create an adaptive brightness controller that fuses ambient light and a user knob into a final LED brightness, with a simple weighted average and a rate limit to avoid visible flicker. Include a simple safety block to handle sensor loss by falling back to the knob. Add inline tests for abrupt light changes, knob adjustments, and sensor fault fallback.

Design a multi-mode classroom climate controller with modes Off, Eco, and Comfort. Use a PID to hold temperature at a setpoint in Celsius and a separate loop to keep CO2 below 1000 ppm by adjusting fan speed. Validate sensors at startup, enter Safe mode on any fault, and enforce a hard heater cutoff at 45 Celsius. Run at 10 Hz with WCET under 0.8 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests for all mode transitions, setpoint changes, and sensor fault injection.

Create an educational line-following demo with modes Calibrate, Follow, and Recover. Fuse two reflectance sensors for line position and use a simple PID on line error in Follow mode. If a forward distance sensor reports an obstacle closer than 0.25 meters, stop. Control loop runs at 50 Hz with WCET under 1 ms. Include a simple safety block for sensor timeouts. Add inline scenario tests covering calibration, normal tracking, obstacle stop, and lost line recovery.

Implement a three-floor elevator simulator with a robust state machine: Idle, Moving, DoorOpen, and EmergencyStop. Handle hall and car calls, enforce door dwell time of 5 seconds, and never move with doors open. Include door obstruction and overload inputs. Add a simple safety block to prevent conflicting commands and to handle emergency stop. Provide thorough inline tests for all transitions, simultaneous calls, obstruction events, and emergency recovery.

Build a high-rate data acquisition demo with modes Idle, Record, and Analyze. Sample two analog channels at 200 Hz, compute running mean and standard deviation, and flag anomalies beyond 3 standard deviations. Guarantee no buffer overflow with a simple safety block. Enforce WCET under 0.6 ms per cycle. Include inline tests for timing accuracy, overflow prevention, and correct anomaly detection on synthetic data.

Create a balance-beam stabilizer demo with modes Tune, Run, and Fault. Estimate tilt using a complementary filter at 200 Hz and drive an actuator with a PID to keep angle within plus minus 2 degrees. Implement safety cutoffs for angle exceeding 20 degrees, sensor timeout over 100 ms, and actuator saturation. Enforce WCET under 0.7 ms. Add comprehensive inline tests for disturbances, mode switching, and injected sensor failures.

Make a simple lesson example: when a button is pressed, turn on an LED; when released, turn it off. Debounce the button (20 ms). Add a simple safety block that forces the LED off if the input reads invalid. Include inline tests simulating press, bounce, and release.

Create a beginner-friendly blinker that flashes an LED at 1 Hz and stops blinking while a button is held. Use basic syntax only, and add inline tests to verify the 500 ms on/off timing and the hold-to-stop behavior.

Read a temperature sensor in Celsius and turn on a fan output when temperature exceeds 30 C, turning it off below 28 C (simple hysteresis). Include a safety block to clamp readings between -20 C and 80 C. Provide inline tests covering boundary values.

Program a buzzer to emit a short beep (200 ms) on each button press (rising edge only). Keep the syntax simple. Add a safety default that silences the buzzer on any fault. Include inline tests with a sequence of presses and holds.

Build a toggle switch behavior: each valid button press inverts the LED state. Debounce at 30 ms. Ensure power-up default is LED off via a safety block. Add inline tests for rapid presses and no double-trigger on hold.

Map a dial input (0–100 percent) to LED brightness (0–100 percent). Clamp out-of-range values and default to 0 on error using a simple safety block. Provide inline tests with representative inputs (0, 50, 100, 120, -10).

Count button presses up to 10 and indicate the count by blinking an LED that many times when a display button is pressed. Include a long-press (1 s) to reset the count. Add inline tests for counting, reset, and debounce.

Make a one-shot timer: after a button press, turn a fan output on for 5 seconds, then off, ignoring extra presses during the interval. Use basic syntax and a safety block that forces off on fault. Include inline tests with early and late presses.

Implement a light threshold detector using a light sensor in lux: turn on an LED above 300 lux and off below 250 lux (hysteresis). Clamp readings 0–10000 lux with a safety block. Add inline tests for crossing points.
Read temperature in Celsius and classify it: below 15 C = "cold", 15–25 C = "comfortable", above 25 C = "warm". Use basic syntax and include inline tests for 14.9, 15.0, 25.0, and 25.1 C.

Generate a PWM output at 500 Hz with duty cycle set by a 0–100 percent dial. Clamp to 0–100 percent and force 0 percent on invalid input via a simple safety block. Provide inline tests for duty values 0, 25, 50, 75, 100, and an out-of-range case.

Alternate two LEDs: A on while B off for 1 second, then swap, repeating. Start with both off for 200 ms on power-up for a self-test. Add inline tests to verify the sequence timing and initial condition.

Design a safety stop example: if any sensor read returns an error flag, all actuators (LED, buzzer, fan) must immediately turn off and remain off until reset. Keep syntax basic. Include inline tests that inject a fault and verify safe behavior.

Create a simple moving average over the last 4 samples of a temperature sensor (C), outputting the integer average. Use a safety block to reject values outside -40 C to 125 C. Provide inline tests with a known sequence.
Build a set/reset latch with two buttons: SET turns the LED on, RESET turns it off. Debounce inputs and ensure both pressed leads to RESET for safety. Add inline tests for each case.

Implement a traffic light state machine for a classroom model: RED (5 s) -> GREEN (7 s) -> YELLOW (2 s) -> RED. A pedestrian button during GREEN should trigger YELLOW at the next safe point. Include a safety block capping any state time at 10 s. Provide inline tests for transitions and button requests.

Create a three-state fan controller: OFF below 22 C, LOW between 22–26 C, HIGH above 26 C with 1 C hysteresis. On sensor fault, default to OFF via a safety block. Include inline tests for threshold crossings and a fault.

Design a water level indicator with two float switches: LOW and HIGH. LED shows GREEN at HIGH, YELLOW at LOW, and RED if LOW is open while HIGH is closed (inconsistent). Use a safety block to handle inconsistent states. Add inline tests.

Build a simple door alarm: when a door switch is open, pulse a buzzer (500 ms on, 500 ms off) until a mute button is pressed. Debounce both inputs. Add inline tests to verify pulsing, mute, and re-arming on next open.

Create a classroom countdown timer: set minutes with a dial (0–10 min), start/stop with a button, and beep once per second when under 10 seconds remaining. Ensure WCET under 5 ms per tick and include inline tests for timing and edge cases.

Implement a rate limiter for a motor command: allow changes no faster than 10 percent every 100 ms. If the command input times out for 500 ms, use a safety block to force the command to 0. Provide inline tests with step inputs.

Demonstrate a simple scheduler: read sensors every 50 ms, update control every 100 ms, and log every 500 ms. Ensure tasks don't overlap. Use basic syntax and add inline tests that check the timing counters.

Compare two temperature sensors in Celsius and raise a fault if they differ by more than 2 C for over 1 second. On fault, set outputs to a safe default via a safety block. Include inline tests for matching and mismatched cases.
Teach debouncing: implement a 20 ms configurable debounce for two buttons and expose clean on/off events. Keep syntax straightforward. Include inline tests with simulated bounce patterns.

Make a servo sweep demo: move from 0 to 180 degrees over 4 seconds, pause 1 second, then back to 0. Clamp commands to 0–180 degrees and stop on fault via a safety block. Provide inline tests for the motion profile and limits.

Write a thermostat with hysteresis: target 22 C with a 0.5 C band, controlling a heater relay. Enforce a minimum off time of 10 s for relay protection. Add inline tests for toggling around the setpoint and the minimum off-time rule.
Create a sound level meter demo: map microphone level in dB to light up 0–5 LEDs. Update at 20 Hz. Saturate readings below 30 dB and above 90 dB. Include inline tests with sample levels.

Build a reaction timer game: after a random delay (1–3 s), turn on an LED and measure time to button press in milliseconds. Categorize results as "fast" (<250 ms), "okay" (250–500 ms), or "slow" (>500 ms). Add inline tests using fixed random seeds.

Implement a simple digital lock: enter a four-press code using two buttons (left/right). State machine handles input, success, failure, and lockout for 30 s after 3 wrong attempts. Provide inline tests for correct, wrong, and lockout paths.

Create a basic step counter: detect steps from an accelerometer magnitude threshold with a 250 ms refractory period to avoid double counts. Include a safety block that ignores NaN or saturated readings. Provide inline tests with a sample waveform.

Make a mini data recorder: store the last 10 temperature readings (C) and compute min, max, and average on demand. Include a clear command. Add inline tests that push known values and verify statistics.

Design a crosswalk demo: a button request triggers a WALK phase with beeps counting down from 10 to 0, then returns to traffic GREEN. Ensure a minimum 5 s vehicle GREEN between requests. Add inline tests for timing and multiple requests.

Implement a soft-start fan: when commanded on, ramp PWM duty from 0 to target over 2 seconds. Limit maximum duty to 80 percent. On any fault, use a safety block to ramp down to 0. Include inline tests for ramp-up, cap, and fault ramp-down.

Create a classroom vote tally: three buttons represent A, B, and C. Count votes over 30 seconds and light the LED of the winner; on ties, flash all three. Handle simultaneous presses fairly. Add inline tests with several voting patterns.

Build an interval beeper: beep every N seconds (1–60) as set by a dial, adjusting smoothly if N changes mid-run. On power-up, play a quick self-test beep pattern. Provide inline tests for N=1, N=10, and a mid-run change.

Teach PID basics: control temperature to 25 C at 1 Hz using a simple PID with anti-windup and actuator limits 0–100 percent. Add a safety condition that cuts output if the sensor jumps more than 5 C/s. Include inline tests with a step change.

Demonstrate a complementary filter: fuse accelerometer and gyroscope data to estimate tilt angle in degrees, updating at 50 Hz. Saturate output to ±90 degrees and fall back to accelerometer-only if gyro is invalid. Provide inline tests with synthetic signals.

Combine two noisy light sensors using a weighted average based on provided variances. Detect and isolate a stuck-at sensor (no change for 5 s) and continue with the healthy one. Use a safety block for fallback. Add inline tests for noise and stuck faults.

Make a line-following demo: compute a steering command from lateral error using proportional control, limited to ±100 percent and a rate limit of 20 percent per 100 ms. Update at 20 Hz. Include inline tests with a series of errors.

Create a 3-floor elevator model state machine: IDLE, MOVING_UP, MOVING_DOWN, DOOR_OPEN. Use door interlocks to prevent motion while open and stop on an overload input. Provide inline tests for floor requests and safety stops.

Control DC motor speed to 300 rpm using a simple PID on pulse feedback. Handle loss of tach signal: if no pulses for 500 ms while commanded, force output to 0 via a safety block. Include inline tests for setpoint steps and tach timeout.

Fuse three temperature sensors (C) using a median filter with outlier rejection if a reading differs by more than 3 C from the median. On one-sample fault, hold last good value. Add inline tests with clean, noisy, and outlier cases.

Control LED brightness to maintain 300 lux at a light sensor using a basic PID at 10 Hz. Clamp the output to 90 percent maximum for safety. Provide inline tests that simulate a disturbance and recovery.

Detect wheel slip by comparing measured wheel speed to a reference: if slip exceeds 10 percent for 200 ms, reduce the command by 30 percent and then recover gradually over 2 seconds. Add inline tests for slip onset and recovery.

Program a small robot arm demo state machine: IDLE (motors off), MOVE (drive to a target angle), HOLD (maintain position). Commands via buttons. Include timeouts and interlocks to avoid motion without a confirmed target. Provide inline tests for all transitions.

Design a multi-mode classroom demo with modes DEMO, NORMAL, and SAFE. DEMO runs a light pattern, NORMAL runs a 22 C thermostat, SAFE forces all outputs off. Transitions via buttons and any detected fault to SAFE. Specify a 100 Hz tick and a WCET budget of 2 ms. Include a global safety block defining safe outputs and comprehensive inline tests for all mode changes and recoveries.

Create a lab bench controller with modes SETUP, RUN, PAUSE, and EMERGENCY. Schedule tasks with deadlines: sensing every 5 ms, control every 10 ms, logging every 100 ms. Include a watchdog and strict input validation. Provide inline tests for meeting deadlines, mode transitions, and EMERGENCY latching on faults.

Build a rover brain with modes IDLE, FOLLOW_LINE, AVOID_OBSTACLE, and SAFE_STOP. Fuse two distance sensors by taking the minimum for obstacle detection. Enforce a safety speed limit of 0.5 m/s and stop within 300 ms on any fault. Include inline tests exercising all mode transitions and safety timing.

Develop an energy lab demonstrator managing two loops: PID lighting to 400 lux and PID fan speed to 250 rpm. Master modes: OFF, AUTO, MANUAL, FAULT. Enforce WCET < 3 ms per cycle at 50 Hz. Include thorough inline tests for PID clamping, manual override behavior, and automatic fault recovery to OFF.

Construct a comprehensive classroom safety relay example: monitor dual emergency stop channels with redundancy and a 100 ms discrepancy window, controlling two actuators with force-guided behavior. Include power-on self-test, periodic proof test every 10 s, and a formal safety block defining fail-safe defaults. Provide exhaustive inline tests for normal runs, channel mismatch, stuck buttons, and recovery rules.

Make a beginner-friendly script that turns on a single LED whenever a pushbutton is held down, with debounce of 30 ms. Add a simple safety block so the LED output is always boolean, and write inline tests that simulate press and release sequences.

Blink one LED at 1 Hz when a slide switch is ON, and keep it OFF when the switch is OFF. Include a safety block limiting duty cycle between 10% and 90%, and inline tests that check timing over 5 seconds.

Read an analog knob (0–1023) and map it to LED brightness from 0% to 100%. Clamp the output and reject any ADC readings outside expected range with a safety check. Provide inline tests with sample inputs 0, 512, 1023, and out-of-range values.

Sound a buzzer when temperature exceeds 30 C and silence it below 28 C (hysteresis). Add a safety block to cap buzzer on-time to 5 s per minute. Include inline tests that sweep temperature from 20 C to 35 C.

Toggle an LED on each valid button press (edge-triggered), with 25 ms debounce and ignore long holds. Add a safety default that the LED is OFF at startup. Include inline tests for bounce and long-press scenarios.

Use a light sensor to turn on a lamp output when ambient drops below a threshold. Include a safety block to avoid rapid toggling by minimum on/off time of 2 s. Add inline tests with light values around the threshold.
When a button is held for 2 s, turn an LED on for exactly 3 s, then return to idle. Enforce safety timeouts so the LED cannot exceed 3 s. Provide inline tests that cover short and long holds.
Set a fan PWM to a fixed 30% duty. When an override button is pressed, switch to 60% duty. Use a safety block to cap duty between 0% and 80%. Add inline tests to verify both levels.
Flash a status LED briefly (100 ms) every 10 s to show the system is alive. Ensure timing accuracy within ±20 ms. Include a simple safety block and inline tests that simulate 30 s of time.
Make a simple alarm: pressing a button triggers a 1 s beep and ignores retriggers during that second. Provide a safety default of buzzer OFF on fault. Include inline tests with rapid presses.
Control a relay output that follows a digital input, with a safety default to OFF at startup and on any error. Add inline tests that verify the fail-safe behavior.

Read a temperature sensor and turn on a 'Too Hot' LED above 32 C. Clamp sensor readings to a safe range and include a safety block that forces the LED OFF if readings are invalid. Provide inline tests with typical and invalid values.
Center a hobby servo by generating a control value corresponding to 1500 microseconds. Apply safety limits of 1000–2000 microseconds. Include inline tests that check the clamping.
Create a metronome LED whose tempo is set by a knob from 40 to 180 BPM. Clamp to this range and smooth sudden changes. Include inline tests with knob positions at endpoints and mid-range.

Flash 'SOS' in Morse code on an LED with a unit time of 200 ms. Include a safety block that prevents unit time from dropping below 100 ms. Provide inline tests that verify the dot-dash sequence length.

Build a small pedestrian crossing demo: state machine with states Idle, Wait, Walk, Flashing. A button requests crossing; use timed transitions. Safety requirement: never show Walk and Vehicle-Green simultaneously. Include inline tests for normal and repeated requests.
Create an up/down dimmer controlled by two buttons. Short press adjusts by 5%, long press ramps. Clamp brightness between 0% and 100% with a safety block. Add inline tests for edge cases.

Use an ultrasonic distance sensor to control beep rate: faster beeps as distance shrinks from 100 cm to 10 cm, steady tone below 10 cm. Include a safety block to bound beep frequency and duty. Provide inline tests with simulated distances.

Make a fan controller with three speeds: 0%, 50%, 100% based on temperatures below 24 C, between 24–28 C, and above 28 C, with 1 C hysteresis. Safety: enforce minimum run time of 10 s per change. Include inline tests.

Detect short press vs long press on a single button and drive two different outputs. Debounce inputs and include a safety default that both outputs are OFF. Add inline tests covering both press types.

Create a simple door alarm: when a magnetic contact opens while 'armed', flash an LED and beep for 5 s. Implement states Disarmed and Armed with a toggle button. Safety: ignore alarm during a 2 s entry delay. Include inline tests.

Reaction timer game: after a random delay (1–3 s), light an LED and measure the time until the button is pressed. Show the measured milliseconds on a simple bar-LED output. Safety: timeout after 5 s. Provide inline tests with simulated reaction times.
Crossfade between two LEDs based on a knob position, so one fades up while the other fades down. Rate-limit changes to avoid flicker. Safety: clamp PWM to 0–100%. Include inline tests.
Drive an RGB LED where three knobs set Red, Green, and Blue. Add a safety block to cap total brightness to 70% to simulate current limiting. Provide inline tests with various combinations.

Control a small pump using a water level sensor: start when level low, stop when level high. Enforce minimum on time of 5 s and minimum off time of 5 s as a safety measure. Include inline tests with bouncing sensor input.
Night-light demo: when the room is dark and motion is detected, fade an LED up for 30 s then fade down. Safety: cap maximum brightness and ignore re-triggers during active period. Add inline tests.
Servo sweep exercise: on start, sweep from 0 degrees to 180 degrees over 4 s and back, and stop when a button is pressed. Safety: limit output to valid servo range. Include inline tests for timing.
Build a 4-step chaser across four LEDs with tempo controlled by a knob. Safety: keep step rate between 0.5 Hz and 5 Hz. Provide inline tests that validate the sequence and limits.

Thermostat demo: knob sets a temperature setpoint from 18 C to 26 C. Heater LED indicates heating when temperature is below setpoint minus 0.5 C; cooling LED indicates cooling above setpoint plus 0.5 C. Safety: never allow both on. Include inline tests.

Keypad code lock simulation: accept a 4-digit code, light 'OK' LED on correct entry, 'Error' LED otherwise. Lock out for 30 s after 3 wrong tries. Safety: clear buffer on timeout. Add inline tests with correct and incorrect sequences.

Sample-and-hold data logger: sample a sensor every 200 ms and keep a rolling window of the last 10 samples, exposed via a debug output. Safety: ensure sampling jitter under 5 ms. Provide inline tests verifying the ring buffer.

Tilt level using a 3-axis accelerometer: compute pitch angle and drive a bar graph LED accordingly. Apply a simple low-pass filter. Safety: saturate angle to ±90 degrees. Include inline tests with synthetic acceleration vectors.
Soft-start fan: when turned ON by a switch, ramp from 0% to 60% over 2 s; when turned OFF, ramp down smoothly. Safety: limit slope to 40%/s. Add inline tests that check ramps.
Switch PWM frequency between 500 Hz and 2 kHz based on a mode input. Ensure the transition occurs at a safe time to avoid glitches. Provide inline tests to confirm correct frequency selection.

Blink two LEDs at different rates (0.5 Hz and 2 Hz) concurrently. Maintain a maximum allowed execution time per tick of 1 ms as a WCET constraint. Include inline tests that verify both rates and the WCET budget.

Closed-loop speed control: read a quadrature encoder and regulate motor speed to a target in RPM using a PID. Safety: cap output 0–80% and stop if no encoder pulses for 500 ms. Include inline tests with a simple simulated motor/encoder model.
PID temperature control to maintain 37.0 C within ±0.5 C. Use anti-windup and a safety overtemperature cutoff at 45 C with a 60 s cooldown lockout. Provide inline tests with a thermal plant model.

Estimate tilt by fusing gyro (deg/s) and accelerometer (g) with a complementary filter, then stabilize a servo to hold level. Safety: bound angle to ±45 degrees and handle sensor dropout. Include inline tests with synthetic motion and noise.

Dual-sensor validation: read two temperature sensors, raise a fault if they differ by more than 2.0 C, otherwise control a heater to 25 C with hysteresis. Safety: heater OFF on fault. Provide inline tests for agreement and disagreement cases.

Maintain water level using an ultrasonic sensor and a pump via a PI controller. Target level given in centimeters. Safety: disable pump if level is below the sensor's minimum range or above maximum. Add inline tests with a simple tank model.

Fan control with feedforward plus PI: map temperature (20–40 C) to a baseline duty, then trim with PI to hit target airflow. Safety: duty limited to 0–90% and rate-limited changes. Include inline tests with a plant model and step changes.

Trajectory follower for a servo position: accept a step command but track it with jerk-limited ramps (bounded acceleration). Run at 100 Hz and ensure WCET under 0.5 ms. Safety: clamp position and velocity. Provide inline tests.

One-dimensional Kalman filter demo combining noisy position and velocity measurements to estimate position. Drive an LED brightness proportional to the estimate. Safety: bound the estimate range. Include inline tests with generated noisy data.

Gain scheduling example: use one set of PID gains for low setpoints and another for high setpoints, switching at 50% with hysteresis. Safety: ensure smooth transition without spikes. Provide inline tests across the boundary.

Fault-tolerant voting: read three independent limit switches and output TRUE if at least two agree. Raise a diagnostic flag if any input is stuck. Safety: default output to FALSE on error. Include inline tests with failure injection.

Multi-mode classroom climate controller with modes Off, Heat, Cool, and Fan. Include interlocks so Heat and Cool can never be active together and enforce a minimum 2-minute off time for the compressor. Run a 1 s control loop with WCET under 2 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests covering mode changes, sensor faults, and timing.

Line-following demo with three reflectance sensors: implement PID on lateral error with selectable modes Safe, Normal, and Aggressive that scale speed and gains. Safety: cap speed to 0.5 m/s and stop on sensor dropout. Include thorough inline tests with a simulated track and noisy sensors.

System with power-on self-test: at startup, test LEDs, buzzer, buttons, and sensors; then enter Normal operation if all pass, else Safe mode. Safety: any runtime fault forces Safe mode with outputs off. Require POST to finish within 2 s. Provide complete inline tests for pass and fail cases.

Task scheduler exercise: schedule sampling at 100 Hz, control at 50 Hz, and logging at 1 Hz. Detect and handle overruns, keeping CPU utilization under 60%. Safety: shed logging first if overloaded. Include comprehensive inline tests that verify rates, WCET limits, and overload recovery.

Mini greenhouse controller with states Idle, Irrigate, Ventilate, and Alarm using temperature (C), humidity (%), and soil moisture. Safety: lock out irrigation for 30 min after each run, raise alarm above 40 C, and fail-safe outputs OFF on sensor errors. Provide thorough inline tests that walk through day/night scenarios and faults.

Teach students basic syntax: when a button is pressed, turn on an LED; when released, turn it off. Add simple debounce and a basic safety block that forces the LED OFF on any fault. Include a couple of inline tests.
Make a heartbeat light that blinks at 1 Hz while an enable flag is true. If any error occurs, a safety block should ensure the LED defaults to OFF. Add inline tests for period and enable handling.
Read a temperature value in Celsius and turn a fan output ON above 30°C and OFF otherwise. Use clear beginner-friendly structure and include inline tests for 29°C, 30°C, and 31°C.
Simple buzzer demo: when a momentary switch is pressed, play a 200 ms beep, then stay silent until the next press. Provide an inline test to check beep duration.

Map a knob (0–100%) to LED brightness (0–100%). Clamp the output to the valid range and include a tiny safety block that shuts the LED off if the input is invalid. Add one inline test for min and max.
Count button presses and display the count on four indicator LEDs (binary). Reset the count when the button is held for 2 seconds. Include inline tests for debouncing and the long-press reset.

Motion light exercise: when a motion sensor triggers, turn a light on for 5 seconds and retrigger if motion happens again. Add basic safety: if the timer misbehaves, turn the light off. Include an inline test.
Freeze alert: if temperature falls below 5°C, sound a beeper until temperature returns to 6°C or above (hysteresis). Keep the logic simple and add a basic inline test.
Double-click practice: toggle a relay only when the button is clicked twice within 400 ms. Any other pattern does nothing. Provide inline tests for success and failure cases.
Light threshold demo: if ambient light exceeds 200 lux, turn OFF the LED; otherwise turn it ON. Include a safety default and inline tests around the 200 lux boundary.
Generate a fixed 1 kHz PWM with 25% duty for a demo output. Make sure a safety block forces duty to 0% if any fault flag is set. Add an inline test that checks duty and frequency.
Metronome: produce a short tick on a buzzer every 500 ms. Include a start/stop boolean and inline tests verifying the interval and start behavior.
Proximity warning: when distance drops below 10 cm, turn a warning LED on; otherwise off. Add a simple safety block that turns it off if the sensor reading is out of range. Provide inline tests.
Scale a sensor reading (0–1.0) to a percentage output (0–100%). Use basic syntax only, saturate at limits, and add an inline test for a mid-scale value.

Safety press-and-hold: drive a motor_enable output HIGH only if a button has been held continuously for 2.0 s; otherwise keep it LOW. Use a small safety block to force LOW on any error. Include inline tests.
Build a mini traffic light with three LEDs cycling Green 5 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 5 s. Include a Pause/Resume button that freezes and resumes the timer. Add inline tests for each state's duration.
