Doorbell finite-state machine: Idle → Chime (play buzzer for 1 s) → Cooldown (ignore presses for 0.5 s) → back to Idle. Add inline tests and a safety block that silences the buzzer on fault.
Two-button counter: Button A increments, Button B decrements a digit shown on a seven-segment display. Clamp between 0 and 9, with debounced inputs. Include inline tests for edges.

Day/night lamp controller: use a light sensor and a manual override switch. In Auto, lamp is ON below 150 lux and OFF above 200 lux (hysteresis). In Manual, follow the switch. Default to OFF in a safety block. Add tests.
Two-speed fan control with temperature in Celsius: OFF below 25°C, LOW from 25–30°C, HIGH above 30°C. Use hysteresis to avoid chatter. Provide inline tests at boundary temperatures.

Pedestrian crossing demo: manage vehicle green/yellow/red LEDs and a pedestrian 'WALK' indicator after a request button press. Enforce precise timings and ensure vehicles get yellow before red. Add timing tests.
Map button hold duration to buzzer pitch: short press gives 400 Hz, long press gives 800 Hz, very long press 1200 Hz. Debounce, categorize durations, and include inline tests.

Soil moisture controller: read two sensors (%). If either is below 30%, open the valve for 10 s, but limit watering to at most once per 5 minutes. Add inline tests and a safety block that closes the valve on fault.

Reaction timer game: Wait random 1–3 s, then turn an LED on; measure response time from LED ON to button press in milliseconds and beep that many short ticks (capped at 10). Include tests for valid ranges.

Simple thermostat: setpoint from a knob (15–30°C). If mode switch is HEAT, drive heater when temperature < setpoint−0.5°C; if COOL, drive fan when temperature > setpoint+0.5°C. Ensure heater and fan are never ON together via a safety block. Add inline tests.
Servo sweep lab: when enabled, move a servo from 0% to 100% over 2 s, pause 0.5 s at ends, and repeat. Emergency stop input forces 50%. Include a safety guard and inline timing tests.
Tap-to-toggle, hold-to-dim lamp: a quick tap toggles ON/OFF; holding changes brightness up/down with wrap-around. Keep state across resets using a retained variable. Provide inline tests.

Water tank pump control: with a low-level float (LL) and a high-level float (HL), start the pump when LL is open and stop when HL closes. Enforce minimum ON/OFF times of 10 s to avoid chattering. Add tests.
Two-button combo lock: press A then B within 2.0 s to toggle an output. Any other sequence resets. Implement as a tiny state machine with inline tests.

Fan health monitor: track average current draw and if it stays above a threshold for 10 s, light a 'filter clogged' LED. Reset when current returns to normal for 20 s. Include tests and a safety default OFF.

Countdown timer: start, stop, and reset buttons control a seconds countdown shown on a small display. Beep at zero, and ignore start if already running. Provide inline tests for transitions and debouncing.

Basic interlock: only run the motor when both guard_closed and start_pressed are true; drop out immediately if either becomes false. Add a safety block that forces motor off on any fault. Include inline tests.
RGB temperature lamp: pick blue below 18°C, green 18–25°C, yellow 25–30°C, red above 30°C; also dim based on ambient light (%) to avoid glare. Add anti-flicker hysteresis and tests.
Event recorder: store up to 8 timestamps of button presses and later replay buzzer beeps at the same intervals when 'play' is pressed. Handle overflow gracefully and include inline tests.

Line follower demo: read left/right reflectance values; if left < right, turn on LEFT indicator, else RIGHT; if equal within a tolerance, show CENTER. Add a calibration mode entered by holding the button 3 s. Include tests.

Beginner PID lab: maintain 37.0°C using a heater output limited to 0–100%. Include anti-windup, output rate limiting, and a safety block that shuts the heater off if temperature exceeds 40°C or the sensor faults. Add inline step-response tests.

Sensor fusion demo: combine two Celsius temperature sensors via a weighted average (e.g., 0.6/0.4) to reduce noise, then control a fan with on/off hysteresis around a 28°C setpoint. Include inline tests and a safety default OFF.

Altitude estimator: fuse barometric pressure (Pa) with vertical acceleration (m/s^2) using a simple complementary filter to output height in meters. Run at 50 Hz with WCET ≤ 2 ms, and include inline tests for step and drift.

Speed control: use a PID to hold 1.00 m/s based on an encoder-derived velocity. Clamp the motor command to safe bounds and add a watchdog that sets output to safe if an update deadline is missed. Provide inline tests.

Dual-sensor occupancy: require both a PIR and a microphone amplitude threshold to be true within 2 s to assert 'occupied'; otherwise ignore. Add debouncing, a false-positive lockout, and a safety block that clears 'occupied' on fault. Include tests.

Thermal chamber demo: PID controls temperature to a setpoint while a safety layer enforces a hard cutoff at 45°C, checks for sensor stuck values, and limits continuous heater on-time to 60 s. Include startup self-test and inline tests.

Sensor validation: read two independent voltage sensors; if they disagree by more than 5%, enter a latched fail-safe state that shuts all outputs and lights an alarm. Provide inline property tests and a manual reset action.

Rate-of-change alarm: low-pass filter temperature and compute dT/dt. If the rate exceeds 2.0°C/s, trigger an alarm; clear it when it falls below 1.0°C/s (hysteresis). Run at 100 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 ms and include tests.

Heading estimator: blend magnetometer heading (degrees) with gyro yaw rate using a complementary filter. Provide a button to calibrate offset, output 0–360°, and use a safety default if sensors saturate. Add inline tests.

Closed-loop light control: measure illuminance (lux) and use a PID to track a setpoint. Limit PWM to 80%, derate brightness if board temperature exceeds 45°C, and ensure a safety fallback to OFF on faults. Include inline tests.

Multi-mode classroom robot demo: Modes are Idle, Manual, and Auto-Patrol. Use a clear state machine, an emergency stop that overrides everything, and a heartbeat monitor. Specify timing (control loop at 20 Hz, WCET 2 ms). Provide exhaustive inline tests for all transitions and safety overrides.

Incubator practice system with modes Warm-up, Regulate, Standby, Fault. Use PID for temperature, verify sensors on startup, and enforce safety (fail-safe off, max heater on-time 60 s). Run at 10 Hz with WCET ≤ 2 ms. Include comprehensive inline tests for mode logic and safety constraints.

Air-quality classroom box: modes Calibrate, Monitor, Alert. Fuse readings from two gas sensors, drive a fan and alarm, and latch alarms until acknowledged. Include a watchdog, tests for sensor dropout/recovery, and explicit safety invariants verified via inline tests.

Mini greenhouse scheduler: manage lights, fan, and pump with Day/Night modes and a Rainy-Day override input. Enforce pump duty limits and soil moisture thresholds in percent. Scheduler runs at 1 Hz. Provide thorough inline tests for each mode and safety rule.

Educational conveyor controller: modes Setup, Run, JamClear, Fault. Use presence, speed, and temperature sensors with simple fusion for reliability; implement interlocks, emergency stop, and deadline enforcement. Require unit tests, property tests, and timing assertions as inline tests.

Write a tiny tutorial exercise: when a pushbutton is held, turn a light on; when released, turn it off. Add a simple safety block to debounce the button for 30 ms and include inline tests that simulate press and release timing.

Make a status light blink at 1 Hz with a 50% duty cycle. Expose a parameter to change the rate between 0.5 Hz and 2 Hz. Include inline tests checking exact on/off durations and a safety clamp on the rate.

Read a temperature value in Celsius and print OK below 30 C and HOT at or above 30 C on a simple text display. Clamp impossible readings below -40 C or above 125 C using a safety block. Provide inline tests for edge cases.

When a motion sensor reports activity, beep a buzzer once for 200 ms, then ignore further triggers for 2 s. Add inline tests for back-to-back motion events and a safety timeout to prevent continuous beeping.
Map a knob position (0 to 100%) to LED brightness (0 to 100%). Saturate out-of-range inputs with a safety block and include inline tests for 0%, 50%, and 100% cases.
Each distinct button press toggles a light on or off. Use rising-edge detection with 20 ms debounce. Include inline tests showing that holding the button does not retrigger.

Simulate a traffic light: green 5 s, yellow 2 s, red 5 s, looping forever. Ensure green and red are never on at the same time via a simple safety interlock. Add inline tests verifying the sequence and durations.
Turn on a nightlight when ambient light drops below 100 lux and turn it off when it rises above 150 lux (hysteresis). Include inline tests for transitions and a safety cap on update rate at 10 Hz.
Build a 5-second countdown timer that beeps once per second and a longer beep at zero. Limit the maximum settable duration to 60 s with a safety block. Provide inline tests for timing accuracy.

Create a door alarm: when a door switch is open, sound an alarm until closed. Add a mute button that silences the alarm for 10 s. Include inline tests for all combinations and a safety latch to prevent auto-unmute while pressed.
If vibration magnitude exceeds a threshold, flash a light rapidly for 1 s. Reject extreme sensor spikes using a safety clamp. Provide inline tests for just-below and just-above threshold events.

When a water sensor detects wet for more than 200 ms, turn on a pump output; turn it off when dry for 200 ms. Add inline tests for chattering signals and a safety block that prevents toggling faster than 5 Hz.

Make a simple number guessing game with two buttons: one increments a guess 0–9, the other submits. Show higher, lower, or correct on a text output. Seed the random target for repeatable inline tests, and add a safety limit of 30 s per round.

Convert a temperature in Celsius to a tri-color indicator: blue below 18 C, green from 18 to 24 C, red above 24 C. Limit updates to 10 Hz in a safety block and include inline tests at boundary values.
Create a metronome that ticks at 120 BPM with start and stop buttons. Ensure the tick handler WCET stays under 2 ms. Include inline tests for tempo accuracy and button debouncing.

Design a small state machine for a pedestrian crossing: default cars green; when the request button is pressed, switch to yellow 3 s, then red 10 s with WALK on, then back to green. Enforce minimum 10 s of green between requests using a safety block. Add inline tests for the full sequence.

Control a classroom light using multiple cues: turn on if motion is detected or sound exceeds 60 dB, but only when ambient light is below 200 lux. After turning on, keep it on for a 30 s cooldown. Include inline tests and a safety cap so it cannot cycle more than once per 5 s.

Make a temperature-controlled fan with four speeds: off below 25 C, low at 25–30 C, medium at 30–35 C, high above 35 C. If the sensor is invalid, default to low speed for safety. Include inline tests for each band and the fault case.

Create a reaction timer game: after a random delay between 1 and 3 s, light an indicator and measure milliseconds until the button is pressed. Reject early button presses. Use a seeded random for inline tests and a safety block to keep the delay within bounds.

Compute heart rate from pulse intervals: detect peaks, calculate beats per minute, and update every 5 s. Reject intervals shorter than 300 ms or longer than 2 s with a safety block. Provide inline tests with sample intervals.
Read a slider and apply a moving average over the last 5 samples before setting LED brightness. Add inline tests demonstrating the smoothing and a safety limit of 50 updates per second.

Run a sprinkler simulation: operate a pump for 30 s every 5 min, with a manual override button to start or stop immediately. For safety, cap total run time to 5 min per hour. Include inline tests for scheduling and override behavior.

Build a thermostat with hysteresis targeting 22 C with a ±0.5 C band. Control separate heater and cooler outputs with an interlock so both cannot be on simultaneously. Include inline tests for rising and falling temperatures.

Create a classroom noise meter: map sound level in dB to a 5-step bar graph. Low-pass filter readings with a 200 ms window and update the display at 10 Hz. Provide inline tests and a safety block for input range 30–100 dB.

Drive a buzzer whose tone increases from 200 Hz to 2000 Hz as a distance sensor reports values decreasing from 200 cm to 10 cm, updating every 50 ms. Clamp the tone within limits using a safety block and add inline tests.
Implement a stopwatch with start, stop, and reset buttons. Show minutes:seconds:centiseconds. Ensure total drift is less than 1% over 60 s. Include inline tests for button sequences and timing.

Mix three color channels from three sliders to produce an RGB output. If the sum would exceed 100% current, normalize the channels proportionally as a safety measure. Add inline tests for several combinations.

Sample temperature once per second and keep min, max, and average over the last 60 samples. Handle startup with no samples without errors. Provide inline tests for rolling updates and a safety check against division by zero.
Control a small motor direction with a forward/backward switch. Require a 100 ms deadtime with outputs off when changing direction. Include inline tests showing the deadtime enforcement.

Create an emergency stop interlock for a student lab. If the E-stop is pressed, immediately disable all actuators and latch until a reset button is used. Provide inline tests and ensure the response happens within 10 ms.

Shake-to-roll dice: when a sudden acceleration spike occurs, display a random number 1–6 and ignore new shakes for 1 s. Use a seeded random source for inline tests and a safety clamp on the sampling rate at 100 Hz.

Simulate a simple line follower logic with two reflectance inputs (left and right): drive left or right motor outputs to steer toward the line, go forward when both see the line. Stop if both read dark for more than 1 s. Include inline tests for several sensor patterns.

Make an alarm clock logic: at a set time (hours and minutes configured with buttons), start a buzzer for up to 10 min or until a stop button is pressed. Debounce all buttons and provide inline tests for setting and alarm handling.

Create a humidity gauge: read %RH and map to a color gradient from blue at 30% to green at 50% to red at 70% and above, with linear interpolation between points. Update at 2 Hz, and include inline tests for mapping accuracy.

Play a three-tone doorbell melody when a sudden increase in light is detected. Add a manual quiet mode toggle that suppresses sound. Ensure the total tone duration never exceeds 5 s via a safety block. Provide inline tests.

Demonstrate PID temperature control for a small heater to maintain 50 C. Provide adjustable P, I, and D gains, limit the output between 0 and 100%, and sample at 5 Hz. Include inline tests showing a step response that settles within 60 s without overshooting by more than 5 C.

Fuse two temperature sensors into a robust reading: reject outliers when the difference exceeds 5 C, otherwise compute a weighted average. Use the fused value to control a heater to 25 C. If disagreement persists, enter a safe default state. Provide inline tests for normal and fault cases.

Estimate tilt angle using accelerometer and gyroscope data with a complementary filter. Output the angle at 50 Hz, bounded to ±90 degrees by a safety block. Include inline tests with known motion sequences.

Create a vending-like state machine: accept coin inputs to reach a target amount, allow a cancel button to refund, and dispense exactly once when the target is reached. Add inactivity timeouts and inline tests covering every transition.

Control fan speed to a setpoint of 3000 RPM using PID based on tachometer pulses. Enforce a maximum acceleration limit and saturate the output 0–100%. Provide inline tests with simulated pulse inputs.

Combine readings from ultrasonic and infrared distance sensors: validate each for plausibility, then take the minimum as the safe distance estimate. Drive a warning output if the estimate is below 20 cm. Include inline tests, including one sensor failing.

Closed-loop line following: compute steering from the difference of left and right line sensors using proportional control. Update at 100 Hz and stop if both sensors report off-line for more than 0.5 s. Provide inline tests for track loss and recovery.

Maintain water tank level at 50% using a simple PI controller with inflow and outflow valves. Sample at 2 Hz, limit the control output, and add an overflow safety that closes valves above 90%. Include inline tests for steps and disturbances.

Use PID to keep ambient light at 200 lux by adjusting a dimmable lamp based on a light sensor. Limit rate of change to avoid flicker and clamp output 0–100%. Provide inline tests for setpoint tracking.

Simulate a 3-floor elevator controller state machine handling up, down, and door buttons. Include door open/close timing, a door interlock that prevents movement when open, and an inactivity timeout. Provide comprehensive inline tests.

Design a multi-mode classroom robot controller with modes: idle, line-follow, and obstacle-avoid. Provide a teacher switch to change modes, a heartbeat indicator at 2 Hz, and an emergency stop that latches. Run the control loop at 50 Hz with WCET under 3 ms. Include extensive inline tests for all mode transitions, E-stop behavior, and boundary cases.

Create a lab climate controller with operating modes off, heat, cool, vent, and auto. Manage heater and fan with strict interlocks, minimum on/off times, and sensor fault fallback. Enforce a main loop rate of 10 Hz and declare WCET targets. Supply comprehensive inline tests that cover every transition and fault path.

Implement a multi-mode data acquisition system: baseline at 10 Hz, burst at 200 Hz for up to 5 s on demand, and low-power at 1 Hz. Use double buffering to avoid data loss, add safety checks for buffer overflow, and timeouts for bursts. Provide detailed inline tests for timing, mode changes, and edge conditions.

Program a two-hand safety control demo: an actuator runs only when two separate buttons are pressed within 0.5 s of each other and held. Detect stuck buttons, handle release order, and enter a fault mode if either input is shorted. Prove behavior with thorough inline tests and timing assertions.

Build an autonomous mini-greenhouse controller with modes germination, growth, and night. Use PID loops for temperature (setpoint 24 C) and humidity (setpoint 60% RH), fuse two sensors for each measurement with outlier rejection, and enforce safe bounds on heaters, humidifiers, and fans. Define a 5 Hz control rate, WCET under 4 ms, and provide broad inline tests including step responses and sensor fault injection.

Create a beginner-friendly classroom exercise: when a pushbutton is held, turn an indicator on; otherwise keep it off. Include a simple safety block that defaults the indicator to off on any error or at startup. Add inline tests that press and release the button and verify the indicator follows.

Build a demo that debounces a button using a 50 ms window and toggles an indicator only on clean rising edges. Add a simple safety block that ignores presses longer than 5 s. Include inline tests covering bounce patterns and long holds.

Read a slider input (0–1023) and map it linearly to a 0–100% brightness value for an indicator. Use a safety block to clamp out-of-range readings. Provide inline tests for min, mid, max, and an out-of-range case.

Make an indicator blink at 1 Hz with a 50% duty cycle. Add a safety block that stops blinking and forces off if a fault flag is set. Include inline timing tests that check on/off durations within ±10%.

Simple threshold demo: if the measured temperature exceeds 30 °C, activate an alarm; otherwise keep it silent. Use a safety block to enforce a minimum 2 s cooldown between alarms. Provide inline tests with temperature steps in °C.

Create a tiny two-state toggle: each clean button press flips an indicator between ON and OFF. Start in OFF. Include a safety block to ensure the state initializes to OFF at power-up. Add inline tests for multiple presses and a reset event.

Compute a moving average of the last 5 samples from a sensor and display the averaged value as a percentage. Use a safety block to discard negative readings. Include inline tests with a known sequence to verify the average.

Map a knob position to a 0–100% output level, then limit the output to 80% whenever a safety flag is active. Implement this with a simple safety block and add inline tests that flip the flag and check the capped value.
Count incoming pulses and show the count modulo 10 on an indicator array. Add a safety block that halts counting if the rate exceeds 200 pulses per second. Provide inline tests with timed pulses.

After power-up, wait 3 seconds, then turn an indicator on and keep it on. Use a safety block to cancel the timer if a cancel input is true. Include inline tests that simulate time progression and cancel behavior.
Read two numeric inputs and output the larger value. Include a safety block that substitutes zero if either input is invalid. Add inline tests for equal values, negative numbers, and invalid data.

Design a simple alarm latch: when vibration exceeds a threshold, set an alarm that stays on until a reset input is received. Add a safety block that auto-clears the alarm after 10 s if no vibration persists. Include inline tests for trigger, latch, and timeout.

Create a unit conversion demo that converts temperature from Celsius to Fahrenheit and back, echoing both values. Use a safety block to clamp Celsius between −40 °C and 125 °C. Provide inline tests with edge and mid-range values.

Generate a repeatable random-looking blink sequence seeded by a classroom 'seed' input so students can compare runs. Add a safety block that forces a fixed pattern when test_mode is true. Include inline tests to verify determinism.

Build a light/dark classifier: if ambient light falls below a threshold, set 'night' true; otherwise 'day' true. Add a safety block to allow manual override to 'day'. Provide inline tests around the threshold and with override active.

Simulate a single-direction traffic light with states Green → Yellow → Red, with a pedestrian request that shortens Green. Use a clear state machine. Add a safety block that prevents skipping Red. Include inline tests checking state durations and button requests.

Create a door controller: while 'open' button held, increase position; while 'close' held, decrease; stop at 0% and 100% limits. Add a safety block that stops movement immediately if an overcurrent flag is set. Provide inline tests for limit handling and safety trips.

Require both a motion sensor and a door switch to be active within 2 seconds to trigger an alarm. If only one triggers, do nothing. Use a small state machine and a safety block with a 5 s cooldown after any alarm. Add inline tests with varied timing.

Make a thermostat with hysteresis: turn the heater on below 20.0 °C and off above 22.0 °C. Include a safety block that limits continuous heater on-time to 15 minutes. Provide inline tests for temperature sweeps and timeout.

Implement a rate limiter that changes an output no faster than 10 units per second, given a target input. Use a safety block to cap the output between 0 and 100. Include inline tests with step inputs and time-based checks.

Build a tiny scheduler that runs Task A at 10 Hz and Task B at 1 Hz. Add a safety block that enforces WCET limits of 2 ms for A and 5 ms for B, logging a fault if exceeded. Include inline tests verifying tick counts and fault behavior.

Create a mini 'Simon says' memory game with 4-step sequences: present cues, then check button inputs against the sequence. Use a simple state machine, a safety block for a per-step timeout, and inline tests that cover both success and failure paths.

Control a tank fill using two float switches: start filling when the lower switch is low, stop when the upper switch goes high. Add a safety block with 200 ms debounce to prevent chatter. Provide inline tests for bouncing inputs.

Crossfade between two sensor inputs using a blend knob (0.0 to 1.0), outputting y = (1−k)a + k b. Use a safety block to clamp k within [0,1]. Include inline tests for k = 0, 0.5, 1 and out-of-range values.

Create a three-stage process timer: Preheat for 5 s, Run for 20 s, Cooldown for 10 s, then stop. Allow a cancel input at any time. Use a safety block to ensure outputs are off when stopped. Add inline tests for stage transitions and cancel.

Fuse two temperature sensors by averaging their readings; if they disagree by more than 2.0 °C, raise a fault and hold the last good average. Implement a simple safety block for this behavior and add inline tests with mismatched sensor scenarios.

Log the timestamps of the last 10 button presses (in milliseconds since start). Use a safety block to avoid memory growth beyond 10 entries. Include inline tests that press the button 12 times and verify eviction of the oldest entries.

Control a fan speed based on temperature: map 25 °C to 0% duty and 60 °C to 100% duty, linearly. Add a safety block enforcing a minimum duty of 20% whenever the fan is enabled. Provide inline tests for mapping endpoints and midpoints.

Read a rotary encoder to increment or decrement a value from 0 to 99 with proper debouncing. Add a safety block to clamp the value within bounds. Include inline tests with forward and reverse rotations and bounce patterns.

Given left and right light sensors, set 'turn' to LEFT if left is brighter, RIGHT if right is brighter, and STRAIGHT if within 5% of each other. Use a safety block to handle missing data. Provide inline tests covering all three outcomes.

Make an indicator blink slowly (0.5 Hz) during normal operation and quickly (4 Hz) when an 'alert' input is true. Add a safety block to revert to slow after 30 s of continuous alert. Include inline tests for timing and revert behavior.

Implement a soft-start ramp: when enabled, increase output from 0 to the target over 3.0 seconds; when disabled, ramp down to 0 over 1.0 second. Use a safety block to force output to 0 on fault. Add inline time-based tests.

Design a deadman enable: the output is true only while a button is held and a heartbeat signal arrives at least at 5 Hz. Add a safety block that disables output if no heartbeat for 300 ms. Provide inline tests with varying heartbeat intervals.

Filter noisy readings by computing the median of 3 samples collected every cycle. Add a safety block to replace non-numeric or missing values with the last valid sample. Include inline tests with outliers and NaN cases.

Teach proportional control: set output = k*(setpoint − measurement), with k configurable, and saturate output to 0–100. Use a safety block that zeros output if the error exceeds 100 units. Add inline tests for gains, saturation, and safety trip.

Demonstrate PID temperature control to hold 25.0 °C using a sample rate of 10 Hz. Include anti-windup and output limits (0–100%). Add a safety block that shuts everything down if temperature exceeds 35.0 °C. Provide inline step-response tests.

Estimate tilt angle by fusing gyroscope and accelerometer data using a complementary filter at 100 Hz (e.g., 98/2 split). Add a safety block to bound the angle within −90° to +90°. Include inline tests with synthetic motion profiles.

Fuse two sensors providing the same quantity by weighting them inversely to their variance; update variances online from recent samples. Add a safety block that ignores a sensor when its variance is zero or NaN. Provide inline tests with changing noise levels.

Control velocity in m/s using a PID loop with a rate limit on acceleration of 0.5 m/s² and output bounds. Add a safety block that commands zero velocity when an emergency_stop input is true. Include inline tests with setpoint steps and disturbances.

Implement a robust state machine with states RUN, PAUSE, and FAULT. Ensure outputs are disabled in FAULT, and only a reset can leave FAULT. Add a safety block to log and latch faults on specific error inputs. Provide inline tests for all transitions.

Create a periodic scheduler with three tasks at 1 ms, 10 ms, and 100 ms periods; enforce per-task WCET budgets and raise a fault on deadline miss. Add a safety block that degrades gracefully by skipping lower-priority tasks when overloaded. Include inline tests simulating overruns.

Monitor sensor health: if a reading remains unchanged beyond 5.0 seconds, declare it stuck and switch to a backup reading. Add a safety block to flag the fault and limit output changes during switchover. Provide inline tests covering detection and recovery.

Maintain 1.0 m spacing to a moving target by controlling speed with a PID on distance error, limited to 0.3 m/s maximum speed. Add a safety block that halts if distance falls below 0.2 m. Include inline tests for approaching and following scenarios.

Perform startup auto-calibration: collect 100 samples over 1.0 second to compute offset and scale, then apply them to subsequent readings. Add a safety block that times out after 1.0 second and uses default calibration. Provide inline tests verifying the math.

Estimate battery state-of-charge using coulomb counting blended with an open-circuit voltage correction every 60 s. Add a safety block that cuts off load below 10% SoC. Include inline tests with charge/discharge cycles and corrections.

Design a multi-mode climate controller with modes OFF, ECO, COMFORT, and FAULT. Use hysteresis control in ECO and PID at 10 Hz in COMFORT to hold a setpoint in °C. Enforce WCET limits and mutual exclusivity of heater and fan via a safety block. Require comprehensive inline tests for mode transitions, setpoint changes, and injected faults.

Create a small autonomous mission demo with phases INIT, EXPLORE, and RETURN. Use a state machine, fuse position from odometry and a beacon signal, and use PID to hold heading. Add a safety block implementing a 5 m geofence and a failsafe return. Include thorough inline tests for nominal runs and fault cases with timing constraints.

Build a conveyor-style sequence controller with modes MANUAL, AUTO, and E-STOP. Coordinate three sensors for start, part-in-place, and jam detection; interlock actuators to ensure safe sequencing. Enforce a 20 Hz watchdog and 1 ms WCET per tick with a safety block. Provide comprehensive inline tests including race conditions and E-STOP.

Implement a power management demo with modes SLEEP, IDLE, and ACTIVE. Schedule tasks with deadlines, scale output duty based on computed load, and limit current to 2.0 A as a safety constraint. Add a safety block that prevents brownout by shedding load. Include inline tests for mode coverage and limit enforcement.

Capstone greenhouse controller for class: modes GERMINATE, GROW, HOLD. Maintain temperature (°C) with PID and humidity (%) with on/off control, sample at 5 Hz. Fuse two temperature sensors, detect sensor faults, and specify WCET budgets. Add safety blocks for heater runtime limits and humidity overshoot prevention. Require extensive inline tests including edge cases and failure injection.

Create a beginner-friendly blink demo: flash an LED at 1 Hz with a 50 percent duty cycle. Add a simple safety block that prevents the blink rate from exceeding 5 Hz even if a variable is mis-set. Include inline tests that verify on and off durations stay within 10 percent of the target over 10 cycles.

Make a basic button-to-light exercise: when the button is held, the LED is on; when released, it is off. Use a safety block to debounce for 20 ms and ignore pulses shorter than that. Add inline tests simulating bounce sequences to confirm stable LED behavior.

Write a small classroom alarm: if temperature exceeds 30 C, sound a buzzer for 1 second. Include a simple safety check that caps any continuous buzzer time to 2 seconds. Provide inline tests for values at 29.9 C, 30.0 C, and 31.5 C.

Build a light-activated lamp demo: if measured light is below 100 lux, turn on the LED; above 120 lux, turn it off. Implement hysteresis to prevent flicker and a safety default to off on sensor fault. Add inline tests for transitions and fault handling.

Create a simple counter that blinks the LED N times each time a button is pressed, where N increments from 1 to 5 then wraps. Add a safety block to ignore presses longer than 2 s. Include inline tests to verify wraparound and debounced counting.

Design a toggle light: each valid button press inverts the LED state. Debounce for 200 ms and add a safety block that prevents toggling more than 5 times per second. Provide inline tests for single, double, and rapid press scenarios.

Map an analog input (0 to 100 percent) to LED brightness. Add a safety rate limiter so brightness changes no faster than 20 percent per second. Include inline tests that step the input and verify the limited slope.

Make a metronome beeper that ticks every 500 ms. Enforce a WCET under 2 ms for the periodic task and add a safety block that ensures minimum tick spacing of 300 ms. Add inline tests checking period error within ±5 ms across 10 ticks.

Write a proximity alert: if distance is less than 20 cm, turn on a buzzer for 200 ms. Add a safety timeout so stale sensor values older than 250 ms are treated as invalid. Provide inline tests for 15 cm, 25 cm, and stale data cases.

Create a door indicator using a single contact sensor: green LED when closed, red LED when open. If the sensor reports an error, default to red as a safety stance. Include inline tests for closed, open, and error states.

Build a heartbeat LED with a pattern of two quick blinks every 2 seconds. Add a safety guard that prevents any blink train from exceeding 10 Hz total toggles. Include inline tests to verify pattern timing and spacing.

Make a simple clap trigger using a digital sound threshold input: when a rising edge occurs, turn the LED on for 200 ms. Add a safety refractory period of 300 ms to avoid retriggers. Provide inline tests with closely spaced edges.

Create a temperature-to-color demo: below 20 C light blue, 20–25 C green, above 25 C red. Include a safety default to blue if the sensor is invalid. Add inline tests at 19.9 C, 22 C, 25.1 C, and invalid reading.

Implement a simple stopwatch: a button starts and stops timing, and while running the LED blinks once per second. Add a safety limit that caps maximum run time to 10 minutes. Include inline tests for start, stop, and overrun behavior.

Write an alarm latch: on sensor trip, the LED latches on and stays on until a reset button is pressed. Add a safety block disallowing latch if reset is being held. Provide inline tests for trip, latch, and reset sequences.

Simulate a traffic light with states Green 5 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 5 s driving three LEDs. Include a safety assertion that Yellow and Green are never on together. Add inline tests verifying the full cycle timing and order.

Make a two-button combo challenge: only if button A is pressed then button B within 3 seconds does the LED turn on. Reset state after 10 seconds of inactivity. Add a safety block that clears state on any fault. Provide inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences.

Create a classroom fan demo where temperature from 20 to 35 C maps linearly to PWM 0 to 80 percent. Add a safety clamp that turns the fan off below 18 C and never exceeds 80 percent. Include inline tests checking mapping at endpoints and midpoints.

Control a rotary actuator angle from a knob input, mapping 0–100 percent to 0–180 degrees. Add a safety clamp to restrict motion to 10–170 degrees to protect end stops. Include inline tests for linearity and clamping at extremes.

Build a reaction time game: after a random delay between 1 and 3 seconds, turn on an LED; the student presses a button and a buzzer beeps once per 100 ms of reaction time. Add a safety anti-cheat: if the button is pressed early, restart with a penalty. Provide inline tests simulating early press and valid responses.

Create a crosswalk simulation: cycle Green 6 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 6 s, and when a button is pressed, schedule a walk phase that extends Red by 4 s. Add a safety rule that minimum Red is 4 s. Include inline tests for button timing effects.

Develop a hysteresis thermostat: turn heater on below 22.5 C and off above 23.5 C, aiming at 23 C. Add a safety timer that forces a 5 s rest after any 60 s continuous on-time. Provide inline tests that step through temperatures and check rest enforcement.

Make a simple data sampling demo: sample two analog channels at 20 Hz and compute a 10-sample moving average for each. Add a safety block rejecting any sample more than 3 standard deviations from the current average. Include inline tests with crafted sequences including outliers.

Write a water level control state machine with states Fill, Idle, and Alarm using two discrete level sensors (low and high). Safety: turn off the output if sensor combinations are inconsistent. Add inline tests for normal fill and sensor mismatch.

Create a soft-start dimmer: when turning on, ramp LED brightness from 0 to target over 2 seconds; when turning off, ramp down over 2 seconds. Add a safety limit of 60 percent per second max rate. Include inline tests measuring ramp slopes and durations.

Design a bumper-logic demo with two bump sensors: if left is hit, turn on right LED; if right is hit, turn on left LED; if both are hit, sound a buzzer. Add 50 ms debounce as a safety. Provide inline tests for all combinations.

Implement a tiny scheduler: run Task A at 10 Hz and Task B at 1 Hz. Add a safety assertion that Task A WCET stays under 1 ms and Task B under 3 ms. Include inline tests confirming correct call counts over 5 seconds.

Build a pulse counter that counts rising edges up to 999, then wraps to 0 on overflow. Add a safety filter to ignore pulses faster than 1 kHz. Provide inline tests for counting, overflow, and high-rate rejection.

Create a light-following demo using two light sensors left and right: increase the corresponding LED brightness toward the brighter side. Add a 10 percent deadband to avoid jitter as a safety. Include inline tests that check symmetric and asymmetric inputs.

Program a Morse code sender that repeatedly plays SOS on a buzzer. Add a safety rule that total buzzer on-time does not exceed 50 percent in any 1 s window. Provide inline tests verifying dot, dash, and spacing durations.

Write a doorbell with hold behavior: pressing the button plays a tone up to 2 seconds; if held longer, enforce a 1 second cooldown before it can play again. Add inline tests for short press, long press, and cooldown.

Create a color cycle lamp that fades through the RGB spectrum over 10 seconds and repeats smoothly. Include a safety guard to limit channel update rate to one step per 10 ms. Add inline tests ensuring continuity and cycle period.

Make a time-of-day demo: at the start of each minute, pulse an LED for 100 ms. Add a safety backstop using a monotonic timer so that if the clock jumps backward, the pulse still occurs once per minute. Include inline tests with simulated clock changes.

Implement a press handler with short and long press: short press toggles LED, long press (>1 s) forces LED off. Add a safety lockout of 200 ms after any release. Provide inline tests spanning edge timing around 1 s.

Create a two-sensor logic demo: LED on only if both sensors are high, unless an override switch is active, in which case LED on if either sensor is high. Add a safety default to off on any sensor fault. Include inline tests for all combinations and a fault case.

Develop a PID temperature controller to hold 40 C with a heater output (0–100 percent). Include anti-windup, output saturation, and a safety cutoff if the sensor is missing or if temperature exceeds 45 C. Run at 10 Hz with WCET under 2 ms. Add inline tests for step response and fault cutoff.

Create a PID speed control demo that tracks a target speed in m/s from a knob input. Clamp the target to 0–1.5 m/s and limit output to 70 percent as a safety. Provide inline tests expecting settling within 2 s for a small step and no overshoot beyond 10 percent.

Implement a complementary filter estimating tilt angle by fusing accelerometer (degrees) and gyro (deg/s) at 50 Hz with alpha 0.98. Add a safety check that if data is stale for more than 100 ms, hold the last good angle. Include inline tests with synthetic rotations and pauses.

Write a sensor fusion average for three temperature sensors: compute a median-based value in Celsius and reject outliers. Add a safety alarm if two or more sensors disagree by over 2 C. Include inline tests with consistent and outlier datasets.

Build a two-loop control demo: an outer PI loop maintains liquid level at a setpoint in cm by commanding a valve opening, while an inner limiter enforces a maximum rise rate of 5 cm/s. Add safety to shut the valve on level sensor fault. Provide inline tests for steps and rate limiting.

Create a line-tracking error estimator using two light sensors that outputs a normalized error from -1.0 (far left) to +1.0 (far right). Add safety saturation and hold the last valid value if inputs are invalid. Include inline tests for balanced and extreme cases.

Implement position control in 0–100 units with model-based feedforward plus PID feedback. Include soft limits and an emergency stop input that forces output to zero immediately. Run at 100 Hz with WCET under 1 ms. Add inline tests for step tracking and emergency stop response.

Create a scalar estimator that tracks room temperature with noisy sensor input and a slow bias drift, using a simple Kalman-like update. Add a safety bound on variance and reset the filter on divergence. Provide inline tests with seeded noise and a bias step.

Build a gain-scheduled PID heater: use one set of gains below 30 C and another above, with 2 C hysteresis to prevent chatter. Add safety saturation and a sensor-fault fallback that disables output. Include inline tests verifying gain switches and hysteresis behavior.

Develop a multi-sensor attitude demo that fuses 3-axis acceleration and gyro to estimate roll angle in degrees. Run at 200 Hz with a WCET budget of 0.5 ms and a safety monitor that times out if any sensor is stale for 200 ms. Add inline tests for steady-state and step rotations.

Build an educational attitude control mock-up with modes Stabilize, Acro, and Disarm. Use complementary fusion at 250 Hz for roll/pitch, PID holds angles in Stabilize, and rate control in Acro. Safety includes bounded commands, a two-button arming sequence, auto-disarm after 10 s inactivity, and a Safe mode on sensor timeout. WCET budget 0.8 ms. Add inline tests for arming, sensor loss, angle step response, and mode switches.

Design a classroom conveyor demo with modes Idle, Feed, JamClear, and Stop. Use two optical sensors to detect items, drive the motor with soft-start, and detect jams if movement stops for 2 s. Safety: emergency stop input, current-limit proxy via 60 percent duty cap, and allow JamClear only while Stop is held. Run Feed tasks at 50 Hz with WCET < 1 ms. Provide inline tests for normal flow, jam detection, emergency stop, and invalid jam clear attempts.

Create a smart lab fan system with modes Setup, Learn, Auto, Manual, and Fault. Learn mode identifies a simple gain by stepping output and observing speed in RPM; Auto uses PI control with rate limits to track a target RPM. Safety includes sensor plausibility checks, default to Fault on missing feedback, and decay outputs to zero within 300 ms on any fault. Control at 100 Hz with WCET 0.8 ms. Add inline tests validating learning completion, PI convergence, and fail-safe decay timing.

Create a beginner-friendly ReflexScript that turns on an indicator light when a pushbutton is pressed and turns it off on release. Use very basic syntax, add a simple safety block that defaults the light to OFF at startup and on any input error, and include inline tests for press, hold, and release.

Write a tiny ReflexScript that blinks an indicator at 1 Hz. Add a toggle switch to start/stop the blinking. Include a simple safety guard so the indicator is OFF if the switch is undefined, and provide inline tests for timing and switch transitions.

Make a classroom demo that reads a light sensor and turns on a lamp when the reading is below a set threshold. Sample at 5 Hz, expose the threshold as a constant, clamp invalid sensor values in a safety block, and include inline tests at and around the threshold.

Build a simple ReflexScript where pressing a button beeps a buzzer exactly once, and it won’t beep again until the button is released. Add a safety condition to suppress output if the button appears stuck for more than 2 seconds. Include inline tests with a simulated bounce sequence.

Create a basic counter that increments every second and resets when a reset button is pressed. Show the count on three indicator LEDs in binary. Use simple syntax, ensure a safety fallback that resets on overflow, and add inline tests for timing and reset behavior.

Write a small lesson script that reads temperature in Celsius and turns on a warning light above 30 °C. Include a safety block that clamps any invalid readings to a safe range (−10 to 60 °C), and add inline tests for 29.9, 30.0, and 30.1 °C.

Make a debounced button demo: use a 20 ms debounce window to toggle an indicator each time the button is pressed. Default the indicator to OFF in a safety block. Provide inline tests showing bounce events and the expected single toggle.

Create a simple analog-to-brightness mapper where a knob controls an indicator from 0% to 100%. Saturate out-of-range inputs in a safety guard. Include inline tests at 0%, 50%, and 100% mapping points.

Write a periodic timer demo that triggers a short beep every 10 seconds. Specify a worst-case execution time (WCET) budget of under 2 ms per cycle and include inline tests verifying the schedule and WCET constraint.

Create two-button control: one button forces a light ON, the other forces it OFF. Ensure mutual exclusion and that the last command wins. Add a safety default of OFF on startup and include inline tests for each button and simultaneous presses.

Build a one-step 'Simon says' activity that flashes a color, waits for the matching button, and then shows a success indicator. Keep the state machine minimal. Add a safety timeout (5 s) that resets the round, and include inline tests for correct and incorrect responses.

Write a temperature threshold alarm: when temperature exceeds 37 °C, pulse a buzzer for 5 seconds then mute. Sample at 1 Hz, ignore brief spikes via a simple safety filter, and add inline tests around 36.9–37.1 °C and the 5-second pulse duration.

Create a simple stopwatch: start/stop with a button; while running, an indicator blinks fast (4 Hz), otherwise slow (1 Hz). Add a safety auto-stop at 60 seconds, and include inline tests for start, stop, and timeout.

Make a motion-triggered light: when a motion sensor activates, turn on a lamp for 15 seconds, retriggering allowed. Add a safety guard to prevent toggling faster than once per second, and include inline tests with back-to-back activations.

Build a sound-threshold demo: if sound level exceeds a threshold, toggle an LED. Use 5 dB hysteresis to avoid chatter. Add a safety clamp for unrealistic values and include inline tests demonstrating hysteresis behavior.

Design a simple traffic light state machine for a two-way intersection with a pedestrian button. Define green/yellow/red durations, guarantee a minimum walk time, and add a safety fallback that forces all-red on any fault. Include inline tests for common sequences.

Create a fan control where two temperature sensors are read and the higher value is used. Turn the fan ON above 28 °C and OFF below 26 °C. Run at 2 Hz, detect a failed sensor in a safety block, and include inline tests for sensor mismatch cases.

Build a dimmable classroom lamp with two modes: Manual (knob sets brightness) and Auto (ambient light feedback keeps a target level). Use a mode button to switch, default to Manual in a safety block, and include inline tests for mode changes and clamping.

Make a door buzzer with a grace period: when the door opens, start a 10-second timer; if it remains open when time expires, beep until the door closes or a silence button is pressed. Add a safety reset on sensor error and inline tests for each path.

Write a water level indicator using two float switches: green light for OK (high), red for low, and blink red if the switches report an impossible combination. Latch low-level alarms until acknowledged. Add inline tests and a safety block that handles undefined inputs.

Create a reaction timer game: after a random delay between 1 and 3 seconds, turn on a light; measure the time until the button is pressed and categorize the result. Provide a fixed seed for randomness in inline tests, and include a WCET note for timing reliability.

Build a metronome that ticks at a tempo set by a knob from 40 to 200 BPM. A button starts/stops the ticks. Constrain tempo to valid bounds in a safety block and provide inline tests for boundary and mid-scale tempos.

Write a simple thermostat with 0.5 °C hysteresis that drives a heater to maintain a setpoint. Sample at 5 Hz, cut out safely if temperature exceeds 45 °C, and include inline tests that show on/off transitions with hysteresis.

Create a mock door lock state machine with states: Locked, Unlocked, and Alarm. A sequence of four buttons must be pressed in order; three wrong attempts trigger Alarm. Auto-relock after 30 seconds. Include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences and safety resets.

Build a two-player quiz buzzer: the first button pressed locks out the other and lights the winner’s indicator until reset. Debounce both inputs, handle ties within 10 ms, and include inline tests covering simultaneous presses and reset.

Design a small elevator demo for three floors: request buttons per floor, movement indicators, and a state machine that serves requests in order. Ignore invalid moves in a safety guard. Provide inline tests for single and multiple requests.

Create a crosswalk controller: when the pedestrian button is pressed, schedule a walk phase with audible beeps for at least 7 seconds, then a flashing don’t-walk. Allow button holds. Add a safety early abort only on an emergency signal, and inline tests for timing.

Write a greenhouse vent control: open the vent when temperature > 32 °C or humidity > 80%, otherwise close. Rate-limit vent actuation to at most once every 30 seconds. Use a safety default to closed and include inline tests for threshold crossings and rate limits.

Build a classroom timer with a settable duration from 1 to 15 minutes via a knob. Start, pause, and reset with buttons; beep at the end. Enforce bounds in a safety block and add inline tests for minimum, maximum, and mid-duration cases.

Create a color mixing demo where three sliders control red, green, and blue indicators scaled 0–255. Clamp all inputs in a safety guard. Include inline tests verifying end-to-end mapping for each channel.

Make a tilt alarm: if tilt angle exceeds 15 degrees, sound a beep; if angle returns within 15 degrees and stays stable for 5 seconds, stop. Use simple filtering at 50 Hz and include a safety block to bound angles. Provide inline tests with noisy data.

Write a handwashing helper: when proximity is detected, run a 20-second sequence with progress blinks and a final beep, ignoring retriggers while active. Add a safety timeout to recover from stuck sensors and include inline tests for retrigger attempts.

Build a Morse code trainer: detect dots and dashes from a button based on press duration, decode letters A–Z, and indicate recognized letters. Use a 1-second inter-symbol timeout. Clear partial input after long idle in a safety block. Include inline tests for a few letters.

Create a speed monitor using wheel pulse input: compute speed in m/s and light a warning if speed exceeds 5.0 m/s. Sample at 100 Hz, handle missing pulses safely, and include inline tests for low, boundary, and high speeds.

Write a simple data logger: every 2 seconds record temperature and light level into a ring buffer of 60 samples. A button displays min and max values using indicators. Add bounds checks in a safety block and inline tests for buffer wrap-around.

Design a three-sensor voter: read three temperature sensors, compute the median, and alarm if any sensor deviates by more than 3 °C from the median. Sample at 1 Hz, set a degraded-mode flag in a safety block, and include inline tests for outliers.

Implement PID temperature control to hold 37.0 °C using a heater output. Sample at 5 Hz, include anti-windup, and enforce a safety cutoff above 40.0 °C. Provide inline tests for step response with an overshoot limit.

Create a line-following concept demo: two reflective sensors provide left/right signals; compute an error and apply proportional control to left/right speed commands. Update at 50 Hz, stop safely if sensors are lost, and include inline tests with a simple S-curve path.

Build a complementary filter to fuse a fast gyroscope rate with a slow angle estimate, producing a smoother angle output. Update at 100 Hz, bound outputs in a safety guard, and include inline tests with step and drift scenarios.

Write an altitude estimation demo that fuses barometer and accelerometer using a simple confidence-weighted update. Run at 25 Hz, detect spikes in a safety block, and include inline tests with noisy sensor sequences.

Implement PID speed control to maintain 2.0 m/s based on pulse timing. Run the control loop at 100 Hz with WCET < 2 ms. Shut down safely on stall detection and include inline tests for step changes and stall.

Create an adaptive light threshold: compute a moving average of ambient light and turn the lamp on when the reading is below average minus 10%. Provide a safety fallback to a fixed threshold if recent data are insufficient. Include inline tests for changing conditions.

Build a sensor watchdog: monitor a data stream and flag a fault if updates stop for more than 500 ms. Force all outputs to a safe state on fault. Include inline tests for normal operation, late updates, and recovery.
Write a rate limiter: ensure a brightness command from a knob changes no faster than 10% per second. Add saturation safety checks and include inline tests showing step inputs being slew-limited.

Design a two-loop control demo: an outer loop keeps a water level near the midpoint using simple hysteresis on a level sensor; an inner PID loop regulates inflow based on a flow sensor. Run at 10 Hz, add an overflow safety cutoff, and include inline tests.

Create a sensor calibration routine: on a calibrate command, collect 100 samples, compute offset and scale, and store them. If variance is too high, reject calibration in a safety block. Provide inline tests for stable and noisy data.

Build a multi-mode classroom demo with modes Demo, Interactive, and Safe. Long-press cycles mode; short-press toggles run/pause. Each mode drives lights and buzzer differently. A global safety condition forces Safe mode on any sensor fault. Include inline tests for all mode transitions and fault recovery.

Develop a comprehensive traffic controller with Normal, Night (flashing), and Emergency (all red) modes. Inputs include vehicle presence, pedestrian request, and emergency signal. Target WCET 1 ms at 50 Hz, include a watchdog and inline tests for timing, starvation prevention, and failover.

Create a bench-top altitude-hold simulator with modes: Off, Hold, and Landing. Fuse barometer and accelerometer for altitude, use PID for hold, and enforce a 0–3 m safety geofence. Loss of either sensor forces Landing. Provide extensive inline tests and parameter sanity checks.

Design a classroom safety interlock framework: any activity output is gated by a master enable, an emergency stop, and a watchdog timeout. Include a small demo (heater and motor outputs) that uses the interlock. Provide exhaustive inline tests for all interlock paths, timing, and recovery from faults.

Show basic syntax by writing a tiny ReflexScript that turns on an indicator when a pushbutton is pressed. Include a simple safety block to ensure the output defaults to OFF on startup and after any fault, and add a couple of inline tests for pressed and not pressed cases.

Create a beginner-friendly example that reads temperature in Celsius and turns a fan output ON when it reaches 30 C, OFF below 28 C (hysteresis). Clamp the sensed value to 0–100 C in a safety block and include inline tests for boundary values.
Map a 0–100% slider input to LED brightness. Use a safety block to limit brightness to 0–80% for demo safety, and include inline tests that check 0%, 50%, and 120% inputs.

Blink an LED once per second as a classroom heartbeat. Ensure the timing stays within ±5% and add a safety block that stops blinking and turns the LED OFF if an error flag is set. Include inline tests that validate two consecutive toggles.

When a button is tapped, turn on a buzzer for exactly 300 ms, then turn it off. Add a simple safety block to prevent retriggering more than once per second. Provide inline tests that simulate quick repeated taps.

Read a light sensor value and set an LED to ON when it drops below a threshold, OFF otherwise. Use a safety block to debounce the decision by 50 ms and add inline tests for noisy flicker around the threshold.

Build a simple up-counter that increments on each rising edge of a pulse input and drives a 4-step indicator (0–3). Include a safety block that saturates the count at 3 and inline tests to verify wrap prevention.
Implement a toggle: each valid button press flips an LED state. Debounce for 30 ms in a safety block and add inline tests to verify no double-toggles from chatter.

Turn a pump output ON when soil moisture is below 35% and OFF when it rises above 45%. Default to OFF on startup in a safety block, and include inline tests for dry, wet, and sensor-missing (NaN) cases.
Convert an analog voltage (0–5 V) to a percentage readout 0–100%. Clamp the input to 0–5 V in a safety block and include inline tests for 0 V, 2.5 V, 5.5 V.

Create an on-delay timer: when a switch is held, turn on an indicator after 2.0 s and keep it on while held. Add a safety block that caps the delay at 5 s. Provide inline tests for early release and sustained hold.
Use a knob to set LED blink period between 100 ms and 1000 ms. Clamp and quantize the period in a safety block, and add inline tests for minimum, mid, and maximum positions.

Detect a mild shake using an accelerometer magnitude > 1.5 m/s^2 and flash an LED for 200 ms. Saturate the measured acceleration to ±10 m/s^2 in a safety block, and include inline tests with sample vectors.
Latch an alarm when a door sensor opens; keep it latched for 5 s after closing. Ensure the alarm defaults to OFF at startup via a safety block and add inline tests for open-close sequences.

Build a simple thermometer display that rounds temperature to the nearest whole Celsius degree and outputs an integer value. Clamp input to −20 to 60 C in a safety block and add inline tests for rounding behavior.

Design a small state machine for a classroom traffic light: Green 5 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 5 s, repeating. Add a pushbutton to extend Red by 5 s when pressed. Ensure a safety block prevents invalid light combinations, and include inline tests for a full cycle.

Create a door control state machine with states Closed, Opening, Open, Closing. Use open/close limit sensors and a single command input. Add a 10 s timeout safety block that stops movement if neither limit is reached, and include inline tests for normal and timeout cases.

Build a thermostat with Celsius setpoint and 0.5 C deadband controlling a heater output. Clamp setpoint to 15–30 C in a safety block, update at 2 Hz, and include inline tests for under/over/at setpoint.

Make a soft-start motor controller: when enabled, ramp the speed from 0% to the target over 3 s, and ramp down over 1 s when disabled. Limit the rate of change in a safety block. Provide inline tests for abrupt enable/disable.

Create a night-light controller: fade LED up when ambient light drops below a threshold and fade down when it rises. Add hysteresis and a safety block limiting max brightness to 70%. Include inline tests with a light sequence.

Build a reaction timer game: after a random delay (0.5–3.0 s), turn on a light and measure the time to a button press in milliseconds. Enforce WCET under 2 ms and include inline tests that simulate reaction times.

Control a water tank pump using two level switches (LOW and HIGH). Pump turns ON at LOW and OFF at HIGH. Add a safety block to detect both switches active (fault) and force OFF. Include inline tests for all combinations.

Implement a metronome that beeps at a tempo set by a knob (40–200 BPM). Keep timing drift under 1% and include a safety block to mute after 2 minutes of continuous run. Provide inline tests for two tempos.

Create a pedestrian crossing controller: when a button is pressed, finish the current 10 s Green, then go to 2 s Yellow, then 8 s Walk with flashing for the last 4 s. Ensure mutual exclusion of conflicting signals via a safety block and add inline tests.

Require two buttons to be pressed within 1.0 s to activate an output for 10 s. If only one is pressed, reset after 1.0 s. Add a safety block to enforce default OFF, and include inline tests for timing edge cases.

Combine temperature (Celsius) and humidity (%) to control a dehumidifier: enable if humidity > 60% and temperature > 18 C, disable if humidity < 55% or temperature < 16 C. Clamp ranges in a safety block and add inline tests.

Make an alarm with Snooze: Idle, Alarming, Snooze states. A button starts Alarming for 60 s; Snooze silences for 5 min; Alarming resumes once. Add a safety block ensuring Alarming times out after 2 min max. Include inline tests of transitions.

Design a 3-speed fan controller based on temperature thresholds at 25 C, 30 C, and 35 C with 1 C hysteresis. Add a sensor-missing fallback to OFF in a safety block and include inline tests for rising and falling temps.

Compute speed in m/s from a pulse input (pulses per meter) and light a warning if speed exceeds 2.0 m/s. Update every 100 ms, clamp computed speed to 0–5 m/s in a safety block, and add inline tests with sample pulse counts.

Build a small classroom plant-care demo: turn on a pump for 5 s if soil moisture < 30% and temperature > 20 C, but no more than once every 10 minutes. Enforce the lockout with a safety block. Provide inline tests for scheduling.

Create counters for three digital inputs with a reset button and a hold function that freezes the displayed totals. Update at 10 Hz with WCET under 0.5 ms. Include inline tests for increments and hold behavior.

Detect a double clap: two audio peaks above a threshold within 500 ms toggle a light. Use a safety block to ignore continuous loud noise by requiring silence < threshold for 200 ms before arming. Add inline tests.

Control a sweeping pointer: move from 0% to 100% and back continuously, reversing at limit switches. Add a safety block to back off 5% after hitting a limit. Include inline tests verifying reversal behavior.

Use two-axis tilt to choose one of four direction indicators (N/E/S/W) based on angle thresholds in degrees. Saturate each axis to ±90 degrees in a safety block and add inline tests for quadrant edges.
Create an interval timer with start/stop and a 2 Hz heartbeat LED while running. Cap total run time at 15 minutes in a safety block. Provide inline tests for pause/resume and timeout.

Implement a PID controller to maintain 37.0 C using a heater output. Use a 100 ms update, limit output to 0–100%, include anti-windup and a safety block that shuts down if temperature exceeds 45 C. Provide inline tests with a simple simulated plant.

Build a line-following demo: use left and right light sensors to compute an error signal and drive a steering output with proportional control. Add a safety block to limit steering to ±30 degrees and include inline tests for dark/light asymmetry cases.

Fuse readings from two temperature sensors in Celsius using a median filter with outlier rejection (>2 C apart). Use the fused value to control a heater with hysteresis. Add a safety block to fault if both disagree persistently. Include inline tests.
Create a PID speed controller that maintains 1200 RPM from a pulse frequency sensor. Update at 200 Hz, ensure WCET under 0.8 ms, clamp output 0–100%, and include inline tests for load step changes.

Estimate tilt angle in degrees with a complementary filter that blends gyro rate and accelerometer angle at 50 Hz. Saturate outputs to ±90 degrees in a safety block and add inline tests using synthetic motion data.

Control water level using ultrasonic distance: maintain a setpoint height with a PI controller at 10 Hz. Add a safety block that disables the pump if readings are invalid or sudden jumps > 0.2 m occur. Provide inline tests for sensor dropouts.

Fuse three light sensors to estimate ambient lux with a weighted average that de-emphasizes saturated channels. Use the estimate to keep a lamp at a target lux via proportional control. Include a safety block that limits rate-of-change. Add inline tests.

Compute a comfort index from temperature in Celsius and relative humidity %, then drive a tri-color indicator: Green comfortable, Yellow caution, Red uncomfortable. Use a safety block to clamp inputs and include inline tests for each zone.

Design a closed-loop brightness controller: measure reflected light and hold it at 50% of a reference using PI control at 20 Hz. Limit slew rate and provide a safety block for sensor faults. Include inline tests with step changes.

Implement an adaptive noise filter using an exponential moving average whose gain changes with signal variance. Constrain the gain between 0.05 and 0.5 in a safety block. Provide inline tests demonstrating fast and slow response.

Create a multi-mode classroom demo with modes Idle, Demo, and Game. Use a long-press to cycle modes and a short-press for actions. Ensure safe defaults, a watchdog heartbeat at 5 Hz, WCET under 1 ms, and a safety block that forces Idle on any fault. Include comprehensive inline tests covering all transitions and timeouts.

Develop a temperature control system with Auto and Manual modes. Auto uses PID to hold 25.0 C; Manual lets a knob set output directly. Provide bumpless transfer between modes, integral hold in Manual, over-temperature shutdown at 40 C, and thorough inline tests for mode switching and disturbances.

Design a multi-sensor air-quality indicator for the classroom that fuses CO2 (ppm), VOC (index), and humidity (%) into an overall quality score. Modes: Normal, Alert, Fault. Perform a power-on self-test, enforce mutual exclusion of conflicting indicators, WCET < 1 ms, and include comprehensive inline tests including sensor failure cases.

Implement a dual-channel safety interlock that requires two independent buttons held continuously to energize an actuator. Detect stuck-on faults, apply a 200 ms mismatch tolerance window, default to de-energized on startup, and provide exhaustive inline tests for single/dual press, stuck, and release timing.

Build a coordinated intersection controller with two traffic directions and pedestrian phases, plus an emergency preemption mode that forces all-red within 200 ms. Guarantee mutual exclusion, enforce minimum and maximum green times, provide fail-safe all-red on any fault, WCET under 1.5 ms, and comprehensive inline tests for normal cycles and preemption.

Create a ReflexScript beginner exercise where a pushbutton toggles an LED, with debouncing. Include a simple safety block that defaults the LED OFF if the input is undefined, and add inline tests that simulate quick and slow button presses to verify correct toggling behavior.

Make a simple dimmer: an analog knob controls LED brightness from 0% to 100%. Clamp any out-of-range values in a basic safety block. Add inline tests for 0%, 50%, and 100% brightness to check the mapping.

Write a small demo that reads a light sensor and beeps a buzzer when it's dark. Use a threshold with a tiny hysteresis so it doesn’t chatter. Include a safety block that limits each beep to no more than 500 ms. Provide inline tests with light levels above and below threshold.

Build a temperature classifier: read Celsius and print a text label of Cold, Warm, or Hot. Add a safety block to handle NaN or out-of-range readings by reporting Sensor Fault. Include inline tests for 10 C, 25 C, and 40 C.

Create a counter that increments on each button press and wraps at 10. Once per second, blink an LED the current count number of times. Add a safety block to clamp the count between 0 and 10. Include inline tests for debounced presses and wrap-around.

Teach timing with a 1 Hz LED flasher that can be started and stopped with a switch. Enforce a 50% duty cycle using basic syntax. Add inline tests to verify period and duty cycle within a small tolerance.

Make a motion-triggered chime: when motion is detected, sound a buzzer for 200 ms and ignore further triggers until it finishes. Include a safety block capping sound duration to 1 s max. Add inline tests for single and repeated triggers.

Implement a simple door indicator: LED ON when the door is closed, OFF when open. Provide a configurable invert option for normally-open vs normally-closed sensors. Default LED OFF if input is invalid via a safety block. Add inline tests covering both polarities.

Build a 10-second classroom countdown: on button press, count down from 10 s, then beep once at zero; allow cancel with a second press. Add a safety block ensuring the beep lasts under 1 s. Include inline tests for start, cancel, and completion.

Create a sound threshold demo: if the measured level crosses a set threshold, toggle an LED. Include a simple safety block to clamp the threshold to a valid range. Provide inline tests that feed low, high, and borderline levels.

Read a distance sensor in centimeters and print the value once per second; if the distance is less than 5 cm, also print "Too close". Add a safety block to handle out-of-range or invalid readings gracefully. Include inline tests with 2 cm, 10 cm, and invalid data.

Program a smooth LED breathing effect with a 3-second period and a start/stop button. Add a safety block that ensures brightness never exceeds 100%. Include inline tests to verify the timing and boundaries of the brightness curve.

Teach simple filtering: compute and print a moving average of the last 4 light sensor readings at 2 Hz. If the sensor fails, freeze the output and report a fault via a safety block. Add inline tests with a known sequence of values.

Do a unit conversion exercise: read temperature in Celsius and print both Celsius and Fahrenheit once per second. Saturate input to -40 C..125 C in a safety block. Include inline tests verifying the conversion formula and clamping.
Create a metronome that beeps at 120 BPM with a start/stop control. Bind the BPM between 40 and 200 in a safety block. Add inline tests that check the rate timing at 60, 120, and 180 BPM.

Design a pedestrian crossing state machine: handle a walk button, give a walk interval, then a flashing don't-walk, and return to idle. Include timers and a safety rule: maximum green time 30 s. Provide inline tests covering each state transition.

Build an automatic night light: when it’s dark and motion is detected, turn on a light for 30 s, then turn off. Enforce a cooldown so it doesn’t retrigger immediately. Add a safety block limiting total on-time per minute. Include inline tests for day/night and motion/no motion.

Create a water level alarm using two float switches (low and high). Drive a status LED (green/amber/red) and sound a buzzer on high level. Add a safety block to fail-safe red if inputs are inconsistent. Include inline tests for all combinations.
Make a color-mixing exercise: three sliders control an RGB LED. Clamp each channel 0–100% and also limit combined intensity to 80% in a safety block. Add inline tests for edge cases and saturation.

Implement a servo positioner: a knob sets position, and two limit switches prevent motion beyond bounds. Include a safety block that never commands beyond the active limits. Provide inline tests that simulate hitting each limit.

Write a simple thermostat with hysteresis around a setpoint in Celsius. Toggle a heater output and display status. Add a safety block capping total heater on-time per hour. Include inline tests for temperatures around the thresholds.

Create a reaction timer: after a random delay, turn on an LED; measure the time to button press in milliseconds and display it. Reject premature presses. Include inline tests for early press, timely press, and timeout.

Build a tiny data logger: sample temperature and light at 2 Hz, keep running min/max, and print a summary every 10 seconds. Add a safety check to maintain the sampling rate. Provide inline tests with stubbed sensor feeds.

Make a two-button combination lock: require a specific sequence of presses to toggle an output. Use a small state machine. Add a safety feature that locks out for 30 s after 3 failed attempts. Include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences.

Demonstrate actuator interlocks: two buttons request forward or reverse, and a stop button halts motion. Ensure never commanding both directions at once via a safety block. Add inline tests for all button combinations.

Create a plant moisture reminder: when soil is dry, light an LED; a snooze button silences alerts for a set period. Threshold is in percent. Add a safety block to load a default calibration if the sensor is missing. Include inline tests.

Write a simple scheduler for three classroom tasks with configurable durations. Beep between tasks and allow pause/resume. Include a safety rule: total cycle must not exceed 60 minutes. Add inline tests for timing and pause behavior.

Make a distance indicator using an ultrasonic sensor: light green/yellow/red LEDs for far/medium/near ranges in centimeters. Smooth readings with a simple average and handle no-echo as a fault. Include inline tests.

Use an accelerometer’s X-axis to decide which of three LEDs is lit (left, center, right). Add a deadband around center and a 200 ms hold time. Include a safety block that defaults all LEDs OFF if data is invalid. Provide inline tests.

Create a temperature alarm with three levels: Warning at 35 C, Alarm at 45 C, and a Critical latch that requires a reset input. Use small hysteresis on each threshold. Include inline tests spanning all levels and the reset behavior.

Build a classroom quiz buzzer: first press among four team buttons wins; light that team’s LED and lock out others until reset. Resolve ties within 5 ms by earliest timestamp. Add debounce safety. Include inline tests for simultaneous presses.

Teach timing with a Morse code learner: detect short and long button presses and replay them on an LED using correct gap timings. Add a safety block to cap maximum message length. Include inline tests for dot, dash, and spacing.

Implement an on-delay/off-delay relay timer with adjustable delays from 0.1 s to 60 s. Show state on an indicator LED. Clamp delay values in a safety block. Provide inline tests for minimum, middle, and maximum settings.

Create a handwash helper: when motion is detected, start a 20-second LED countdown; stop early if no motion for 5 s; enforce a 10-second lockout after completion. Include inline tests for trigger, early exit, and lockout.

Make a vote tally: three buttons for A/B/C, update counts and display the current leader each minute. Provide a teacher-only reset action. Add safety for debouncing and counter overflow. Include inline tests for typical and edge cases.

Create a line-following demo that reads two reflectance sensors and uses a simple PID to set left/right motor speeds at 50 Hz. Include a speed cap and a fail-safe stop on sensor fault in a safety block. Add inline tests with synthetic sensor patterns.

Write a PID temperature controller to hold 37 C, updating at 10 Hz. Limit output to 0–80%, and add an overtemperature cutoff at 42 C with a redundant check in a safety block. Include inline tests using a simple thermal plant model.

Build a light-tracking servo using sensor fusion: compare two light sensors and aim the servo toward the brighter side using a complementary approach at 20 Hz. Add a safety block to limit range and slew rate. Provide inline tests with scripted brightness sweeps.

Implement an altitude estimator that fuses a barometer and accelerometer to produce a smoothed altitude in meters at 50 Hz. Add outlier rejection and fallback to a single sensor on failure via a safety block. Include inline tests with synthetic flight data.

Create an inertial step counter using an accelerometer and a small state machine. Report cadence in steps per minute. Add safety to avoid double-counting spikes and to handle sensor saturation. Provide inline tests with sample waveforms.

Design a PID fan controller to maintain airflow at 1.5 m/s, updating at 5 Hz. Add a watchdog to turn the fan off on stall detection and enforce a maximum duty cycle in a safety block. Include inline tests for setpoint tracking.

Fuse three temperature sensors and output a robust Celsius value using majority voting. Detect and isolate a faulty sensor. In a safety block, alarm if there is no consensus. Add inline tests with nominal, biased, and failed sensors.

Build a heading estimator that integrates a gyroscope and corrects with a magnetometer via a complementary filter. Output heading in degrees [0, 360). Run at 100 Hz with WCET 2 ms. Add a safety block for magnetic anomaly detection. Include inline tests.

Create a water tank level controller: maintain 30 cm depth using PID on a control valve. Run the loop at 20 Hz. Add safety for overflow cutoff and sensor timeouts. Include inline tests using a simple tank model.

Implement servo position control with PID and a basic feedforward term at 200 Hz (WCET 1 ms). Add a safety block to limit acceleration and clamp the commanded range. Provide inline tests verifying step response performance.

Compose a multi-mode classroom climate controller with modes Off, Heat, Cool, and Fan-Only. Use PID control for temperature in Celsius and allow a daily schedule. Include safety for max rate-of-change, redundant sensor voting, a watchdog, and WCET 5 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests for mode transitions and sensor failures.

Design an educational robot base demo with modes Manual, Line-Follow, and Obstacle-Avoid. Fuse IR and ultrasonic sensors for obstacle detection. Run the main loop at 50 Hz. Add safety: emergency stop, actuator interlocks, and fail-safe if a loop deadline is missed. Include scenario-based inline tests.

Create a lab incubator profile controller with stages Ramp, Hold, and Cool using PID temperature control. Pause if the door opens. Add safety for overtemperature cutoff and dual-sensor validation. Log units in Celsius and seconds with WCET 3 ms. Provide thorough inline tests for stage logic and alarms.
