Build a renewable energy classroom demo: a turbine emulator with modes Idle, Spin-Up, Track MPPT, and Brake. Compute power from voltage and current at 100 Hz. Add safety for overspeed braking, thermal limits, and brown-out recovery. Include formalized inline tests for mode logic and safety trips.

Implement an autonomous water delivery demo with modes Fill, Deliver, and Purge. Use level sensors and a flowmeter with PID to control flow in L/min. Add safety for leak detection, overflow prevention, and a watchdog. Specify timing constraints for each mode and provide comprehensive inline tests.

Create a simple tutorial example that turns on a single LED while a pushbutton is held down and turns it off when released. Include a simple safety block that treats any undefined input as not pressed, and add inline tests that press and release the button to verify the LED follows correctly.

Make a 1 Hz blinker: the LED should be on for 500 ms and off for 500 ms, repeating. Specify a timing constraint that the average period remains within ±5% of 1.0 s. Add a safety block to force the LED off if the timer fails, and include inline tests that run for 5 seconds and check the duty cycle.

Beginner exercise: read a temperature sensor in Celsius and turn on a HEAT indicator when the reading is below 20 C, otherwise turn it off. Use a safety block to ignore readings outside -40 C to 125 C and default the indicator off on fault. Add inline tests for 15 C, 25 C, and an out-of-range value.

When a toggle switch turns on, beep a buzzer for exactly 200 ms once. Ignore additional changes for 300 ms (simple debounce). Add a safety block that silences the buzzer on invalid input. Provide inline tests for on→off transitions and verify the beep duration with a tolerance of ±10 ms.

Read a light sensor and turn on an LED when the value exceeds a threshold. Make the threshold a named constant, and add a safety block that clamps the sensor reading to 0–100%. Include inline tests that sweep the sensor value and check the LED switching point.

Build a periodic task that flips an output pin every 200 ms to make a square wave. Require worst-case execution time under 2 ms per activation. Include a safety block that forces the output low if the schedule slips, and add inline tests for timing accuracy over 2 seconds.

On a button press, latch an LED on for 3 seconds, then turn it off automatically. Ignore new presses during the 3-second hold. Add a safety block that defaults the LED off if timekeeping fails. Write inline tests that press at t=0 and t=1.5 s to confirm the latch behavior.

Map a dial reading (0–100%) to LED brightness (0–100%) linearly. Include a safety block that clamps the input to the valid range and caps the output at 100%. Provide inline tests at 0%, 50%, and 100% to check the mapping.

Create a 2-second on, 2-second off pattern for an LED. Keep the average cycle period within ±2%. Add a safety block that forces the LED off on any timing fault. Include inline tests that verify on/off durations across two full cycles.

Make a rising-edge detector for a pushbutton that pulses an LED for 100 ms on each clean press. Use simple debouncing (20 ms). Add a safety block to suppress pulses if the input is unstable. Include inline tests for bounce-like sequences and a single clean press.

Read a temperature in Celsius, convert it to Fahrenheit, and publish both as status variables for a classroom demo. Use a safety block to flag and ignore any value outside -50 C to 150 C. Add inline tests that check conversion accuracy at 0 C, 25 C, and 100 C.

Implement a periodic sampler at 50 Hz that captures the latest sensor value and stores it. Enforce a WCET of 1 ms per sample. Add a safety block that holds the last known-good value on sensor error. Provide inline tests to verify sample count after 1 second and proper error holding.

When a trigger input goes high, activate a buzzer for exactly 1.0 s, then silence it. Further triggers during the beep are ignored. Include a safety block that forces the buzzer off on timeout or fault. Add inline tests to verify the exact duration and re-trigger lockout.

On startup, wait 500 ms to simulate system stabilization, then turn on a READY LED. Add a safety block that keeps READY off if the timer hasn't started. Include inline tests that check the LED state at t=0 ms, 400 ms, and 600 ms.

Clamp an input value to a range of 0 to 100 and mirror it to an output indicator for a simple range-check demo. Add a safety block that sets the output to 0 if the input is invalid. Provide inline tests for -10, 0, 55, 100, and 150.

Create a small traffic light state machine for a single direction: GREEN 4 s, YELLOW 1 s, RED 5 s, then repeat. Add a safety block that forces RED on any fault. Write inline tests that step through time and verify the state sequence and durations.

Build a mini thermostat demo: read temperature in Celsius and drive two LEDs—HEAT when below 20 C, COOL when above 25 C—with 1 C hysteresis around each threshold. Add a safety block that defaults both LEDs off if the sensor is out of range. Include inline tests at 19 C, 20.5 C, 25 C, and 26 C.

Design a door alarm: if the door sensor indicates open for more than 10 s, sound a buzzer continuously until the door is closed. Include a MUTE button that silences the buzzer while the door remains open. Add a safety block that silences on sensor fault. Provide inline tests for open/close and mute behavior.

Make a dimmer with two buttons: one increments brightness by 10%, the other decrements by 10%. Long-press both together to reset to 50%. Enforce bounds of 0–100% with a safety block, and include inline tests for step changes, bounds, and reset.

Create a reaction timer game: when the LED lights up after a random delay (1–3 s), the student presses a button; measure reaction time in milliseconds and categorize as FAST (<250 ms), OK (250–500 ms), or SLOW (>500 ms). Add a safety block to cancel the round on input fault. Include inline tests using simulated press times.

Build a metronome that ticks the buzzer and flashes an LED at a BPM set by a dial between 30 and 240 BPM. Cap the rate within that range in a safety block. Require loop WCET under 2 ms. Provide inline tests at 60 BPM and 120 BPM to verify intervals.

Water level monitor: read level in cm and turn on a PUMP output when above 30 cm. Keep the pump on for a minimum of 5 seconds once started. Add a safety block to prevent running if level is invalid. Include inline tests for short spikes and sustained high water.

Night light with fade: if ambient light is low, smoothly fade an LED up to 80%; if bright, fade down to 0%. Add 5% hysteresis and limit the change rate to 10% per second. Include a safety block that freezes at the last safe value on sensor fault. Provide inline tests that step the light level.

Two-button password demo: require a press of Button A followed by Button B within 3 seconds to unlock an LED for 5 seconds. Any other sequence resets. Add a safety block that auto-resets on input fault. Include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences and the time window.

Crosswalk signal: implement a state machine with DON'T WALK, WALK (7 s), and FLASHING DON'T WALK (7 s). A pedestrian button requests a crossing; the system services requests in order. Add a safety block that defaults to DON'T WALK on fault. Provide inline tests validating timing and button handling.

Fan speed selector: based on temperature in Celsius, set outputs OFF below 22 C, LOW between 22–26 C, and HIGH above 26 C, with 0.5 C hysteresis to reduce chatter. Add a safety block to force OFF if sensor invalid. Include inline tests at boundary points.

Analog actuator demo: read a dial (0–100%) and command an actuator output to follow, but limit the ramp rate to 20% per second. Add an emergency stop input that forces output to 0 immediately. Include a safety block and inline tests for ramping and e-stop.

Press counter with debounce: count distinct button presses per minute and publish the count once per second. Debounce with 25 ms and ignore long holds. Add a safety block that freezes the count on input fault. Provide inline tests with a sequence of presses and holds.

Quiet-hours notifier: if a motion sensor is active and the time-of-day dial indicates between 8.0 and 20.0 hours, buzz for 100 ms; otherwise stay silent. Use a safety block to suppress buzzing on invalid time or sensor values. Include inline tests for edge times and motion events.

Light schedule demo: turn a GROW LIGHT output on for 16 hours and off for 8 hours repeatedly, with a manual override button that toggles the current state and resumes the schedule at the next boundary. Add a safety block that forces OFF on fault. Provide inline tests over a simulated day.

Elevator indicator simulation: manage a state machine for floor indicators 1–3 using UP and DOWN buttons. Change the active floor one step per press and light the corresponding LED. Ignore invalid floor requests. Add a safety block and inline tests for boundary behavior.

Compare two temperature sensors in Celsius. If they differ by more than 2 C, turn on an ERROR LED; otherwise publish the average temperature. Add a safety block that sets ERROR if either sensor is invalid. Include inline tests for matching and mismatched readings.

Motion-triggered light: when motion is detected, turn on an LED for 30 seconds; retrigger to extend the time. Suppress brief false positives shorter than 50 ms. Add a safety block that defaults the LED off on fault. Provide inline tests for single and repeated triggers.

Rain alert: if RAIN is true and WINDOW_OPEN is true, turn on a CLOSE indicator and keep it latched until both conditions are false for 30 seconds. Add a safety block that clears the indicator on sensor fault. Include inline tests for latching and clear timing.

Stopwatch: implement start, stop, and reset buttons; blink an LED at 2 Hz while running; publish elapsed time in milliseconds. Enforce a 100 Hz tick with WCET under 1 ms. Add a safety block that freezes time on fault. Include inline tests for start/stop/reset sequences.

PID temperature control demo: maintain a setpoint in Celsius (from a dial) by driving a HEATER output 0–100%. Update at 10 Hz, include anti-windup and output saturation, and require WCET < 1 ms. Add a safety block that disables output if the sensor is invalid or setpoint is out of 10–40 C. Provide inline tests with step changes in setpoint.

Fuse two angle sensors (degrees) with a weighted average controlled by a parameter alpha (0.0–1.0). Clamp inputs to -180 to +180 degrees and publish the fused angle. Add a safety block that ignores any invalid sensor and falls back to the valid one. Include inline tests for alpha=0, 0.5, and 1.0.

Two-sensor voting for distance in cm: if both sensors are valid and within 5 cm of each other, output their mean; otherwise signal a FAULT LED and hold the last safe value. Add a safety block for out-of-range data (0–500 cm). Provide inline tests for agreement, disagreement, and recovery.

PID speed controller: maintain a target speed in m/s from a dial, using a wheel speed sensor. Enforce output limits and speed bounds 0.0–3.0 m/s, update at 20 Hz, and include anti-windup. Add a safety block that sets output to 0 on sensor fault. Provide inline tests for step commands and steady-state error.

Conveyor safety demo: motor runs only when START is pressed, STOP is not pressed, GUARD is closed, and JAM sensor is clear. E-STOP input immediately forces the motor off. Implement as a clear state machine with a safety block that defaults to off. Include inline tests for all interlocks.

Watchdog example: run a 100 Hz control loop that toggles an LED each iteration. If any cycle is missed, trigger a watchdog that sets outputs to safe defaults and logs a flag. Include a safety block for the fail-safe state. Provide inline tests that simulate a missed cycle.

Median-of-three fusion: read three temperature sensors in Celsius, reject outliers using a median filter, and publish the filtered value. Add a safety block that detects when fewer than two sensors are valid and holds the last safe value. Include inline tests for outliers and sensor failures.

Adaptive baseline detector: learn a baseline from the first 5 seconds of data, then raise an ALERT if the input deviates by more than 10% from the baseline. Freeze the baseline during alerts. Add a safety block that resets on invalid data. Provide inline tests covering learning, deviation, and reset.

Three-mode light controller: NORMAL follows a dial (0–100%), ECO limits to 60% max, and SAFE forces 0%. Use a mode switch input and clean transitions with state retention. Add a safety block that falls back to SAFE on any fault. Include inline tests for all mode changes and bounds.

PID water level control: read level in cm and drive a pump output to reach a setpoint in cm. Include deadband around ±1 cm, anti-windup, and output saturation. Update at 10 Hz with WCET < 1 ms. Add a safety block that disables the pump on invalid readings. Provide inline tests for step setpoints.

Multi-mode classroom controller: implement Demo, Lab, and Exam modes that change sampling rate (5 Hz, 20 Hz, 50 Hz), allowed output range (0–100%, 0–80%, 0–50%), and safety strictness. Mode is selected by a switch and must require a confirm button to enter Exam. Include a safety block and inline tests for all transitions, timing, and fault handling.

Full intersection simulation with left-turn phase and pedestrian crossing: state machine with configurable timings (seconds). Include emergency preemption input that forces all-red within 100 ms. Add a safety block that defaults to all-red on any error. Provide comprehensive inline tests for timing, requests, and preemption.

Mini greenhouse manager: modes Idle, Heat, Cool, and Vent based on temperature (Celsius) and humidity (%RH). Apply priorities: safety alarms override modes; heat and cool must be mutually exclusive; vent when humidity >70% and not heating or cooling. Add safety clamps and sensor fault handling. Include inline tests for mode decisions and transitions at key values.

Educational robot logic core (simulated): modes Manual, Follow-Light, and Avoid-Obstacle using two light sensors and one distance sensor. Blend left/right outputs based on mode, and stop if an emergency stop is active. Add a safety block that forces stop on any sensor fault. Include inline tests for each mode and safety stop.

PID benchmark suite for the classroom: expose P, I, and D gains via inputs, run automated step tests on a mock plant, measure settle time and overshoot, and report pass/fail against criteria. Enforce output caps and log WCET per cycle. Add a safety block to halt tests on invalid data. Provide comprehensive inline tests for multiple gain settings.

Write a beginner-friendly ReflexScript that turns an LED on while a pushbutton is held and off when released. Debounce the button in a simple way, start with the LED in a safe OFF state at power-up, and include inline tests that check LED behavior for pressed and not-pressed inputs.

Create a simple tutorial program where a knob (analog input) controls LED brightness from 0% to 100%. Clamp values outside range, default to 0% if the input is invalid, and add inline tests that feed sample analog values and verify the resulting duty cycles.

Make a classroom demo: if a temperature sensor reads above 30 Celsius, turn on a small fan; otherwise turn it off. Use a basic safety block to force the fan OFF on startup or sensor fault, and write inline tests for temperatures at 25 C, 30 C, and 35 C.

Write a ReflexScript that activates a buzzer when an object is detected within 20 cm by a simple distance sensor, and silences it otherwise. Include a safety default of buzzer OFF if the sensor data is missing, and provide inline tests around 15 cm, 20 cm, and 25 cm.

For a basic lab, map a two-position switch to a relay: ON when the switch is up, OFF when down. Ensure the relay starts OFF at reset, handle any invalid input as OFF, and add inline tests verifying both positions and the startup state.

Build a 1 Hz LED blinker with a clear, beginner-style structure. Use a periodic timer, ensure the LED defaults OFF at boot, and add inline tests that simulate time passing and assert that the LED toggles once per second.

Create a simple program: when a button is pressed, beep a buzzer for 200 ms, then stop. Debounce the button, ensure buzzer is OFF on startup and on faults, and include inline tests that simulate quick taps and verify the 200 ms pulse.

Write a ReflexScript that turns on a lamp LED when ambient light drops below 200 lux and turns it off above that threshold. Start in a safe OFF state, treat invalid sensor readings as OFF, and include inline tests at 150, 200, and 250 lux.

Make a basic decision example: show green LED when temperature is under 25 C and red LED when 25 C or higher. Use a simple safety block to turn both LEDs OFF on init or sensor error, and add inline tests for 24.9 C, 25.0 C, and an invalid reading.
Teach timing: after power-up, wait 3 seconds, then turn on an LED and keep it on. Ensure LED is OFF at startup, and write inline tests that simulate time to confirm it turns on only after 3 s.

Very simple toggle exercise: each time the button is pressed and released, flip the LED state. Debounce inputs, ensure the LED starts OFF, and include inline tests showing two presses lead to OFF->ON->OFF.
Create a tiny audio demo: when a slide switch is ON, drive a buzzer at 2 kHz; when OFF, silence it. Default to OFF at startup and build inline tests for both switch positions and failure cases.

Build a touch-to-toggle nightlight: a capacitive touch sensor toggles a small LED strip on or off. Keep the logic minimal, start OFF for safety, include a basic debounce, and add inline tests verifying toggling on successive touches.

Write a demo counter that blinks an LED N times (1 to 5) each time a button is pressed, then wraps back to 1. Ensure safe OFF on startup, limit N between 1 and 5, and include inline tests that press the button 7 times to check wrap-around.

Create a vibration alert: when a simple vibration sensor triggers, flash an LED briefly (100 ms) then turn it off. Default LED OFF at boot, ignore spurious rapid repeats for 200 ms, and provide inline tests for single and rapid multiple triggers.

Design a small state machine for a classroom traffic light with three LEDs: green (3 s), yellow (1 s), red (3 s), then repeat. Start safely with red on if anything fails, and write inline tests that step time and validate the sequence.

Implement a door alarm: if a magnetic contact indicates OPEN for more than 5 seconds, sound a buzzer until the door closes or a mute button is pressed. Use a simple state machine, ensure buzzer defaults OFF, and include inline tests for open/close and mute behavior.

Create a beginner thermostat with hysteresis: maintain a target of 22 C by turning a heater ON below 21.5 C and OFF above 22.5 C. Clamp any setpoint to 18–26 C, default heater OFF on errors, and add inline tests across the thresholds.

Two-button gate: energize a relay only when both Button A and Button B are pressed simultaneously; otherwise keep it off. Provide a simple safety block to force OFF at startup, and write inline tests covering all button combinations.

Build a light comparison demo: read two light sensors (left and right). Turn on the LED under the brighter sensor and turn both off if readings are equal within a small tolerance. Start with both off, and include inline tests for left brighter, right brighter, and tie.

Map temperature to a 3-speed fan: LOW below 25 C, MEDIUM 25–30 C, HIGH above 30 C. Default to OFF on sensor fault, ensure outputs are mutually exclusive, and write inline tests exercising each band and an invalid reading.

Do a sampling and smoothing exercise: sample a noisy sensor at 50 Hz and publish a simple moving average over the last 5 samples to an LED brightness. Default brightness to 0% on faults, and add inline tests that feed a known sequence to verify the averaged output.

Create a simple state machine with three states: IDLE (LED off), COUNTDOWN (blink LED at 2 Hz for 3 s), and ALARM (buzzer on). A button starts the countdown from IDLE; after countdown, go to ALARM until a reset button is pressed. Include inline tests for the sequence.

Write a servo demo: sweep a hobby servo from 0 to 180 degrees and back continuously with a pause of 0.5 s at each end. Limit angles to 0–180, default to 90 degrees on startup, and add inline tests validating the motion order.

Implement motor direction control using two limit switches: run motor forward until the forward limit is reached, then reverse until the reverse limit, then repeat. Stop safely if both limits are triggered or if input is invalid, and include inline tests for each case.

Turn signal practice: with a left button, blink a left LED at 1 Hz; with a right button, blink a right LED; with both buttons, turn on both LEDs steadily as hazard lights. Start with all off, and write inline tests for each input combination.

Battery monitor demo: read a voltage input in volts and beep the buzzer if it is below 3.3 V. Latch the alarm until a reset button is pressed. Default buzzer OFF and add inline tests for 3.2 V, 3.3 V, 3.4 V, and the reset behavior.

Build a timer with pause: Button A starts a 10-second countdown blinking an LED at 2 Hz; Button B pauses/resumes the countdown. On reaching zero, turn the LED solid on. Ensure safe startup, and write inline tests for start, pause, resume, and completion.

Color indicator: map temperature bands to an RGB LED—blue below 15 C, green 15–25 C, red above 25 C. Enforce that only one color is active at a time, default to off on sensor fault, and include inline tests for each band and a bad reading.

Create a metronome: blink an LED and tick a buzzer at a tempo set by a knob from 40 to 200 beats per minute. Clamp values, start safely with outputs off, and add inline tests verifying the period at 60 BPM and 120 BPM.

Design a simple alarm clock demo: at power-up, wait for a set time (e.g., 5 s), then pulse a buzzer at 2 Hz for 10 s. Include a stop button. Ensure safe defaults and write inline tests that simulate time progression and button presses.

Average-of-two fusion exercise: read two temperature sensors and compute the average in Celsius, then drive a fan on above 28 C. If the two sensors disagree by more than 3 C, treat it as a fault and force the fan OFF. Include inline tests for agreement and disagreement.

Implement a simple proportional control: adjust LED brightness proportionally to error between a light setpoint (300 lux) and ambient light. Limit brightness to 0–100%, default to 0% on faults, and add inline tests for low, equal, and high ambient readings.

Create a timed lock: if the correct sequence of two buttons (A then B within 2 s) is entered, activate a relay for 3 s, then turn it off. Reset on wrong order or timeout. Start OFF for safety, and include inline tests covering success, wrong order, and timeout.

Do a simple scheduler demo: sample a sensor at 20 Hz and blink an LED at 2 Hz concurrently. Ensure the sampling and blinking rates are maintained, default outputs safe on errors, and include inline tests that check the timing over 5 seconds.

PWM fan curve: set fan speed in % as a piecewise-linear function of temperature (20 C→0%, 30 C→50%, 40 C→100%). Clamp outside 0–100%, default to 0% if sensor invalid, and write inline tests at 20, 25, 30, 35, 40 C and an invalid sample.

Motion-activated light: if a PIR motion sensor detects movement, turn on an LED for 15 seconds; each new detection extends the timer. Default LED OFF, and include inline tests simulating motion bursts and idle periods.

Build a simple PID controller to maintain water temperature at 37 C using heater PWM. Sample at 10 Hz, clamp PWM 0–100%, add integral windup protection, and specify a safety block that forces heater OFF on sensor fault. Include inline tests with a step-change simulator.

Implement PID speed control for a small DC motor to hold 1.5 m/s based on a pulse encoder. Run the control loop at 50 Hz, limit output 0–100%, stop the motor if no encoder pulses are seen for 200 ms, and provide inline tests for setpoint step and loss-of-signal.

Sensor fusion demo: combine accelerometer and gyro to estimate tilt angle in degrees at 100 Hz using a simple complementary filter. Default to 0 degrees on sensor error, constrain angle to −90..+90 degrees, and include inline tests with synthetic inputs.

Obstacle alarm with redundancy: read two distance sensors and choose the minimum distance as the trusted value; if they differ by more than 10 cm, treat it as a fault and turn the buzzer off. Trigger the buzzer when the trusted distance < 25 cm. Add inline tests for agreement and disagreement.

Closed-loop light level: use a PID controller to keep ambient light at 300 lux by dimming a lamp output. Sample at 20 Hz, clamp output 0–100%, include anti-windup, and require a safety block to force off on sensor fault. Provide inline tests for step changes in ambient light.

Temperature fusion and validation: take three temperature sensors, compute the median, and drive a fan on above 29 C. If any sensor is out-of-range (< −20 C or > 80 C), flag a fault and default outputs to safe OFF. Include inline tests with outliers and normal cases.

Rate-limited control: when a knob changes, adjust motor speed but limit the ramp to 10% per second to avoid jerks. Enforce output 0–100%, start at 0%, and write inline tests that apply a sudden jump and verify the ramping behavior.

Timing safety showcase: run a control task at 100 Hz and assert that worst-case execution time stays below 2 ms per cycle. If an overrun is detected, drop the update and set outputs to a safe state. Include inline tests that simulate both normal and overrun conditions.

Fusion for reliability: average two thermistors to estimate room temperature, but ignore a sensor if it deviates by more than 2 C from the other. Drive a heater with simple proportional control towards 21 C, clamp 0–100%, and include inline tests for matching and drifting sensors.

Expert classroom project: build a multi-mode lamp with three modes—DEMO (auto cycle colors every 2 s), MANUAL (knob sets brightness), and SAFE (all off). Use a state machine with a mode button to switch modes, enforce safe defaults, and include comprehensive inline tests covering mode transitions, boundary values, and startup.

Create a two-mode educational thermostat: TEACH mode freezes outputs but shows decisions via LEDs; RUN mode actually controls a heater to 23 C with hysteresis. Require a simple safety block for sensor faults, and include thorough inline tests for both modes and fault transitions.

Develop a lab system with NORMAL and SAFE modes. In NORMAL, read a distance sensor at 50 Hz and drive a motor speed proportionally for distances 10–100 cm. In SAFE, force motor OFF and blink an LED slowly. Switch to SAFE on invalid readings or a safety button. Include exhaustive inline tests for all transitions and edge cases.

Design a comprehensive classroom demo: a traffic controller with DAY and NIGHT modes. DAY cycles green/yellow/red with pedestrian request handling; NIGHT blinks yellow only. Specify timing (e.g., green 5 s, yellow 2 s, red 5 s), default to all red on faults, and add extensive inline tests for timing, button requests, and mode switching.

Make a blinking indicator that runs at 1 Hz when a start/stop switch is ON. Add a simple safety block that clamps the duty cycle between 10% and 90%, and include inline tests that verify the blink rate and clamp behavior at the boundaries.
Turn a buzzer ON while a momentary button is held and OFF when released. Debounce the button to ignore chatter and add inline tests to simulate quick taps and long holds.

Read a temperature value in Celsius and turn on a blue light when it exceeds 30 C. Use a safety block to clamp sensor readings to the range −40 C to 125 C and include inline tests for values below, within, and above the range.
Toggle a light on each clean button press event. Ensure you limit toggles to at most 10 per second with a simple safety block, and write inline tests covering bounce bursts and rapid presses.

Count incoming sensor pulses and flash an indicator briefly every time the count reaches a multiple of 5. Include a safety block that saturates the counter at 1000, and provide inline tests that exercise rollover and exact multiples.
Create a 2-second one-shot timer: when a switch turns ON, wait 2 s and then produce a 200 ms output pulse. Prevent retriggering while active and add inline tests for back-to-back activations.
Map an analog input (0.0 to 3.3 V) to a brightness command (0% to 100%). Use a safety block to clamp out-of-range inputs and include inline tests for 0.0 V, 1.65 V, 3.3 V, and a negative value.

Turn on a warning light when ambient light level falls below 50 lux. Require the low-light condition to persist for at least 100 ms (simple safety filter) and add inline tests that simulate flickering light.

On each rising edge of a pushbutton, output a single 200 ms pulse. Include a safety block enforcing a minimum off time of 300 ms between pulses, and write inline tests for rapid presses and held presses.
Read distance in centimeters and turn on an indicator if the distance is less than 20 cm. Clamp valid readings to 2–400 cm using a safety block and include inline tests for 1 cm, 20 cm, and 500 cm.

Demonstrate a sawtooth PWM: increase duty cycle smoothly from 0% to 100% over 5 seconds, then reset and repeat, with a fixed 20 ms base period. Use a safety block to keep the duty cycle in bounds and add inline tests for timing and bounds.
If sound level exceeds 80 dB, turn on a warning indicator only after the high level persists for 200 ms. Add inline tests that confirm no alert on short spikes and an alert on sustained noise.

Make a blinker with two speeds: a slow 1 Hz mode and a fast 5 Hz mode selected by a switch. Use a safety default to slow mode if the input is invalid and add inline tests covering both modes and the default case.
Generate a single-tick event on the falling edge of a button signal. Implement debounce and provide inline tests that include noisy transitions and clean edges.

Compute a 5-sample moving average of temperature (C). Turn a heater control ON when the average is below 22 C and OFF otherwise. Clamp the input range with a simple safety block and include inline tests for stable and step-changing inputs.

Build a basic traffic light state machine with Green (10 s), Yellow (3 s), and Red (7 s). A pedestrian button should insert a safe crossing phase. Add a safety interlock to prevent Green and Walk from being on together and include inline timing tests.

Create a two-mode fan controller (Off/Auto). In Auto, turn the fan ON when temperature > 28 C and OFF when temperature < 26 C (hysteresis). Add an overheat cutoff at 60 C as a safety block and include inline tests.

Control a small pump with two float switches. In Fill mode, run the pump until the High switch closes, then stop; if the Low switch does not close within 5 s, declare a dry-run fault and stop. Provide inline tests for normal and fault cases.

Process a three-button keypad to control three indicators. If the first two buttons are held together for more than 2 s, turn all indicators OFF. Add a safety rule to prevent enabling conflicting outputs and include inline tests.

Implement a metronome whose BPM is set by an analog input. Constrain BPM to 40–180 and output a tick at the set rate. Guarantee updates on a 10 ms schedule and include inline tests for boundary values and mid-range.

Convert a raw analog reading to Celsius using a simple linear approximation. Saturate the result with a safety block and raise an alert if the rate of change exceeds 2 C/s. Provide inline tests for steady and ramping inputs.

Read two temperature sensors and compare them. If they differ by more than 3 C, enter a fault state and inhibit a heater command; otherwise perform normal threshold control. Add inline tests for agreement and disagreement.

Make an elevator door simulator with states: Closed, Opening, Open, and Closing. A button triggers Opening; auto-close after 5 s; stop Closing immediately if an obstruction sensor is active. Include inline tests for each state transition.

Create a night-light controller using a light sensor and a motion sensor. If it is dark (< 50 lux) and motion is detected, turn on a lamp for 30 s; keep it off if bright. Limit maximum on-time to 2 minutes with a safety block and include inline tests.

Read a control knob and produce an actuator command, but limit the rate of change to at most 10% every 100 ms to avoid jerk. Add a watchdog that forces the command to zero if no updates occur for 500 ms. Provide inline tests.

Sample temperature every 1 s and maintain rolling min and max over the last 60 s. If the sensor reports an invalid value, reset the statistics with a safety rule. Include inline tests to verify window behavior.

Make a color pattern sequencer with three patterns. A short button press cycles the pattern; a long press (> 2 s) pauses playback. Add a safety constraint that the estimated total current stays under 30 mA and provide inline tests.

Build a handwash helper: on button press, run a 20 s countdown with a fast blink for the first 5 s and a slow blink for the remaining 15 s. Prevent retriggering while active and add inline tests for timing.

Create a two-player buzzer game. The first button pressed locks in and lights that player's indicator, disabling the other until reset. Handle simultaneous presses deterministically and include inline tests.

Build a mini greenhouse monitor using temperature (C) and humidity (%RH). Trigger an alert if temperature > 30 C or humidity < 30%. Add sanity checks for sensor ranges and include inline tests with realistic values.
Make an auto-dimmer that sets lamp brightness inversely to ambient light (lux), with a deadband around the setpoint to reduce flicker. Saturate brightness to 0–100% and include inline tests.
Measure the frequency of a digital signal and publish the result in Hz. Update every 10 ms, clamp the reported value to 0–1000 Hz, and include inline tests for 0 Hz, 100 Hz, and 1200 Hz.
Simulate a bouncing light. Track a position integer from 0 to 10, move one step every 100 ms, and reverse direction at the ends. Enforce bounds with a safety block and add inline tests.
Sweep an actuator from 0 to 180 degrees and back, stepping 5 degrees every 50 ms. Clamp the commanded angle within 0–180 with a safety block and provide inline tests for endpoints and wraparound.

Create a door alarm. When the door opens, start a 30 s countdown; if not acknowledged before it expires, sound an alarm. Ensure the alarm cannot run longer than 60 s (safety block) and include inline tests.

Demonstrate PID temperature control to maintain 25 C. Sample every 100 ms and output a 0–100% heater command with clamp and anti-windup. Add a safety cutoff if temperature exceeds 60 C and include inline step-response tests.

Fuse accelerometer tilt and gyroscope rate to estimate angle in degrees using a simple complementary filter at 200 Hz. Add sanity checks for sensor saturation, clamp the estimate to ±90 degrees, and provide inline tests with synthetic ramps and pulses.

Make a line-following demo: compute a steering command from left/right light sensors using proportional control on the error. Limit steering rate with a safety block and stop if both sensors are saturated. Include inline tests.

Implement PID speed control of a small fan using RPM feedback. The setpoint is given in RPM. Include output clamping, anti-windup, stall detection that triggers a fault, and inline tests for setpoint steps and stall.

Combine two distance sensors to estimate range in cm with simple outlier rejection (discard the reading if it deviates by more than 20%). Use a safety timeout if either sensor stops updating and include inline tests.

Create a thermal ramp controller that moves from 20 C to 50 C at 0.5 C/s using PID. Enforce a rate limiter and overshoot protection, and add inline tests verifying ramp rate and final temperature within ±0.5 C.

Estimate vertical altitude (m) by fusing barometric pressure (Pa) with vertical acceleration (m/s^2) via a complementary filter at 50 Hz. Bound the output to a reasonable range and include inline tests with injected steps and noise.
Demonstrate a PID voltage regulator that maintains 5.0 V at the output. Clamp current to 500 mA with a safety block and shut down if overcurrent persists longer than 200 ms. Include inline tests.

Implement sensor failover: read two temperature sensors and use the primary unless a fault is detected (stuck value or out-of-range), then switch to the backup. Smooth transitions and add inline tests for fault detection and recovery.

Build a simple 1D Kalman filter to estimate position (m) from a noisy position measurement and a velocity input (m/s). Run at 50 Hz, keep the estimate numerically stable with bounds, and include inline tests with known sequences.

Design a multi-mode lab fan controller with Manual, Auto, and Fail-safe modes. Auto uses PID to maintain 24 C; Manual uses a knob; Fail-safe engages on sensor fault or temperature > 60 C. Include a 200 ms watchdog, enforce WCET < 2 ms per 50 Hz tick, and provide comprehensive inline tests for mode transitions, faults, and anti-windup.

Create a classroom traffic system with modes Normal, Night, and Emergency. Normal runs full sequencing with pedestrian requests; Night blinks amber; Emergency forces all red. Add safety interlocks to prevent conflicting greens, run at 100 ms updates with WCET ≤ 1 ms, and include inline tests for timing, button events, and a stuck-button fault.

Build an educational line follower with modes Calibrate, Follow, and Pause. Calibrate captures sensor min/max; Follow uses PID on line error with simple two-sensor fusion; Pause stops outputs. Limit motor commands and declare a fault if the line is lost for > 500 ms. Enforce a 10 ms period with WCET ≤ 500 µs and provide extensive inline tests, including randomized inputs.

Design a mini environment chamber controller with Idle, Heat, Cool, and Fault modes. Use two temperature sensors with voting, PID for heating/cooling, and monitor humidity. Safety: over-temp cutoff at 55 C, stuck-relay detection, and ramp-rate limit of 1 C/min. Run on a 1 s tick with WCET ≤ 3 ms and include inline tests for steps, ramps, sensor disagreement, and power-loss recovery.

Implement a water system with modes Fill, Hold, Drain, and Lockout using three level sensors. Add hysteresis to prevent chatter, timeouts to detect faults, and a manual override input. Require WCET ≤ 1 ms at 100 Hz and include comprehensive inline tests for normal operation, corner cases, simultaneous input changes, and safe default to closed valves on any fault.

Make a simple classroom demo that turns an indicator LED on while a pushbutton is held and turns it off otherwise. Include a simple safety block that defaults the LED to off if the input is undefined, and add inline tests for pressed and released cases.

Create a basic blinker that flashes an LED at 1 Hz with 50% duty cycle. Add a simple safety block to clamp the allowable frequency between 0.5 and 2.0 Hz. Provide inline tests that verify the period is 1.0 s ± 0.05 s.

Read a light sensor in lux (0 to 1000) and map it to LED brightness 0 to 100%. Use a simple safety block to clamp sensor values to the valid range. Add inline tests at 0, 500, and 1000 lux to confirm the mapping.

On startup, sound a buzzer at 440 Hz for 0.5 s as a power-on chime. Include a safety block that silences the buzzer if the requested duration exceeds 1.0 s. Add inline tests that trigger and verify a single 0.5 s tone.

Build a simple thermostat demo: if temperature is at least 30.0 °C, set a fan output ON; otherwise OFF. Use a safety block to default the fan to OFF on invalid readings. Add inline tests at 29.9 °C, 30.0 °C, and an invalid sensor value.
Read a knob as a percentage (0–100%) and drive an LED brightness to match. Clamp input values to 0–100% in a simple safety block. Provide inline tests for -5%, 0%, 100%, and 120%.

Make an LED toggle on each button release (detect the falling edge from pressed to released). Keep syntax simple. Include inline tests that simulate a press-release-press-release sequence and check the LED toggles twice.

When a trigger button is pressed, turn an LED on for 2 seconds, then turn it off. Ignore further presses while the LED is on. Include a safety block that ensures the default state is off. Add inline tests for single press and presses during the on interval.
Use a sound level input in dB to flash an LED when the level exceeds 60 dB. Clamp sensor values to 0–120 dB in a safety block. Add inline tests at 59 dB, 60 dB, and 90 dB to verify behavior.

Use a distance sensor (meters) to activate a buzzer when distance is less than 0.20 m. Default to buzzer off on invalid readings using a simple safety block. Provide inline tests at 0.19 m, 0.20 m, 0.25 m, and an invalid input.

Turn on an LED only when two separate buttons are both pressed (logical AND). If either input is undefined, default to off using a simple safety block. Include inline tests for all four button combinations.

Implement a heartbeat LED that blinks steadily at 2 Hz. Add a lightweight performance check to assert worst-case execution time stays under 0.5 ms per cycle. Include inline tests for blink rate and WCET assertion.
Drive an indicator based on a moisture sensor: if moisture exceeds 50%, turn the LED on; otherwise off. Clamp input to 0–100% in a safety block. Add inline tests at 49%, 50%, and 51%.

Compute a simple 4-sample moving average of a light sensor and map the average to LED brightness. Use a safety block to reset averaging if the sensor reports an invalid value. Provide inline tests with a known sequence to check the average.

Scale a normalized analog input from -1.0..1.0 into an output brightness of 0..100% using a linear mapping. Saturate both input and output via a simple safety block. Add inline tests at -1.0, 0.0, 1.0, and 2.0.

Create a three-color traffic light state machine that cycles: green 5 s, yellow 2 s, red 5 s, starting at red. Enforce time bounds 1–10 s with a simple safety block. Add inline tests that step through 12 seconds and verify the sequence.

Design a fan controller with four levels based on temperature: <22 °C off, 22–26 °C low, 26–30 °C medium, >30 °C high. Add 0.5 °C hysteresis. Default to off on bad data via a safety block. Include inline tests around each threshold.

Implement a debounced toggle: a button controls an LED, toggling only after 20 ms of stable press or release. Add a safety block to guarantee at most one toggle per stable press. Provide inline tests that simulate noisy bouncing.

When an alarm signal rises, play three short buzzer beeps (100 ms on, 100 ms off). Prevent overlapping sequences with a simple safety block. Add inline tests that trigger the alarm once and then again during the sequence to verify lockout.

Build a door timer: if a door switch indicates open for more than 5 s, sound a buzzer until closed. Include a safety block to avoid time overflow and default to silent on sensor fault. Add inline tests for open <5 s, open >5 s, and close behavior.

Make an ambient lighting demo: as room light increases (lux), dim the lamp so that output ranges from 90% (dark) down to 10% (bright). Clamp the output between 10% and 90% via a safety block. Provide inline tests at low, medium, and high lux.

Combine two controls with precedence: a safety switch overrides a pushbutton. If the safety switch is off, the actuator is off; otherwise the pushbutton decides on/off. Use a simple safety block for a fail-safe default off. Add inline tests for all precedence cases.

Create a metronome LED flasher with tempo set by a knob from 40 to 200 bpm. Clamp bpm in a safety block and target timing jitter under 10 ms. Include inline tests at 60 bpm and 120 bpm verifying intervals.

Build a simple stopwatch: a button starts and stops timing, an LED indicates running, and a second LED blinks every 1 s while running. Use a safety block to ignore presses shorter than 30 ms. Provide inline tests for start, stop, and multiple cycles.

Make a reaction timer game: after a random delay between 1 and 3 seconds, turn on an LED; measure the time until the button is pressed, and buzz if under 300 ms. Cap the measurement at 5 s using a safety block. Include inline tests with a fixed random seed.

Create a small state machine with states Ready, Armed, Active. Two buttons must be pressed in sequence within 3 s to reach Active; any fault returns to Ready. Use a simple safety block for default-to-Ready behavior. Add inline tests covering correct and incorrect sequences.
Drive an RGB indicator using three sliders (0–100%) for red, green, and blue. Clamp each channel in a safety block. Provide inline tests for extremes (0%, 100%) and a mixed color like 25%, 50%, 75%.

Implement a thermostat with a minimum on/off time of 30 s to protect the actuator. The setpoint comes from a knob from 15 to 28 °C with ±0.5 °C hysteresis. Add a safety block to enforce the minimum time. Include inline tests that attempt rapid toggling.

Detect a double-click (two presses within 300 ms) to toggle an LED; a single click turns it off. Add a safety block that ignores ambiguous timing. Provide inline tests with timing patterns for single, double, and slow double clicks.

Use a tilt angle input in degrees to sound a buzzer when angle exceeds 15 deg, and silence it only when it drops below 10 deg (hysteresis). Default to silent on invalid sensor data via a safety block. Add inline tests around the thresholds.

Create a dimmer with two buttons: one increases brightness by 10% steps, the other decreases. Long-press repeats at 5 Hz. Clamp between 0% and 100% via a safety block. Include inline tests for stepping, clamping, and long-press repeat.

Schedule two periodic tasks: sensor sampling at 50 Hz and output updates at 25 Hz. Verify both rates are met over 2 s. Add a WCET budget of 1 ms per cycle in a safety check. Include inline tests counting ticks for each task.

Demonstrate a simple low-pass filter: compute an exponential moving average of temperature at 10 Hz with a 2 s time constant, and show the filtered value on a display channel. Clamp sensor input in a safety block. Provide inline tests with a step input and expected settling behavior.

Read two temperature sensors and implement voting: if they differ by more than 2.0 °C, light a fault LED and use the lower value for control; otherwise use the average. Use a safety block for default safe behavior. Add inline tests for agreement and disagreement cases.

Blink an LED to send SOS in Morse code: three dots (200 ms), three dashes (600 ms), three dots, with standard gaps. Include a stop button that pauses the sequence. Add a safety block to ensure durations stay within ±10%. Provide inline tests verifying segment timings.

Implement a PID loop to hold a target temperature of 37.0 °C with an actuator output 0–100%. Sample at 10 Hz, clamp output, include basic anti-windup, and shut down if temperature exceeds 45 °C. Add inline tests using a simple plant model to verify settling time under 60 s.

Create a speed controller to maintain 300 rpm using tachometer pulses, updating at 50 Hz. Use a PI controller with output clamping and a safety block that sets output to 0 if pulses are missing for 2 s. Provide inline tests with a simulated load disturbance.

Fuse two distance sensors (e.g., ultrasonic and IR) to estimate distance in meters. Use complementary weighting and reject outliers beyond 3 standard deviations. Default to a safe large distance if both are invalid via a safety block. Include inline tests with conflicting inputs.

Build a complementary filter to estimate tilt angle by combining accelerometer and gyroscope data at 100 Hz. Limit output to -90..90 deg and fall back to accelerometer if gyro saturates, using a safety block. Add inline tests with a known rotation profile.

Estimate altitude by fusing a barometer (kPa) and a sonar (m), updating at 50 Hz and outputting smoothed altitude in meters. Hold last good value for up to 0.5 s on dropout via a safety block. Provide inline tests covering dropout and recovery.

Control water level in a small tank to 15.0 cm using a PID controller and a 0–100% pump output at 20 Hz. Stop the pump if the level sensor reads above 25 cm or indicates a fault using a safety block. Add inline tests with step changes and a simulated leak.

Fuse two temperature sensors by checking plausibility and then computing a weighted average based on variance estimates. If they differ by more than 5 °C, light a fault LED and use the more conservative (lower) value. Include a safety block and inline tests for normal and fault conditions.

Maintain 300 lux at a photodiode by adjusting lamp brightness with a PI controller running at 50 Hz. Clamp brightness 0–100% and turn off on sensor fault via a safety block. Add inline tests demonstrating overshoot under 10% and recovery from a step disturbance.

Estimate heading by combining magnetometer and gyroscope, updating at 50 Hz. Include a calibration offset for the magnetometer and detect disturbances when field magnitude is outside 30–70 uT; freeze heading during disturbance via a safety block. Provide inline tests for calibration and disturbance cases.

Design a gain-scheduled PI temperature controller to hold 25 °C: use higher gains for errors above 2 °C and lower gains near the setpoint. Limit the actuator slew rate to 10% per second and shut off above 50 °C in a safety block. Include inline tests with a simulated plant showing improved settling.

Build a multi-mode temperature rig: Manual (open-loop via knob), Auto (PID to 37 °C), and Safe (fault). Define safe transitions, latch faults on overtemp >45 °C or sensor failure, and blink a heartbeat LED. Run control at 20 Hz with WCET under 1 ms. Include comprehensive inline tests for mode changes, faults, and recovery.

Create a classroom lighting system with modes: Day (track ambient with inverse mapping), Study (hold 400 lux using PI), Night (constant 10%). Select modes with two buttons and default to Night on sensor fault via a safety block. Add inline tests for all modes, transitions, and loss of sensor.

Implement a multi-rate fan controller with modes Off, Auto, and Purge. Auto fuses two gas sensors to set speed; Purge runs 100% for 5 minutes; an emergency stop input forces Off. Enforce WCET <2 ms, and add a safety block for sensor faults. Provide inline tests for scheduling, mode transitions, and fault injection.

Model a small tank system with modes Fill, Hold, Drain, and Fault. Transitions depend on two level switches and a setpoint; Hold uses simple PI to maintain level. Stop pumps on dry or overfill conditions via a safety block. Include inline tests that cover all transitions and timing behavior at 10 Hz.

Design a mini HVAC demo with modes Heating, Cooling, Ventilate, and Standby. A knob sets temperature; add hysteresis and a 3-minute lockout preventing heat-to-cool transitions. Monitor WCET and raise an overrun flag if exceeded. Use a safety block to default to Ventilate on sensor failure. Provide comprehensive inline tests for lockout, transitions, and faults.

Create a simple tutorial script: when a pushbutton is pressed, turn an indicator light on; when released, turn it off. Use the most basic syntax, add a simple safety block so the light defaults to OFF on any fault, and include an inline test that simulates a press and checks the light state.
Read a knob as an analog value and map it to an indicator brightness from 0% to 100%. Clamp the output to that range using a safety block. Provide inline tests for 0%, 50%, and 100% positions.

Measure room temperature in Celsius and turn on a cooling fan when it exceeds 25 °C, otherwise keep it off. Add a safety block that ignores impossible readings below −40 °C or above 125 °C. Include inline tests for 24 °C, 26 °C, and an out-of-range value.

Blink an LED at exactly 2 Hz for a classroom demo. Keep the loop simple, and include an inline test that checks the period is 500 ms within a small tolerance. Add a note in a safety block to stop blinking if timing is misconfigured.
Sound a buzzer when noise level exceeds 60 dB and silence it otherwise. Use straightforward if/else syntax, a safety block to mute on sensor failure, and inline tests for 55 dB and 65 dB.
Count button presses up to 9 and print the count to a console-like output; reset to 0 after 9. Default safely to 0 on reset or sensor fault. Provide inline tests that simulate a sequence of presses.
Implement a simple enable switch: when a switch is ON, pass through a signal to an output; when OFF, force the output to a safe 0 state. Add an inline test for both positions.

Take a raw sensor value and publish a moving average over the last 5 samples to reduce noise. Use basic loop constructs, include a safety block that freezes output if data becomes NaN, and add inline tests with a known sequence.
Map ambient light in lux to an LED brightness so that 0 lux gives 100% brightness and 1000 lux gives 0% (inverted mapping). Clamp within 0–100%. Include inline tests at 0, 500, and 1000 lux.

When a button is not pressed, keep an indicator ON; when pressed, turn it OFF (inverted logic). Use simple conditions, include a safety block defaulting to OFF if input is invalid, and add a basic inline test.
Turn on a dehumidifier relay when humidity is above 70% RH and turn it off when below or equal. Reject readings below 0% or above 100% with a safety block. Provide inline tests at 50%, 70%, and 105%.

Create a heater control with hysteresis: turn ON below 18 °C and turn OFF above 22 °C. Use basic syntax, include a safety block to ignore unrealistic readings, and add inline tests covering both thresholds.

Generate a single 500 ms output pulse each time a button press is detected. Ensure it does not retrigger while held. Include a safety block to debounce minimally and provide inline tests for press and hold.

Clamp a voltage measurement to the range 0.0–5.0 V and forward it to an output channel unchanged otherwise. Add inline tests for below-range, in-range, and above-range values, and include a safety default.
If light level falls below 100 lux, enable a shade actuator to open; otherwise, disable it. Default to disabled on any fault via a safety block, and include a simple inline test.

Build a simple traffic light state machine for a single intersection: Green 5 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 5 s, repeating. Include start-up initialization to Red, a safety block that forces Red on fault, and inline tests verifying state durations.
Design a door chime with an LED indicator: on button press, flash the LED twice and play a short beep pattern, then idle. Debounce the button for 50 ms. Add inline tests for rapid presses and timing.

Make a thermostat with manual override: automatic mode uses hysteresis (heat ON <20 °C, OFF >22 °C) and manual mode forces OFF. Use a state variable for mode, include a safety block that defaults to manual OFF on sensor fault, and add inline tests for mode switching.

Implement start/stop controls for a motor enable line using two buttons. Stop has priority over start. Include a safety block that disables the motor if both are pressed or if inputs are invalid, and add inline tests for all combinations.

Create a crosswalk button that integrates with a simple traffic light: when requested, extend the Red phase by 4 s and blink a walk indicator at 1 Hz during the extension. Ensure normal cycle otherwise. Provide inline tests for with/without request.

Control water pump based on two float switches: start when low level is reached and stop when high level is reached. Add a minimum off-time of 10 s to protect the pump. Use a safety block to shut down if both switches read active simultaneously. Include inline tests.

Use two light sensors to steer a pan actuator: if left is darker than right by more than 100 lux, pan left; if right is darker by more than 100 lux, pan right; otherwise hold. Limit the pan command between −100% and +100% in a safety block and add inline tests.

Create a reaction timer: after a random 1–3 s wait, turn on a light and measure how quickly a student presses a button. Report the reaction time in milliseconds. Ensure the loop runs at 100 Hz and include inline tests for simulated response times.

Build a metronome that beeps at a BPM set by a knob from 40 to 180 BPM. Quantize to whole BPM and ensure the tick timing error is under 2%. Add inline tests for several BPM settings and a safety block for invalid knob values.

Program a debounced toggle: each clean press of a button toggles an indicator on or off. Use a 30 ms debounce window. Include inline tests with a bouncy input sequence to demonstrate correct behavior.

Create a scheduled output gate that allows an actuator to run only during the first 3 seconds of every 10-second cycle. Outside that window, force OFF via a safety block. Add inline tests spanning multiple cycles.

Design a hand dryer state machine: detect hands via a proximity sensor, run the blower for 15 s, then enforce a 5 s cooldown before it can run again. Failsafe OFF on sensor fault using a safety block. Provide inline tests for enter/exit and cooldown.

Automate plant watering: if soil moisture is below 30% for more than 10 s, run a pump for 5 s; stop early if moisture rises above 40%. Include a safety block that prevents pumping longer than 10 s total per minute. Add inline tests with time progression.

Create a classroom alarm system with three states: Disarmed, Armed, and Alarm. Use an entry delay of 5 s after arming and a 10 s siren when triggered. Provide a safety block that mutes the siren if the battery voltage drops below 10.5 V. Add inline tests for transitions.

Implement two-sensor agreement: enable a heater only when both temperature sensors read below 18 °C. If they disagree by more than 3 °C, log a fault and keep the heater OFF via a safety block. Include inline tests.

Control window blinds with Up and Down buttons and an interlock so both cannot command motion simultaneously. Use states: Idle, MovingUp, MovingDown; stop when the limit switch for that direction is reached. Add inline tests for edge cases.

Make a line-following demo with two reflectance sensors: if left sees darker line, slow left motor and speed up right; if right sees darker, do the opposite; if neither, go straight. Cap motor outputs to 0–100% in a safety block and include inline tests.

Build a classroom timer: set minutes with a knob (0–10 min), start with a button, show remaining time via periodic prints, and beep for 2 s when time expires. Ensure the update loop runs at 10 Hz and add inline tests for a short timed run.

Create a CO2 warning light with three colors: Green below 800 ppm, Yellow 800–1200 ppm, Red above 1200 ppm. Include a safety block that treats any sensor error as Red. Provide inline tests at boundary values.

Implement a simple data logger that samples temperature in °C and humidity in %RH at 1 Hz and outputs a CSV line each second. Include a safety block that skips a record if either value is out of plausible range. Add inline tests with a short simulated run.

Demonstrate PID temperature control to hold a chamber at 37.0 °C. Run the control loop at 10 Hz, limit heater power to 0–80%, include anti-windup, and enter a safe OFF state if temperature exceeds 45 °C. Provide inline tests using a simple plant model.

Implement PID speed control to maintain a fan at 1200 RPM using a tachometer input. Sample at 50 Hz, cap the duty output at 0–100%, and immediately shut down if speed exceeds 1500 RPM via a safety block. Add inline tests with a mocked tach signal.

Fuse two temperature sensors by computing a median-filtered value and rejecting any reading more than ±5 °C from the current estimate. If both are rejected, hold the last good value and disable the actuator in a safety block. Include inline tests with outliers.

Create a complementary filter to estimate tilt angle by combining a gyroscope (deg/s) and accelerometer (g) at 100 Hz. Saturate the angle estimate to ±90°. On sensor dropout, freeze estimate and flag a fault using a safety block. Add inline tests.

Fuse two distance sensors to estimate range in centimeters: take the median of three recent samples from each and then compute a weighted average favoring the more stable sensor. Reject ranges below 2 cm and above 400 cm in a safety block. Include inline tests.

Design a PID liquid level controller to maintain 50% level in a small tank using a pump output. Run at 10 Hz, limit output slew rate to avoid surges, and enter a fault-safe state if level sensor reports stuck values for more than 3 s. Provide inline tests.

Build an advanced thermostat with adaptive gain: use PID around a 22 °C setpoint and reduce proportional gain when rate of change exceeds 1 °C/min. Enforce heater OFF if room surpasses 28 °C via a safety block. Add inline tests showing adaptation.

Implement sensor fusion for a classroom weather station: combine humidity and temperature to compute relative comfort index, and fuse two wind speed readings in m/s using a trimmed mean that drops the highest and lowest of a 5-sample window. Safety-block out impossible values. Include inline tests.

Create a fault-tolerant controller that monitors three identical temperature sensors and uses majority voting. If agreement spread exceeds 2 °C, enter a degraded mode that shuts off actuators and logs a warning via a safety block. Provide inline tests.

Develop a closed-loop position controller for an actuator to reach 45 degrees using PID with a 100 Hz update rate. Limit command in degrees per second to 90 deg/s, and trigger a safety stop if error stays above 10 degrees for more than 2 s. Include inline tests.

Create a multi-mode classroom demo system with Manual and Auto modes for a small vehicle: Manual sets left/right motor outputs from two knobs; Auto performs simple line following using two sensors. Include a mode switch, an emergency stop that overrides both modes, WCET under 2 ms per 100 Hz cycle, simple safety blocks for output limits, and comprehensive inline tests covering mode transitions and E-stop.

Build a climate control trainer with four modes: Off, Heat (PID to 21 °C), Cool (PID to 24 °C), and Auto (select based on current temperature). Require a 2-minute minimum off-time between compressor starts in Cool, enforce max heater duty 80% in Heat, and default to Off on any sensor fault via safety blocks. Include a thorough set of inline tests for each mode and transitions.

Design a multi-mode traffic controller with Day and Night profiles: Day uses standard Green/Yellow/Red timing with a pedestrian request; Night flashes Yellow every 1 s and responds to pedestrian requests by switching to an all-Red phase for 6 s. Guarantee WCET below 1 ms at 100 Hz, force all Red on faults via a safety block, and provide extensive inline tests for both profiles.

Implement a fault-tolerant sensor fusion module for distance measurement with three range sensors: use a rolling trimmed mean, detect and isolate persistent outliers, and fail over to the two remaining sensors if one dies. Provide a maintenance mode to run self-tests, enforce output limits (2–400 cm) in a safety block, and include comprehensive inline tests with dropout and recovery scenarios.

Create a multi-mode lab demonstrator that teaches control: Mode A runs a simple open-loop motor ramp, Mode B runs PID speed control to a target RPM, Mode C simulates a sensor fault and demonstrates safe shutdown. Include an instructor switch to select modes, enforce output limits and emergency stop in safety blocks, ensure control updates complete within 1 ms at 200 Hz, and supply a broad suite of inline tests.

Write a very simple ReflexScript that turns an LED on while a push button is pressed and turns it off otherwise. Include a basic debounce and a simple safety block that ensures the LED defaults OFF on startup. Add inline tests that simulate quick taps and long presses.

Make a classroom demo that beeps a buzzer for 300 ms whenever the measured temperature exceeds 30 Celsius. Add a safety block that ignores readings outside −40 to 125 C. Provide inline tests for 29 C, 30 C, and 31 C.

Create a tiny program that maps a knob reading (0–100%) to LED brightness (0–100%). Clamp out-of-range inputs, and default brightness to 0% if the sensor is missing. Add inline tests covering 0%, 50%, 100%, and an invalid 150% reading.

Blink a status LED at exactly 1 Hz with a 50% duty cycle. Include a simple timing constraint and document a WCET budget of 0.5 ms per tick. Add inline tests that verify the on/off durations within a small tolerance.

Count button presses and show the count modulo 8 using three LEDs as a binary display. Ensure the count resets to 0 on startup and when a reset button is held for 2 seconds. Include debounce and inline tests for rapid press sequences.

Turn on an LED when ambient light is below 50 lux and turn it off when above 60 lux (hysteresis). Include a safety block that forces the LED OFF if the light sensor value is invalid. Add inline tests with a sequence of lux values crossing thresholds.

When motion is detected, turn on a light for 5 seconds, then turn it off. Retrigger the timer if motion happens again, but cap the maximum continuous ON time at 10 seconds. Include inline tests simulating motion bursts.

Display temperature range: turn a green LED ON when 20–25 Celsius, else turn a red LED ON. Ensure only one LED can be on at a time. Include safety that turns both OFF if the reading is missing. Add inline tests at 19, 22, and 27 C.
Add a simple safety interlock: if supply voltage falls below 3.0 V, turn off all outputs and stay off until the voltage rises above 3.2 V. Include inline tests that simulate a brownout and recovery.

Implement a classroom timer: every 100 ms increment a counter; when a reset button is held for 1 second, reset to zero. Show activity by blinking an LED briefly each second. Provide debounce and inline tests for hold detection.
Create a press-and-hold demo: LED is ON only while the button is held down. Use a simple safety block to filter bounce and ensure LED is OFF at startup. Add inline tests for chattering inputs.
On receiving a 'start' input, wait 3 seconds, then turn on an LED. If 'start' goes low before 3 seconds, cancel the action. Provide inline tests for both completion and cancellation cases.
Generate a steady PWM output at 25% duty cycle for an LED dimming demo. Include a safety rule that forces 0% duty if an enable input is low. Add inline tests verifying duty cycle transitions.

Control a small hobby servo: read a slider input (0–180 degrees) and set the servo angle accordingly. Clamp the command to 0–180 degrees and default to 90 degrees if the input is invalid. Include inline tests at edge values.

Create a low-temperature alarm: if temperature drops below 5 Celsius, flash an LED at 2 Hz for 10 seconds, then rearm. Add a safety block to ignore sensor glitches shorter than 100 ms. Provide inline tests with step changes.

Build a two-button mini lock: require Button A then Button B within 3 seconds to toggle an LED. Use a small state machine and reset on timeout or wrong order. Add a simple lockout after 3 failed attempts for 10 seconds. Include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences.

Implement a traffic light state machine for a simple intersection with a pedestrian request button. Enforce timing: green 10 s, yellow 2 s, red 10 s; when pressed, serve pedestrian crossing safely. Add a safety rule that prevents conflicting greens. Provide inline tests covering normal cycle and a button press mid-cycle.

Use a rotary encoder to adjust LED brightness in steps of 5%. Debounce the signals and clamp brightness between 0% and 100%. Include inline tests for clockwise and counterclockwise turns and boundary cases.
Make a metronome: LED pulses at a tempo set by a knob from 40 to 180 BPM. Ensure timing accuracy within ±1%. Declare WCET under 1 ms per tick. Add inline tests for 40 BPM and 180 BPM.

Create a simple fan controller: read temperature in Celsius and choose low/medium/high speeds based on thresholds (e.g., <25 C off, 25–30 low, 30–35 medium, >35 high). Add a safety cutoff at 80 C with a warning blink. Include inline tests across thresholds.

Write a hysteresis thermostat: heater ON at 22 C, OFF at 24 C. Default to OFF if the temperature sensor is missing or invalid. Provide inline tests that step the temperature up and down through the thresholds.

Design a motion-activated light: on motion, turn light ON and keep it on for at least 30 seconds; retrigger if new motion arrives. Enforce a maximum ON time of 5 minutes. Include inline tests simulating sparse and frequent motion.

Sample light and temperature every 200 ms and compute a moving average over the last 5 samples for each. Use the averaged light to set LED brightness. Add a safety block to handle NaN or out-of-range values. Provide inline tests with noisy inputs.
Create a two-mode blinker: Mode A blinks an LED at 1 Hz, Mode B at 5 Hz. Toggle modes with a button. Ensure clean transitions and debounce. Add inline tests for rapid toggling.

Build a battery monitor: based on measured voltage, signal states with LED patterns: >3.8 V solid, 3.6–3.8 V slow blink, 3.4–3.6 V fast blink, <3.4 V off and enter low-power. Add a safety block for low-voltage shutdown at 3.2 V. Include inline tests at all thresholds.

Implement a stopwatch: start/stop and reset buttons, with an LED indicating running state. Use a 100 Hz tick to accumulate elapsed time in milliseconds. Require WCET under 2 ms per tick. Add inline tests for start/stop/reset sequences.

Model elevator doors with a small state machine: CLOSED, OPENING, OPEN, CLOSING. Inputs: open command, close command, and obstruction sensor. Safety rule: never close when obstructed; time out opening/closing after 5 s. Provide inline tests for obstruction events and timeouts.

Develop a reaction timer: after a random delay between 1 and 3 seconds, turn on an LED; measure the time until the button is pressed and record the reaction time in milliseconds. Ignore premature presses. Include inline tests with simulated user responses.

Create a plant-watering demo: when soil moisture drops below a threshold, run a pump for up to 5 seconds, then wait at least 30 minutes before allowing another run. Add a safety daily limit of 60 seconds total run time. Include inline tests that simulate a day of operation.

Mix three LED channels (R, G, B) from three sliders to demonstrate color blending. Add a simple safety model that caps the sum of brightness to a maximum to simulate current limiting. Include inline tests for cap behavior.

Design a toy vending controller: accept coin inputs of 1, 2, and 5 units; vend when total >= 7 units; indicate change owed with blink counts. Reset after vend. Add a safety block that ignores invalid coin pulses. Provide inline tests for various coin sequences.

Implement a one-way pedestrian crossing sequencer: normally green; when a request arrives, switch to yellow for 2 seconds, red for 10 seconds, then back to green. Enforce the durations precisely. Add inline tests for repeated requests.
Filter noisy temperature readings using a 3-sample median filter before comparing to thresholds for an alarm. Include inline tests that inject spikes and show the filter behavior.
Use a tilt sensor to trigger a buzzer when the tilt exceeds 15 degrees for longer than 500 ms. Add hysteresis so it turns off only below 10 degrees. Include inline tests for jittery angles.

Set up a two-team quiz buzzer: the first button pressed locks out the other team; indicate the winner with LEDs until a reset button is pressed. Debounce inputs and ensure ties within 20 ms resolve to 'tie' indication. Provide inline tests for race conditions.

Implement PID temperature control to maintain 37.0 Celsius using a heater output from 0% to 100%. Include anti-windup and a safety cutoff that shuts everything down above 40.0 C. Run the control loop at 10 Hz. Provide inline tests with step changes and a simulated plant.

Create a motor speed controller using PID to hold a setpoint in revolutions per minute (rpm) from a tachometer input. Limit the rate of change of the command to avoid jerk. Add inline tests for a setpoint step and a sudden load increase.

Fuse two temperature sensors by computing a weighted average and rejecting outliers when they differ by more than 5 C. Drive a fan speed based on the fused temperature. Enter safe mode if a disagreement persists for 10 seconds. Include inline tests covering agreement and disagreement cases.

Estimate tilt angle by combining accelerometer and gyroscope measurements with a complementary filter. If tilt exceeds 30 degrees for 1 second, trigger an alarm. Provide a safety fallback that uses only accelerometer data if the gyro is unavailable. Add inline tests for steady tilt and quick motions.

Regulate water level at 25 cm in a small tank using PID control of a valve (0–100% open). Safety: if level exceeds 30 cm, force valve closed and latch a fault until manually cleared. Run at 20 Hz. Include inline tests with inflow disturbances.

Compute heat index from temperature (C) and relative humidity (%) and indicate comfort with LEDs: comfortable, warm, hot. Safety: handle invalid sensor values by showing an error state. Add inline tests with representative inputs.

Detect hand claps using an adaptive threshold based on a moving average and standard deviation of microphone amplitude. Rate limit detections to at most 2 per second. Include inline tests with bursts and background noise.

Build a simple line follower logic: read left and right reflectance sensors, compute lateral error, and apply PID to a steering output (−1.0 to +1.0). Safety: stop if both sensors report loss of line for >500 ms. Provide inline tests with a curved path and a gap.

Control a classroom ventilation fan based on CO2 concentration in parts per million (ppm) using PID to maintain 800 ppm. Safety: cap fan speed at 80% and trigger an alert if CO2 exceeds 2000 ppm. Run the loop at 5 Hz. Add inline tests for occupancy changes.

Create a tilt-compensated compass: fuse accelerometer and magnetometer to compute heading in degrees. Safety: if magnetic field magnitude is out of expected range, enter a degraded mode and flag an error. Include inline tests for rotations and magnetic disturbances.

Design a multi-mode lab incubator controller with modes OFF, HEAT, HOLD, and COOL. Use PID in HOLD to maintain a temperature setpoint in Celsius. Safety requirements: dual-sensor voting with plausibility checks, watchdog heartbeat, and an overtemperature latch above 40 C. Control loop at 10 Hz with WCET ≤2 ms. Include inline tests for mode transitions, sensor faults, and watchdog expiry.

Create an autonomous classroom greenhouse demo with modes DAY, NIGHT, and AWAY. Control lighting by schedule, humidity with PID (%RH), and irrigation based on soil moisture thresholds with daily limits. Safety interlocks: leak detection, low reservoir, and door-open pause. Run at 5 Hz. Provide comprehensive inline tests for schedule changes, fault injection, and recovery.

Implement a mobile robot demo controller with modes IDLE, DRIVE, and DOCK. Fuse wheel odometry and IMU for pose, and use velocity PID in m/s. Safety: e-stop input, low-battery derating, and collision timeout if no progress for 2 seconds. Enforce a 50 Hz loop with WCET ≤1 ms. Add inline tests for abrupt stops, sensor dropout, and docking transitions.

Develop a wind tunnel classroom controller with modes CALIBRATE, RUN, and SAFE. Maintain airspeed in m/s using PID with a pitot sensor. Perform an auto-calibration on startup. Safety: door interlock, overcurrent trip, and overspeed hard stop. Update at 100 Hz with WCET ≤0.5 ms. Include inline tests for calibration failure, overspeed, and recovery to SAFE.

Build a multi-station quiz game for up to 8 teams: first-press lockout, tie handling within a 20 ms fairness window, scoreboard display logic, and referee override. Safety: heartbeat monitor and brownout safe state. Timing: 200 Hz input scan with WCET ≤0.8 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests for ties, resets, and power recovery.

Write a simple ReflexScript that turns a light on whenever a pushbutton is pressed and turns it off when released. Use clear basic syntax and include a tiny safety block that ensures the light starts OFF at power-up. Add one inline test that simulates a press and checks the output goes ON.

Create a beginner-friendly blinker: flash an indicator at 1 Hz with a 50% duty cycle. Keep the script minimal, include a safety block that disables the output if the rate is set to zero, and add an inline test that verifies two toggles occur over 2 seconds.

Read a temperature sensor in Celsius and turn on an LED if the temperature is above 30 C. Include a simple safety default (LED off on sensor error) and an inline test covering both below and above threshold cases.
Make a ReflexScript that reads a knob and maps 0–100% to a bargraph output. Clamp values to [0,100] with a basic safety guard. Add one inline test to confirm that a 120% input clamps to 100%.
Debounce a classroom pushbutton with a 50 ms filter and only count rising edges. Blink an LED once for each valid press. Include an inline test for a bouncing waveform.

Build a 10-second timer that counts up once per second and then resets to zero. Show the count on a simple numeric output. Add a safety block that resets the count if any overflow is detected, and include an inline test for the rollover.
On motion detection, pulse a buzzer for 200 ms then stay quiet for 800 ms before rearming. Use clear timing and a small safety block to prevent continuous buzzing. Include one inline test.

Read a light sensor and turn a night-light on when the level is below a threshold. Provide hysteresis of 5 units to avoid flicker. Add a safety default (light off) if the sensor value is invalid, and an inline test for hysteresis behavior.
Create a simple square wave generator at 2 Hz for a classroom demo. Provide a safety limit so the frequency cannot exceed 10 Hz. Include an inline test that checks the period is 0.5 s.
Make a ReflexScript that converts Celsius to Fahrenheit and prints both. Include inline tests for 0 C and 100 C to verify 32 F and 212 F.

Implement a rising-edge detector: when a digital input goes from 0 to 1, briefly flash an LED for 100 ms. Include a safety block so the LED is forced off if the input is undefined, and add a simple inline test.
Compare two analog inputs A and B. If A > B by at least 0.2 units, turn on an indicator; otherwise turn it off. Include an inline test with sample pairs.
Write a small script that limits a value to the safe range 0 to 5 volts before passing it to an output. Add inline tests that check clamping at -1 V and 6 V.

If no button press is detected within 5 s, flash an LED rapidly to prompt interaction. Stop flashing on the next valid press. Include a basic safety block to ensure flashing stops when the system is disabled, plus one inline test.

Create a simple metering demo: read humidity in % and show a three-level indicator (low <30%, ok 30–60%, high >60%). Add inline tests for boundary values and default to 'ok' on missing data with a safety guard.
