Design a two-button controller: one button starts a timer, the other stops it. Display elapsed time in seconds. Include debouncing, a safety rule that time cannot decrease, and inline tests for start/stop sequences.

Build a tiny traffic light state machine with Green (5 s), Yellow (2 s), and Red (5 s) states. Add a pedestrian request button that shortens the current Green to 2 s minimum before changing. Include a safety block that forces Red on any fault and inline tests for transitions.
Create PWM dimming of an LED based on a light sensor: brighter room -> dimmer LED. Limit the duty cycle between 10% and 90% as a safety measure. Add inline tests for mapping and limits.
Write a fan controller with two speeds: turn on low at 28 C and high at 32 C, with 1 C hysteresis. Fail safe to OFF if the temperature is invalid. Provide inline tests for threshold and hysteresis.

Make a calibration routine: when a button is held for 2 s, store the current sensor baseline and thereafter subtract it from readings. Include a safety guard preventing calibration while the sensor is unstable, and inline tests.
Program a metronome that ticks every 500 ms, with tempo adjustable from 300 to 1200 ms via a knob. Enforce limits with a safety block and add an inline test for 500 ms timing.

Develop a door alarm with states: IDLE, ARMED, ALARM. Use a switch to arm/disarm and a sensor to trigger ALARM. Require a 2 s hold to disarm. Include a safety default to IDLE on fault, and inline tests for state changes.

When a toggle switch is flipped on, sweep a servo smoothly from 0 to 180 degrees over 3 s; when flipped off, sweep back. Add a safety clamp to keep angles within 0–180 and include inline tests for endpoints.

Encode SOS in Morse code on a buzzer ( ... --- ... ). Keep timing accurate within ±10 ms. Include a safety block that silences the buzzer if a cancel input is active, and inline tests for dot/dash durations.
Implement a moving average filter of window 8 on a noisy sensor, then drive an indicator when the filtered value exceeds a threshold. Add inline tests that verify smoothing.
Create a color mixer using three sliders for red, green, and blue. Limit the combined output power to a safe maximum by scaling if necessary. Include inline tests demonstrating the limiter.

Make a low-voltage monitor: if measured supply drops below 3.3 V for more than 100 ms, set a LOW indicator; clear it only after rising above 3.5 V. Debounce the input, add a safety default (indicator off on bad reading), and include inline tests.
Write a countdown timer from 60 to 0 seconds with pause and resume buttons. Sound a beep for 500 ms at the end. Include a safety rule preventing the count from going negative and add inline tests.
Log an event every time a button is pressed and store a timestamp in milliseconds up to 60 s. Provide a safety cap on the log size and inline tests for wraparound behavior.
Create a simple scheduler that runs Task A at 10 Hz and Task B at 1 Hz. Ensure Task A WCET is less than 2 ms. Include inline tests to check the rates.
Implement a rate limiter so that an output value cannot change faster than 10% per second. Provide an inline test that steps the input and verifies the slew.
Design a proximity warning: as distance (in cm) decreases, increase a buzzer beep rate from 0.5 Hz at 100 cm to 5 Hz at 10 cm. Clamp within these limits as a safety feature and include inline tests.

Build a classroom stoplight driven by two sensors: if noise level > 70 dB or occupancy is high, show RED; else if noise > 50 dB, show YELLOW; otherwise GREEN. Include a safety default to YELLOW on sensor fault and inline tests.

Implement a simple uploader simulation: every second, send the latest averaged sensor value and reset its accumulator. Add a safety guard that prevents sending NaN or invalid data. Include inline tests.

Construct a mini game: reaction timer. Light turns on randomly after 1–3 s; student presses button as fast as possible. Measure reaction in milliseconds and display best-of-5. Safety: ignore presses before the signal. Include inline tests.

Implement a PID temperature controller to maintain 37.0 C using a heater output. Sample at 10 Hz, limit output 0–100%, add anti-windup, and include a safety cutoff that disables the heater above 40 C or on sensor fault. Provide inline tests for setpoint tracking and clamp behavior.

Fuse two temperature sensors by weighted average (70/30). If their difference exceeds 2.0 C for more than 1 s, raise a FAULT and freeze the output at a safe value. Include inline tests for both normal and divergent cases.

Create a motor control state machine with states OFF, RAMP_UP, RUN, and FAULT. Command speed in m/s with a maximum acceleration of 0.5 m/s^2. Stop and enter FAULT on overcurrent. Guarantee a control loop rate of 50 Hz with a WCET under 1 ms, and add inline tests.

Regulate ambient light to a setpoint in lux using PWM. Include a PI controller with output limits and anti-windup. Add a safety block that forces minimum brightness if the sensor saturates, plus inline tests.

Develop a fallback scheme: use a primary distance sensor, but if no new data arrives within 500 ms, switch to a secondary sensor and flag a warning. Ensure outputs stay within safe bounds. Provide inline tests for timeout and recovery.

Implement adaptive sampling: measure signal variance and increase sampling rate up to 200 Hz when variance is high; drop to 10 Hz when steady. Enforce CPU usage limits and include inline tests for rate switching.

Build an event counter that triggers on rising edges faster than 100 Hz without missing events, and resets every second. Provide a safety feature that disables counting if the input is stuck high. Include inline tests.

Estimate tilt angle in degrees by blending a gyro (deg/s) and an accelerometer using a complementary filter (e.g., 98%/2%). Constrain the estimate to [-90, 90] degrees as a safety measure and include inline tests.

Create an environmental monitor that reads temperature (C) and humidity (%) to compute a heat index, then sets fan speed LOW/MED/HIGH accordingly. Fail safe to LOW on invalid readings and include inline tests for the calculation.

Add a two-hand safety interlock for an actuator: require two buttons pressed within 0.2 s to activate, release either to deactivate. Detect and lock out a stuck button condition. Provide inline tests.

Design a classroom greenhouse controller with modes OFF, MANUAL, AUTO, and SAFE_SHUTDOWN. Control heater to 24 C, lamp to maintain 500 lux, and irrigation based on soil moisture %. Schedule tasks at: sensing 5 Hz, control 2 Hz, logging 0.5 Hz. Guarantee WCET per cycle under 3 ms. Include simple safety blocks for overtemp and dry-run protection, and comprehensive inline tests for all mode transitions.

Create a complete line-following demo: two reflectance sensors feed a state machine with SEARCH, LOCK, and LOST states; a PID adjusts steering to keep centered; cap speed at 0.5 m/s as a safety limit. Provide thorough inline tests covering sharp turns and sensor dropout.

Build a diagnostic harness for classroom projects: perform a built-in self-test at startup for all inputs and outputs, then enter normal operation with periodic health checks. Specify logging at 10 Hz and fault escalation (WARN, ERROR, SAFE). Include safety blocks and inline tests with coverage goals.

Implement a multi-rate framework: run sensor fusion at 100 Hz, control loop at 50 Hz, and user interface updates at 5 Hz. Declare WCET limits per task and enforce deadlines. Add unit-aware checks and extensive inline tests for rate separation.

Write a lab template that students can extend: includes a stub state machine, a configurable PID block, sensor mapping utilities with units, a simple safety pattern for outputs, and example inline tests. Provide clear comments and beginner-friendly structure.

Make a tiny classroom demo: when a pushbutton is pressed, turn on an indicator LED; otherwise keep it off. Add a simple safety block to ignore bouncing for 50 ms, and include inline tests to check the LED follows the button.
Create a periodic blinker that toggles an LED at 1 Hz. Provide a safety limiter so the blink period cannot go below 100 ms if misconfigured. Add inline tests that validate the on/off durations.
Read a light sensor (0–100%) and map it to an LED brightness output. Clamp outputs to 0–100% with a simple safety block. Include inline tests with sample inputs and expected outputs.
Build a classroom counter: each time a button is tapped, increment a 0–9 display and wrap to 0 after 9. Debounce taps with a 30 ms safety filter. Add inline tests for incrementing and wraparound.

Make a simple temperature alert: if temperature exceeds 30 Celsius, turn on a warning LED; otherwise turn it off. Include a safety block that treats any invalid reading as safe (LED off), and inline tests for boundary values.
Create a buzzer that beeps for 200 ms when a button is released (edge-triggered). Add a safety block to prevent re-triggering within 300 ms. Include inline tests covering quick taps and long presses.

Design a simple toggle switch: each button press flips an LED state. Use a safety block to reject long presses over 2 seconds as errors. Include inline tests for press/release sequences and error handling.

Make a heartbeat indicator that blinks fast (4 Hz) while an 'active' flag is true and slow (0.5 Hz) otherwise. Cap CPU time with a WCET budget of 1 ms per cycle. Add inline timing tests to verify both rates and the WCET.
Convert Celsius to Fahrenheit and display the result as an integer. Include a safety block that saturates outputs to 0–212 F, and inline tests for known conversion pairs like 0 C and 100 C.

Create a simple threshold gate: output HIGH if an analog input is above 2.5 V, LOW otherwise. Add a 20 ms hold-off safety block to avoid chatter. Include inline tests for just-below and just-above threshold cases.
Build a classroom metronome LED that flashes every 600 ms, with a start/stop input. Safety: prevent rates faster than 100 ms. Provide inline tests for start/stop behavior and rate limit enforcement.
Make a two-LED indicator: red if value < 25, green if value >= 25. Ensure they never turn on simultaneously using a safety guard. Add inline tests for both sides of the threshold.

Create a simple timer: when a button is pressed, turn on an LED for exactly 3 seconds then turn it off. Add safety to cancel the timer if the button is held longer than 5 seconds. Include inline tests for normal and cancel cases.

Design a classroom demo that latches an alarm when temperature > 40 C until a reset button is pressed. Include a safety block that logs and ignores negative readings. Add inline tests for latch, reset, and invalid data.
Make a stepwise dimmer: each short button press increases brightness by 10% up to 100%, then wraps to 0%. Debounce with a 25 ms safety filter and include inline tests for stepping and wrap behavior.

Implement a simple three-state traffic light for a classroom model: green (5 s), yellow (2 s), red (5 s) repeating. Add a pedestrian button that inserts a safe red phase. Provide inline tests for state transitions and timing tolerances.

Create a reaction-time game: two players each have a button and LED; after a random 1–3 s wait, light a 'go' LED and record who presses first. Penalize early presses by flashing their LED. Include inline tests simulating timing scenarios.

Build a stop/start timer with lap capture: a start/stop button toggles counting, and a lap button stores the current time. Safety: ignore lap presses if not running. Add inline tests for lap accuracy and state handling.

Design a thermostat with hysteresis: maintain 22 C by switching heat on below 21.5 C and off above 22.5 C. Safety: treat sensor timeouts as 'heat off'. Include inline tests for hysteresis and fault handling.

Create a two-mode LED pattern: mode A chases left to right, mode B chases right to left. Mode changes on a mode button. Safety: prevent mode change during an active step to avoid glitches. Add inline tests for mode switching.

Implement a finite state machine for door monitoring: states Closed, Open, Alarm. If open longer than 10 s, enter Alarm and pulse a buzzer at 2 Hz until closed again. Include a safety block to handle stuck sensors, and inline tests.

Build a proportional dimmer using a potentiometer input to control LED brightness, with a 'lock' button that freezes the output until unlocked. Safety: bound the brightness to 0–100%. Add inline tests.

Create a countdown timer that starts from a configurable number of seconds, shows remaining time on a numeric display, and beeps at 0. Safety: cap configurable time at 600 s. Include inline tests for counts and cap enforcement.

Make a cycle controller for a small pump: run 5 s ON, 10 s OFF repeatedly, unless a disable input is active. Safety: enforce a minimum 3 s OFF between runs. Add inline tests for cycle timing and disable behavior.

Design an elevator door simulator: open, closing, closed states with an obstruction sensor. If obstruction is detected while closing, return to open. Add a safety timeout so closing cannot exceed 4 s. Provide inline tests for all transitions.

Implement a message-controlled blinker: on receiving a 'blink N' command via a simple text input stream, blink N times, limiting N to 1–9. Safety: ignore malformed commands. Include inline tests of parsing and limits.

Create a day/night lamp: use a light sensor to switch ON below 20% and OFF above 40% (hysteresis). Add a manual override that forces OFF for 30 minutes. Include a safety block to handle sensor saturation and inline tests.

Build a digital lock with code entry via four buttons. After the correct sequence, pulse an 'unlock' line for 1 s. After three wrong attempts, lock out for 60 s. Safety: enforce per-press debounce. Add inline tests for success and lockout.

Design a water level monitor with two float switches: OK, Low, Critical. Drive LEDs accordingly, and sound a buzzer continuously in Critical. Safety: fail-safe to Critical if readings are contradictory. Include inline tests.

Create a classroom semaphore: alternate two outputs A and B every 750 ms, but if a 'priority' flag is set, hold A active for an extra 500 ms per cycle. Add inline tests for timing with and without priority.

Implement a simple event logger that counts button presses per minute and resets the count every 60 s. Safety: cap the count at 999 to avoid overflow. Provide inline tests for counting and reset behavior.

Build a fan controller with three speeds based on temperature ranges: low at 25–29 C, medium at 30–34 C, high at 35 C and above, off below 25 C. Safety: if the sensor is invalid, force off. Add inline tests for range boundaries.

Create a simple Morse code trainer: when a student taps a key, measure press duration and classify as dot (<200 ms) or dash (>=200 ms); blink feedback accordingly. Safety: ignore presses longer than 2 s. Include inline tests.

Design a countdown with pause/resume and a 'halfway' event that flashes an LED three times when 50% time remains. Safety: prevent negative time values. Add inline tests for pause/resume and halfway detection.

Implement a classroom quiz buzzer for up to four players: the first button pressed locks out others and lights that player's LED until reset. Safety: handle simultaneous presses deterministically. Include inline tests showing tie-break rules.

Create a PID controller demo that maintains a target temperature at 40 C using a heater output. Use a 10 Hz control loop, with safety limits on output 0–100% and integral windup protection. Include inline tests with step responses.

Implement a closed-loop speed controller for a small fan using tachometer pulses, with PID at 50 Hz. Safety: cut output if measured speed exceeds 5000 RPM or if the sensor is missing. Add inline tests for setpoint tracking and faults.

Build a two-sensor fusion demo for temperature: combine readings from two sensors using a weighted average that ignores any sensor deviating more than 5 C from the other. Safety: if both are invalid, signal a fault and force outputs safe. Provide inline tests.

Design a tilt estimation example that fuses accelerometer X/Y with a simple complementary filter at 100 Hz to compute angle in degrees. Safety: saturate angle output to ±90°. Add inline tests for static and step changes.

Create a fluid level controller that maintains 50% level by modulating a valve with PID, updating at 20 Hz. Safety: enforce a minimum closed time of 200 ms to protect hardware and trigger an alarm if level change rate exceeds 10%/s. Include inline tests.

Implement a line-following demo with two reflectance sensors driving left/right motor speeds using proportional control. Safety: stop motors if sensors disagree beyond a threshold or if a stop switch is pressed. Add inline tests.

Build a classroom greenhouse controller: maintain 60% relative humidity and 24 C with separate outputs, coordinating so heater and fan are not on simultaneously. Safety: fail to safe OFF on any sensor fault. Include inline tests.

Create a rate-limited position controller: accept position commands in millimeters, limit slew rate to 50 mm/s, and apply a PI loop at 100 Hz. Safety: clamp the commanded range to 0–200 mm and enforce a WCET under 2 ms. Provide inline tests.

Design a vibration monitor that low-pass filters a sensor at 200 Hz sample rate and triggers an alarm if RMS exceeds 1.5 g for more than 2 s. Safety: handle missing data gracefully and avoid false alarms. Include inline tests.

Implement multi-sensor fusion for room occupancy: combine PIR, sound level, and light change to estimate occupancy from 0 to 1. Safety: bound the output to 0–1 and default to 0 if all sensors are quiet for 15 minutes. Add inline tests.

Develop a multi-mode classroom demo: Manual mode lets a user set LED brightness; Auto mode tracks ambient light to keep desk illumination at 300 lux target with PI control; Safe mode forces LED off on sensor fault. Include a clear state machine, timing at 20 Hz, a WCET budget of 1 ms, a simple safety block for bounds, and comprehensive inline tests covering mode transitions and fault recovery.

Create a lab project controller with three modes: Setup, Run, and Diagnostics. In Setup, calibrate a temperature sensor; in Run, regulate to a setpoint with PID; in Diagnostics, output self-test patterns. Include safety interlocks that prevent entering Run unless calibration succeeded, and provide exhaustive inline tests for each mode and transition.

Design a robotics classroom base with modes Idle, Teleop, and Auto. Idle keeps outputs safe, Teleop maps joystick inputs to wheel speeds with limits, Auto follows a timed trajectory at 50 Hz while respecting speed and acceleration constraints. Include fail-safe transitions to Idle on any fault, WCET not to exceed 2 ms, and thorough inline tests with simulated inputs.

Build a comprehensive environmental chamber demo with modes Heat, Cool, Soak, and Standby. Sequence through a programmed profile with dwell times in minutes, enforce mutually exclusive actuators, and log key events. Add safety for over-temperature at 60 C and sensor disagreement, and provide extensive inline tests for profile execution and corner cases.

Implement a multi-stage experiment timer: program up to five stages with durations and outputs, support pause/resume and skip, and guarantee deterministic behavior under timing jitter. Include a safety block capping total runtime at 2 hours, WCET analysis notes, and comprehensive inline tests for scheduling and user interactions.

Create a simple classroom demo that turns an indicator light on while a pushbutton is held and off otherwise. Use a simple safety block so the light defaults to OFF on startup and on any input fault. Add concise inline tests that simulate press and release and verify the output matches.

Make a heartbeat blinker that flashes an indicator at 1 Hz with 50% duty. Include a simple safety block that forces the light OFF if the timing routine fails. Provide inline tests that check the on/off durations are about 500 ms each.

Build a basic thermostat exercise: if the measured temperature is below 20 °C, turn a heater output ON, otherwise OFF. Add a safety block that hard-cuts the heater if the reading exceeds 30 °C or becomes invalid. Include inline tests covering 19.5 °C, 20.0 °C, 31.0 °C, and a missing reading.

Map a slider input (0-100%) to a buzzer volume output limited to 0-80%. Use a safety block to clamp the volume and mute on input errors. Write inline tests that sweep 0%, 50%, 100%, and an out-of-range value.

When a tap sensor detects a knock, play a 200 ms beep once, then ignore further knocks for 300 ms. Include a safety block that ensures the buzzer is silent if the sensor is noisy or unavailable. Add inline tests for single tap, rapid double-tap, and no tap.

Turn on a lamp when ambient light falls below 200 lux and turn it off at or above 220 lux (simple hysteresis). Use a safety block to default the lamp OFF on sensor fault. Include inline tests around 199, 200, 219, and 220 lux.
Every 5 seconds, emit a short 100 ms beep as a periodic reminder. Ensure a safety block silences the buzzer if the scheduler falters. Provide inline tests that verify the interval and pulse width.

If a slide switch is ON, hold an indicator at 30% brightness; if OFF, keep it off. Add a simple safety block that forces OFF if the switch state is unreadable. Include inline tests for both positions and a fault case.

Turn a fan ON when the air quality index is 100 or higher, and OFF otherwise. Include a safety block that prevents operation if the index reading is stale. Add inline tests for 99, 100, 150, and an invalid value.

At power-up, assert a digital output HIGH for 2 seconds, then keep it LOW. Use a safety block that ensures the output returns LOW on any timing error. Provide inline tests that check behavior at t=0 s, 1 s, 2 s, and 3 s.

Create a command-to-output passthrough that caps a PWM duty request at 60%. Add a safety block that also enforces a minimum of 0% and sets 0% if input is NaN. Include inline tests for requests -10%, 0%, 50%, 60%, and 90%.

Average the last 4 sensor readings and turn an alarm LED ON if the mean exceeds a configurable threshold. Include a safety block that suppresses the alarm when fewer than 4 valid samples are available. Write inline tests with sequences just below and just above the threshold.
If a tilt detector reports TILTED, sound a buzzer; otherwise stay silent. Use a simple safety block to silence on invalid states. Add inline tests for both conditions and a fault.

When soil moisture falls below 30%, run a pump for 1 second, then wait until the next valid low reading. Include a safety block that prevents repeated activation more often than once every 5 seconds. Provide inline tests for low, high, and rapid toggling inputs.

On power-up, blink an indicator three times (200 ms on, 200 ms off), then leave it steadily ON. Add a safety block that keeps the indicator OFF if initialization fails. Include inline tests that validate the blink count and final state.

Design a small traffic light state machine for a single crossing: GREEN 5 s, YELLOW 2 s, RED 5 s, looping. A pedestrian button, when pressed during GREEN, queues a change at the end of the green phase. Add a simple safety block guaranteeing all lights go RED on any fault. Include inline tests that step through the sequence and a button press during GREEN.

Create a two-speed fan controller: read temperature in °C; fan is OFF below 24 °C, LOW between 24-28 °C, and HIGH at or above 28 °C with 1 °C hysteresis. Use a safety block to shut everything down above 50 °C or if the sensor fails. Write inline tests for 23, 24, 27, 28, 29, and a fault.

Implement a button-controlled dimmer: short press toggles ON/OFF, long press ramps brightness up then wraps to low. Debounce to 20 ms. Include a safety block to cap brightness at 80%. Add inline tests for short and long presses and debounce behavior.

Build a set/reset latch with two buttons: SET turns a relay ON, RESET turns it OFF. Ignore any press shorter than 30 ms. Use a safety block to force OFF on simultaneous press or input error. Provide inline tests covering set, reset, bounce, and both pressed.

Make a classroom countdown timer: a START button loads a preset number of seconds from a knob, a STOP button cancels, an LED blinks at 2 Hz while counting, and a buzzer beeps for 500 ms when reaching zero. Safety block: buzzer never longer than 3 s and defaults OFF on faults. Inline tests for start, stop, edge cases (0 s, max), and completion.

Compare two light sensors and turn on the indicator above the brighter sensor; if within 5 lux, turn both off. Include a safety block that turns both off if either sensor fails. Add inline tests for left>right, right>left, near-equal, and a fault.

Create a door alarm: if a magnetic switch stays OPEN for more than 2 seconds, sound a siren until a SILENCE button is pressed; auto-rearm when closed for 5 seconds. Use a safety block to limit siren to 30 seconds continuous. Provide inline tests for open, silence, close, and reopen.

Control a water pump with two level switches: when LOW is triggered, turn pump ON; when HIGH is triggered, turn pump OFF. Include a safety block that stops the pump if it runs more than 60 s continuously. Add inline tests simulating filling and draining.

Program a metronome: a tempo knob sets 40-180 BPM; an LED ticks each beat, and an optional accent every 4th beat. Update loop at 100 Hz; target WCET <= 0.5 ms. Use a safety block to default to 60 BPM if input invalid. Inline tests checking periods at 60 and 120 BPM.

Design a reaction timer: state machine waits for a random delay, lights ready indicator, then measures time between GO and button press, finally blinking the measured tenths of seconds. Add a safety block to prevent starts within 1 s of a previous run. Include inline tests simulating fast and slow reactions.

Thermostat with day/night modes: a toggle selects 22 °C day and 18 °C night. Heater turns ON when below setpoint by 0.5 °C and OFF when above by 0.5 °C. Safety block: heater off above 45 °C or on sensor fault. Write inline tests for both modes and hysteresis edges.

Color mixer: three sliders drive red, green, blue channels; limit the sum to 200/255 to keep current low. Include a safety block that rescales or clamps to the limit. Add inline tests for combinations that exceed and do not exceed the sum.

Control a pointer actuator from a knob: command 0-180 degrees with a rate limit of 30 deg/s to smooth motion. Safety block: clamp to [0,180] and disable on invalid input. Provide inline tests for step commands and rate limiting.

On button press, play a three-tone chime: 300 ms on, 200 ms off, 300 ms on, 200 ms off, 600 ms on. Ignore new presses while playing. Add a safety block to cap maximum amplitude. Include inline tests for a single press and repeated presses.

Greenhouse mini-controller: turn a fan ON if humidity > 70% or temperature > 30 °C; turn a heater ON if temperature < 18 °C; never allow heater and fan simultaneously. Use a safety block to enforce mutual exclusion and cut off at 50 °C. Add inline tests for various temp/humidity pairs.

Noise stoplight: compute a smoothed sound level and drive GREEN below 40 dB, YELLOW between 40-60 dB, and RED at or above 60 dB. Use a safety block to default to GREEN if the sensor fails. Provide inline tests for threshold crossings and smoothing response.

Morse code beeper: read a configuration word and emit corresponding dots and dashes at 10 WPM with proper intra-character and inter-character spacing. Safety block: mute if the text contains unsupported characters. Inline test with the word 'SOS'.

Use a rotary encoder to adjust a value 0-100 and display it on a 5-LED bar (each LED = 20). Include acceleration when turning fast. Add a safety block that clamps within bounds. Provide inline tests for slow turns, fast turns, and wraparound prevention.

Build a frequency counter: measure the frequency of a digital input and blink an LED at the measured period. Use a 5 s rolling average for stability. Safety block: treat no pulses as 0 Hz and keep LED off. Inline tests for 1 Hz, 2 Hz, and 0 Hz conditions.

Tilt-activated lamp: read an angle sensor in degrees; fade an LED up when tilted between 5° and 30°, and fade down otherwise. Update at 50 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms. Safety block: default off if sensor saturates. Inline tests for 0°, 10°, 30°, and 45°.

Implement PID temperature control to hold 37.0 °C using a heater. Sample at 5 Hz with anti-windup and output limited to 0-70%. Include a safety block that hard-cuts power above 40 °C or on sensor faults. Add inline step-response tests that check settling within +/-2 °C in 60 s.

Create a velocity control for airflow: maintain 2.0 m/s using a PID loop with an anemometer reading. Update at 20 Hz; saturate output 0-100%. Safety block: enter safe-off if the sensor is missing or variance too high. Inline tests with setpoint changes and simulated noise.

Estimate tilt by fusing an angle sensor with a gyro rate using a complementary filter (degrees and deg/s) and stabilize the angle with a proportional actuator output. Timing: 100 Hz, WCET < 1 ms. Safety block: clamp angle and disable on fault. Provide inline tests with synthetic rotation/tilt cases.

Use two temperature sensors for robust control: if they differ by <=2 °C, control a heater to 25 °C using the average; otherwise, flag a fault and turn the heater off. Include a safety block for over-temperature at 50 °C. Add inline tests for matching, slight mismatch, large mismatch, and overheat.

Make a light tracker: two photodetectors provide error; drive a pan actuator with PID to center the light source. Sample at 50 Hz; limit position to 0-180°. Safety block: move to safe center on fault. Inline tests for step changes in light position.

Fuse distance estimates from two sensors (e.g., infrared and ultrasonic) using a weighted average that favors the closer reading within 10-100 cm. Map the fused distance to a beeper pitch inversely proportional to distance. Safety block: mute for <5 cm or invalid. Inline tests with distance vectors.

Control water level to 60% using a PI loop and a valve actuator with 10 Hz updates. Safety block: close the valve if level >90% or sensor missing. Include inline tests for setpoint tracking, saturation, and sensor loss.

Implement a temperature ramp controller: limit the rate of increase to 5 °C/min toward a setpoint and use derivative action to reduce overshoot. Update at 10 Hz. Safety block: shut the heater off on any rapid rise beyond the limit. Inline tests for steep setpoint steps.

Estimate altitude by combining barometric and temperature-corrected readings; output altitude change and beep when change exceeds 2 m in 10 s. Update at 25 Hz; WCET <= 1 ms. Safety block: alarm if vertical rate exceeds 10 m/s. Inline tests with synthetic ascent/descent profiles.

Regulate light intensity to 300 lux at a sensor using PID on a dimmable lamp. Update at 10 Hz with integral windup guarding. Safety block: lock out output if measured lux exceeds 1000. Provide inline tests for step increases and decreases in ambient light.

Create a multi-mode classroom demo with a mode button: DEMO (timed light patterns), MANUAL (knob maps to brightness), and SAFE (all outputs off). Implement a clear mode state machine, run at 100 Hz with WCET <= 0.5 ms, and a safety block that forces SAFE on any fault. Include inline tests covering every mode transition and a simulated fault.

Design a small climate station with modes: SETUP (calibrate temperature sensor), MONITOR (display readings), CONTROL (maintain 22 °C using PI), and EMERGENCY (shut down if a gas level alarm is high). Use a hierarchical state machine with a 5 Hz loop and WCET <= 2 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests for calibration flow, control within +/-1 °C, and emergency latching.

Build a two-mode speed lab: OPEN-LOOP (slider sets duty, ignore feedback) and CLOSED-LOOP (hold 300 RPM with PID using encoder feedback). Require seamless switching without output spikes, duty limited to <=75%, and a safety block that enters FAULT on overcurrent input. Add inline tests for mode switching, saturation, and fault recovery.

Develop a beginner robotics exercise with three modes: IDLE, CALIBRATE SENSORS, and FOLLOW LINE using two light sensors and differential drive outputs. Control loop 50 Hz, WCET <= 1 ms. Safety block: stop if an obstacle sensor reports <15 cm or sensors disagree strongly. Include inline tests for calibration, following, and obstacle stops.

Specify a power management demo with NORMAL, LOW-POWER, and FAULT modes. In NORMAL, sample three sensors at 100 Hz; in LOW-POWER, sample at 10 Hz and dim indicators; in FAULT, force all outputs to a safe state and log an error counter. Add a watchdog heartbeat, a safety block that asserts safe outputs during mode changes, and inline tests simulating brownouts and timeouts to verify WCET < 1 ms.

For a classroom demo, make a simple ReflexScript that turns on an indicator LED while a pushbutton is held down. Include a simple safety block so the LED always defaults OFF at startup. Add brief inline tests that press and release the button to show the LED follows correctly.

Beginner exercise: blink an LED at 1 Hz when an ON/OFF toggle is set to ON, and keep it OFF otherwise. Please keep the script to basic syntax, include a safety block to force the LED OFF on any fault, and provide inline tests for both toggle positions.

Write a small tutorial example that toggles an LED each time a button is pressed. Use a simple 20 ms debounce implemented with basic syntax. Add a safety block to ensure the output remains OFF if the input is undefined, and include inline tests for single press, double press, and bouncing.

Create a simple threshold indicator: read a temperature (Celsius) value and light an LED if it exceeds 30 °C. Clamp any sensor reading outside −40 to 125 °C in a safety block. Include inline tests with sample values of 25, 30, and 35 °C.

Make a buzzer that sounds for exactly 2 seconds when a switch closes, then ignores further triggers until it finishes. Keep the logic simple and add a safety block to silence the buzzer on reset. Provide inline tests demonstrating a trigger, a retrigger during the 2 s window, and a clean retrigger after.

Map a knob (0–100%) to LED brightness using PWM. Clip the input range to 0–100 in a safety block, and keep the code beginner-friendly. Include inline tests that try −10%, 50%, and 120% and verify the LED duty ends up at 0%, 50%, and 100% respectively.

Build a simple classroom timer that counts seconds from 0 up to 10 and then wraps back to 0. Expose the current count as a variable. Add a safety block to reset the counter on startup, and include inline tests that step through 12 seconds and verify the wrap-around.

Generate a 500 Hz PWM signal whose duty cycle is set by a slider (0–100%). Enforce bounds in a safety block and keep the script to basic syntax. Add inline tests to confirm 0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100% duty settings.

Two-LED logic demo: LED1 mirrors a digital input, LED2 shows the inverse. Use basic syntax only, add a safety block to default both LEDs OFF on fault, and include inline tests that check the truth table for input = 0 and input = 1.

On button press, play a simple beep pattern on a buzzer: short, short, long. Guard the maximum duty to 50% in a safety block. Include inline tests that verify the pattern timing and that a new press during playback is ignored until the sequence finishes.

Create a latching LED: a short press toggles the LED, and a long press (3 seconds) forces it OFF. Add a safety block that turns the LED OFF at startup and if the input is invalid. Provide inline tests for short press, long press, and multiple toggles.

Implement a heartbeat LED that blinks at 2 Hz when a system_ok flag is true and stays OFF when false. Include a simple safety block that forces OFF for 500 ms at startup. Add inline tests showing both states and the startup behavior.

Make a basic light controller: turn on a lamp when ambient light is below a threshold. Let the threshold be adjustable but clamp it to 0–1000 lux in a safety block. Include inline tests with values at 50, 200, and 800 lux and verify correct switching.

Build an alarm indicator that toggles an LED at 4 Hz for 5 seconds whenever an alarm flag becomes true. Keep the logic simple, include a safety block that ensures the LED is OFF after the 5 s window, and add inline tests checking timing accuracy within ±5%.

Beginner counter: each button press increments a value from 0 to 9 and then wraps to 0. Debounce by 50 ms using basic syntax. Add a safety block to ignore undefined inputs, and provide inline tests for rapid presses and wrap-around at 9.

Design a small state machine for a pedestrian crossing demo: states WAIT, WALK (5 s steady), and DONT_WALK (3 s blinking). A button starts the sequence. Include a safety block to default to WAIT. Provide inline tests that check each state's duration and transitions.

Create a two-button combination lock for a green LED: pressing A then B within 10 seconds turns the LED ON; any other input resets the sequence. Add a safety block to detect and handle a stuck button. Include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences and the timeout.

Build a simple fan controller with three speeds based on temperature in °C: <25 OFF, 25–30 LOW, 30–35 MEDIUM, ≥35 HIGH. Add a safety block that forces OFF above 80 °C or if the sensor is invalid. Provide inline tests covering the range boundaries.

Implement a basic hysteresis thermostat: heater ON below 19 °C and OFF above 21 °C. Prevent rapid cycling by enforcing a 30 s minimum ON time. Include a safety block that shuts the heater off above 50 °C. Add inline tests for hysteresis behavior and min-ON timing.

Make a light-following demo with two light sensors: choose the brighter side and light the corresponding LED. Add a small deadband to avoid flicker when values are close. Include a safety block that turns both LEDs OFF if sensor data is invalid. Provide inline tests for edge cases.

Create a metronome that ticks at a tempo set by a knob (30–180 BPM). Clamp the tempo in a safety block. Provide start/stop control. Target WCET under 1 ms per tick scheduling. Include inline tests at 60, 120, and out-of-range settings.

Show how to debounce a pushbutton sampled at 1 kHz using simple logic. Expose both raw and debounced signals. Add a safety block that holds the debounced output stable on invalid input. Include inline tests that simulate bouncing edges and verify clean transitions.

Build a reaction timer game: after a random delay (capped at 2 s), light an LED; measure the time in milliseconds until the player presses the button. Track the best score. Include a safety block to bound the random delay and to default the LED OFF. Provide inline tests with scripted responses.

Model a two-floor elevator as a small state machine with states IDLE, MOVING_UP, MOVING_DOWN, and DOOR_OPEN. Buttons request floors; doors time out after 10 s. Add a safety block that immediately stops movement if an obstruction input is true. Include inline tests for typical trips and faults.
Servo sweep demo: move a servo smoothly from 0° to 180° over 4 s, hold 1 s, then back to 0°. Clip commands to 0–180° in a safety block. Include inline tests that check end positions and timing.

Create an alarm latch: if a sensor value exceeds a threshold for 3 consecutive samples at 50 Hz, turn an LED ON and keep it ON until reset. Handle NaN or missing data in a safety block by ignoring those samples. Include inline tests with borderline sequences.

Adjustable blinker: each button press cycles the blink rate through 0.5, 1, 2, and 4 Hz. Show the current rate on two indicator LEDs as a 2-bit code. Use a safety block to default to 1 Hz on startup. Add inline tests for each rate and wrap-around.

Data logger stub for class: sample temperature (°C) every 200 ms and compute a running average over the last 10 samples. Clamp sensor values to −40…125 °C in a safety block. Provide inline tests that feed a sequence and verify the average.

Motion detector exercise: if a motion input stays HIGH for more than 200 ms, sound a buzzer for 1 s, then ignore retriggers for 3 s. Add a safety block to keep the buzzer silent on any invalid input. Include inline tests for brief glitches and sustained motion.

PWM fan soft-start: when enabled, ramp the fan duty from 0% to the target setting over 2 seconds. Add a safety block that immediately shuts off if measured current exceeds 1.5 A. Include inline tests that verify ramp linearity and overcurrent behavior.

Simple vending mock-up: a COIN button adds 1 unit of credit; if CREDIT ≥ 2 and ITEM is pressed, dispense (turn LED ON for 1 s) and subtract 2 units; return change when RESET is pressed. Timeout resets after 30 s of inactivity. Add a safety block for stuck buttons. Include inline tests for typical flows.

Parking lot counter: two beam sensors A and B detect direction. Sequence A→B increments, B→A decrements. Show count 0–99 and clamp in a safety block. Provide inline tests with valid sequences and bouncing to verify robustness.

Color cycling demo: smoothly cycle an RGB LED through hues over 10 seconds. Add a global ENABLE input; when disabled, force all channels OFF via a safety block. Include inline tests for enable/disable transitions and hue timing.

Stopwatch: start, stop, and reset buttons control a millisecond counter. Ensure WCET per tick ≤ 0.5 ms. Add a safety block to prevent counting when inputs are invalid. Include inline tests for start/stop/resume and rollover at 1 hour.

Morse code practice: continuously transmit “SOS” on an LED and buzzer with standard dot/dash timing and a 10 s repeat period. Add a safety block limiting duty cycle to ≤50%. Provide inline tests that verify timing and repetition.

PID heater control lab: maintain 37.0 °C using PWM output and a temperature sensor sampled at 10 Hz. Include anti-windup and output clamping. Add a safety block to shut down above 45 °C or on sensor fault. Provide inline tests with a simple plant model to validate settling and overshoot.

Sensor fusion exercise: combine two temperature sensors into a single fused value using a weighted average with fault detection. Ignore outliers when the sensors differ by more than 5 °C. Add a safety block to fall back to the sane sensor. Include inline tests covering agreement, disagreement, and failure.

PID speed control: regulate a motor to 1200 RPM using encoder feedback sampled at 1 kHz. Rate-limit setpoint changes to avoid jerk. Add a safety block that cuts power on overspeed >1500 RPM or if no encoder pulses are seen for 200 ms. Include inline tests of step responses and fault cases.

Compute tilt angle (degrees) with a complementary filter using accelerometer and gyro data at 200 Hz. Blend fast gyro and slow accel to get a stable estimate. Add a safety block to handle saturation and NaN inputs. Provide inline tests with step and constant-rate scenarios.

Line follower concept: with two reflectance sensors (left/right), produce a steering output from −1.0 to +1.0 using simple proportional control. Add a safety block that commands 0 (stop) if both sensors read dark. Include inline tests for centered, left, and right cases.

Environmental monitor: compute dew point (°C) from temperature and relative humidity. Trigger an alarm when dew point exceeds 18 °C. Add a safety block that clamps RH to 0–100% and rejects invalid readings. Include inline tests with representative inputs.

Battery demo: estimate state of charge using coulomb counting corrected by occasional voltage measurements at 10 Hz. Add a safety block that disconnects the load when voltage drops below 3.0 V. Provide inline tests covering discharge, recharge, and low-voltage cutoff.

Adaptive brightness: use a PID loop to maintain 300 lux on a light sensor by driving a dimmable lamp. Limit the rate of change of the command. Add a safety block that caps duty at 90%. Include inline tests that step the ambient light and verify regulation.

Distance fusion: read three noisy range sensors and compute a robust estimate by averaging while rejecting spikes deviating by >20% from the median. Add a safety block that holds the last good value if all inputs are invalid. Include inline tests with noisy sequences.

Heading hold: maintain a target heading (degrees) using a PID on gyro-derived angle at 100 Hz. Add a safety block that disables control if angular rate exceeds 200 deg/s. Provide inline tests for step changes and rate-limited disturbances.

Multi-mode climate controller for class: modes OFF, HEAT, COOL, and FAN. Use a state machine with hysteresis around a setpoint; HEAT and COOL use PID control. Add safety interlocks (minimum compressor OFF time of 3 minutes, overtemperature cutoff at 50 °C). Include extensive inline tests for mode transitions, sensor faults, and timing edges.

Mini water tank plant: control a pump with two level sensors (LOW/HIGH). Modes: FILL (until HIGH), HOLD, and DRAIN (on command). Add safety stops for overflow and pump current >2 A. Require WCET < 2 ms per control cycle. Provide inline tests covering each mode and each fault.

Autonomous experiment scheduler: run task A at 10 Hz, task B at 5 Hz, and task C at 1 Hz with jitter <1 ms. Include a safety watchdog and a FAULT/RECOVER mode on missed deadlines. Provide comprehensive inline tests that simulate deadline misses and verify recovery.

Educational altitude controller (simulated): modes ARMED, TAKEOFF, HOVER, LAND, and FAULT. Fuse barometer and accelerometer for altitude; use a PID to hold 1.0 m during HOVER. Add a safety geofence of 0…2 m and drop to FAULT on sensor dropout. Include inline tests for each mode and step responses.

Laboratory conveyor demo: states IDLE, RUN, and JAM_CLEAR. Read item and jam sensors; regulate belt speed to 0.5 m/s with a PID. Add safety for emergency stop and a jam timeout of 2 s that triggers JAM_CLEAR. Include exhaustive inline tests for jams, restarts, and speed overshoot.

Beginner-friendly exercise: when a button is pressed, turn on a light and turn it off when released. Add a simple safety block so the light cannot stay on for more than 10 s without a new press. Include inline tests that press and release the button and verify on/off behavior and the 10 s safety cutoff.

Blink a lamp at 1 Hz using clear basic syntax. Provide inline tests that measure the blink period and assert it is within ±10%. Include a simple safety block that disables blinking if a stop flag is set.

Read temperature in Celsius and turn on a fan when it exceeds 30 C, else turn it off. Add a simple safety block that ensures the fan command is strictly on or off and fails off if the sensor is invalid. Include inline tests with sample readings to exercise both branches.

Beep a buzzer for 200 ms whenever a touch sensor is tapped. Debounce taps with a 50 ms window. Add a safety timeout that prevents beeping longer than 500 ms. Include inline tests that validate the 200 ms pulse and that rapid multiple taps are filtered.

Use a knob to control LED brightness from 0% to 100%. Clamp the output range with a simple safety block to avoid values outside 0–100%. Add inline tests that check mapping at minimum, midpoint, and maximum inputs.

Create a counter that increments on each button press from 0 to 9 and then wraps to 0. Blink the current count once per second. Include a safety rule that resets the counter to 0 after 30 s of no presses. Add inline tests for wrap-around and the idle reset.

Build a simple start/stop timer: first press starts timing, next press stops, then blink once per elapsed second. Debounce inputs. Add a safety check that ignores presses that are less than 20 ms apart. Provide inline tests that verify timing accuracy within 5%.

Make a tilt alarm: when tilt is detected, turn on a red light for 5 s, then turn off. Prevent retriggering during the 5 s active period with a simple safety block. Include inline tests that simulate tilt events and verify lockout behavior.

Build a night light using a light sensor: turn the lamp on below a threshold and off above it, with 10% hysteresis to avoid flicker. Add a minimum off-time of 2 s via a safety block. Include inline tests for threshold crossing and hysteresis behavior.

Proximity alert: if distance is less than 15 cm, pulse a buzzer at 5 Hz until the area is clear. Add a safety block to cap the buzzer duty cycle at 50%. Provide inline tests with distances 10 cm and 20 cm to verify pulsing and silence.

Show humidity as a 3-level indicator: low below 30%, ok from 30% to 60%, high above 60%. Add a simple safety mechanism to avoid rapid toggling by requiring a 2-s hold before changing levels. Include inline tests to confirm each level.

When a button is held for more than 300 ms, play a 440 Hz tone for 1 s. Use a safety block to ensure the tone never exceeds 2 s. Add inline tests that verify the hold-to-activate behavior and the 1 s duration within ±5%.

Read an input voltage (0–5 V). Light an indicator if voltage is below 3.3 V. Add a safety rule: if the reading is out of range or missing, force the indicator off. Include inline tests for 2.5 V, 3.3 V, 4.0 V, and an invalid value.

Sample temperature every 500 ms and compute a moving average over the last 4 samples. Display HOT if the average exceeds 35 C. Safety: if a sample is missing, hold the previous average and keep outputs safe. Add inline tests for averaging and the HOT threshold.

Generate a single 100 ms pulse to a small motor when a trigger button is pressed. Enforce a 1 s lockout between pulses with a simple safety block. Provide inline tests for pulse length and lockout behavior.

Two-button lamp control for the classroom: Button A toggles the lamp, Button B forces it OFF and overrides A. Debounce both. Add a safety block that prevents more than two toggles per second. Include inline tests for precedence and debouncing.

Design a three-light traffic demo cycling green 5 s, yellow 2 s, red 5 s. A pedestrian button should request a longer red phase on the next cycle. Add a safety default that forces red if any fault is detected. Include inline tests for cycle timing and the pedestrian insertion.

Temperature-controlled fan with hysteresis: turn the fan ON at 28 C and OFF at 26 C. Sample at 2 Hz. Safety: stop the fan if the sensor is invalid or stale for more than 2 s. Add inline tests that step temperature through both thresholds.

Reaction timer game: after a random delay of 1–3 s, turn on a light; measure reaction time in milliseconds until a button is pressed. Ignore early presses with a simple safety block. Include inline tests to verify the measurement range and early-press handling.

Automatic night light that fades brightness based on a light sensor. Update brightness at 20 Hz. Use a safety block to clamp brightness between 0% and 90%. Add inline tests that check fade response to slow darkening and quick brightening.

Simple keypad lock: accept a 4-digit code from buttons, unlock a light when correct, and relock after 10 s. Lock out for 5 s after three wrong attempts. Safety: clear state on power-up. Include inline tests for correct code, wrong code, and lockout.

Two-speed fan control: low speed above 25 C, high speed above 32 C, with a 2 C hysteresis for downshifts. Add a safety rule to limit maximum runtime to 10 min followed by a 1 min cooldown. Provide inline tests for threshold transitions and cooldown.

Mini elevator controller for two floors with states Idle, MovingUp, MovingDown, and DoorOpen. Inputs: up/down request buttons and top/bottom limit switches. Safety: if both limits are asserted, stop immediately and hold. Include inline tests for state transitions and limit handling.

Water tank monitor using two level switches (low and high): turn pump ON at low, OFF at high. Add dry-run protection: if high level is not reached within 60 s, stop and signal an alert. Include inline tests covering normal fill and the timeout case.

Turn-signal controller: left and right buttons flash respective lamps; a hazard switch flashes both at 2 Hz and overrides individual signals. Safety: enforce a minimum 200 ms off-time each cycle. Add inline tests for override priority and flash timing.

Build a Simon memory game for 3 steps using colored lights and matching buttons. Use a state machine with Show, Wait, and Check states. Add a safety timeout if the user is idle for 5 s. Include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences.

Temperature alarm with delay: require temperature above 40 C for 3 consecutive samples before buzzing, to avoid false positives. Add a mute button that silences alarms for 60 s. Include inline tests for consecutive-sample logic and mute behavior.

Scoreboard counter: increment and decrement buttons adjust a score from 0 to 99. Debounce and allow repeating when held for more than 500 ms. Safety: clamp at limits. Provide inline tests for debouncing, repeats, and boundary conditions.

Greenhouse vent opener: drive a servo to Open above 28 C and Close below 24 C with hysteresis. Safety: limit servo motion to at most 1 s per minute to reduce wear. Include inline tests that sweep temperature and verify motion limits.

Classroom countdown timer with start, pause, and reset. Tick at 10 ms; beep for 1 s when reaching zero. Ensure the control loop WCET remains under 2 ms. Add inline tests for start/pause/resume and beep duration.

Morse code sender for SOS when a button is pressed: dot 100 ms, dash 300 ms, with correct intra- and inter-character gaps. Safety: provide a stop button that cancels immediately. Include inline tests verifying the total pattern length and correct dot/dash timing.

Distance bar graph: map 10–100 cm to 0–5 LEDs, updating at 10 Hz. Add a safety rule to hold the last value if the input jumps by more than 20 cm in a single sample. Provide inline tests for mapping, rate, and spike rejection.

Pedestrian crossing controller with audible beeps: Walk for 8 s, Flashing Dont Walk for 5 s, then Dont Walk until the next request. A request button schedules the next Walk. Safety: default to Dont Walk on any fault. Include inline tests for phase timing and request handling.

Implement a five-sample moving average filter for temperature readings at 5 Hz. Output the filtered Celsius value. Safety: handle invalid values by skipping them and holding the last good output if all samples are invalid. Add inline tests for known sequences and invalid data.

Battery monitor: read voltage in volts and indicate green above 3.8 V, yellow from 3.5 to 3.8 V, red below 3.5 V. Safety: blink red if the voltage drops below 3.2 V. Include inline tests for each range and the blink condition.

PID temperature control to maintain 37.0 C with a heater. Sample at 10 Hz, include actuator saturation (0–100%) and anti-windup. Safety: hard cutout at 45 C and sensor fault detection that forces output to 0. Add inline tests for step response, steady-state error, and safety cutoff.

Closed-loop speed control for a small motor using pulse feedback in Hz. Track a setpoint from 0 to 20 Hz with a PID. Safety: if pulses stop for 500 ms while a command is active, shut down and flag a fault. Include inline tests for ramping and loss-of-signal handling.

Fuse two temperature sensors into a robust estimate (e.g., median or outlier-resistant average) and use the fused Celsius value to control a fan proportionally. Safety: if sensors disagree by more than 5 C, enter a safe low-power mode. Provide inline tests for agreement and disagreement cases.

Estimate tilt angle by combining gyroscope rate (deg/s) and accelerometer tilt using a complementary filter at 100 Hz. Safety: saturate output to ±90 deg and detect invalid sensor data. Add inline tests with synthetic motion to verify fusion behavior.

Weighted fusion of two light sensors for dimming a lamp: compute 0.7*sensorA + 0.3*sensorB and map to brightness. Safety: if one sensor is invalid, fall back to the other and clamp brightness 0–100%. Include inline tests for weighting and fallback.

Implement a slew-rate limiter for a motor command: limit change to 10% per 50 ms and apply a small deadband around zero. Safety: an emergency stop input forces output to 0 immediately. Provide inline tests for step inputs and emergency stop behavior.

Create a fault-tolerant state machine with states Run and Fault. Monitor an overcurrent input; on fault, latch in the Fault state and require a manual reset. Safety: ensure all actuators go to safe values in Fault. Add inline tests for fault detection and latch behavior.

Water level PID control: maintain 20 cm using a pump and a level sensor, sampling at 5 Hz. Safety: if level rises less than 1 cm within 30 s of pump activation, stop and signal a possible blockage. Include inline tests for setpoint tracking and the blockage condition.

Two-point temperature calibration: given raw readings at 0 C and 50 C references, compute offset and scale, then apply to future Celsius readings. Safety: reject calibration if span is less than 10 C. Provide inline tests verifying the corrected values at both reference points.

Thermal management with heater and fan: hold 30 C using PID on the heater and proportional fan cooling above 31 C. Safety: never allow both heater and fan to be at 100% simultaneously and cut out at 45 C. Include inline tests for coordination and limit conditions.

Multi-mode classroom demo with modes Idle, Manual, Auto, and Fault. In Manual, buttons control a lamp and motor; in Auto, follow a 3-step timed sequence; Fault forces everything off. Include a simple safety block around all actuators, a watchdog expecting a 20 Hz tick, WCET under 2 ms, and comprehensive inline tests for all mode transitions and watchdog behavior.

Multi-mode climate controller: modes Off, Heat, Cool, Safe. Fuse two temperature sensors; use PID to heat to 25.0 C and proportional cooling above 26.0 C. Safety: enter Safe at 45 C, add hysteresis, and interlock actuators. Run at 10 Hz. Provide extensive inline tests for setpoint tracking, hysteresis edges, and Safe entry/exit.

Wind speed control rig for demonstrations with modes Setup, Run, and Emergency. Maintain airflow speed at a setpoint in m/s using PID at 20 Hz. Emergency input halts immediately. Add a simple safety block to cap actuator at 0–90% and assert WCET under 1 ms. Include thorough inline tests: step response, disturbance rejection, and emergency stop.

Lab centrifuge simulator with modes Idle, SpinUp, Hold, SpinDown, and Fault. Control rotational speed in rpm with PID using tach pulses; overspeed of +10% triggers Fault. Add a door-open interlock, ramp limits, and 100 Hz control. Include exhaustive inline tests for ramp profiles, overspeed handling, and interlock behavior.

Smart dispenser project with modes Calibrate, Dispense, Purge, and Fault. Use a flow sensor to measure volume in mL and dispense a target volume within ±5 mL using feedback. Add timeout and jam detection, a simple safety block to close the valve on any fault, a 50 Hz loop, WCET assertions, and comprehensive inline tests for calibration, normal dispense, and fault cases.

For a classroom demo, turn on an LED when a pushbutton is pressed and turn it off when released. Include a simple safety block to debounce the button for 30 ms and add inline tests that press and release the button to verify the LED follows.
Create a beginner example that reads a slider (0–100%) and sets an LED brightness to match. Clamp the input to 0–100% using a simple safety block and include inline tests for 0%, 50%, and 100%.

When the measured temperature exceeds 30 Celsius, switch on a cooling fan output; otherwise switch it off. Add a simple safety guard to default off if the sensor value is missing, and write inline tests for 25 C and 35 C.

Make a toggle light: each time the button is pressed, the LED changes state. Ignore bounces shorter than 20 ms using a safety block and include inline tests to show two presses result in LED off again.
Blink an LED at 2 Hz continuously. Provide inline tests that check the on/off timing over one second.
Sound a buzzer for exactly 1.0 s when a motion input goes high. Rate-limit triggers to at most once every 5 s with a simple safety block. Include inline tests for back-to-back triggers.
If ambient light drops below 200 lux, turn on a night-light output; otherwise keep it off. Add inline tests for 150 lux and 300 lux.
Read distance in meters; if distance < 0.25 m, activate an alarm output. Fail safe to off if the reading is out of range (<0 m or >4 m) using a safety block. Include inline tests.
On power-up, ramp an LED brightness from 0% to 100% over 3 seconds, then hold. Provide an inline test that verifies the final value at t=3 s.
Generate a one-shot pulse: when a rising edge is detected on a digital input, drive an output high for 100 ms. Add inline tests for single and rapid repeated edges.
Count how many times a button is pressed and show even counts by turning an LED on and odd counts by turning it off. Debounce for 25 ms and include inline tests for 3 presses.
Create a simple threshold alarm for humidity: if relative humidity ≥ 60%RH, turn on a warning LED. Use a safety block to clamp measured humidity to 0–100%RH and add inline tests.
Drive a small fan at half speed (50% duty) while a switch is held, and stop when it’s released. Add inline tests covering both positions.
Turn on a heater output when temperature is ≤ 18 C and turn it off when > 18 C. Include inline tests and a safety default of off if the reading is invalid.
Make a metronome: beep for 100 ms every 500 ms. Include inline timing tests to verify the interval.

Build a tiny traffic light for demonstrations: cycle through Green (3 s), Yellow (1 s), Red (3 s) using three LEDs. Include a pedestrian button that, when pressed, inserts a Red phase after the current Yellow. Model it as a simple state machine and add inline tests for the sequence timing.

Create a classroom hand-wash timer: when a proximity sensor detects hands, start a 20 s countdown with an LED bar filling in steps and a short beep every 5 s. Ignore retriggers until finished. Provide inline tests for start, progress, and completion.

Design a thermostat with hysteresis: turn a heater on below 20 C and off above 22 C. Add a status LED that shows red when heating and blue when idle. Include inline tests to prove no chatter around thresholds.

Make a night hallway light: if motion is detected and ambient light < 150 lux, turn on a lamp for 30 s; otherwise, keep it off. Rate-limit to avoid retriggering within the 30 s window. Add inline tests for light/dark and motion/no motion cases.

Implement a two-button combination lock demo: require Button A then Button B within 2 s to toggle an output. Presses out of order or too slow should reset. Represent it as a state machine and include inline tests.

Create a reaction timer game. After a random delay between 1–3 s, turn on a green LED; measure the time until the button is pressed and play a buzzer tone proportional to reaction time. Include inline tests with simulated times.
Build a simple fan controller with three speeds: low below 25 C, medium between 25–30 C, and high above 30 C. Use an LED to indicate the selected level. Add inline tests for boundary temperatures.

Use a moving average filter over the last 5 samples of a light sensor and turn on an output if the filtered value drops below a threshold. Show inline tests comparing raw spikes versus filtered behavior.
Construct a simple PWM dimmer: a knob controls LED brightness, but enforce a minimum of 10% and maximum of 90% using a safety block. Provide inline tests for edge values.
Program a beeper that signals Morse-style: when a button is held, emit a repeating pattern of short-short-long beeps with precise timing. Add inline tests for one full pattern.
Make a simple fan-with-delay: when the heater turns off, keep the fan running for an additional 60 s to cool down. Use a small state machine and inline tests for transitions.

Create a tilt alarm using a tilt sensor. If tilted beyond a threshold for more than 200 ms, sound a buzzer and flash an LED at 5 Hz until returned upright. Include inline tests for brief versus sustained tilts.
Design a water level monitor with two thresholds: below 0.2 m turn on a fill pump; above 0.8 m turn it off; in between, hold the last state. Include inline tests to demonstrate latch behavior.
Build a simple metered dispenser demo: each button press opens a valve for 250 ms and then locks out new presses for 1 s. Provide inline tests for rapid pressing.

Create a line-follow helper: read two light sensors (left/right) and set a servo output left, right, or center accordingly. Add a safety block to clamp servo angle and include inline tests for typical cases.
Implement a classroom timer with start/stop buttons and a display LED that is solid on while running and blinks at 1 Hz when paused. Write inline tests for all button sequences.
Develop a CO2-aware fan: if CO2 exceeds 1000 ppm, run the fan; if it falls below 800 ppm, stop. Indicate 'ventilate' on an LED while running. Include inline tests for the hysteresis.
Create a safety light that ramps up to full brightness at sunset (light < 100 lux) and ramps down at sunrise. Use a simple finite state machine and provide inline tests for dawn and dusk transitions.
Build a simple watchdog demo: if no button press occurs within 10 s, flash a warning LED at 2 Hz; when a button is pressed, return to idle. Include inline tests for timeout and reset.

Control a small pump with a float switch and a manual override switch; the pump runs if the float is low or the override is on, but must stop if an emergency stop input is active. Include inline tests for all combinations.

Implement a temperature controller with a PID loop to maintain 37.0 C using a heater output. Run the control at 10 Hz with a WCET budget of 5 ms. Add a safety block to limit heater duty to 0–80% and default to 0% if the sensor is invalid. Include inline tests for a step change in setpoint.

Create a speed control demo: maintain a target belt speed of 0.5 m/s using feedback from a sensor. Use PID with anti-windup, run at 50 Hz, and ensure WCET ≤ 4 ms. Add inline tests that verify settling within 3 s.

Fuse two temperature sensors by computing a weighted average and rejecting any reading that differs by more than 3 C from the other. If disagreement persists for 5 s, enter a safe mode that shuts outputs off. Include inline tests for agreement and disagreement cases.

Design a tilt-stabilized platform controller using a complementary filter to combine accelerometer and gyroscope data at 100 Hz. Drive a servo to hold 0 degrees. Include a safety block to clamp angles and inline tests with simulated disturbances.

Build a humidity control system that maintains 50%RH using PID on a humidifier output, with a dehumidifier fallback if >60%RH. Sample at 5 Hz, WCET ≤ 10 ms. Provide inline tests for step humidity changes.

Create a sensor fusion demo that estimates altitude by blending barometer (slow) and ultrasonic (fast) measurements. Run at 40 Hz and command an actuator to hold 1.0 m. Include safety limits on actuator travel and inline tests.

Implement a two-stage heating controller: preheat mode drives heater at 60% until 30 C, then switch to PID control to hold 34 C. Ensure smooth mode handoff and include inline tests for the transition.

Develop a balancing fan system that uses PID to keep airflow at 2.0 m/s based on anemometer readings. Limit output changes to 10% per cycle for safety and include inline tests for sudden disturbances.

Create a multi-sensor light controller that fuses ambient light (lux) and occupancy to maintain a target lux level with PID dimming while turning lights off after 5 min of no occupancy. Sample at 10 Hz and add inline tests.

Design a safety-critical temperature monitor that cross-checks three sensors with median voting; if spread exceeds 2 C, cut off the heater and raise an alarm. Provide inline tests, including a stuck-sensor scenario.

Build a classroom climate system with three modes: Heat, Cool, and Off. Each mode uses its own control logic (PID for Heat at 22 C, PID for Cool at 26 C), with shared safety that shuts all outputs off on sensor faults or door-open input. Include a top-level mode state machine, run at 5 Hz, WCET ≤ 8 ms, and comprehensive inline tests covering mode changes and faults.

Create a multi-mode lab fan controller with Manual, Auto, and Safe modes. Manual sets speed from a slider; Auto uses PID to hold 1.5 m/s; Safe forces 0%. Add an emergency stop that overrides all modes. Require thorough inline tests for every transition and override.

Design a redundant sensor fusion demo with two temperature sensors and one humidity sensor. Provide Normal and Degraded modes: in Degraded, downweight the faulty sensor and restrict actuator outputs to ≤50%. Include a supervisory state machine, timing checks, and comprehensive inline tests including sensor dropouts.

Implement a teaching example of a mobile platform controller with modes: Idle, Follow-Line, and Fault. Fuse two line sensors and a gyro to command left/right actuators. Enforce strict safety limits on velocity (≤0.3 m/s) and acceleration, run at 100 Hz with WCET ≤ 6 ms, and include extensive inline tests for mode transitions and limit enforcement.

Develop a lab incubator controller with Startup, Regulate, and Alarm modes. Use a warm-up sequence, then PID to maintain 37 C, and raise an alarm if any sensor drifts >2 C from the median. Require a complete set of inline tests covering startup timing, regulation stability, and alarm latching.

Create a beginner-friendly ReflexScript that reads a digital push button and turns on a single indicator light only while the button is held down. Add a simple safety block that forces the light off if the input is undefined, and include inline tests for press, release, and a simulated bouncing sequence.

Make a tiny exercise: read an analog knob and set one LED’s brightness from 0% to 100% accordingly. Clamp the value in a safety block to prevent out-of-range duty cycles, and include inline tests that check 0%, 50%, and 100% settings.

Write a classroom demo that turns on a night-light LED when ambient light falls below 100 lux. Include a simple safety block to cap the LED brightness at 80% duty, and add inline tests for 50 lux, 100 lux, and 200 lux scenarios.

Tutorial task: control a heater output from a temperature sensor with hysteresis (on below 20°C, off above 22°C). Use a safety block so the heater is forced off on sensor fault, and provide inline tests covering cold, warm, and invalid readings.

Simple lab: when a button is tapped, generate a single 200 ms beep on a buzzer; holding the button should not extend the beep. Add a safety block to silence the buzzer if the timer overruns, and write inline tests measuring the beep duration.
Beginner blinking light: make one LED blink at 1 Hz. Expose the blink rate as a variable, guard the timer with a safety block, and include inline tests that verify the period within ±5%.

Create a motion-activated indicator: when motion is detected, turn on an LED for 5 seconds, then turn it off. Add a safety block that cancels the timer if multiple triggers arrive too fast, and include inline tests for single and repeated activations.

Door open demo: when a magnetic switch indicates ‘open’, light an LED; otherwise keep it off. Use a safety block to enter a blinking error state if the sensor becomes disconnected, and add inline tests simulating open, closed, and fault.
Sound-triggered light: turn on an LED for 1 second when sound level exceeds 60 dB. Clamp the measured level range in a safety block, and include inline tests for 40 dB, 60 dB, and 80 dB cases.

Button counter mini-project: count button presses and turn the LED on only when the count is a multiple of 3. Debounce with a simple approach, add a safety block to reset the counter on overflow, and include inline tests for a sequence of presses.

Two-rate blinker: use a switch to select between 0.5 Hz and 2 Hz blink on the same LED. Add a safety block to default to 0.5 Hz if the switch state is invalid, and provide inline tests for both positions.

Touch-to-toggle: use a touch sensor to toggle an LED with 50 ms debounce. Include a safety block that ignores touches shorter than 10 ms, and add inline tests for short, valid, and rapid-touch patterns.

Heartbeat indicator: create a steady 2 Hz heartbeat on an LED. Ensure the loop WCET stays under 1 ms, add a safety block that pauses blinking on timing overrun, and include inline tests that check duty and period.

Light-fade demo: map a light sensor reading to LED brightness so the LED is brighter in the dark and dim in bright light. Add a safety block to invert mapping only once at startup, and include inline tests for low, medium, and high light levels.

Pressure threshold exercise: when pressure drops below 95 kPa, turn on a warning LED; otherwise keep it off. Provide a safety block that treats out-of-range sensor values as a fault (LED blinking), and add inline tests for 90, 95, and 105 kPa.

Make a simple direction selector using two buttons: one output for FORWARD, one for REVERSE. Only one output may be active at a time. Implement a small state machine to handle presses and releases, include a safety block that forces both outputs off on conflict, and add inline tests for all transitions.

Traffic light classroom demo: control RED, GREEN, and YELLOW outputs with timed phases and a pedestrian button. Use a clear state machine, enforce the safety rule that opposing greens never occur, and include inline tests for normal cycles and a late pedestrian request.

Three-mode nightlight: OFF, AUTO (uses <100 lux to turn on), and ON. Change modes with a single button (short press cycles, long press toggles ON). Include a safety block that caps LED duty to 75%, and provide inline tests for mode transitions and lux thresholds.
Use a rotary encoder to adjust an LED blink rate from 0.5 Hz to 5 Hz. Debounce the encoder, clamp the rate in a safety block, and add inline tests for step-up, step-down, and wraparound behavior.

Build a simple alarm: an ARM button enables monitoring, a DOOR sensor triggers a buzzer after a 10 s entry delay unless DISARM is pressed. Implement as a state machine, include a safety block that limits buzzer runtime to 60 s, and write inline tests for arm, entry, disarm, and alarm.

Temperature-to-fan levels: drive LOW, MED, HIGH outputs based on thresholds (LOW above 25°C, MED above 30°C, HIGH above 35°C). Add hysteresis, a safety block to shut all outputs if the sensor fails, and inline tests across the temperature range.

Audible crosswalk cue: when WALK is permitted, beep a pattern (200 ms on, 800 ms off) and light an indicator; otherwise stay silent. Use a timing-based state machine, add a safety block that silences outputs after 2 minutes continuous operation, and include inline tests for pattern accuracy.

Water leak monitor: if moisture is detected, flash an LED and start a 1-minute timer. A MUTE button silences the LED for that minute. Implement debounced inputs, a safety block to prevent retrigger flooding, and inline tests for leak, mute, and re-trigger.

Metronome trainer: blink an LED and tick a buzzer at a BPM set by a knob from 40 to 200 BPM. Keep timing jitter low, clamp BPM in a safety block, and provide inline tests checking period within ±2% at 60, 120, and 180 BPM.

Dual temperature compare: read two temperature sensors; display a warning LED if their difference exceeds 2°C and use the colder reading for control output. Add a safety block that ignores a sensor flagged as faulty, and include inline tests for agree, disagree, and single-sensor-fail cases.

Fan feedback check: when the FAN command is on, verify that a speed sensor shows pulses within 2 seconds; otherwise shut the fan off and blink an error LED. Implement a simple watchdog safety block and include inline tests for normal spin-up and stalled fan.

Tilt indicator: read a 2-axis accelerometer and turn on LEFT or RIGHT LED when tilt exceeds ±10 degrees, with a deadband. Add a safety block to suppress output if the sensor saturates, and include inline tests for angles −20°, 0°, and +20°.

Plant watering demo: if soil moisture is below a threshold, run the pump for up to 5 seconds, then wait 30 minutes before the next attempt. Add a safety block that enforces a hard 5-second maximum per cycle, and include inline tests for dry, wet, and repeated dry conditions.

Stopwatch exercise: Start/Stop with one button, Reset with a long press. Blink an LED while running. Ensure debouncing, include a safety block that auto-stops after 1 hour, and write inline tests for run, stop, reset, and time accumulation.

Reaction game: after a random delay (0.5–3.0 s), turn on an LED; measure the time until the button is pressed and briefly flash the LED proportional to the reaction time. Add a safety block to re-seed randomness once at startup, and include inline tests with deterministic delays.

SOS flasher: generate the Morse SOS pattern (· · · — — — · · ·) on an LED with standard timing. Include a safety block that enforces a maximum total cycle length, and add inline tests verifying dot and dash durations and spacing.

Distance alert: use a distance sensor to set an LED color or brightness level—safe zone above 100 cm, caution 50–100 cm, alert below 50 cm. Rate-limit updates to 10 Hz, add a safety block to hold last good value on sensor dropout, and provide inline tests across thresholds.

Comfort controller: if temperature > 30°C and humidity > 70%, turn on a dehumidifier output; else turn it off. Provide a manual override button that times out after 15 minutes. Include a safety block to ensure mutual exclusion between AUTO and MANUAL, and inline tests.

Event counter: count rising edges on a signal and every minute blink the LED a number of times equal to the count, then reset. Add a safety block to cap the count at 255, and include inline tests for low, high, and overflow counts.

Automatic door demo: states Closed, Opening, Open, Closing. Inputs: open button, close button, obstruction sensor. Outputs: open and close commands. Safety: stop and reverse if obstruction; never open and close at the same time. Provide inline tests for all state transitions and the obstruction case.

PID temperature control lab: maintain 37.0°C using a heater and a temperature sensor. Run the loop at 10 Hz, include anti-windup and output clamping in a safety block, and add inline tests for step response, overshoot < 2°C, and sensor fault behavior (heater forced off).

Closed-loop speed control: use a tachometer to hold a target speed of 1200 RPM with a PID controller. Update at 100 Hz with WCET under 2 ms, include safety to cut output if no pulses detected for 0.5 s, and provide inline tests for setpoint changes and disturbances.

Tilt estimation via sensor fusion: combine gyro and accelerometer data with a complementary filter to estimate pitch angle in degrees. Update at 50 Hz, detect sensor dropout in a safety block, and include inline tests with synthetic constant-angle and step-tilt sequences.

Dual-sensor temperature fusion: compute a fused temperature from two sensors using a weighted average that rejects outliers (>5°C apart). Use the fused value to control a heater with hysteresis, add a safety block that enters a fault state if both disagree persistently, and include inline tests.
