Water level PID: regulate a tank level at 15 cm using a level sensor and a pump. Sample at 20 Hz, include safety to prevent pump runtime exceeding 30 s per minute and to shut down on sensor glitch, and provide inline tests for setpoint tracking and dry-run detection.

Constant-lux controller: hold 300 lux at a photodetector by adjusting an LED’s PWM via a PID loop. Limit duty cycle to 85% in a safety block, run at 50 Hz, and include inline tests for step changes in ambient light and steady-state error.

Occupancy lighting with conditions: turn lights on only when motion is detected and ambient light < 100 lux; keep them on for a 5-minute hold time. Enforce safety to always turn off within 10 minutes max, update at 5 Hz, and include inline tests for rapid motion bursts and no-motion periods.

Height estimation fusion: combine barometric and ultrasonic readings to estimate height in centimeters with a complementary filter. Update at 20 Hz, include a safety block to clamp unrealistic jumps (>50 cm per sample), and add inline tests with synthetic ascent and descent profiles.

Position hold PID: control an actuator to hold an angle at 45 degrees using a position sensor. Include anti-windup, output saturation in a safety block, loop at 200 Hz with WCET < 1 ms, and inline tests for step responses and saturation behavior.

Environmental index control: compute a heat index from temperature (°C) and humidity (%) and drive a fan to keep the index below a chosen threshold. Add safety to shut down if either sensor is invalid, rate-limit to 10 Hz, and include inline tests across typical classroom conditions.

Design a multi-mode classroom climate controller with three modes: OFF, AUTO (PID to hold 22°C), and MANUAL (fixed fan speed set by a knob). Specify a timing budget (control loop at 20 Hz, WCET < 2 ms), enforce safety invariants (heater and fan cannot be on simultaneously in OFF), and include comprehensive inline tests for mode transitions, sensor loss, and watchdog recovery.

Develop a day/night crosswalk controller: Day mode runs standard vehicle and pedestrian sequences with a request button; Night mode flashes yellow only. Provide a formal state machine, enforce safety (never show WALK when vehicles green), update at 10 Hz with WCET < 1 ms, and include thorough inline tests with simulated time progression.

Create a small greenhouse demo with modes Seedling, Growth, and Dormant. Use temperature (°C) and humidity (%) to control heater, fan, and mister with hysteresis per mode. Include safety limits (max heater on-time 10 min/hr, overtemp shutoff at 40°C), run at 1 Hz, WCET < 1 ms, and embed extensive inline tests including sensor-fault cases.

Build a multi-sensor fusion lab: modes Calibrate, Run, and Error. Fuse accelerometer, gyro, and magnetometer to estimate heading in degrees; detect magnetic disturbance and enter Error if variance spikes. Require calibration be completed before Run, enforce safety timeouts, run at 100 Hz with WCET < 1 ms, and add rich inline tests using synthetic data.

Specify an educational elevator controller for three floors with call buttons, car buttons, and door sensors. Implement scheduling (serve in the direction of travel), door timing, obstruction handling, and an emergency stop. Define safety invariants (never move with doors open, doors must open at a floor), run at 20 Hz with WCET < 2 ms, and include comprehensive inline tests covering edge cases.

Create a simple classroom demo where a digital output turns on only while a pushbutton is held down, and turns off otherwise. Use clear, basic syntax. Include a simple safety block that forces the output off if the input is undefined. Add inline tests that simulate pressed and released states and assert the correct output.

Blink a status light at 2 Hz for a lab demo. Keep the logic very simple. Add a safety block that turns the light off if the loop timing is missed. Provide inline tests that measure the on/off timing within ±50 ms tolerance.

Make a one-shot: on a rising edge from a pushbutton, energize an output for exactly 200 ms, then return to off. Include a basic safety block to ignore further triggers during the pulse. Add inline tests for single, double, and bouncing presses to verify behavior.

Read a temperature sensor and turn on a warm indicator when the value is at or above 30 Celsius. Clamp sensor readings to a plausible range of −40 to 85 Celsius in a simple safety block. Add inline tests that feed values below, at, and above the threshold.

Use an analog knob to set a light’s brightness from 0% to 100%. Keep the mapping linear and straightforward. Include a safety block that clamps the output between 0 and 100%. Add inline tests for 0%, 50%, and 100% input positions.

Build a small state machine for a pedestrian crossing: green for cars, then yellow, then red with a walk signal when a request input is active, then back to green. Use simple timing for each phase. Add a safety block that forces all lights red at startup for 1 s. Provide inline tests that simulate a button request and verify the sequence.

Make a simple buzzer that beeps for 1 second when a motion input is detected, but no more than once every 5 seconds. Include a safety block that silences the buzzer if the motion input is stuck on. Add inline tests covering single trigger, rapid re-triggers, and stuck-on input.

Detect a press-and-hold: if a button is held for longer than 1.0 s, turn an output on; otherwise do nothing. Keep the logic easy to follow. Include a basic safety block that resets state on input fault. Add inline tests for short tap, long hold, and noisy input.

Create a classroom timer with start and reset buttons. When started, count down from 10 seconds, blink a light during the last 3 seconds, and sound a short beep at zero. Add a safety block that cancels the countdown if both buttons are pressed. Include inline tests for start, reset mid-count, and completion.

Implement a two-threshold fan control using temperature in Celsius with 1 C hysteresis: below 25 C the fan is off, above 27 C it is on. Use basic syntax. Add a safety block that disables the fan if the sensor reads out of range (−40 to 85 C). Provide inline tests that step through the thresholds and verify hysteresis.

Create a simple debounced button reader with a 20 ms debounce window and drive an LED mirror of the debounced state. Include a safety block that defaults to LED off at startup. Add inline tests with a bouncing input pattern to show the debounce works.

Design a reaction time game for two players: on a random delay, light a ready signal; the first button pressed after that wins and lights the corresponding player’s indicator. Reject early presses. Add a safety block to reset the game after 10 seconds of inactivity. Include inline tests simulating different press timings.

On each button press, toggle an LED between on and off. Keep the code minimal and readable. Add a simple safety block that prevents toggling while the button is bouncing for 30 ms. Provide inline tests with a debounce scenario.

Create a square-wave generator on a digital output at 10 Hz with 50% duty. Use straightforward timing. Add a safety block that forces the output low if the control loop overruns. Include inline tests to check the period and duty cycle within a small tolerance.

Build a simple day/night light using a light sensor: when ambient is low, fade an LED up; when bright, fade it down. Add a safety block that clamps the fade rate to prevent flicker. Provide inline tests that step the sensor reading and assert smooth transitions.

Implement a metronome beeper with tempo set by a knob (range 40–180 BPM). Keep the tick timing accurate to ±5 ms. Add a safety block that defaults to 60 BPM if the knob is out of range. Include inline tests for 60, 120, and 180 BPM timing.

Count button clicks and indicate the count using LED blink patterns (e.g., blink N times, pause). Reset the count after it reaches 10. Use a safety block to clear the count on long-press of 2 seconds. Add inline tests for multiple clicks and the reset condition.

Create a three-level temperature indicator: green below 20 C, yellow between 20 and 30 C, red at or above 30 C using three outputs. Add a safety block that turns all indicators off if the sensor fails. Provide inline tests that sweep temperature across the thresholds.

Make a basic edge detector: when an input transitions from low to high, flash an LED for 100 ms. Keep the logic simple. Include a safety block to ignore repeats during the flash. Add inline tests for rapid sequences of edges.

Program a simple classroom stopwatch with start/stop and reset buttons. Display running status via a blinking LED (1 Hz when running, steady on when stopped, off when reset). Add a safety block that prevents reset while running. Include inline tests for start, stop, and reset sequences.

Create a gentle breathing effect on an LED, cycling brightness up and down over 3 seconds. Keep the code beginner-friendly. Add a safety block that sets brightness to zero on any timing fault. Provide inline tests that check the cycle duration.

Implement a light chaser across three LEDs at 5 steps per second. Change direction each time a button is pressed. Add a safety block that pauses the chaser if the button is held. Include inline tests that simulate presses and verify direction changes.

Build a two-stage distance alert: if distance is less than 1.0 m, turn on a caution light; if less than 0.5 m, also sound a buzzer. Add a safety block that silences the buzzer on sensor timeout. Provide inline tests for 1.2 m, 0.8 m, 0.4 m, and missing data.

Make a 500 ms beep every 2 seconds when temperature exceeds 37.5 C, otherwise stay silent. Include a safety block that clamps sensor readings to −40..85 C. Add inline tests that step around 37.5 C and check beep timing.

Create a simple rate limiter: when an input is toggled rapidly, ensure the output changes no more than twice per second. Keep the implementation clear. Add a safety block that resets the limiter after 10 seconds idle. Include inline tests with rapid toggling.

Design a double-click detector: single click toggles a light; double-click within 300 ms triggers a short beep. Use a small state machine. Add a safety block to ignore presses during the beep. Provide inline tests for single, double, and long presses.

Create a simple thermostat with day/night setpoints selected by a switch (21 C day, 18 C night) and 0.5 C hysteresis. Add a safety block that forces output off if readings go outside −40..85 C. Include inline tests switching setpoints and crossing thresholds.

Build a three-LED bar graph for a potentiometer: 0–33% light 1, 34–66% lights 1–2, 67–100% lights 1–3. Add a safety block that blanks all LEDs on invalid input. Provide inline tests at 0%, 33%, 50%, 66%, and 100%.

Implement a PI controller to maintain a light sensor reading at a target level set by a knob. Run the loop at 50 Hz. Add a safety block that clamps the output and disables control if the sensor is disconnected. Include inline tests with step changes in target and simulated feedback.

Make a Morse code blinker that transmits SOS repeatedly with correct dot/dash timing. Run the logic at 100 Hz and keep WCET under 1 ms. Add a safety block that stops blinking if timing is violated. Provide inline tests verifying the dot/dash durations.

Combine temperature and humidity readings to trigger a comfort indicator: green when 20–24 C and 30–60% RH, yellow when slightly outside, red when far outside. Add a safety block that turns indicators off if either sensor is invalid. Include inline tests that cover boundary values.

Implement a PID temperature controller to hold 37.0 C. Sample at 10 Hz. Add a safety block that cuts the heater if the measured temperature exceeds 39.0 C or the sensor is missing. Include inline tests with a simple plant simulation (step response) to verify settling and safety trip.

Create a watchdog heartbeat: if a periodic tick input arrives at least once per second, breathe a status LED; if no tick for 2 seconds, switch to a steady red fault indicator. Add a safety block that clears the fault after a valid tick. Provide inline tests that include tick dropouts and recovery.

Smooth a noisy analog sensor with a 5-sample moving average and compare to a threshold. Light an indicator when the smoothed value exceeds the threshold. Add a safety block that saturates inputs. Include inline tests with a noisy sequence showing the filter effect.

Fuse two temperature sensors by taking a weighted average after discarding outliers that differ by more than 2 C. Use the fused value to control a cooling fan with hysteresis. Add a safety block that forces the fan on if the sensors disagree too much. Provide inline tests covering agreement, disagreement, and out-of-range readings.

Implement a classroom timer that supports start, pause, and reset, with an LED indicating each mode (blinking for running, solid for paused, off for reset). Add a safety block that auto-resets after 5 minutes. Include inline tests for mode transitions and timeout.

Estimate tilt angle by fusing a gyro and accelerometer with a simple complementary filter running at 100 Hz. Blink an LED faster as tilt magnitude increases. Ensure WCET under 2 ms. Add a safety block that holds the last valid estimate if a sensor update is late. Provide inline tests with synthetic sensor data.

Build a simple pump controller: when the water level sensor indicates low, turn the pump on until a high level is reached; enforce a minimum off-time of 10 seconds between runs. Add a safety block to shut the pump off on sensor fault. Include inline tests for normal fill and fault cases.

Create a PID speed controller where speed is measured by pulse frequency. Allow setting the target speed with a knob. Sample at 50 Hz, clamp the output to safe limits, and detect sensor loss. Add inline tests that simulate a step change in setpoint and a sensor dropout.

Implement a direction-aware light seeker: read two light sensors, drive a left/right indicator toward the brighter side, and neutral when balanced. Add a safety block that disables indicators if both sensors are saturated. Provide inline tests with varying light distributions.

Fuse two distance sensors by validating each reading, then using the minimum of the valid values to set a three-level alert (<1.0 m caution, <0.5 m warning with buzzer). Add a safety block that mutes the buzzer if both sensors are invalid. Include inline tests for valid, mixed, and invalid cases.

Create a multi-mode incubator demo with modes: Standby, Warm-up, Regulate, and Fault. Use PID temperature control in Regulate mode to hold 37.0 C, and require humidity within 40–60% RH. Add safety interlocks for overtemperature (>39.0 C), sensor loss, and startup self-test. Run at 10 Hz with WCET under 2 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests that cover mode transitions, setpoint convergence, and all fault conditions.

Estimate velocity from position samples at 50 Hz using a low-pass differentiated estimate, then maintain target velocity at 0.5 m/s with a PI controller. Clamp control output, and detect stale data. Add inline tests with a ramp input and a setpoint change to verify response and safety behavior.

Design a multi-mode traffic controller: Normal cycle, Night flashing (all-way amber), and Emergency preemption (all red except a priority path). Include a safe startup phase where all lights are red for 2 seconds. Add timing constraints (run at 50 Hz, WCET < 2 ms). Provide an extensive inline test suite that exercises each mode and transition.

Implement a fault-tolerant average of three temperature sensors: discard any reading that differs from the median by more than 3 C, average the remaining, and control a fan with hysteresis. Add a safety block that forces the fan on if only one sensor remains valid. Include inline tests with consistent readings and with an outlier.

Create a multi-mode classroom timer: modes are Idle, Running, Paused, Alarm, and Fault. Support start, pause, resume, and reset inputs, with clear LED indicators per mode. Add a safety block that enters Fault if loop timing exceeds 5 ms, and that recovers to Idle after a user reset. Provide comprehensive inline tests for all modes and timing violations.

Build a closed-loop brightness control that uses a PI controller to keep a photodiode reading at 300 lux. Sample at 50 Hz. Add output saturation and a safety block that disables control if the measured lux jumps suddenly (e.g., >100 lux per cycle). Include inline tests with step disturbances.

Develop a multi-mode air quality fan controller with modes Off, Auto, Boost, and Fault. Use two sensors: CO2 (ppm) and temperature (Celsius). In Auto, increase fan speed proportionally between 800–1500 ppm; in Boost, force maximum for 10 minutes. Add safety that enters Fault on missing data or >45 C. Run at 10 Hz and keep WCET under 2 ms. Provide a thorough inline test suite for mode logic and safety.

Implement a line-following demo: read two reflectance sensors and drive left/right outputs using proportional correction to keep centered. Add a safety block that stops both outputs if both sensors see no line for 1 second. Include inline tests that simulate left/right deviations and loss of line.

Create a multi-mode water tank trainer with modes Fill, Drain, Idle, and Fault. Use low and high level sensors to control a pump and a valve with minimum on/off times of 5 seconds. Add safety interlocks to prevent simultaneous pump and valve activation and to enter Fault on sensor disagreement. Provide comprehensive inline tests covering normal cycles, rapid toggling attempts, and fault conditions.

Create a beginner tutorial that turns on a status light whenever a pushbutton is pressed and otherwise keeps it off. Use a simple safety block to default the light to off on startup and on any input fault. Add inline tests that simulate press and release sequences, including a quick tap and a long hold.

Write a classroom demo that blinks a light at exactly 1 Hz. Include a clear comment explaining the basic syntax used. Add a simple safety block that forces the light off if timing slips by more than 50 ms. Provide inline tests that verify the on/off durations are within tolerance.

Make a tutorial that sounds a short beep (100 ms) when a button is pressed and stays silent otherwise. Default to silent at power-up using a simple safety block. Include inline tests covering no press, single press, and double press cases.

For a basic exercise, set an output high 3 seconds after startup and keep it high. Add a safety block that cancels the action and keeps the output low if any timer fails. Include inline tests that check the 3 s delay.

Implement a simple edge-triggered latch: each distinct button press toggles a lamp on or off. Use minimal basic syntax. Add a safety block to force off at startup. Provide inline tests that include a press, release, and multiple rapid presses.

Classroom demo: on a rising edge of a trigger input, pulse an output for 200 ms. Keep the pulse width precise. Add inline tests to verify pulse creation and that retriggers during the pulse are ignored.

Beginner tutorial on debouncing: require a button to be stable for 50 ms before considering it pressed, then turn on a light while held. Include a simple safety block to ignore input if it becomes undefined. Add inline tests with bouncing patterns.

Create a heartbeat indicator: blink briefly once per second to show the system is alive. State a WCET requirement that the control logic must execute in under 1 ms per cycle. Provide inline tests measuring blink period and duty cycle.

Basic threshold alarm: if a temperature input reports above 30.0 Celsius, turn on a fan output; otherwise turn it off. Include a simple safety block that forces the fan off if the sensor is missing or invalid. Add inline tests with values below, at, and above 30.0 C.

Implement a basic XOR gate using two digital inputs and one output, suitable for a logic lesson. Add inline tests covering all four input combinations. Include a safety block that drives the output low if either input is undefined.

Startup sequence demo: play three short beeps with 200 ms gaps to indicate successful boot. Provide inline tests that check the timing of each beep and gap. Use a simple safety block to suppress the sequence if a fault flag is set.

Write a lesson that continuously reads a light sensor and turns on a lamp when brightness is below a threshold, otherwise turns it off. Include units in comments (e.g., lux). Add inline tests for dark, bright, and boundary cases, plus a safety block that keeps the lamp off if the sensor reading is invalid.

Intro exercise: maintain a fixed 50% duty cycle on a PWM output. Add an inline test that checks the duty cycle within ±5%. Include a simple safety block that disables the output if timing jitter exceeds a set limit.

Create a one-shot timer: when a button is pressed, turn on an indicator for exactly 1.0 second and then turn it off. Ignore additional presses during the active period. Provide inline tests and a safety block to guarantee the indicator defaults to off.

Make a simple counter lesson: each time a momentary switch is pressed, increment a counter and toggle an output on every even count. Include inline tests for 0, 1, 2, and 3 presses. Add a safety block that resets the counter to zero on startup.

Build a small traffic light state machine for one direction: green 4 s, yellow 1 s, red 4 s. Include a pedestrian request input that forces the next transition to red. On any fault, all lights must be red using a simple safety block. Add inline tests stepping through states and a pedestrian press.

Two-button dimmer: one button increases brightness by 10%, the other decreases by 10%, clamped between 0% and 100%. Update no faster than every 100 ms. Include inline tests and a safety block that forces 0% on startup.

Door monitor project: if a door switch remains open for more than 5 seconds, sound an alarm; stop the alarm when the door closes. Provide an arming switch that disables the alarm when off. Add inline tests and a safety block that mutes the alarm when inputs are invalid.

Make a thermostat with hysteresis: maintain 22.0 Celsius using a heater output with ±0.5 C hysteresis. Include a safety block to shut the heater off if the sensor exceeds 50 C or fails. Add inline tests that sweep the temperature across thresholds.

Level control demo: use low and high level switches to run a pump. Turn the pump on when low is active and off when high is active. Add a 30 s timeout that forces the pump off if high never occurs. Provide inline tests and a safety block for invalid switch states.

Create a PWM fade effect that ramps brightness up and down over 1 second cycles. Add a pause/resume switch and ensure cycle timing accuracy within ±10 ms. Include inline tests and a safety block that pauses and sets brightness to 0% on fault.

Demonstrate button debouncing for two independent buttons (50 ms each) that control two separate outputs. Provide inline tests with bounce patterns and simultaneous presses. Include a simple safety block that forces both outputs off on startup.

Implement a small stopwatch state machine with states: idle, running, and paused. One button starts/stops, another resets. Display ticks at 10 Hz on an output pattern. Add inline tests covering transitions and a safety block to ensure reset on power-up.

Crosswalk demo: when a request button is pressed, flash a light and beep at 2 Hz for 10 seconds, then return to idle. Ignore new requests while active. Provide inline tests and a safety block that silences the beeper on any detected fault.

Quiz buzzer game for two contestants: the first button pressed locks out the other and lights the winner indicator. A reset button clears the lockout. Handle ties within 5 ms deterministically. Include inline tests and a safety block that clears the lockout on startup.

Smart light: if ambient light is low and motion is detected, turn on a lamp for 30 seconds; otherwise keep it off. Restart the 30 s timer on new motion. Provide inline tests for both sensors and a safety block that forces off when sensors disagree or are invalid.

Preset fan controller: a three-position selector chooses 30%, 60%, or 100% speed. If the selector is in an invalid state, default to 30% using a safety block. Add inline tests for each position and transitions.

Pulse counter: count input pulses and toggle an indicator every 100 pulses. Include a reset button that zeroes the count with debounce. Provide inline tests simulating pulse trains and reset presses, plus a safety block that ignores pulses faster than a defined limit.

Ramp generator lesson: when enabled, ramp an analog output linearly from 0.0 to 5.0 volts over 5.0 seconds, then hold. Clamp within range and stop immediately on disable. Add inline tests that verify slope and endpoints, and a safety block that forces 0.0 V on fault.

LED chaser with 4 outputs: move a single lit position along the outputs at a rate controlled by a knob from 0.5 Hz to 5 Hz. If the requested rate is out of range, stop and turn all off via a safety block. Provide inline tests covering min, mid, and max rates.

Alarm with snooze: a button triggers an alarm tone for 10 seconds; pressing a snooze button mutes it for 60 seconds. Implement a clear state machine and add inline tests for all transitions. Include a safety block that ensures the alarm is muted on startup.

Frequency classifier: measure the period of an input and categorize it as slow (<2 Hz), medium (2–10 Hz), or fast (>10 Hz). Indicate the category on three separate outputs. Update classification at 2 Hz. Add inline tests and a safety block for invalid periods.

Alternate two outputs every 250 ms. If an override switch is on, force both outputs off regardless of timing. Include inline tests for timing, override behavior, and a safety block that defaults to override active on startup.

Temperature indicator: use two thresholds, 15 C and 28 C, to classify cold, warm, and hot with three outputs. If temperature exceeds 40 C, blink the hot indicator rapidly as a warning. Provide inline tests and a safety block that forces all indicators off if the sensor is invalid.

Deadman switch demo: an output is enabled only while a button is held. After release, lockout for 1 second before it can be enabled again. Add inline tests for hold, release, and re-enable, and include a safety block that forces the output off on startup.

PID temperature control lab: maintain 37.0 Celsius using a heater output (0–100%). Sample at 10 Hz. Include anti-windup and a safety block that latches a fault and forces output to 0% if temperature exceeds 45 C or the sensor fails. Add inline tests with a simple plant model for step response and setpoint changes.

Speed regulator: hold a target speed of 1200 RPM using PID based on pulse timing. Update at 100 Hz. Enforce output limits and add a safety block that disables output if RPM exceeds 1500 or if no pulses are seen for 1 second. Provide inline tests with simulated pulse streams.

Sensor fusion exercise: read two temperature sensors and produce a fused estimate using median or outlier rejection. Control a cooling fan to maintain 25.0 C. If sensors disagree by more than 3.0 C, enter a fault state via a safety block. Include inline tests with noisy and mismatched data.

Orientation demo: fuse a tilt sensor (acceleration) and a rate sensor (rotation) using a complementary filter to estimate angle in degrees at 100 Hz. Output the estimated angle and apply a safety block that freezes the estimate if either sensor saturates. Provide inline tests with scripted rotations.

Level control simulation: maintain a tank level at 50% using a PID controller driving a valve, with a 20 ms sample time. Implement saturation and a slew rate limit for the valve command. Add a safety block that closes the valve on fault. Provide inline tests with a simple tank model.

Kalman filter tutorial: implement a 1D position estimator in meters with a simple process model and noisy measurements, updating at 50 Hz. Show how variance evolves. Add inline tests that verify convergence on a step input and include a safety block that resets the filter if covariance diverges.

Safety interlock manager: enable a heater only when three conditions are true—guard closed, temperature below 60 C, and watchdog OK. If any interlock opens, immediately disable output and enter a fault state. Provide inline tests for each interlock and the fault latch using a simple safety block.

Cascaded control lesson: ramp a temperature setpoint at no more than 1.0 C/s and use a PID loop to track it with a heater. Include anti-windup and a safety block that disables heat above 50 C. Provide inline tests that verify ramp limiting and tracking performance.

Gain scheduling demo: switch between two PID gain sets depending on error magnitude to avoid overshoot while maintaining response speed. Target is 25.0 C. Add a safety block that zeros output on sensor fault and include inline tests with step inputs.

Sensor health monitor: compute a moving variance of a sensor signal; if variance stays below a threshold for 5 seconds (stuck sensor), flag a fault and fail over to a backup sensor. Use a safety block to mark the fault latched. Include inline tests covering normal, stuck, and recovery cases.

Design a multi-mode greenhouse controller for class: modes Setup, Run, Fault, and Manual Override. Control temperature and humidity at 5 Hz; WCET per cycle must be <2 ms. Use simple safety blocks for interlocks and a fault latch. Provide comprehensive inline tests for mode transitions, sensor failures, and manual override behaviors.

Capstone demo: an environmental chamber with modes Idle, Heat, Cool, and Soak. Implement PID loops for heating and cooling with shared safety that limits temperature to 50 C. Define state machine transitions, timing constraints, and recovery from faults. Include a thorough set of inline tests that cover timing, overshoot, and fault injection.

Power management lab: manage three loads with priority under modes Low-Power, Active, and Fault. Enforce a total current limit of 500 mA by shedding lower-priority loads first. Run the scheduler at 50 Hz with WCET <1 ms. Add simple safety blocks for limit violations and inline tests that sweep load demands and simulate brownout.

Multi-mode data logger: modes Calibration, Logging, Upload, and Fault. Fuse accelerometer and gyroscope readings into a 100 Hz orientation estimate (units m/s^2 and deg/s in logs). Require safe shutdown on low battery via a safety block. Provide inline tests that simulate a 10 s session with calibration, motion, upload, and a fault injection.

Conveyor classroom demo: modes Stop, Jog, Auto, and E-Stop. In Auto, move forward for 5 s, pause 2 s, then repeat. Jog moves only while a button is held. E-Stop immediately disables all outputs and latches a fault until reset via a safety block. Specify WCET, and include comprehensive inline tests for all mode transitions and timing.

For a classroom demo, make a light turn on while a pushbutton is held. Keep the logic to basic syntax with simple variables and if/else. Include a simple safety block that ignores input if it flickers faster than 20 ms, and add inline tests that press and release the button to verify the light follows correctly.

Create a tiny exercise where a single button toggles a light on each press. Use only basic syntax. Add a safety block that prevents a second toggle within 200 ms, and write inline tests covering double-press and long-press cases.

Sound a buzzer when the room gets dark (below a light level threshold). Keep it beginner-friendly. Add a safety block to limit the buzzer to 1 second per event, and include inline tests for bright, dim, and borderline conditions.

Read temperature in Celsius and turn on a blue indicator if it is 18–22 C, otherwise turn on a red indicator. Keep the code simple. Add a safety block that discards readings below -40 C or above 125 C, and inline tests for those edge values.

Map a dial position (0–100%) to light brightness from off to full. Use only basic syntax. Add a safety block that clamps the brightness to 0–100% and include inline tests for inputs -10%, 50%, and 120%.

Blink a light at 1 Hz for a classroom timing demo. Keep it simple and readable. Add a safety block that prevents the blink rate from exceeding 2 Hz, and include inline tests that check period accuracy within ±10%.

Turn on a small fan output when humidity is above 70%, and turn it off when it drops below 65% (simple hysteresis). Use basic syntax and a clear if/else chain. Include a safety block that prevents more than 6 on/off cycles per minute, plus inline tests showing the hysteresis works.

Count button presses up to 9 and display the count on a simple bar of LEDs. Reset to 0 after reaching 9. Add a safety block that ignores any press shorter than 30 ms, and write inline tests that simulate fast and slow presses.

When a water contact sensor reports wet, turn on an alarm light; when dry, turn it off. Keep to basic syntax. Add a safety block that requires the wet signal to persist for at least 50 ms before alarming, and provide inline tests for noisy transitions.

Drive a short chime (buzzer) when a door sensor opens, but never longer than 2 seconds. Use straightforward if/else logic. Add inline tests for open, close, and rapid open-close cases and a safety block that prevents repeated chimes within 3 seconds.

Implement a simple countdown timer that starts at 10 seconds and beeps once when it finishes. Keep the logic simple. Include a safety block that forbids setting times greater than 60 seconds, and inline tests for 0, 10, and 61 seconds.

Every 1 second, read a temperature sensor and display the value in Celsius on a numeric display. Add a safety block to clamp the display range to -20 C to 50 C, and include inline tests checking update timing and clamping.

Turn on a light when an object is closer than 0.2 m to a distance sensor; otherwise turn it off. Use basic syntax. Add a safety block that replaces any negative or NaN distance with a safe default, and include inline tests for 0.1 m, 0.25 m, and invalid data.

Simple classroom math tool: read width and height from two sliders and compute the area. Show the area as an integer. Add a safety block that treats any negative input as zero, and include inline tests for (3,4), (-2,5), and (0,0).

Use a switch to choose between displaying 'Hello' and 'World' on a small display. Keep to beginner-level syntax. Add a safety block that defaults to 'Hello' if the switch state is unknown, and write inline tests for both positions and an invalid state.

Build a simple traffic light sequence (green → yellow → red) for a single intersection approach. Use a small state machine with clear states. Add a safety block ensuring yellow lasts at least 2 seconds, and include inline tests that verify the state order and durations.

Create a two-button combination lock: press A then B to unlock an LED for 5 seconds. Model it as a state machine. Add a safety block that locks out input for 10 seconds after 3 wrong attempts, and include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences.

Design a quiz buzzer for up to four students: the first button pressed locks out the others and lights a winner indicator. Implement the lockout as a state machine. Add a safety block to ignore presses within 50 ms of startup, and write inline tests where two buttons are pressed nearly simultaneously.

Make a thermostat that controls a heater output to maintain 22 C with a 1 C deadband. Add a safety block that disables the heater if the reading exceeds 35 C or the sensor is missing, and include inline tests for cold, warm, and sensor-fault cases.

Control a small water pump using two level switches: start when low level is detected and stop when high level is reached. Use a clear state machine to avoid chattering. Add a safety block that prevents dry running if both switches read open, plus inline tests that simulate filling and emptying.

Create a crossing beacon that flashes lights in an alternating pattern, with a manual override button to make both lights steady for 10 seconds. Include a safety block that limits the override to once per minute, and add inline tests for timing and override behavior.

Simulate a tiny elevator with two floors: buttons request up or down and LEDs indicate floor. Implement a finite state machine with moving and idle states. Add a safety block that prevents moving beyond the top or below the bottom, and inline tests for all transitions.

Build a metronome with an adjustable tempo from 40 to 208 BPM using a slider input. Add a safety block that clamps tempo to this range and ensures no missed ticks. Include inline tests measuring tick intervals for 60 BPM and 120 BPM within ±5%.

Make a motion-activated light that turns on when motion is detected and turns off after 30 seconds of no motion. Add a safety block that limits the maximum on-time to 5 minutes, and include inline tests for repeated motion events.

Use a rotary encoder to navigate a simple three-item menu on a display with a select button. Implement a small state machine for navigation and selection. Add a safety block that bounds the index between 0 and 2, and inline tests for wrap-around attempts.

Create a proximity beeper: as distance decreases from 1.0 m to 0.1 m, increase beep frequency. Add a safety block that silences the buzzer if the sensor reports values outside 0.05–2.0 m, and include inline tests at 1.0 m, 0.5 m, 0.1 m, and 3.0 m.

Implement a mini data logger that samples temperature every 500 ms and maintains a 5-sample moving average shown on a display. Add a safety block that rejects any reading that changes more than 10 C between samples, and include inline tests for averaging and outlier rejection.

Create a reaction-time game: after a random delay, a light turns on and the player presses a button; measure the reaction time in milliseconds. Add a safety block that cancels the round if the button is pressed before the light, and include inline tests for early and valid presses.

Build a basic line detector using two reflectance sensors: light up a left or right indicator depending on which sensor sees darker. Add a safety block to declare 'unknown' and light both if both sensors match within a small tolerance, and include inline tests for left, right, and equal readings.

Control two fluid valves so that exactly one is ever open; a selector input chooses which one. Add a safety block that enforces mutual exclusion and a 100 ms minimum closed time during switching, and include inline tests that try to command both valves at once.

Create a keypad-based password entry: accept a 4-digit code, unlock for 10 seconds on success, and beep on failure. Model it with a state machine. Add a safety block that enforces a 3-try limit with a 30-second cooldown, and inline tests for success, failures, and cooldown.

Build a simple alarm clock that keeps time in HH:MM, lets the user set an alarm, and sounds a buzzer at the set time. Add a safety block that validates time entries (00:00 to 23:59), and include inline tests for rollover and alarm triggering.

Fade an RGB light smoothly through colors, with a pause/resume button. Add a safety block that caps total current by limiting combined brightness, and include inline tests for pause/resume and cap behavior.

Show indoor air quality using a CO2 sensor: green below 800 ppm, yellow 800–1200 ppm, red above 1200 ppm. Add a safety block that ignores readings during the first 10 seconds after startup (sensor warm-up), and include inline tests for boundary values.

Create a basic speed display: read a wheel sensor to compute velocity in m/s and show it rounded to one decimal place. Add a safety block that outputs 0 if no pulses are seen for 2 seconds, and include inline tests for steady speed, zero speed, and dropout.

Implement a temperature controller that maintains 37.0 C using a PID loop updating at 10 Hz. Add a safety block that shuts off heat if temperature exceeds 50 C or if the sensor is faulty, limit output to 0–80%, and include inline tests with step changes and a simulated sensor fault. Ensure WCET ≤ 5 ms.

Create a closed-loop speed controller for a small motor using PID to hold 1.5 m/s based on pulse counts per second. Add a safety block for stall detection (zero pulses for 1 s triggers shutdown) and an over-speed cutoff at 2.0 m/s, with inline tests for setpoint changes and stall.

Fuse two temperature sensors into a single estimate using a weighted average that favors the sensor with lower variance. Add a safety block that discards any reading outside -40 to 125 C and falls back to the other sensor if one fails, and include inline tests covering noise, failure, and recovery.

Estimate tilt angle in degrees using an accelerometer and gyro with a complementary filter running at 100 Hz. Add a safety block that saturates angles to ±90 degrees and detects sensor saturation, and include inline tests for static tilt and rotation. Target WCET ≤ 2 ms.

Combine ultrasonic and infrared distance sensors to choose a reliable distance estimate for obstacle detection. Prefer the one with consistent readings; otherwise average them. Add a safety block that rejects estimates outside 0.05–3.0 m, and include inline tests for agreement, disagreement, and out-of-range cases.

Maintain room illumination at 300 lux using a PID controller that adjusts a dimmable light. Add a safety block limiting the rate of change to prevent flicker and capping output between 10% and 90%, with inline tests for sudden disturbances and saturation.

Control liquid level in a small tank to 15 cm using a PI controller with anti-windup. Add a safety block that triggers an alarm and shuts valves if level exceeds 20 cm or drops below 2 cm, and include inline tests for fill, drain, and sensor dropout.

Compute a simple indoor air quality score by fusing CO2 (ppm) and PM2.5 (µg/m³) with configurable weights, and drive a 3-speed fan accordingly. Add a safety block that ensures the fan never stays above 80% duty for more than 10 minutes without a cooldown, and include inline tests for various pollutant combinations and the cooldown.

Follow a temperature ramp profile: heat from 20 C to 30 C over 5 minutes, hold for 10 minutes, then cool to 22 C. Use a small state machine supervising a PID heater output. Add a safety block for over-temperature shutdown and sensor fault detection, plus inline tests for profile timing and fault handling.

Home a positioner to a limit switch, then use PID to hold a target angle in degrees. Implement homing and ready states. Add a safety block that stops motion if an end-stop is hit unexpectedly, and include inline tests for homing success, PID tracking, and simulated end-stop faults.

Design a multi-mode classroom incubator with modes Off, Heat, Hold, and Alarm. Use PID temperature control in Hold to maintain 37.0 C. Add safety blocks for sensor failure, heater overcurrent, and over-temperature shutdown, and a watchdog that forces Alarm on missed deadlines. Specify a 10 Hz control rate with WCET ≤ 3 ms, and include comprehensive inline tests covering all mode transitions and injected faults.

Create a mini greenhouse controller with two zones that can be Off, Heat, or Vent independently, plus a global Alarm mode. Coordinate so that heating and venting are not active simultaneously in the same zone. Include safety blocks for sensor plausibility (temp -20 to 60 C, humidity 0–100%), actuator interlocks, and a timed cooldown, with inline tests that exercise conflicting commands and fault recovery.

Build an experiment scheduler with modes Setup, Run, and Review. Schedule tasks for sampling sensors at 50 Hz, logging at 5 Hz, and updating a display at 2 Hz. Specify per-task WCET budgets (1 ms, 2 ms, and 5 ms respectively) and include a safety block that drops noncritical updates if deadlines are missed. Provide comprehensive inline tests for schedule timing and overload handling.

Program a laboratory centrifuge simulator with Idle, Spin, and Brake modes. Use PID to achieve target RPM and a state machine to manage ramps. Add safety blocks for lid interlock, over-speed cutoff, and imbalance detection, with a watchdog on the control loop. Include extensive inline tests for mode transitions, emergency stop, and overspeed scenarios.

Develop a line-following lab cart controller with modes Setup, Calibrate, Run, and Fail-safe. Fuse two line sensors with IMU gyro data to compute lateral error, and limit speed to 0.5 m/s. Add safety blocks for sensor loss, excessive error, and an emergency stop input. Run the control loop at 200 Hz with WCET ≤ 1 ms, and provide comprehensive inline tests for calibration, steady tracking, sharp turns, and fault injection.

Write a tiny ReflexScript tutorial that turns on a single LED while a pushbutton is held, and turns it off otherwise. Show clear, beginner-friendly basic syntax, add a simple safety block that defaults the LED off if the input is unreadable, and include inline tests that simulate press and release with debounced edges.

Make a one-second blinker demo: an LED toggles every 1000 ms. Keep the code minimal to teach basic syntax, add a safety block that forces the LED off if the timer fails, and include inline tests that check timing accuracy within ±10 ms.

Create a simple program that reads a temperature sensor and prints the value in Celsius once per second. Clamp the reading to 0–50 °C in a safety block, and add inline tests feeding -10, 25, and 100 to verify the clamping and output format.

Beginner task: sound a buzzer when ambient light drops below a threshold. Include a safety block that ensures the buzzer is off on sensor fault, and add inline tests for light values above, below, and exactly at the threshold.

Pot-to-brightness demo: map a 0–100% control input to LED brightness with PWM, but cap the duty cycle at 80% in a safety block. Keep the syntax simple and add inline tests for 0%, 50%, 90%, and an invalid reading.

Count button presses up to 10 and then reset to 0. Show clean basic syntax and a safety block that ignores presses shorter than 20 ms (debounce). Provide inline tests that simulate rapid presses, bounces, and the wrap back to 0.

Blink an LED exactly three times after startup (250 ms on, 250 ms off), then leave it off. Add a safety block that cancels blinking if a stop flag is set. Include inline tests that verify the on/off durations and final off state.

Turn on a warning LED when a distance sensor reports less than 20 cm. In a safety block, discard out-of-range values (<0 cm or >400 cm). Include inline tests for 10 cm, 50 cm, -5 cm, and 500 cm cases.

Write a quick classroom demo that maps an analog voltage from 0–5 V to a printed percentage (0–100%). Saturate out-of-range readings in a safety block and add inline tests for -0.5 V, 0 V, 2.5 V, 5 V, and 6 V.

Build a periodic logger that prints the current time tick at 5 Hz. State a WCET limit of 3 ms for the logging task, include a simple safety block that skips a cycle if runtime exceeds the limit, and add inline tests using a virtual clock.
Make a pass/fail indicator: given a score input 0–100, print PASS if ≥60 and FAIL otherwise. Use a safety block to handle invalid inputs by printing ERROR. Add inline tests for 59, 60, 100, and 120.

When a button is held for more than 2 s, turn on an LED for exactly 1 s, then turn it off. If the button is released early, cancel the action (safety behavior). Include inline tests that cover early release, exact 2 s hold, and long hold.

Generate a simple triangle wave command from 0% to 50% and back to 0% over 2 s, looping. Add a safety block that forces 0% if a stop flag is set. Provide inline tests that verify the ramp steps and period.

Play a 500 ms tone when a button is pressed, then enforce a minimum off time of 200 ms before the next tone. Include a safety block that silences output on fault, and inline tests for back-to-back presses and timing gaps.

Teach conversions: read a Celsius value, calculate Fahrenheit, then convert back to Celsius to show equivalence. Keep the syntax simple, and add inline tests for 0 °C, 25 °C, and 100 °C verifying round-trip accuracy.

Create a traffic light state machine with three LEDs: GREEN 5 s, YELLOW 2 s, RED 5 s. A pedestrian button requests a crossing that is honored on the next RED. Include a safety block that forces all-red on fault, and inline tests to verify timing and transitions.

Build a water level controller using two float switches (LOW and HIGH). Run a pump until HIGH is reached or 10 s passes, whichever comes first. Add a safety block with a 20 s cooldown between runs, and inline tests that simulate both sensors and timeouts.

Make a reaction timer game: after a random delay between 1–3 s, turn on an LED; measure the time in milliseconds until the button is pressed. Use a safety block to ignore early presses, and provide inline tests for early, fast, and slow reactions.

Drive a 7-segment display to show digits 0–9, advancing with each button press. Include a safety block that blanks the display on invalid digit values. Provide inline tests that step through all digits and verify segment patterns.

Implement a simple fan controller with hysteresis: fan turns on at 25 °C and off at 23 °C. Add a safety block that shuts everything down above 60 °C. Include inline tests covering rising and falling temperature profiles.

Create a classroom bell scheduler that rings a buzzer for 3 s at specific minute marks from an array. Simulate the clock, add a safety block that disables ringing outside school hours, and include inline tests for schedule adherence.

Write a dimmer with two buttons: UP increases brightness by 5%, DOWN decreases by 5%. Long press should auto-repeat at 10 Hz. Clamp output to 0–100% in a safety block, and add inline tests for single and long presses.

Add a 5-sample moving average filter to a noisy sensor reading and publish the filtered value. Use a safety block that holds the last good value if input is stale for >500 ms. Include inline tests with a known sequence.

Design a small state machine for a door alarm: DISARMED, ARMED, ALARM. The button toggles between DISARMED and ARMED; the door sensor triggers ALARM when ARMED. Include a safety block that ignores sensor events for 5 s after arming, and inline tests.

Make a metronome that blinks an LED at a tempo given in BPM (40–200). Enforce timing error <2 ms per beat and clamp tempo in a safety block. Provide inline tests with virtual time to verify several BPMs.

Create a 3-floor mini elevator simulation: LEDs indicate floor, buttons request floors, and movement happens one floor per second. Add a safety block that stops movement when an overload flag is set. Include inline tests for call ordering and timing.

Build a soil moisture controller that runs a pump until moisture crosses a threshold or 8 s passes. Add a safety interlock that enforces a 30 s cooldown before the next run. Include inline tests covering dry-to-wet transitions and timeouts.

Create a two-team scoreboard: buttons increment Team A or B; pressing both for 2 s resets to 0–0. Debounce inputs and add a safety block that prevents counts above 99. Provide inline tests for edge cases.

Implement a day/night lamp with hysteresis: LED turns on below 300 lux and off above 400 lux. In a safety block, turn the LED off if the sensor faults. Add inline tests for rising and falling light sequences.
Map a knob to a servo angle from 0° to 180° and apply a rate limit of 60°/s to keep motion smooth. Use a safety block to clamp angles. Include inline tests that verify mapping and rate limiting.

Blink Morse code for the text "SOS" using a 200 ms time unit. Ensure correct dot, dash, and spacing timing. Add a safety block that cancels output on a stop flag, and inline tests that check the LED timing sequence.

Write a temperature logger that samples at 2 Hz and tracks the running minimum and maximum over the last 60 s. State a WCET limit of 5 ms for the sample task, add a safety block that drops a sample if overrun occurs, and include inline tests.

Program a crosswalk signal with states WALK (7 s), FLASH (5 s), and DON'T WALK, plus a numeric countdown. Add a safety block that turns all lights off if a fault flag is raised. Provide inline tests for full cycle behavior.

Create an alarm clock: at the set time, sound a buzzer for 30 s; a snooze button adds 5 minutes and silences. Ensure you handle times correctly around minute changes. Add a safety block to prevent triggering before the current time, and inline tests.

Build a two-player quiz buzzer: the first button pressed wins and locks out the other until reset. Debounce both inputs, add a safety block that auto-resets after 15 s idle, and provide inline tests for simultaneous and near-simultaneous presses.

Implement a PID loop to maintain 37.0 °C using a heater output (0–100%) at 10 Hz. Include anti-windup, a safety block that cuts output if temperature exceeds 45 °C or the sensor faults, and inline tests with a simple thermal plant model.

Fuse two temperature sensors by rejecting outliers and averaging the remaining values to decide when to turn a fan on above 28 °C. Add a safety block that enters a safe state if the sensors disagree by >3 °C. Include inline tests with divergent readings.

Estimate tilt angle (degrees) by fusing accelerometer and gyro data with a complementary filter at 100 Hz. Use a safety block that falls back to accelerometer-only if gyro data is stale >50 ms. Provide inline tests with simulated motion.

Create a PID speed controller to hold 1.50 m/s using pulse-based encoder feedback at 50 Hz. State WCET <2 ms for the control step, add a safety block that zeroes output on stop flag or if large error persists >5 s, and include inline tests with a simple inertia model.

Maintain room brightness at 300 lux using PID on a dimmer (limit to 0–80%). Add anti-windup and a safety block that disables control on sensor fault. Provide inline tests with a basic light response model.

Fuse two distance sensors: ignore values outside 5–200 cm, then compute a weighted average; if they disagree by >50 cm, choose the nearer reading. Trigger a warning if combined distance <25 cm. Include a safety block for sensor faults and inline tests.

Control a tank level to 50% using a PI controller running at 5 Hz. Limit the valve command to 0–70% and add a safety block that closes the valve on overflow detection. Include inline tests with a simple leaky tank simulation.

Build a simple 1D predictor-corrector filter for altitude (meters) combining barometer readings with a vertical velocity estimate to smooth noise. Cap sudden jumps >2 m in a safety block. Provide inline tests with step and ramp inputs.

Implement PID control of fan speed to 1200 RPM, sampling every 20 ms. Add a safety block that shuts down on tachometer timeout or overspeed. Include inline tests using a first-order plant response and verify settling time.

Add thermal runaway protection: compute dT/dt in °C/s and immediately cut heater output if dT/dt >5 °C/s or absolute temperature >80 °C. Ensure the safety block overrides any other command, and include inline tests with rising temperature scenarios.

Design a mini greenhouse controller with modes OFF, MANUAL, and AUTO. In AUTO, hold 22–24 °C using heater and fan with hysteresis; in MANUAL, use a setpoint. Add a safety cutoff above 45 °C, a clear state machine, loop rate 2 Hz with WCET <3 ms, and comprehensive inline tests for mode transitions and fault recovery.

Create a classroom robot cart controller with modes IDLE, DRIVE, and BRAKE. Use PID to reach 0.8 m/s, and switch to BRAKE when an obstacle sensor triggers. Include a pre-start self-test, a watchdog that forces IDLE on task overrun, and an extensive inline test suite with timing checks and fault injection.

Build an energy monitor and load shedder with modes NORMAL, ALERT, and SHED. Compute power from voltage and current; if power >200 W for >5 s, shed a noncritical load. Add brownout safety behavior, run at 20 Hz with WCET <1 ms, and provide comprehensive inline tests.

Write a lab incubator controller with modes WARMUP, REGULATE, and COOLDOWN. Fuse two temperature sensors (median) and use PID to maintain 37 °C with a small fan assist. Add a safety state if sensors disagree by >2 °C, and include thorough inline tests for mode logic, PID response, and failure cases.

Create a 4-player quiz system with modes READY, LOCKED, and REVIEW. First press wins, but enforce a 100 ms fairness window to resolve near-simultaneous presses. Long-press an admin button to enter REVIEW and show the press order. Add safety (debounce, auto-reset after 30 s) and a complete inline test suite for edge cases.

Write a ReflexScript lesson example that turns an LED on only while a pushbutton is pressed. Use basic syntax, add a simple safety block to ignore contact bounce for 30 ms, and include inline tests that verify LED on/off behavior during press and release edges.

Create a beginner-friendly ReflexScript demo that blinks an LED at 1 Hz with a 50% duty cycle. Include a simple safety block to clamp the period between 0.5 s and 2.0 s, and add inline tests that check the blink period within ±5% tolerance.

Make a classroom exercise in ReflexScript that reads a knob (0–100%) and sets LED brightness to match. Clamp input to 0–100% with a simple safety block, and include inline tests mapping sample inputs (0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%) to expected PWM outputs.

Program a simple alert: when temperature exceeds 30 C, sound a buzzer for 500 ms, then stay quiet for at least 1 s before it can trigger again. Use basic syntax, a safety block to reject sensor values below -40 C or above 125 C, and inline tests for threshold crossing and the cooldown timer.

Teach level-based decisions: read a light sensor and choose LED color as red for dark, yellow for medium, and green for bright. Add a safety block to clamp sensor values to expected range and inline tests covering the three thresholds and boundary cases.

Show how to detect button edges in ReflexScript by toggling an LED only on a rising edge (press). Include a simple debounce safety block (20 ms) and inline tests verifying that holding the button does not produce multiple toggles.

Create a timing lab: measure the elapsed time between two button presses and blink an LED that many times modulo 10. Add a safety block to cap the measured interval at 5 s, and include inline tests for short, long, and out-of-range intervals.

Write a periodic ReflexScript task running at 10 Hz that reads temperature in C and computes Fahrenheit. Use a safety block to replace invalid readings with the last good value, and include inline tests that check the conversion formula for sample inputs.

Design a motion-triggered beep: on a transition from no-motion to motion, play a 200 ms tone, then ignore new triggers for 1 s. Include a simple safety block to ensure the tone length stays between 100 and 500 ms, and add inline tests for trigger, retrigger lockout, and return to ready.

For a truth table lesson, read two digital inputs and turn an LED on only when both are true. Add inline tests that cover all four input combinations and a safety block that defaults the LED off if either input is undefined.

Build a basic analog-to-percentage converter: map 0.0–3.3 V to 0–100% and expose it as an output variable. Use a safety block to clamp voltage and a simple linear map. Include inline tests for 0.0 V, 1.65 V, and 3.3 V cases.

Create a reflex project that averages the last 4 light sensor readings and turns an LED on when the average is below a threshold. Use a safety block to initialize the average on startup and include inline tests showing the moving average behavior over time.

Teach duration logic: if a button is held for more than 2 s, turn an LED solid; if tapped for less than 2 s, blink it once. Implement with basic syntax, a safety block limiting max blink duration to 500 ms, and inline tests simulating both short and long presses.

Write an exercise that reads temperature in C and blinks an LED a number of times equal to the tens digit (e.g., 23 C -> 2 blinks). Add a safety block to cap blink count between 0 and 9 and inline tests for several sample temperatures.

Make a startup timer: after power-on, wait 3 s, then turn on an LED and leave it on. Include a safety block to ensure the delay stays within 1–5 s and inline tests that validate the delay timing and final state.

Create a traffic light classroom demo using a simple state machine: green, yellow, red, with a pedestrian button that requests a crossing phase. Specify nominal durations (green 10 s, yellow 2 s, red 10 s), add a safety block that forces all-red if the button is stuck, and include inline tests for timing and transitions.

Build a two-room fan controller: read two temperature sensors in C, run a fan if either room exceeds 26 C, and set a fault LED if the sensors disagree by more than 2 C. Use a safety block to handle missing data, and include inline tests for each case.

Write a potentiometer-to-servo demo: position a servo from 0 to 180 degrees based on the knob, with a rate limit of 30 degrees per second. Include a safety block to clamp angle range and inline tests for mapping and rate limiting.

Design a reaction timer game: after a random delay between 1 and 3 s, light an LED; measure the time until a button press in milliseconds, and store the best of 5 tries. Add a safety block to cap the max reaction at 3 s and include inline tests with scripted press times.

Implement a water tank monitor with three float switches (low, ok, high). Turn the pump on when level is low and off when high, with a minimum pump run time of 5 s. Add a safety block to prevent rapid cycling and inline tests for all transitions.

Create a crosswalk beacon demo: during the day (bright), keep a green LED steady; at night (dark), flash a yellow LED at 1 Hz. Use a safety block to clamp the light sensor range and include inline tests for day/night threshold behavior.

Build a door alarm state machine with Arm, EntryDelay, Alarm, and Disarm states. Use a 10 s arming delay, 5 s entry delay, and auto-silence the alarm after 2 minutes. Include a safety block for missing sensor input and inline tests for each state transition.

Program a simple DC motor speed control where a knob sets the target speed and a soft-start ramp takes 0.5 s to reach it. Add a safety block limiting the duty cycle between 0% and 90% and inline tests confirming the ramp behavior.

Create a data sampler that reads temperature at 2 Hz and maintains the minimum and maximum over the last 60 s, exposing them as variables. Include a safety block for sensor timeouts and inline tests using a sequence of simulated readings.

Write a simple two-button menu: Next cycles through three modes, Select confirms the current mode and lights a corresponding LED. Implement a small state machine, add a safety block for long-press timeouts, and include inline tests for button sequences.

Teach sensor validation: read two temperature sensors, compute their average if both are valid; if the difference exceeds 3 C, raise a warning and use the last good average. Include a safety block for NaN/invalid input and inline tests for agree/disagree cases.

Make a distance-based buzzer: map distance from 10 cm to 100 cm to beep rate from 10 Hz down to 2 Hz. Add a safety block to clamp distance inputs and inline tests that verify the mapping and rate limits.

Build a classroom metronome where a knob sets tempo from 40 to 200 BPM and a buzzer ticks accordingly. Ensure jitter under 2 ms, add a safety block for BPM limits, and include inline tests confirming timing at 60 and 120 BPM.

Implement a simple access code demo using three buttons A, B, and C: the unlock sequence is A, B, A. Any wrong press resets the sequence. Include a safety block for stuck buttons and inline tests that cover correct and incorrect sequences.

Create a fan controller with hysteresis: turn on at 28 C and turn off at 26 C, with a minimum on/off time of 30 s. Use a safety block to clamp temperature range and inline tests for threshold and timing behaviors.

Write a color classification demo: read a color sensor and light red, green, or blue LED depending on the dominant component. Include a safety block for saturation and out-of-range values, plus inline tests with sample RGB vectors.

Create an acceleration trigger: when acceleration magnitude exceeds 2.0 m/s^2, set a trigger flag for 1 s and then re-arm. Add a safety block to filter spikes shorter than 10 ms, and include inline tests with synthetic acceleration data.

Design a dimmer with teach mode: on command, record min and max knob positions over 5 s, then map input to that calibrated range. Implement a small state machine, add a safety block to ensure max > min, and include inline tests for calibration and mapping.

Build an LED chaser with adjustable speed from 0.5 Hz to 10 Hz set by a knob. Ensure non-blocking timing, include a safety block to clamp speed, and add inline tests that verify index wrap-around and rate accuracy.

Create an event counter: count input pulses and display the count modulo 8 on an LED bar. Add a safety block to ignore pulses faster than 1000 per second, and include inline tests covering normal counting and over-rate rejection.

Develop a PID temperature controller targeting 37.0 C with ±0.5 C tolerance, sampling at 5 Hz. Include anti-windup, output clamping, a safety block for hard overtemperature cutoff at 45 C, and inline tests with a step-change scenario.

Write a speed control demo using PID to hold 1200 rpm from tachometer pulses at a 100 Hz loop rate. Specify WCET under 1 ms, add a safety block that stops output on loss of feedback, and include inline tests with simulated pulse trains.

Teach sensor fusion with a complementary filter: combine accelerometer and gyroscope to estimate tilt angle in degrees at 50 Hz, and drive a servo toward 0 degrees. Add a safety block that disables output if absolute angle exceeds 45 degrees, and include inline tests using synthetic motion profiles.

Fuse multiple distance readings: at each tick (20 Hz), take three samples and use the median to reject outliers, then set LED brightness inversely to distance. Include a safety block for input range and inline tests with outlier scenarios.

Build an environmental monitor that computes heat index from temperature (C) and humidity (%RH), and turns on a fan if the heat index exceeds 32 C. Add a safety block that forces fan-on if either sensor is missing, and include inline tests with realistic data.

Create a simple battery observer: estimate state of charge using voltage (V) and current (mA) with basic coulomb counting, clamped between 0% and 100%. Add a safety block to stop charging if voltage exceeds 4.25 V, and include inline tests for charge and discharge cases.

Design a pressure control demo: maintain 50 kPa using PID on a valve at 20 Hz, with a safety relief that opens a vent if pressure exceeds 60 kPa. Specify WCET under 2 ms, and include inline tests for setpoint tracking and overpressure handling.

Teach weighted averaging: fuse two temperature sensors using weights based on variance estimated over a 10 s window. Update weights each second, add a safety block to freeze output if variance spikes, and include inline tests with steady and noisy inputs.

Implement adaptive dimming toward a target lux using a PI controller at 25 Hz, with integral clamp to prevent windup. Add a safety block to avoid duty cycles above 90% when the sensor is saturated, and include inline tests for step changes in target.

Create a motion profile generator for a motor: given a target speed, ramp using jerk-limited profiles with max acceleration 1.0 m/s^2 and max jerk 2.0 m/s^3. Include a safety block to abort on stop command and inline tests verifying velocity, acceleration, and jerk limits.

Build a multi-mode lab trainer with modes Normal, Calibration, and Safe. Manage transitions via two buttons and a config input using a clear state machine. Enforce a 50 Hz loop with WCET under 1 ms, add simple safety blocks for sensor timeouts and range checks, and include comprehensive inline tests that cover all transitions and fault recovery.

Develop a classroom climate controller with modes Heat, Cool, Fan-only, and Emergency-Off. Use two temperature sensors and one humidity sensor, implement separate PID loops for heating and cooling, add hysteresis against short cycling, and share safety logic: lockout on sensor disagreement > 3 C, overtemp > 40 C, or undertemp < 5 C. Run at 2 Hz and include thorough inline tests with fault injection.

Create a sterilization chamber simulator with modes Preheat, Sterilize, and Vent. Control temperature to 121 C and hold for 15 minutes; enforce pressure not to exceed 200 kPa. Use PID for temperature and threshold control for pressure. Add safety interlocks (door open inhibits heat, emergency stop forces Vent), require WCET under 3 ms at 10 Hz, and include extensive inline tests for timers and interlocks.

Design a student balancing platform demo with modes Idle, Balance, and Safe. Fuse accelerometer and gyroscope to estimate tilt, run a PID to keep tilt within ±2 degrees, and transition to Safe (outputs cut) if tilt exceeds 20 degrees or sensor data stalls more than 100 ms. Loop at 100 Hz with WCET 1 ms, and provide comprehensive inline tests with synthetic motion and dropouts.

Write a supervisor for an education demo rig controlling lighting, fans, and a buzzer using a master state machine with a schedule clock. Include startup self-test, degraded operation when any sensor fails, and a manual override mode. Require all control tasks to complete within 2 ms each tick at 25 Hz, add simple safety blocks for range checks and timeouts, and include exhaustive inline tests for schedule adherence, overrides, and degradation logic.

Write a beginner-friendly ReflexScript that turns on an indicator light whenever a pushbutton is held down, and ensures the light cannot stay on for more than 5 seconds using a simple safety block. Add a few inline tests that simulate press durations to verify correct on/off behavior and the 5-second cap.

Create a simple ReflexScript lesson: toggle a light each time a button is pressed. Include basic debouncing, keep the logic easy to read with clear comments, and add inline tests to cover quick double-presses and long presses.

Make a tiny thermostat demo in ReflexScript: if temperature exceeds 30 Celsius, enable a fan output; otherwise keep it off. Default to a safe-off state at startup using a simple safety block. Include inline tests with simulated temperatures of 25 C, 30 C, and 35 C.

Build a light-following demo: read a light sensor and set an LED brightness proportional to the measured value. Clamp the output between 10% and 90% brightness for safety, and provide inline tests for low, medium, and high light levels.

Please write a ReflexScript that activates a buzzer when a distance sensor reports less than 0.50 meters. Use a simple safety block so the buzzer cannot sound for more than 10 seconds continuously. Add inline tests for distances of 1.0 m, 0.49 m, and an invalid reading.

Create a classroom timer exercise: press a button to start a 10-second countdown; when it finishes, flash an LED at 2 Hz for 3 seconds. Keep the code simple and add inline tests for starting, mid-count checks, and completion.

Write a ReflexScript that averages the last 5 temperature samples (in Celsius) and maps the average to LED brightness from 0% at 0 C to 100% at 40 C. Include a safety guard to handle sensor faults (NaN or out-of-range) by turning the LED off, and add inline tests for typical and faulty inputs.

Design a simple tilt alarm: if a tilt input is active, sound a buzzer; otherwise stay silent. Implement a basic safety block to ensure the buzzer is muted on startup and on any error. Include inline tests to verify both tilted and level states.

Make a temperature-to-voltage demo: read temperature in Celsius and produce an analog output proportional to 0–5 V for 0–50 C. Clip output at the ends, and include inline tests for 0 C, 25 C, and 60 C.

Write a simple blinker: flash an LED at exactly 1 Hz with a 50% duty cycle. Keep the logic clear for beginners, include a safety block to ensure the output is valid, and add an inline test that checks period and duty.
Create a latch demo: when the button is held for 2 seconds, turn the LED on and keep it on until a quick tap resets it. Add inline tests for short taps, long holds, and the reset tap.

Write a ReflexScript that counts button presses and then blinks an LED that many times when a separate trigger is pressed. Keep it basic, and add inline tests that simulate 0, 3, and 5 presses before triggering.

Create a tone control demo where a knob input scales buzzer frequency from 200 Hz to 2000 Hz. Use a safety block to cap frequencies and mute if the input is invalid. Include inline tests at minimum, mid-scale, and maximum.

Make a safe-start motor example: if a switch is on, set a motor command to 50% duty; otherwise set 0%. Use a simple safety block so the motor command is always 0% at startup and on faults. Provide inline tests for both switch positions and a fault case.

Write a humidity alarm in ReflexScript: if humidity exceeds 70% RH, turn on a dehumidifier output; else turn it off. Add hysteresis of 2% RH to avoid chatter and include inline tests with 69%, 70%, and 72% RH inputs.

Design a traffic light state machine with phases for green, yellow, and red, plus a pedestrian request button that inserts a walk phase. Ensure no two directions are green simultaneously using a simple safety block. Include inline tests that step through the sequence and a case with repeated button presses.

Create a classroom Pomodoro timer: states for Idle, Focus (25 min), and Break (5 min). Start/stop buttons, LED colors for each state, and a beep at transitions. Add inline tests that simulate shortened durations for quick verification.

Write a dual-sensor alarm: only sound the buzzer if both a door sensor and a motion sensor are active at the same time. Limit the buzzer to 15 seconds using a safety block. Include inline tests for single-sensor triggers and both together.

Implement a temperature-controlled fan with hysteresis: turn on at 28 C and off at 26 C. Show fan status with an LED. Run the control loop at 10 Hz and add inline tests for temperatures near the thresholds to verify hysteresis.

Create a moving-average light meter: sample a light sensor every 100 ms, compute a 1-second moving average, and display the average via LED brightness. Include inline tests that feed step and ramp inputs to check smoothing.
Build a metronome: adjustable BPM from 40 to 180 via a knob, flashing an LED and ticking a buzzer on the beat. Keep timing error under 2 ms. Add inline tests for 60 BPM and 120 BPM cadence timing.

Provide a debounced button utility: output a stable pressed/released signal after 20 ms of stability, and blink an LED on each debounced edge. Add inline tests with synthetic bounce patterns to verify correctness.

Create a two-button interlock: both buttons must be pressed within 1 second to enable an output; otherwise lock out for 3 seconds. Use a simple safety block to default the output off. Include inline tests covering valid and invalid timing.

Write an elevator model with states Idle, MovingUp, MovingDown, and DoorOpen. Use buttons for up/down requests and a door sensor. Prevent movement when the door is open using a safety guard. Add inline tests for typical sequences and a door-open fault.

Design a crosswalk beeper: when a request button is pressed, flash an LED at 2 Hz and beep for 10 seconds, then return to idle. Ignore extra requests during active phase. Include inline tests for multiple button presses.

Build a mini greenhouse controller: read temperature and soil moisture; if temp < 20 C, enable a heater; if moisture < 30%, enable a pump; ensure heater and pump are not on simultaneously for more than 5 seconds using a safety block. Add inline tests for various conditions.

Create an LED fade demo: generate a triangle wave to fade an LED up and down smoothly. The period is adjustable from 1 s to 10 s via a knob. Limit duty between 5% and 95% and include inline tests for minimum and maximum period.

Write an adaptive threshold detector: compute a baseline light level as an average over the last 10 seconds and trigger an LED if current light exceeds baseline by 100 lux. Provide inline tests with slow drift and sudden change scenarios.

Implement a rate limiter: given a desired motor command from a knob (0.0–1.0), limit the change to 0.1 per second. Display the limited command via LED brightness. Include inline tests for large step inputs.
Create a tiny scheduler demo that runs two tasks: sensor polling at 20 Hz and a status blink at 2 Hz. Enforce a loop WCET of 1 ms and add inline tests that verify both rates are met.

Build an automatic night light: if ambient is dark and a time-of-day input indicates between 18:00 and 06:00, turn on an LED; otherwise keep it off. Default to safe-off on invalid time or sensor errors. Add inline tests for boundary times and sensor faults.

Create a stopwatch with start, stop, and reset buttons. Use an LED to blink once per second during running. Implement a simple state machine and add inline tests simulating precise button press sequences.
Write a three-level fan controller: Low for 24–26 C, Medium for 26–28 C, High above 28 C, with 1 C hysteresis on each threshold. Include inline tests that sweep temperature and confirm correct bands.

Design a proximity beeper: map distance from 2.0 m (slow beeps) to 0.2 m (fast beeps). Saturate outside the range and mute on invalid readings using a safety block. Add inline tests for edge and mid-range distances.
Make a quiz buzzer: two buttons compete; the first press wins, lights a winner LED, and locks out the other until reset. Include inline tests for simultaneous presses and late presses.

Implement a PID temperature controller to maintain 37 C using a heater PWM output. Sample at 10 Hz, clamp output 0–100%, include anti-windup, and add a safety block to cut heat if temperature exceeds 45 C or the sensor is stale. Provide inline tests for step changes and disturbances.

Create a PID speed control loop using a pulse-rate input as feedback and a motor command as output. Setpoint comes from a knob, run at 50 Hz, and keep WCET under 2 ms. Add inline tests for setpoint steps and load changes.

Write a two-sensor temperature fusion demo: combine readings using a weighted average with outlier rejection if sensors differ by more than 3 C. Drive a fan when fused temperature exceeds 30 C. Use a safety block to force outputs off on disagreement. Include inline tests covering agreement and disagreement cases.

Design a complementary filter to estimate tilt angle in degrees by blending a fast rate-of-change signal with a slower absolute angle reading. Light an LED when within ±5 degrees of level. Add inline tests simulating motion and steady-state.

Create a redundant light sensing module: read two independent light sensors, detect a faulty one (stuck or out-of-range), and use the healthy reading; if both are faulty, default to a safe-off output via a safety block. Add inline tests for normal, single-fault, and dual-fault cases.
