Implement a PID position controller for a slider with a 0–100% position sensor. Setpoint from a knob, rate 20 Hz, with soft limits at 5% and 95% to avoid end stops. Cut output on out-of-range feedback via a safety block. Include inline tests for steps and saturation.

Build an adaptive threshold alarm that increases hysteresis when input noise (measured as rolling standard deviation) grows. Trigger a buzzer when the signal exceeds the adaptive threshold. Add inline tests with quiet and noisy input streams.

Create a majority-vote fusion for three binary sensors: assert alarm only if at least two agree. Include a safety block that suppresses alarm on detected sensor flapping, and inline tests for all vote combinations.

Implement a feedforward + PID control for airflow (in L/min) where a knob sets the target. Use a simple feedforward term plus PID correction, clamp output 0–100%, run at 20 Hz, and add inline tests for setpoint changes.

Fuse two distance sensors to estimate range in meters using a conservative minimum-consistent rule (ignore out-of-range or inconsistent readings). Drive a warning light if fused distance < 0.4 m. Add a safety block to mute on sensor faults and provide inline tests.

Design a multi-mode lab demonstrator with three modes: Demo (traffic light sequence), Lab (PID temperature loop), and Safe (all outputs off). Mode changes occur via buttons; indicate mode with LEDs. Enforce a 100 Hz main loop with WCET under 1 ms, wrap critical outputs in simple safety blocks, and include comprehensive inline tests for mode switching and fault handling.

Create a startup self-test system: on power-up, run diagnostics on inputs and outputs, then either enter Normal mode or Safe mode if any test fails. Provide clear status indications, ensure all critical actions are within simple safety blocks, and write inline tests that inject failures and verify fallbacks.

Build a multi-function timer with three modes: Stopwatch, Countdown, and Metronome. Use buttons to select and control modes; ensure no missed ticks with timing jitter under 1 ms. Include safety guards for the buzzer and comprehensive inline tests covering mode transitions and edge cases.

Implement a three-zone climate controller for a classroom demo: each zone has on/off heating based on temperature bands in Celsius, but total power is limited so no more than two zones heat at once. Add arbitration logic, simple safety blocks for overtemperature conditions, and thorough inline tests for contention scenarios.

Design a safety interlock statechart with modes Idle, Armed, Active, Fault, and Maintenance. Multiple inputs (enable, cancel, fault) govern transitions. Enforce WCET under 2 ms, keep outputs safe by default, use simple safety blocks for actuator enables, and include comprehensive inline tests that validate all transitions and fault recoveries.

Make an indicator turn on while a pushbutton is held, and off otherwise. Default to off at start. Include a simple safety block that forces the indicator off if the input becomes unstable or undefined. Add inline tests that simulate press and release events.

Toggle a buzzer each time a switch is tapped (edge-triggered), ignoring changes faster than 30 ms to demonstrate debouncing. Use basic syntax and a safety block that limits the buzzer to at most 2 seconds of continuous sound. Include inline tests for bounce and normal taps.

When temperature exceeds 30 Celsius, turn a fan output on; turn it off when below 28 Celsius to add hysteresis. Include a safety block that shuts the fan off if the sensor reading is invalid or out of range (-40 to 125 C). Write inline tests for 27 C, 29 C, 31 C, and a sensor fault.

Blink an indicator at 1 Hz for a classroom demo. Keep it simple. Include a safety block that stops blinking and turns the light off if the task overruns its 10 ms WCET. Provide inline tests that check the period and the safe-off behavior.

When a motion sensor triggers, turn on an alarm light for 5 seconds, then turn it off. If motion retriggers during the 5 seconds, keep counting from the latest trigger. Add a safety block that prevents the light from being on for more than 10 seconds continuously. Include inline tests for single and repeated triggers.

Map a knob input from 0–100% to an indicator brightness from 0–100%. Clamp inputs outside the range and ensure the output never exceeds 100%. Use a safety block for clamping and include inline tests for -10%, 0%, 50%, 110%.

Use two buttons: one to start a motor output and another to stop it. Default to stopped at startup. Add a simple safety block that forces the motor off if both buttons are pressed at once. Include inline tests for start, stop, and simultaneous press.

Count button presses up to 9 and show the count on a numeric output, wrapping back to 0 after 9. Add a safety block that prevents the count from exceeding 9 even under bounce. Provide inline tests for 12 quick presses with debouncing and wraparound.

Play a simple pattern of two short beeps when a door switch opens, nothing when it closes. Limit beeps to at most two patterns per second with a safety block. Include inline tests for open, close, and rapid open-close.

Turn on a lamp when ambient light is below 200 lux and turn it off at or above 220 lux (hysteresis). Use a safety block that forces the lamp off if the sensor reads NaN or saturates. Provide inline tests that step through 300, 210, 190, 230 lux.

If soil moisture drops below 30%, run a water pump for 10 seconds, then stop. Prevent re-activation for 1 minute. Add a safety block that caps any single run at 15 seconds. Include inline tests for low moisture, cooldown, and repeated triggers.

Make an output go high for 100 ms on every rising edge of an input, ignoring edges that occur more often than 10 Hz. Use a safety block to enforce the rate limit. Include inline tests with back-to-back edges.
Turn an indicator on only when two separate inputs are both true (AND logic). Start with the indicator off. Add an inline test block that checks all four input combinations. Keep it to basic syntax.
Scale an analog reading 0–1023 into a percentage 0–100 and publish it as a value output. Clamp the result in a safety block. Provide inline tests for readings 0, 512, 1023, and 1200.

If a tilt sensor reports 'tilted', blink an LED rapidly (5 Hz); otherwise keep it steadily on. Include a safety block that ensures the LED is off if the tilt sensor is disconnected. Add inline tests for both tilt states and a fault.

Create a simple two-state traffic light demo that cycles Green for 5 s, Yellow for 2 s, Red for 5 s in a loop. On any detected fault, enter an all-red safe state. Use a state machine with clear states and durations, and provide inline tests that verify the timing and safe-state behavior.

Build a keypad-controlled lock demo: accept a 4-digit code to activate an actuator for 10 seconds, then relock. After 3 failed attempts, enter a 30-second lockout. Include a safety block that ensures the actuator cannot be driven in both directions. Add inline tests for correct code, wrong attempts, and lockout.

Control a tank pump with two level switches: when low level is detected, start the pump; when high level is reached, stop it. Handle the case where sensors disagree by stopping the pump and signaling a fault. Provide inline tests for normal filling and a stuck sensor.

Use both temperature (C) and humidity (%RH) to decide whether to run a fan: turn on if temp > 28 C OR humidity > 70%, and turn off only when both go below temp 26 C and humidity 65%. Include a safety block to force off if either sensor is invalid. Add inline tests covering all branches.

Make a classroom metronome that clicks at a tempo set by a knob from 60 to 180 BPM. Clamp the tempo in a safety block. Provide inline tests that sweep the knob and check periods at 60, 120, and 180 BPM.

Create a pedestrian crossing controller with a button. Normal cycle shows vehicle green; when the button is pressed, transition to a timed pedestrian walk phase with flashing clearance. Safety: never show vehicle green at the same time as walk. Use a state machine and include inline tests for timing and safety.

Control a vent actuator with temperature hysteresis: open above 30 C, close below 25 C, hold position otherwise. Safety: never energize open and close outputs together, and stop movement if a limit switch is hit. Add inline tests.

Make a simple line-follow demonstration with two light sensors controlling left and right drive outputs: if left sensor sees darker surface, bias left; if right is darker, bias right; if both bright, go straight. Safety: stop if sensors are faulty. Include inline tests with sample sensor readings.

Implement a quiz-buzzer for up to 4 players: the first button pressed locks out the others and lights the winner's indicator until a teacher reset input is pressed. Add a safety block that clears all indicators on reset and at startup. Provide inline tests that simulate simultaneous presses.

Detect a rapid temperature change event: if the absolute rate exceeds 2 C per second, trigger an alert output for 3 seconds. Filter noise to avoid false triggers. Include inline tests with a ramp and a sudden jump.

Ventilation based on CO2: turn fan on when CO2 exceeds 1000 ppm and off when below 800 ppm. Use a safety block that turns the fan off if the sensor data is stale. Provide inline tests for crossings and stale data.

Respond to a double-clap: if two sound peaks above a threshold occur within 500 ms, toggle a lamp. Debounce so a long loud sound doesn’t count as two. Include inline tests with timing diagrams simulated by events.

Schedule a status indicator to pulse once every even-numbered second and a different output to pulse on odd-numbered seconds. Safety: ensure both pulses are never overlapping. Provide inline tests that cover 0–5 seconds.

Create a delay-on and delay-off controller: when input turns on, wait 1 s then activate output; when input turns off, wait 2 s before deactivating. Reset timers appropriately if the input changes mid-delay. Add inline tests.

Build a classroom noise stoplight: show green below 60 dB, yellow between 60–75 dB, and red above 75 dB. Hold each state for at least 3 seconds to reduce flicker. Include inline tests for threshold edges and hold times.

Make a 3-speed fan controller: off below 25 C, low between 25–30 C, medium 30–35 C, high above 35 C. Add a safety block to default to off on sensor fault. Provide inline tests that step temperature across all bands.

Automate plant watering: when soil moisture is below 30%, run the pump for 3 seconds, but no more often than once every 5 minutes. Limit the total run time to 30 seconds per day in a safety block. Include inline tests for rate limiting and daily cap.
Demonstrate button debouncing: only toggle an output if the input remains stable for at least 30 ms. Ensure long presses are recognized only once. Provide inline tests with a bouncing waveform.

Make a night light that fades on when ambient light falls below a threshold and fades off when it rises above another threshold. Update at 20 Hz and limit the rate of change so it takes about 2 seconds to fully fade. Use a safety block to force off on sensor error. Include inline tests.

Build a teacher timer: press start to count down 10 seconds; at zero, flash a light three times. Provide a cancel button that stops and resets. Add a safety block to ensure the light cannot be left on longer than 5 seconds. Include inline tests for start, cancel, and complete.

Design a PID temperature controller to hold 37 C. Run the control loop at 10 Hz, and include anti-windup by clamping the integral term. Add a safety block that cuts the heater if temperature exceeds 40 C or the sensor is missing. Provide inline tests with a step change and a simulated sensor fault.

Fuse two temperature sensors into a single estimate using median selection to reject outliers. Drive a fan based on that estimate with hysteresis around 28 C. Safety: if the two sensors disagree by more than 3 C, enter a safe-off mode and flag a fault. Include inline tests for agreement, disagreement, and recovery.

Center a movable pointer on a light source using two light sensors and a PID loop that drives the pointer position to equalize left and right brightness. Update at 50 Hz. Safety: stop motion if either sensor saturates or the pointer hits a limit switch. Add inline tests with synthetic sensor inputs.

Estimate tilt angle by combining a gyroscope (deg/s) and an accelerometer (g) using a complementary filter, then publish the angle at 100 Hz. Include a safety block that falls back to accelerometer-only if the gyro is flagged faulty, and vice versa. Provide inline tests with simulated motion and injected faults.

Control liquid level with a PI loop using an analog level sensor. Target mid-scale level and drive a valve output. Safety: if the level rises faster than expected or both limit switches report closed, immediately close the valve and enter a fault state. Include inline tests for normal control and fault conditions.

Regulate motor speed to a target RPM measured from a pulse frequency input using PID. Update at 20 Hz. Include a safety block that limits the commanded duty to 80% and forces zero if no pulses are detected. Provide inline tests with step changes in target and a simulated stall.

Generate a trapezoidal motion profile for a linear actuator to move from 0% to 100% position in 2 seconds, with 0.5 s accel and decel phases, updating at 100 Hz. Safety: stop immediately if a limit switch triggers. Add inline tests that verify position vs. time at key timestamps.

Fuse two distance sensors (e.g., infrared and ultrasonic) by rejecting any reading that differs from the other by more than 20 cm; otherwise average them. Publish the fused distance at 25 Hz. Safety: mark data invalid if both fail. Include inline tests with consistent readings, outliers, and dropouts.

Compute a comfort index from temperature (C) and humidity (%RH) and control a fan with a PI loop to maintain a target index. Enforce output saturation limits in a safety block. Provide inline tests that sweep inputs and check controller response and saturation.

Create a 3-mode thermostat with Off, Heat, and Cool states. Use separate PID controllers for heating to 22 C and cooling to 24 C, switching with hysteresis. Enforce a minimum 3-minute compressor off-time in a safety block. Update at 10 Hz and include inline tests for mode changes and the lockout.

Build a multi-mode classroom demo with modes Idle, Manual, and Follow-Light. In Follow-Light, use two light sensors and a simple controller to steer left/right; in Manual, pass through joystick commands. Safety: an emergency stop input must immediately force all actuators off and enter a Safe state within 50 ms. Define task rates (control at 50 Hz, monitoring at 100 Hz) and a WCET budget under 2 ms. Include comprehensive inline tests for all transitions, E-stop, and lost-sensor cases.

Implement a 2oo3 voting scheme for three temperature sensors to control a heater to 25 C using PID. Provide modes Normal (3 sensors), Degraded (one sensor failed, 1oo2 voting), and Fault (shut down). Safety: if any sensor reads above 30 C, cut power immediately. Run at 20 Hz with WCET under 2 ms. Add inline tests that inject single and double sensor failures and verify mode transitions and voter outputs.

Create a warehouse-style door controller with states Closed, Opening, Open, Closing, and Obstructed. Use timer-based transitions and an obstruction sensor that forces a reversal to Opening when triggered. Safety: never energize open and close outputs simultaneously, and stop if any limit switch is inconsistent. Include exhaustive inline tests that cover all transitions and fault paths.

Design a small greenhouse supervisor with modes Startup, Normal, Alarm, and Maintenance. Normal mode coordinates a temperature PID (setpoint 26 C) and humidity control (dehumidify above 70% RH), enforcing interlocks so heating and dehumidifying do not conflict. Define task rates (temp PID 10 Hz, humidity 2 Hz, supervision 5 Hz) and ensure total WCET below 3 ms. Include inline tests for every mode, interlock logic, and sensor faults.

Demonstrate a watchdog-supervised system: a periodic task must heartbeat every 100 ms; if a heartbeat is missed, transition to a Safe state that disables all actuators and logs a fault. Define a main control loop at 50 Hz and guarantee WCET under 1 ms. Add inline tests that simulate missed heartbeats, normal operation, and recovery.

Make a beginner-friendly blinker that toggles an LED at 1 Hz and can be started or stopped with a button. Use simple variables and if/else to show basic syntax. Add a safety block that clamps the blink rate between 0.5 and 2 Hz, defaulting LED off on any error. Include inline tests that simulate button presses and verify the LED toggles at the expected cadence.

Write a simple demo: when the button is pressed, turn the LED on; otherwise turn it off. Add 50 ms debounce. Show clear variable declarations to teach basic syntax. Include a safety block that ensures the LED is off if the input is invalid. Provide inline tests that simulate bouncing and confirm stable behavior.

Create a classroom thermostat demo that reads temperature in Celsius and turns a fan output on if above 30 °C, off otherwise. Clamp sensor values to −40 to 125 °C with a simple safety block. Use easy-to-read constants and conditions. Add inline tests that feed in 25 °C, 30 °C, and 35 °C and assert the correct output.

Make a light-activated buzzer: if ambient light falls below 100 lux, sound a buzzer for 2 seconds, then stay quiet for at least 3 seconds before retriggering. Add a safety block that limits buzzer duty cycle to 50%. Include inline tests that simulate light level changes and verify timing.

Demonstrate input mapping: read a knob value from 0–1023 and map it to an output from 0–100% for a classroom indicator. Use simple arithmetic and show constants to illustrate basic syntax. Add a safety block to clamp outputs between 0 and 100%. Include inline tests with representative inputs and expected outputs.

Teach averaging: compute the average of the last 4 noise measurements in dB and display the smoothed value. Implement a safety block that bounds readings to 30–120 dB. Provide inline tests that push low/high values and verify the average and clamping.

Build a periodic pulse generator that emits a short pulse every 250 ms to drive an indicator. Keep the output in a safe default low state on startup. Target WCET under 0.5 ms per cycle. Use basic counters and if/else. Include inline tests checking pulse width and interval.

Create a double-click detector: toggle an LED only when two button presses occur within 400 ms. Debounce the button with 30 ms. Add a safety block that reverts to LED off if timing data is invalid. Include inline tests for single click, slow double click, and fast double click.

Make a motion alert: when motion is detected, beep for 200 ms, then enforce a 500 ms cooldown. Use simple timers and conditions. Add a safety block that keeps the buzzer off if the sensor signal is stuck high for more than 5 seconds. Provide inline tests for single and repeated triggers.

Convert a temperature sensor voltage (millivolts) to degrees Celsius with a linear formula and show the result for students. Demonstrate constants and basic math syntax. Include a safety block that saturates the result to a reasonable range (−40 to 125 °C). Add inline tests with known calibration points.

Build a simple water level guard: if the tank level exceeds 80%, ensure the pump output is turned off; allow it to turn on again below 60% (hysteresis). Provide a safety block that prevents the pump from being enabled above 90% under any condition. Include inline tests covering rising and falling levels.

Program a beeper to play an SOS pattern (··· ––– ···) for a classroom Morse code demonstration. Use basic timing variables and loops. Add a safety block to limit maximum on-time per minute. Include inline tests that verify the durations of short and long beeps and the gaps.

Create a three-step dimmer: each press cycles an LED through 0%, 50%, and 100% brightness. Use simple state variables and clear if/else blocks to teach syntax. Add a safety block that clamps brightness between 0 and 100%. Provide inline tests simulating sequences of button presses.

Make a humidity controller demo: if relative humidity drops below 30%, enable a humidifier output; disable it at 40% or above (with hysteresis). Add a safety block that turns the output off if the sensor reading is out of 0–100% range. Include inline tests for typical and fault cases.

Build a distance converter for class: read distance in centimeters, clamp it to 0–400 cm, and convert to meters with two decimal places. Emphasize constants and variable declarations. Add inline tests for boundary values and a mid-scale input.

Design a simple pedestrian crossing state machine with states Idle (cars go), Wait (button pressed), and Walk (pedestrians cross) using clear enum-like states. Use timeouts: Wait = 3 s, Walk = 7 s. Safety requirement: default to car red on any fault. Add inline tests simulating button presses and state transitions.

Create an interlock demo: only enable the actuator output if both a safety switch and a door sensor read true. If either goes false, immediately disable the actuator. Keep syntax simple with readable conditions. Include a safety block that forces output off on any invalid sensor state. Add inline tests covering all input combinations.

Build a reaction timer game: after a random delay between 1 and 3 seconds, turn on an LED; measure the time to a button press and display the milliseconds. Ensure times are clamped to 0–5000 ms in a safety block. Include inline tests that simulate fast (200 ms) and slow (1200 ms) reactions.

Make a smart night light: read ambient light in lux and smoothly fade an LED up as it gets darker, using a simple low-pass filter to reduce flicker. Use a safety block to clamp brightness 0–100%. Provide inline tests for a step change in lux and verify the gradual response.

Implement a simple dial-controlled setpoint: a rotary input adjusts a temperature setpoint from 10 to 50 °C, shown to students. Add debouncing/limit checking and a safety clamp on the setpoint range. Include inline tests for edge values and small adjustments.

Create a basic thermostat with hysteresis that holds 22.0 °C with ±0.5 °C band by switching heater and cooler outputs. Update at 10 Hz. Safety: if the sensor reports NaN or an out-of-range value, disable both outputs. Include inline tests for below, within, and above the band.

Program a door chime: when a door sensor transitions from closed to open, play a short tone sequence; ignore repeated openings within 5 seconds. Add a safety block that mutes the chime if openings occur too frequently. Include inline tests that simulate open/close events.

Write a sweep demo: move an educational actuator between 10° and 170° over 5 seconds, pause 1 second, and repeat. Clamp commanded angles to 0–180° in a safety block. Provide inline tests that verify min, max, and timing.

Make a simple battery monitor that estimates percent from measured volts using a piecewise-linear curve. Turn on a low-battery indicator at 20%. Safety: detect under-voltage and over-voltage and default the indicator on if readings are invalid. Include inline tests at key voltages.

Build a stopwatch with start, stop, and reset buttons. Update the display every 100 ms. Enforce WCET < 1 ms and ignore simultaneous button presses with priority Start > Stop > Reset. Safety: on any error, stop and reset time. Add inline tests for button sequences and timing.

Create a water tank fill controller: enable fill until level reaches 70%, then turn off. If level drops quickly (>5% in 10 s), flag a leak and disable fill. Safety: pump must be off above 90%. Include inline tests for normal fill and leak scenarios.

Program a metronome: output a click at a BPM set by a knob from 40 to 200 BPM. Ensure precise intervals and clamp BPM in a safety block. Provide inline tests that verify periods at 60 BPM (1000 ms) and 120 BPM (500 ms).

Build a tilt alarm using a simple angle estimate from an accelerometer: if tilt exceeds 15°, sound an alarm; silence it when below 10° (hysteresis). Add a safety block limiting the processed angle to −90° to +90°. Include inline tests for threshold crossing.

Create a three-pattern LED demo selected by two buttons: Pattern A blink, Pattern B breathe, Pattern C chase. Implement a small state machine for menu navigation. Safety: default to all off on any invalid state. Add inline tests that step through each selection.

Make a CO2 indicator: read ppm and show green below 800 ppm, yellow between 800–1200 ppm, and red above 1200 ppm. If the reading is missing, default to red (safety). Include inline tests for 600, 1000, 1500 ppm, and a fault case.

Implement a simple step counter demo: detect steps using an accelerometer magnitude threshold with a 250 ms refractory period to avoid double-counting. Safety: limit count rate to <4 steps/s. Include inline tests with a sequence of simulated peaks and verify counts.

Create a fan controller with five discrete speed levels (0, 25, 50, 75, 100%) selected by a button. Enforce an acceleration limit of 20% per second to teach rate limiting. Add a safety block to clamp outputs. Provide inline tests that simulate rapid button presses.

Build a logic gate trainer: allow students to select AND, OR, or XOR behavior for two digital inputs via a mode selector, driving an output LED. Keep syntax simple and readable. Include inline tests that exercise the full truth table for each mode.

Write a data trigger demo: when temperature crosses above 35 °C, record a timestamped event and light an indicator for 1 s. Ensure monotonic time and debounced threshold (require 2 consecutive high readings). Safety: default indicator off on errors. Add inline tests that simulate crossing, chattering, and reset.

Create an RGB color mixer with three sliders mapped to R, G, and B intensity. Add a safety block that limits the sum of intensities to 100% by proportionally scaling if needed. Include inline tests verifying the scaling for edge cases such as 80/80/80.

Build a PID temperature controller to hold 37.0 °C within ±0.2 °C. Run the control loop at 10 Hz with WCET under 2 ms. Include anti-windup, output clamp 0–100%, and a safety block that disables output if sensor is out of −40 to 125 °C. Provide inline tests with a step in setpoint and simulated plant response.

Create a PID speed control demo that maintains 200 RPM based on pulse feedback. Add a startup ramp and detect stall if no pulses for 1 s, then shut down safely. Clamp duty cycle to 0–100%. Include inline tests that simulate normal operation and a stall event.

Demonstrate a complementary filter: fuse accelerometer and gyro to estimate tilt angle in degrees at 100 Hz. Add a safety block that handles sensor saturation and bounds the angle to −90° to +90°. Provide inline tests with synthetic motion and verify convergence.

Combine two temperature sensors using a median selector for robustness. If their absolute difference exceeds 2.0 °C, flag a fault and switch to a safe fallback value. Emphasize clear conditions and constants. Include inline tests covering matched sensors, small differences, and large disagreement.

Implement a two-loop control demo: outer position loop (PD) generates a velocity target, inner velocity loop (PI) drives an actuator. Add clamps and rate limits, and a safety input that immediately disables output when asserted. Include inline tests for step commands and limit hits.

Create a run/pause/fault state machine for a classroom device. Transitions: Run→Fault on overtemp, Run↔Pause via button, Fault→Pause on acknowledge if temperature normal. Include a watchdog tick and WCET budget of 1 ms. Safety: outputs off in Fault. Add inline tests covering all transitions.

Build an adaptive smoke detector demo: maintain a rolling baseline of a particulate sensor and alarm if reading exceeds baseline by 20% for at least 5 seconds. Latch the alarm until a reset input. Safety: if sensor fails, default to alarm. Include inline tests for baseline drift and alarm delay.

Implement a time-of-flight sensor filter that computes a moving average over the last 10 samples and rejects outliers more than 3 standard deviations from the mean. Safety: bound reported distance to 0–3 m. Provide inline tests with normal data and injected outliers.

Create a line-following classroom demo using two light sensors and a simple proportional controller to adjust steering. Run at 50 Hz and stop safely if both sensors read dark. Include inline tests that feed left/right sensor patterns and verify steering direction.

Program a battery charging demo with CC/CV: constant current at 500 mA until 4.2 V, then constant voltage until taper current below 50 mA. Safety: over-temperature cutout and a maximum charge time of 3 hours. Include inline tests simulating voltage rise and taper.

Design a multi-mode lab trainer with Mode A (blink patterns), Mode B (sensor threshold), and Mode C (PID demo). Provide a simple menu to select modes and a built-in self-test at startup. Enforce safe defaults on any error. Require inline tests that validate each mode’s basic behavior and the self-test.

Create a two-mode thermostat for the classroom: Heating and Cooling modes selectable by a switch, each with its own setpoint and hysteresis schedule for class periods. Include a Safe Mode that activates after three faults within 10 minutes. WCET must be < 1 ms. Provide comprehensive inline tests for mode changes, schedule, and faults.

Build a small robotics demo controller with modes: Manual, Auto Line-Follow, and Safe Stop. Use simple sensor fusion for heading, a watchdog, and explicit timing budgets. Safety: any fault forces Safe Stop and outputs off. Include inline tests and fault injection tests for each mode.

Implement an experiment supervisor that manages up to three student experiments, each with enable/disable, time limits, and interlocks so only one can run at a time. On any fault, enter All-Off. Require coverage-oriented inline tests that exercise overlapping requests, timeouts, and fault handling.

Create an education suite that steps through a sequence of lab exercises using a state-driven workflow. Log pass/fail for each exercise, enforce a 50 Hz update rate with WCET of 0.5 ms, and ensure safety guards are executed on every transition. Provide inline tests that verify each state outcome and all safety checks.

Beginner exercise: write ReflexScript that turns an LED on while a pushbutton is pressed and off otherwise. Use basic syntax with a clear if else. Add a simple safety block that defaults the LED to off if the input is invalid. Include inline tests that simulate press and release events and verify LED state changes.

Toggle LED example for a classroom demo. Each time the button is released, flip the LED state. Show basic variables, edge detection, and a small debounce. Add a simple safety block to force LED off on unknown state. Include inline tests for multiple rapid presses and verify final LED state.

Create a simple temperature indicator. Read a temperature value in Celsius and turn a warning LED on if it exceeds 30 C. Clamp the input to a plausible range using a simple safety block: -40 C to 125 C. Provide inline tests covering values below, at, and above the threshold, plus out of range inputs.

Make a basic 1 Hz blinker. LED on for 500 ms and off for 500 ms. Emphasize basic timing syntax. Add inline tests that check two full cycles with timing tolerance of plus or minus 50 ms. Include a simple safety block so the LED is forced off if timing fails.

When a button is held down for more than 1.0 s, beep a buzzer for 200 ms. Use simple state and timers with beginner friendly syntax. Add a safety block that ensures buzzer duty never exceeds 500 ms per press. Include inline tests for short press, long press, and repeated presses.

Implement a counter that increments once per second and resets to zero at 10. Display the count on a row of LEDs as binary. Use clear variables and loops. Add a simple safety block to cap the count at 10. Provide inline tests that run for 12 seconds and verify the wraparound.

Light alarm: read ambient light in lux. If lux is below 100 for more than 2 s, turn on a buzzer; otherwise silence it. Clamp lux to 0 to 10000 using a simple safety block. Include inline tests for bouncing values around the threshold and the 2 s persistence rule.

Compute a simple average of the last 4 temperature readings in Celsius and map it to LED brightness 0 to 100 percent. Use basic arrays and arithmetic. Add a safety block to ensure brightness stays within 0 to 100. Include inline tests with a sequence of readings and expected averages.

Analog input to brightness mapping. Read a knob as a percentage from 0 to 100 and set LED brightness accordingly with a small deadband of 2 percent around zero. Use basic syntax. Add a simple safety block to saturate brightness to 0 to 100. Provide inline tests for edge cases including negative and over 100 inputs.

Startup pattern demo: on power up, wait 2 s, then blink an LED quickly three times, then stay off. Keep the code simple and readable for beginners. Include a safety block to ensure the LED ends off even if interrupted. Add inline tests that simulate startup timing and verify the pattern.

Press a button to start a 10 second countdown. Dim an LED one step per second until zero, then turn it off. Use basic variables and a loop. Add a safety block to prevent negative brightness. Include inline tests that check the 10 steps and final state.

Humidity alert exercise. If humidity is above 80 percent for more than 5 s, sound a buzzer. Use a simple timer and condition. Clamp humidity to 0 to 100 percent with a safety block. Include inline tests for short spikes and sustained high humidity.

Proximity indicator: read distance in centimeters and light an LED when distance is less than 15 cm. Include a small 1 cm hysteresis to prevent flicker. Use a safety block to bound the distance between 0 and 300 cm. Add inline tests for boundary values and hysteresis behavior.

Build a simple latch. If a hazard flag becomes true, turn an LED on and keep it on until a reset button is pressed. Emphasize basic boolean logic and state. Add a safety block to default to safe off at startup. Include inline tests that verify latch and reset behavior.

Create a ramping LED. Increase brightness from 0 to 100 percent over 5 s, then decrease back to 0 over 5 s, repeating. Use beginner friendly timing and arithmetic. Add a safety block to clamp brightness. Provide inline tests that check brightness at 0 s, 2.5 s, 5 s, 7.5 s, and 10 s.

Two button dimmer. One button increases LED brightness by 10 percent per tap, the other decreases by 10 percent. Include simple debounce and a safety block to keep brightness between 0 and 100. Add inline tests with tap sequences and verify final brightness.

Traffic light state machine for a classroom intersection demo. States: Green, Yellow, Red with durations 6 s, 2 s, 6 s. Add a pedestrian request button that shortens the current Green to 3 s minimum before switching. Include a safety block ensuring conflicting greens never occur. Provide inline tests that step through cycles and a request during green.

Reaction timer game. After a random wait of 0.5 to 2.0 s, turn on an LED and measure the time until the button is pressed in milliseconds. If slower than 3000 ms, play a low tone; otherwise a high tone. Use a safety block to cap the measured time at 3000 ms. Include inline tests with simulated reaction times.

Build a metronome. The tempo in beats per minute is set by a knob from 40 to 180 BPM. Beep at the chosen tempo and flash an LED. Ensure the beat task runs at the correct rate and the WCET stays under 2 ms. Add a safety block clamping BPM. Include inline tests for 60 BPM and 120 BPM timing.

Temperature status LEDs. Green below 25 C, yellow between 25 and 35, red above 35 C, with 1 C hysteresis between bands. Clamp sensor input to reasonable range with a safety block. Include inline tests for transitions up and down to show hysteresis.

Light data sampler. Record one light reading in lux per second for up to 60 samples, then stop and hold. Use simple arrays and indices. Add a safety block to guard against writing past the end. Provide inline tests that insert 65 samples and verify only 60 are stored.

Door controller finite state machine. States Closed, Opening, Open, Closing. Two buttons request open or close. Include a 5 s open timeout before auto close. Add a safety block that stops motion and enters Closed if both commands are active. Include inline tests for typical sequences and conflicting commands.

Event counter with reset. Count rising edges on an input and blink an LED once for every five counts. Add simple debounce with a 20 ms minimum period. Cap the count at 999 using a safety block. Include inline tests with bursty inputs and a reset mid stream.

Median filter practice. Maintain the median of the last 5 temperature readings in Celsius to reduce spikes, then show it on an LED bar. Include a safety block that discards impossible values below -40 C or above 125 C. Provide inline tests that feed in an outlier and verify the median output.

Cooperative tasks demo. Implement a heartbeat LED at 2 Hz and a button triggered beep that lasts 100 ms. Ensure the main loop keeps WCET under 5 ms. Add a safety block that disables the beep if the loop overruns. Include inline tests that check heartbeat continuity while beeping.

Safe relay logic. Energize a motor output only when both Enable and Guard inputs are true. Default to off at startup and if either input becomes invalid. Use a simple safety block for fail safe default. Include inline tests for all input combinations and a fault injection case.

Tilt alarm. Read a tilt angle in degrees. If the angle exceeds 15 degrees for more than 2 s, sound a buzzer until the device is level for 1 s. Use a safety block to clamp angle inputs to -90 to 90 degrees. Include inline tests for brief tilts and sustained tilts.

Two sensor agreement. Read two temperature sensors in Celsius. If both exceed 40 C, turn on an alarm LED. If the absolute difference is greater than 3 C, turn on a fault LED and suppress the alarm. Add a safety block to ignore impossible readings. Include inline tests for agreement and disagreement scenarios.

Simple scheduler. Run one task at 10 Hz to read sensors and another at 1 Hz to update a display. Keep timing jitter under 10 ms. Add a safety block that skips display updates if the sensor task overruns. Include inline tests that verify task rates and jitter bounds.

Automatic night light. Map light sensor lux to LED brightness with a piecewise linear curve and apply a simple moving average to avoid flicker. Use a safety block to bound brightness and lux. Include inline tests that step lux up and down and verify smoothing.

Stopwatch exercise. Buttons for Start Stop and Reset. Display whole seconds and tenths. Long press on Reset clears to zero. Use simple state and timers. Add a safety block that prevents negative time. Provide inline tests for start stop sequences and a long press reset.

Button combo unlock. Require both Button A and Button B to be held for 2 s to toggle an output on or off. Fail safe default off at startup using a safety block. Include inline tests for partial holds, correct holds, and rapid tapping.

Color mixing demo. Three PWM outputs represent red, green, blue. A knob selects hue around a color wheel. Ensure each channel stays within 0 to 100 percent using a safety block. Provide inline tests for 0, 120, and 240 degree hues and verify channel bounds.

Rate limiter practice. Smooth a target brightness command so it cannot change faster than 20 percent per second. Use straightforward arithmetic and timing. Add a safety block to cap brightness. Include inline tests that apply a step change and verify the slope limit.

Sound pattern selector. Three buttons choose one of three beep patterns. Only one pattern plays at a time, and selecting a new one cancels the current. Implement a small state machine. Add a safety block to silence output on invalid state. Include inline tests that switch patterns mid play.

PID temperature control demo for the classroom. Maintain 37.0 C using a heater output 0 to 100 percent, sampled at 10 Hz. Include anti windup and output clamping using a safety block. Declare a fault and force output off if temperature exceeds 45 C or sensor is invalid. Provide inline tests that simulate a step to 20 C and a disturbance.

PID speed control of a small fan using tachometer input in RPM. Target 1200 RPM with a 20 Hz control loop. Enforce WCET under 3 ms. Use a safety block to clamp output 0 to 100 percent and to zero on sensor loss. Include inline tests with simulated load increase and verify convergence.

Sensor fusion exercise. Combine two noisy temperature sensors using a weighted average and simple outlier rejection. Output a stable estimate in Celsius. Add a safety block that ignores readings outside -40 to 125 C. Include inline tests showing fusion behavior when one sensor spikes.

Complementary filter for tilt angle. Fuse accelerometer angle estimate with gyro angular rate in deg per s at 100 Hz to produce a stable angle in degrees. Fail safe to accelerometer only if gyro is invalid. Use a safety block to bound outputs. Provide inline tests with a step tilt and brief gyro dropout.

Distance selection logic. Read two independent range sensors and choose the more reliable estimate using minimum value with a sanity check. Valid range is 2 to 200 cm. If both are invalid, flag a fault and hold last good value. Use a safety block for bounds. Include inline tests for mismatch and fault cases.

Adaptive threshold alarm. Compute a moving mean and standard deviation of light in lux and trigger an alarm if the current value exceeds mean plus 3 sigma for 1 s, sampled at 50 Hz. Add a safety block to avoid divide by zero and overflow. Include inline tests with normal noise and an injected spike.

Velocity estimator. From position samples in meters at 25 Hz, estimate velocity in m per s using a finite difference and a low pass filter. Cap the estimate to a reasonable range using a safety block. Include inline tests with a constant velocity scenario and a sudden stop.

Thermostat with modes. States Heat, Idle, Fault. Use PID control only in Heat. Enforce minimum off time of 30 s and maximum heater on time of 10 min. On sensor fault, enter Fault and force output off using a safety block. Include inline tests for mode transitions and timing constraints.

Discomfort index calculator. Fuse temperature in Celsius and humidity percent into a simple comfort score. Light green below threshold, yellow near threshold, red above. Use a safety block to clamp inputs and outputs. Include inline tests with typical, high heat, and impossible values.

Three sensor voting. Take three temperature readings in Celsius, compute the median for output, and declare a fault if the spread exceeds 5 C. Hold last good output on fault using a safety block. Provide inline tests that cover all permutations of one bad sensor.

Multi mode lab demo. Modes Setup, Demo, Auto, Fault. Buttons change modes and timeouts return to Demo after inactivity. Run a 10 Hz task and a 1 Hz task. Enforce WCET under 4 ms. Use simple safety blocks for all outputs to ensure safe defaults. Include comprehensive inline tests covering all mode transitions, timeouts, and fault recovery.

Classroom incubator controller. Modes Off, Warmup, Regulate, Alarm, Test. Maintain 25.0 C with PID in Regulate. Turn a fan on if humidity exceeds 75 percent. Safety requirements: detect open circuit sensor, shut down on temperature above 35 C, maintain a watchdog heartbeat. Add inline tests for sensor faults, over temperature, and timing.

Educational robot simulation controller. Modes Manual, Auto, SafeStop. Auto mode follows a sequence of waypoints; Manual sets speed via knob. Use PID speed control to 0.5 m per s. An obstacle flag triggers SafeStop immediately. Loop at 50 Hz with WCET under 2 ms. Include inline tests for mode switches, obstacle events, and saturation limits.

Comprehensive traffic intersection. Two directions with pedestrian crossings. Modes Day, Night, Flashing, Fault. Strict mutual exclusion so no conflicting greens. Maintain a pedestrian request queue and timing accuracy within 50 ms. Use safety blocks to enforce safe lighting combinations. Provide a suite of inline tests covering normal cycles, night mode, requests, and fault entry.

Full classroom lab exercise. Build a testable environmental monitor with tasks for temperature in C, humidity percent, and light in lux. A fusion step computes a comfort score from 0 to 100. Modes Normal, Alert, Fault. Sample at 10 Hz and ensure WCET under 5 ms. Safety: bounds checking, sensor timeouts, and safe outputs on fault using simple safety blocks. Provide thorough inline tests including boundary values and fault injection.

For a beginner lab, make a simple program that turns on an LED whenever a pushbutton is pressed and turns it off when released. Use clear basic syntax, debounce the button with a 30 ms filter inside a safety block, and include inline tests that simulate quick taps versus long holds.

Create a 1 Hz blink demo with a single LED. Add a constant to change the blink rate, and a safety block that forces the LED off if an 'emergency_stop' flag is true. Provide inline test cases for normal blink and emergency stop behavior.

Read a temperature sensor in Celsius and beep a buzzer for 500 ms if the value exceeds 30.0 C. Clamp the buzzer duty to 0-100% in a safety block and write inline tests that feed 28 C, 31 C, and a faulty NaN input.
Map a rotary knob (0-100%) to LED brightness. Use linear scaling, enforce bounds with a small safety block, and include inline tests checking 0%, 50%, and 120% inputs.

Measure ambient light in lux and print 'Bright' or 'Dim' based on a 100 lux threshold. Add a safety requirement to treat negative readings as invalid, and write inline tests covering bright, dim, and invalid cases.
Implement a debounced toggle: each valid button press toggles an LED. Require a minimum 200 ms between toggles in a safety block. Add inline tests that simulate bounce and rapid presses.
Make a seconds counter that increments once per second and wraps back to 0 at 60. Include a safety rule that prevents overflow and inline tests for wraparound at 59 -> 0.

Play a short tone while a switch is held for at least 1.0 s; ignore shorter presses. Use a safety block to enforce a maximum tone duration of 2.0 s. Add inline tests for short, exact, and long presses.
Read Celsius temperature and display the nearest integer value. If the sensor is missing, show '---' and keep outputs safe. Include inline tests for rounding up/down and a missing sensor case.

Create a double-beep pattern on a buzzer (beep 100 ms, pause 100 ms, beep 300 ms, then 1 s silence) that repeats. Add a safety block to stop all sound when a 'quiet_mode' flag is set, and provide inline tests.
Use a distance sensor to light an LED when an object is closer than 20 cm. Ignore any reading outside 2-400 cm in a safety block. Provide inline tests for 10 cm, 25 cm, and 1000 cm.

Make a simple 5-sample moving average filter for a noisy input signal. Use basic arrays and ensure numeric stability in a safety block (no division by zero). Include inline tests showing the smoothing effect.
Build an alarm latch: when temperature exceeds 35 C, set an alarm LED until a reset button is pressed. Include a safety block that guarantees the reset always turns the LED off. Add inline tests.

Write a small converter that takes Celsius and outputs Fahrenheit with one decimal place. Include inline tests for 0 C, 100 C, and -40 C, and a safety block that rejects impossible inputs below -60 C or above 200 C.

On each valid button press, produce a 100 ms LED pulse regardless of how long the button is held. Rate-limit pulses to at most 5 per second in a safety block. Include inline tests for bursts and holds.

Design a simple traffic light state machine for a single intersection with a pedestrian button. Use states Green (10 s), Yellow (3 s), Red (7 s). If the button is pressed during Green, schedule a walk phase during the next Red. Add a safety block that forces all lights Red on any fault. Provide inline tests for timing and button presses.

Create a fan controller with three speeds based on temperature in Celsius: Low above 25 C, Medium above 28 C, High above 32 C, else Off. Default to Off on sensor failure using a safety block. Include inline tests for each threshold and a fault.

Build a reaction time game that waits a random delay, then lights an LED; the student presses a button, and the system measures reaction time in milliseconds. Lock out early presses in a safety block. Provide inline tests covering early press, slow press, and normal case.

Make a metronome that ticks an LED according to BPM set by a knob. Limit BPM to 40-200 in a safety block and aim for timing error under 5 ms per beat. Supply inline tests verifying clamping and timing at 60 and 120 BPM.

Program a small elevator door demo with states: Opening, Open, Closing, Closed. If an obstacle sensor trips while Closing, immediately go to Opening. Add minimum open time 2 s. Include a safety block that prevents motor actuation if any sensor is invalid, and inline tests for all transitions.

Create a desk lamp controller that keeps light near 300 lux using simple proportional control and hysteresis. Rate-limit brightness changes (no more than 10% per 100 ms) in a safety block. Provide inline tests for step changes in ambient light.

Implement a classroom incubator that turns a heater on below 36 C and off above 38 C. Hard-limit at 40 C using a safety block to cut power. Run the control at 1 Hz. Include inline tests for warm-up and over-temperature.

Write a servo sweeping demo controlled by a button: each press advances to the next angle in [0 deg, 45 deg, 90 deg, 135 deg, 180 deg]. Limit speed to 60 deg/s in a safety block. Add inline tests for sequence and speed limiting.

Build a data sampler that records temperature and humidity every 500 ms, computes a rolling 10-s average, and flags outliers more than 3 standard deviations. Use a safety block to mark samples invalid if either sensor fails. Provide inline tests with synthetic data.
Create a doorbell that plays a chime pattern only once per press. Use edge detection and a 1 s cooldown enforced by a safety block. Include inline tests for bouncing and repeated presses.

Develop a two-player scoreboard with separate buttons to increment scores and a reset. Prevent scores from exceeding 99 in a safety block. Add inline tests for simultaneous presses and wrap prevention.
Build a thermostat with 1.0 C hysteresis around a setpoint. Fail-safe to Off if the sensor is disconnected using a safety block. Provide inline tests for rising and falling temperature paths.

Make a crosswalk signal that shows 'Walk' for 7 s and 'Don't Walk' for 20 s, with an audible beep during 'Walk'. Ensure the 'Walk' phase always lasts at least 7 s via a safety block. Include inline tests for button timing and min durations.

Create a simple line-following demo with two reflectance sensors driving left and right motor speeds. If both sensors read dark, stop motors in a safety block to prevent runaway. Provide inline tests for left/right/center line positions.

Implement a water level indicator using a distance sensor: show Low (<20 cm), OK (20-40 cm), High (>40 cm) with three LEDs. Reject any reading outside 2-300 cm using a safety block, and include inline tests.
Design an RGB LED color mixer with three sliders (0-255 each). Clamp inputs in a safety block and add inline tests verifying that overflow values are clipped.

Write a classroom timer with Start, Pause, and Reset buttons that displays minutes:seconds. Prevent negative time and bouncing using a safety block. Provide inline tests for sequences of button presses.
Translate a short text into Morse code and blink an LED accordingly. Impose a maximum message length of 64 characters in a safety block and include inline tests for timing of dots and dashes.

Create a smart night light: turn on below 50 lux and off above 100 lux with hysteresis. Provide a manual override button that forces off. Use a safety block to ensure override always wins. Add inline tests.

Implement an inactivity watchdog for a classroom demo: if no button is pressed for 5 minutes, turn off all actuators and enter Idle. Use a safety block to guarantee outputs are safe in Idle. Include inline tests that simulate timeouts.

Build a PID controller to hold a water bath at 37.0 C. Run the control loop at 10 Hz with a worst-case execution time under 2 ms. Include anti-windup and clamp heater output to 0-100% in a safety block. Provide inline tests with a simulated plant step response.

Implement a motor speed controller using PID to track a setpoint in RPM. Update at 50 Hz, limit acceleration to 200 RPM/s, and stop if measured RPM exceeds 120% of the setpoint using a safety block. Add inline tests with ramp and disturbance scenarios.

Combine accelerometer and gyroscope readings to estimate tilt angle in degrees using a complementary filter. Reject NaN and saturating readings in a safety block. Provide inline tests with synthetic rotation and sensor noise.

Fuse two temperature sensors using a median voter and report a fault if the disagreement is greater than 1.0 C. Fail-safe to heater Off in a safety block. Include inline tests for agreement, mild disagreement, and large disagreement.

Detect heartbeats from a photoplethysmography signal using bandpass filtering and adaptive thresholding to estimate beats per minute. Limit LED drive current to a safe maximum in a safety block. Provide inline tests with sample waveforms.

Control water level in a small tank using PID on distance in cm from a level sensor. Clamp valve command to 0-100% and cut off if the tank is empty detected by a float switch via a safety block. Include inline tests.

Fuse ultrasonic and infrared distance measurements to produce a stable estimate in cm. Weight sensors by their variance and ignore outliers deviating more than 20%. Use a safety block to drop to a single-sensor mode if one fails. Add inline tests.

Regulate desk illumination to 500 lux with PID at 20 Hz. Meet a WCET of 1 ms, ramp-limit brightness changes, and ensure a soft-start on power-up in a safety block. Provide inline tests for startup and setpoint changes.

Estimate heading in degrees by fusing gyroscope and magnetometer readings, including calibration offsets and magnetic disturbance detection. Use a safety block to detect sensor saturation and freeze output if necessary. Include inline tests.

Track a position setpoint with a servo using PID and jerk limiting. If the servo fails to move for 500 ms, enter a safe shutdown via a safety block. Provide inline tests for step commands and stall detection.

Create a multi-mode classroom robot controller with modes: Idle, Demo, and SafeStop. Supervise line-follow and obstacle-avoid behaviors under a top-level state machine. Enforce an emergency stop input that immediately forces SafeStop and disables all actuators in a safety block. Declare task rates and WCET budgets, and include a thorough inline test suite for all mode transitions and safety invariants.

Design an environmental chamber controller with modes Warm-up, Regulate, and Fault. Use PID for temperature (C) and humidity (%) with coordinated scheduling. Fuse two temperature sensors and vote outliers. Safety requirements: over-temperature cutoff at 45 C, door-open detection that suspends heating, and all outputs off in Fault via a safety block. Provide comprehensive inline tests including fault injection and recovery.

Specify a smart traffic intersection with Normal, Pedestrian-Only, and Emergency Preemption modes. Model signal timing, pedestrian requests, and emergency vehicle detection. Enforce conflict prevention with an all-red safety block during mode switches. Include inline tests that verify timing constraints, mutual exclusion of greens, and preemption behavior.

Develop a classroom greenhouse manager with Day and Night modes. Control lighting, fan speed, and irrigation: PID for temperature (target 24 C), hysteresis for humidity (50-60%), and soil moisture thresholds in percent. Safety blocks should handle sensor faults and cut irrigation on leak detection. Supply comprehensive inline tests for mode logic and control loops.

Write a teaching demo of a safety supervisor that coordinates several small tasks (metronome, quiz buzzer, status display). Include a watchdog timer, monitor task WCET against budgets, and degrade to SafeMode on missed deadlines using a safety block. Provide extensive inline tests that cover normal operation, overload, and recovery.

Create a beginner-friendly example: when a button is pressed, turn on a single indicator light; when released, turn it off. Use only basic syntax. Include a simple safety block that forces the light off if the input is undefined, and add inline tests for pressed and released cases.

Make a periodic blinker that toggles an LED every 0.5 seconds (2 Hz), starting immediately. Provide a start/stop boolean input; when stop is true, the LED remains off. Add a simple safety block ensuring the LED is off if any timing overrun is detected, and inline tests verifying the blink period within ±10%.

Read a temperature sensor in Celsius and drive a fan output on when temperature is >= 30 C, off when < 28 C (basic hysteresis). Keep the logic simple. Include a safety block to clamp the output to strictly on/off, and add inline tests for 27 C, 29 C, and 31 C.

Build a classroom countdown: when a button is tapped, count down from 10 seconds to 0 and beep once at the end. Use basic constructs only. Include a simple safety block that mutes the buzzer if the duration exceeds 12 seconds, and inline tests for start, mid-count, and end conditions.

Map a knob input (0.0 to 1.0) to an LED brightness percentage from 0 to 100%. Use straightforward arithmetic and basic syntax. Include a safety block to clamp values to [0, 100], and add inline tests at 0, 0.5, and 1.0 inputs.

Create an on-delay function: when a switch closes, turn on an indicator after 200 ms; when the switch opens, turn it off immediately. Keep it simple. Add a safety block that ensures the maximum continuous on-time is 10 seconds, and provide inline tests for short and long presses.

Make a threshold alarm: if a light sensor reads below 50 lux, turn on a lamp; otherwise turn it off. Use basic syntax, add a simple safety block to default off if the sensor reading is not a number, and include inline tests for 30, 50, and 70 lux.

Build a pulse generator that emits a 100 ms ON pulse for each rising edge detected on an input. Keep the logic minimal. Add a safety block preventing pulses more often than 5 Hz, and write inline tests with synthetic edge sequences.

Demonstrate a moving average: sample a noisy sensor at 20 Hz and output the average of the last 5 samples. Use basic syntax only. Include a safety block that holds the last value if a sample is missed, and provide inline tests with a known sample series.

Implement a two-state toggle: each press of a pushbutton toggles an LED between ON and OFF. Use simple edge detection. Add a safety block to reset to OFF on startup or error, and include inline tests for a sequence of presses.

Design a min/max tracker for a Celsius temperature sensor that updates once per second. Expose current, min, and max values, with a reset input to clear min/max. Add a simple safety block to cap values to the range [-40 C, 125 C], and inline tests for typical and out-of-range inputs.

Create a beeper: when an 'alert' boolean is true, generate beeps at 4 Hz with 50% duty. Use basic timing constructs. Include a safety block that silences the beeper after 30 seconds of continuous alert, and inline tests for on and off behavior.

Make a classroom metronome at 120 BPM. Start/stop controlled by a toggle input. Use straightforward timing logic, add a safety block that limits BPM to the range 30–240, and include inline tests verifying beat intervals in milliseconds.

Create a rate limiter: the output follows a target value but may change no faster than 10 units per second. Keep arithmetic simple. Include a safety block to clamp the output to 0–100 units, and provide inline tests for step-up and step-down inputs.

Turn on a heater when temperature < 20 C and off when >= 22 C. Use basic hysteresis logic. Add a simple safety block that prevents the heater from being on more than 15 minutes without a 1-minute cool-off, and include inline tests.

Traffic light demo: implement a three-state cycle (Green 5 s, Yellow 2 s, Red 5 s) with an emergency input that forces Red immediately and resumes the cycle when cleared. Use a clear state machine, include a simple safety block guaranteeing no Green and Red overlap, and inline tests for timing and emergency behavior.

Build a handwashing timer with states: Idle, Washing (20 s countdown with LED progress), Done (beep 2 s). Reset on button press. Include a safety block ensuring the buzzer cannot be active more than 3 seconds at a time, and inline tests covering all transitions.

Create a reaction game for two players. After a random delay of 1–3 seconds, light a 'go' indicator; the first player to press wins and their score increments. Implement a small state machine, include a safety block to prevent ties, and provide inline tests using deterministic seeds.

Design a door chime that plays a short pattern when a door switch opens, but not more than once every 10 seconds. Include a safety block that suppresses playback if a supply voltage input drops below a threshold, and inline tests for rapid open/close events.

Implement a simple scheduler: sample a temperature sensor at 10 Hz and a light sensor at 2 Hz, exposing the latest values on outputs. Ensure worst-case execution time per tick is <= 1 ms; add a safety block that skips noncritical updates if WCET would be exceeded, and write inline tests that simulate timing.

Create a classroom scoreboard with two buttons to increment and decrement a score between 0 and 99, plus a reset input. Use debounced edges, include a safety block to prevent underflow and overflow, and add inline tests for burst button sequences.

Make a proportional mixer: combine two knob inputs (0–100%) to control two outputs so their sum stays exactly 100%. Include a safety block that normalizes and clamps values, and provide inline tests for corner and mid-range cases.

Develop a simple thermostat with three modes: Heat, Cool, Off (mode selected by an enum-like input). Implement hysteresis for each mode. Add a safety block to prevent Heat and Cool from being active simultaneously, and include inline tests for mode switching.

Build an interval trainer: alternate between Work (30 s) and Rest (15 s) stages for N cycles set by an input. Provide LED and buzzer cues. Add a safety block that limits N to 1–20 and caps total session length to 30 minutes, with inline tests for edge values and normal operation.

Implement a simple safe lock: a four-step button sequence unlocks an output for 5 seconds; any wrong input resets the sequence. Include a safety block to lock out inputs for 2 seconds after three failed attempts, and provide inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences.

Create a water level monitor with three thresholds (Low, OK, High) driving three indicators. Use simple averaging of the last 3 samples to reduce chatter. Include a safety block that raises a 'sensor_fault' if readings jump >50% in a single sample, and inline tests for smooth and jumpy inputs.

Design a PWM demo: convert a 'brightness' percent input to a 200 Hz PWM output with 0–100% duty, with an optional 'blink' mode that modulates duty at 1 Hz. Include a safety block to limit continuous duty to 95% maximum, and inline tests for steady and blink modes.

Implement a two-motor direction controller with forward and reverse inputs, plus an interlock that forbids commanding opposite directions at the same time. Add a safety block that enforces a 200 ms dead-time between direction changes, and include inline tests.

Create a step-counter demo: detect steps from an accelerometer magnitude using a simple threshold and a 250 ms refractory period. Provide step count and step rate (steps/min). Include a safety block that caps rate to 300 steps/min, and add inline tests with sample traces.

Build a simple data logger that records the maximum temperature in Celsius seen each minute and exposes the last 10 minutes as an array output. Include a safety block to handle time rollovers gracefully, and inline tests that feed a scripted temperature sequence.

Design a fan controller with three discrete speeds based on temperature bands: <25 C = off, 25–30 C = low, 30–35 C = medium, >35 C = high. Add a safety block to prevent speed changes more often than once every 5 seconds, and provide inline tests.

Create a binary-to-decimal display: read a 4-bit input and drive a two-digit decimal output (00–15). Include a safety block that detects invalid bit patterns and outputs '--', and add inline tests covering all 16 valid cases and a few invalid ones.

Develop a simple calibration routine: when 'calibrate' is triggered, capture the current sensor value as zero and subtract it from future readings. Include a safety block that times out calibration if the signal is unstable, and provide inline tests for stable and unstable scenarios.

Make a finite state machine for a pedestrian crossing: Wait, Walk (10 s), Flash (10 s blink), then back to Wait. A 'request' input starts the cycle. Include a safety block ensuring 'Walk' is never shorter than 7 seconds, and provide inline tests for all transitions.

Implement a classroom 'hot potato' timer that hands an active flag around a list of 4 players at 2 Hz; a button pauses/resumes. Add a safety block guaranteeing exactly one active player at any time, and include inline tests for wrap-around and pause/resume behavior.

Teach PID basics: control a heater to reach and hold 45 C using a PID loop with tunable Kp, Ki, and Kd inputs. Limit the output to 0–100% and implement anti-windup. Add a safety block that shuts off if temperature rises faster than 5 C/s or exceeds 50 C, and include inline tests with a simple plant model stub.

Speed control demo: maintain a target wheel speed in m/s based on a pulse frequency input. Use a PID controller with output saturation and rate limiting. Include a safety block enforcing a 300 ms watchdog on sensor updates, and inline tests with simulated pulse streams.

Sensor fusion lesson: combine two temperature sensors in Celsius using a weighted average that rejects an outlier if the sensors differ by more than 2 C. Add a safety block that flags 'disagree' and freezes the output when disagreement persists for 5 seconds, and include inline tests including divergent data.

Orientation estimation demo: compute a tilt angle in degrees by fusing accelerometer and gyroscope signals with a complementary filter (e.g., 98/2 split) at 100 Hz. Include a safety block that falls back to accelerometer-only if gyro data is stale for more than 100 ms, and provide inline tests using synthetic motion.

Line-following simulator exercise: take a line position error input (in mm) and drive a steering output using a PID controller with optional feed-forward. Implement output saturation and a safety block that forces neutral if error magnitude > 100 mm for > 1 s. Provide inline tests for step and ramp errors.

Altitude hold exercise: given barometer altitude (meters) and vertical acceleration (m/s^2), estimate vertical velocity via integration with drift correction, then control altitude to a setpoint using PID. Include a safety block that limits climb rate to 2 m/s and shuts down on sensor timeout, with inline tests.

Multi-sensor light measurement: fuse two light sensors (lux) using a median then smooth with a moving average to resist spikes. Add a safety block that triggers a 'fault' output if variance over 1 second exceeds a threshold, and include inline tests with clean and noisy inputs.

Thermal chamber controller: maintain 25 C ±0.5 C using a PID with hysteresis on actuator switching. The control loop updates at 10 Hz and WCET per update must be <= 2 ms. Include a safety block to prevent simultaneous heat and cool, and provide inline tests for setpoint tracking and disturbances.

Balance a simulated inverted pendulum angle around 0 degrees using a PID on angle with a low-pass filter on the derivative term. Enforce output limits and include a safety block to cut output if the angle exceeds 20 degrees. Provide inline tests with disturbance impulses.

Classroom robotics lesson: estimate position along a straight track by fusing wheel odometry (meters) with a periodic marker sensor that corrects drift when detected. Control speed to a target profile using PID. Include a safety block that limits acceleration to 1 m/s^2, and add inline tests for drift and correction events.

Create a multi-mode classroom climate demo with modes: Off, Heat (PID to 22 C), Cool (PID to 24 C), and Safe (all outputs off). Include an Error mode entered on sensor fault. Define a top-level state machine with explicit transitions, run control at 5 Hz with WCET <= 1 ms, and add a simple safety block that ensures mutual exclusion of actuators and clamps setpoints to 15–30 C. Provide comprehensive inline tests covering all modes, transitions, and fault recovery.

Design a lab conveyor controller with modes: Manual, Auto, and E-Stop. In Auto, run a state machine: Start, Run at target speed (m/s) via PID, JamDetected, ClearJam, Resume. Implement watchdogs on sensors, a dead-time before reversing, and output saturation. Require inline tests that simulate jams, E-Stop toggles, speed changes, and assert safety invariants are never violated.

Develop a multi-stage water tank lesson: Stage 1 Fill to 60%, Stage 2 Settle 10 s, Stage 3 Drain to 20%, then loop. Use two level sensors and a valve/pump pair with interlocks. Add a safety block that prevents dry-run and overflow, specify update rate 20 Hz with WCET <= 1.5 ms, and supply extensive inline tests including sensor faults and timeouts.

Build a mobile platform simulator controller with modes: Idle, Navigate, Fault. Fuse IMU tilt (degrees) and wheel odometry (meters) for pose, follow a waypoint list at up to 0.5 m/s using PID for heading and speed, and transition to Fault on sensor timeout or pose jump. Enforce acceleration and jerk limits in a safety block. Include a thorough suite of inline tests covering nominal runs, corner cases, and recovery.

Construct a classroom energy lab system with modes: Measure, Analyze, Demonstrate. Measure samples voltage (V) and current (A) at 1 kHz, computes RMS and power; Analyze detects over-power events and logs peaks; Demonstrate drives an indicator with a scripted pattern. Constrain WCET per tick to 0.8 ms, use simple safety blocks to clamp outputs and handle numeric overflow, and provide comprehensive inline tests with synthesized waveforms.

Create a beginner-friendly demo that turns an LED on while a pushbutton is held and off otherwise. Use basic syntax, add a simple safety block to ensure the LED defaults to OFF on startup, and include inline tests that simulate button presses and verify the LED state changes.

Make a classroom exercise where a knob sets LED brightness from 0% to 100%. Clamp the mapped value with a simple safety block, and write inline tests for minimum, midpoint, and maximum input values to confirm correct scaling.

Build a simple alarm that beeps a buzzer for 2 seconds if temperature exceeds 30 °C. Include a safety block to limit beep duration and ensure the buzzer is off if the sensor is invalid, and add inline tests with simulated temperatures.

Design a night-light example: if ambient light falls below a threshold (e.g., 50 lux), turn on an LED; otherwise, turn it off. Use basic syntax, a safety block to validate sensor range, and inline tests for edge conditions around the threshold.

Make a simple traffic light cycle (red → green → yellow) with 1-second intervals. Keep it readable for beginners, include a safety default to red on startup, and add inline tests that verify the order and duration of each light.

Create a clap counter demo: on two claps within 1 second, turn on an LED for 1 second. Add a safety block to ignore claps less than 100 ms apart (debounce) and include inline tests that simulate clap timing sequences.

Program a 2 Hz blinker with approximately 50% duty cycle. Use basic syntax, include a safety block that prevents toggling faster than 10 Hz, and write inline tests that count toggles over 5 seconds to confirm timing.

When a button is pressed, play a 200 ms tone on a buzzer. Add a simple safety block that limits to at most 10 tones per minute, and include inline tests for single press, long press, and rapid presses.

Make a proximity alert: if measured distance is less than 0.20 m, light a warning LED; otherwise, keep it off. Include a safety block to handle invalid sensor readings, and add inline tests around 0.19 m, 0.20 m, and 0.21 m.

Control an RGB LED with three buttons: one for red, one for green, one for blue. Only one color may be active at a time. Use basic syntax, a safety block to enforce mutual exclusion, and inline tests that check each button and combinations.

Implement a counter that increments from 0 to 9 on each button press and displays the number (e.g., on a 7-seg or serial). Use a safety block to constrain the value and wrap at 9→0. Include inline tests with bounce-like rapid presses.

Read a tilt sensor and print 'TILT' over serial when tilted; otherwise print 'LEVEL'. Add a safety block to rate-limit prints to 5 per second and include inline tests simulating rapid changes and steady states.

Create a simple thermostat with hysteresis: turn a fan ON below 21 °C only if temperature was above 23 °C, and turn it OFF above 23 °C only if it was below 21 °C. Add a safety block for sensor validity and inline tests showing hysteresis behavior.

Make a stopwatch: start/stop on a button, show elapsed seconds over serial, and reset on long-press. Include a safety block that auto-resets after 600 s and inline tests for start, stop, and reset sequences.

Build a metronome that ticks every 500 ms and flashes an LED in sync. Keep the script simple, include a safety block to ensure the LED is off between ticks, and add inline tests to verify 10 ticks occur in 5 seconds.

Model a pedestrian crossing with a small state machine: WAIT, WALK, and FLASHING states, with a button to request crossing. Include clear comments, a safety default to WAIT on startup, and inline tests for timing and transitions.
Create a doorbell state machine: IDLE → RING (2 s) → COOLDOWN (5 s) → IDLE. Add a safety block to ignore button presses during COOLDOWN and inline tests covering press during each state.

Combine a light sensor and a motion sensor to control a lamp: turn on only if it's dark and motion is detected; auto-off after 30 s of no motion. Include a simple safety block for manual OFF override and inline tests for all conditions.

Make a dimmable lamp where a knob sets a target level but the brightness ramps smoothly to avoid jumps. Add a safety block limiting ramp rate (e.g., 10% per 100 ms) and inline tests showing step changes produce gradual output.
Implement a three-speed fan controller with UP and DOWN buttons and states LOW, MED, HIGH. Use a safety block to clamp at the ends and include inline tests for all transitions and edge presses.

Create an indoor air indicator using CO2 levels: green under 800 ppm, yellow 800–1200 ppm, red above 1200 ppm. Add a safety block to default to red on sensor error and inline tests with representative ppm values.
Write a tiny serial command demo that accepts ON, OFF, and BLINK n. Ignore unknown commands with a safety block and include inline tests for parsing, including malformed inputs.

Build a latching temperature alarm: if T > 50 °C, turn on buzzer and LED until reset button is pressed. Use a safety block to cap buzzer duty cycle at 50% and add inline tests that simulate the threshold, latch, and reset.

Set up a classroom data logger that samples temperature and light at 10 Hz and prints a timestamped line. Include a timing constraint of WCET ≤ 5 ms per cycle, a safety block for sensor validity, and inline tests that check rate adherence.

Create a simple PWM fan control with an RPM sensor. If actual RPM falls 20% below the setpoint, light a warning LED. Add a safety block that caps PWM at 90% and inline tests with simulated RPM values.

Make a two-button combination lock: open when the sequence ABAB is entered within 10 s; otherwise fail. Add a safety block to enforce a 15 s lockout after 3 failed attempts and include inline tests for correct and incorrect sequences.

Simulate an elevator floor indicator with a simple state machine: moving up, moving down, stopped. Count floors 0 to 5 and constrain with a safety block so the counter never goes out of range. Include inline tests for each movement pattern.
Program a proximity alarm where buzzer beeps faster as distance (m) decreases. Limit beep rate to 10 Hz with a safety block and add inline tests for 0.15 m, 0.50 m, and 1.00 m inputs.

Set a watering valve to open for 5 s every 10 min as a demo scheduler. Include a safety block that forces the valve closed on any fault and inline tests that simulate schedule ticks and fault conditions.

Create a mood light that smoothly cycles colors and can be paused/resumed with a button. Add a safety block to ensure RGB values stay within 0–255 and include inline tests for pause, resume, and wraparound.

Design a power-on self-test that checks temperature and light readings are within plausible ranges. If any test fails, turn on an error LED and disable actuators via a safety block. Include inline tests for both pass and fail cases.

Make a line follower demo using two light sensors: turn a left or right indicator LED depending on which sensor sees darker. Default to both off if unsure using a safety block. Add inline tests for left, right, and ambiguous readings.

Create a tiny musical keyboard: map three buttons to three tones (do, re, mi). Enforce a minimum 100 ms gap between notes with a safety block and include inline tests for overlapping and spaced presses.

Build a classroom countdown timer where a knob sets the duration from 0 to 300 s. Clamp the setpoint with a safety block, beep when time reaches zero, and include inline tests for start, pause, and reset.

Compute a simple comfort indicator using temperature (°C) and relative humidity (%). Show 'OK' or 'HOT' based on a threshold. Use a safety block to handle out-of-range inputs and add inline tests with multiple scenarios.
Use a rotary encoder to adjust a 'volume' level from 0% to 100%. Debounce changes, clamp limits with a safety block, and include inline tests for rapid turns, reverse turns, and boundary conditions.
