Implement a basic PID loop to regulate motor speed to a target in RPM. Use a control update rate around 50 Hz, clamp output to 0–100% with a safety block, detect sensor faults, and include inline tests that check step response settling within 2 s.

Build a temperature controller for an incubator using PID to hold 37.0 °C. Add safety limits of 20–40 °C and an overheat cutoff at 41 °C. Require WCET < 2 ms per cycle and provide inline tests for setpoint tracking and overheat behavior.

Fuse two temperature sensors with a simple median selection and sanity checks. Drive a heater using proportional control to reach 22 °C. If sensors disagree by more than 2 °C, enter a safe mode. Include inline tests for agreement and disagreement cases.

Estimate a tilt angle using a complementary blend of accelerometer and gyro signals at 100 Hz. Add a safety block to cap the reported angle range and include inline tests that simulate a step tilt and constant-rate rotation.

Control water level between 0.30 m and 0.50 m using a PI controller with an ultrasonic sensor. Disable the pump if level < 0.20 m or on sensor timeout using a safety block. Provide inline tests for low level, normal control, and timeouts.

Maintain desk illuminance at 300 lux using PID dimming. Limit maximum brightness to 80% with a safety block, enforce WCET < 3 ms per control cycle, and include inline tests that simulate sudden changes in ambient light.

Add thermal runaway protection: if temperature rises faster than 5 °C per minute, cut power and latch an alarm. Implement with simple logic, a safety block to keep outputs off when latched, and inline tests simulating different rise rates.

Create a basic pedometer: count steps by detecting peaks from an accelerometer. Use a safety block to ignore spikes over 3 g and include inline tests with sequences that represent walking versus noise.

Synchronize two motors to the same target RPM using separate PID loops and a shared setpoint. Run the control loop at 100 Hz, stop both if their difference exceeds 100 RPM for 2 s with a safety block, and include inline tests for disturbances.

Estimate room occupancy by combining motion sensor events and CO2 (ppm) levels. Turn on a fan when occupancy probability is high. Add a safety block to rate-limit fan changes and include inline tests covering low/high CO2 and motion/no-motion cases.

Develop a multi-mode classroom climate controller with modes OFF, HEAT, COOL, and VENT. Use PID in HEAT/COOL for a Celsius setpoint, update at 5 Hz with WCET < 4 ms, add safety cutoffs and a startup self-test, and include inline tests for all mode transitions and faults.

Create a lab safety monitor that watches temperature (°C), humidity (%), and VOC index. Modes: NORMAL, WARNING, ALARM with latching and a timed silence feature. Any invalid sensor forces FAILSAFE via a safety block. Provide comprehensive inline tests and hysteresis.

Build a traffic intersection simulator with pedestrian and vehicle phases. Enforce min green 10 s, max green 30 s, yellow 3 s. Use a state machine, a safety block to prohibit concurrent green signals, and inline tests that verify all timings and transitions.

Design a mini greenhouse controller with modes GERMINATE, GROW, and IDLE. Control light schedules, a moisture pump, and a fan; include PID temperature control in °C. Add a safety lockout if the soil moisture sensor reads high, run at 1 Hz with WCET under 5 ms, and include inline tests for each mode and fault handling.

Write a beginner-friendly ReflexScript exercise: when a pushbutton is pressed, turn on an indicator light; when released, turn it off. Include a simple safety block to debounce the button (e.g., ignore changes faster than 20 ms) and add inline tests that simulate presses and verify the light follows correctly.

Create a classroom demo prompt: blink an indicator light at 1 Hz (500 ms on, 500 ms off). Show clear basic syntax with constants for timing, and include inline tests that check the blink period stays within ±5 ms.

Make a simple ReflexScript tutorial that reads a temperature sensor in Celsius and turns on a cooling fan output when temperature exceeds 30 °C. Use a safety block to clamp the valid sensor range to −40 °C to 125 °C, and include inline tests for 29 °C, 30 °C, and 31 °C.

Student exercise: read a light sensor in lux and turn on a nightlight output when the value drops below 100 lx. Provide a safety block that substitutes a default if the reading is NaN or out of range, and include inline tests covering bright and dark cases.
Beginner task: map a knob position (0–100%) to indicator brightness. Use a safety block to clamp duty cycle between 0% and 100%, and add inline tests for 0%, 50%, and 120% inputs.

Design a simple alarm: if a distance sensor reports less than 0.20 m, activate a buzzer for 200 ms. Add a safety block to rate-limit activations to at most 5 per second, with inline tests demonstrating the limit.

Create a ReflexScript lesson that toggles an indicator each time a button is pressed. Include a debouncing safety block and inline tests that feed a chattering signal to prove only one toggle per real press.

Write a tiny tutorial that calculates the moving average of the last 5 temperature readings in °C and displays the result as a percentage bar (0–100%). Include a safety block to handle missing samples and inline tests with a known sequence.

Class demo: when a sound trigger is detected, turn on an indicator for 500 ms, then turn it back off. Add a safety block to ignore triggers that occur within 100 ms of a prior trigger, and provide inline tests.

Simple threshold practice: if humidity exceeds 70% RH, light a warning LED; otherwise keep it off. Use constants for thresholds, a safety block to clamp humidity to 0–100%, and inline tests around the boundary.

Exercise: build a timer that turns on a light exactly 2 seconds after a button press. Show basic syntax for timers, add a safety block to cancel if the button is released before 2 s, and provide inline tests.

Beginner project: translate a distance reading (in centimeters) to 3 brightness levels (near/medium/far). Use simple if/else with constants, add a safety block to handle negative values, and include inline tests.

Create a basic ReflexScript that counts button presses up to 9 and indicates the count by blinking the light that many times when another button is pressed. Include a safety block to clamp the counter 0–9 and inline tests.

Intro lab: build a heartbeat indicator that blinks briefly every 1000 ms to show the system is alive. Include a note on WCET such that the task must complete within 1 ms, and add an inline test checking the inter-blink interval.

Tutorial exercise: map an analog slider (0–3.3 V) to a percentage, and show the value through 10 discrete LED steps. Use a safety block to bound the voltage and inline tests for 0 V, 1.65 V, and 3.3 V.

Design a small traffic light state machine with three lights: green for 5 s, yellow for 2 s, red for 5 s in a loop. Include a safety block that guarantees no two lights are on at once, and inline tests that verify the sequence and timing within ±50 ms.

Build a door alarm with a magnetic switch input and a buzzer output: if the door is opened, buzz for 1 s; if closed, silence. Add a safety block that enforces a minimum 200 ms off-time between buzzes, and inline tests for rapid open/close.

Create a mode-based controller for an indicator: short press (<300 ms) toggles on/off, long press (≥300 ms) enables a slow blink at 0.5 Hz. Use a simple state machine, a debouncing safety block, and inline tests covering both press types.

Class activity: implement a metronome with adjustable tempo from 40 to 180 BPM using a knob, blinking an LED and beeping on each beat. Add a safety block to clamp BPM and ensure beat jitter <2 ms; include inline tests for tempo edges.

Make a light-following demo: read two light sensors (left/right, in lux) and turn on the indicator on the brighter side, or both if within 5 lx. Add a safety block to handle sensor disagreement if one is stale, and inline tests.

Write a small controller with two buttons for a motor output: one for forward, one for reverse. Use interlock logic to ensure never both directions at once, add a safety block to require a 100 ms neutral before reversing, and inline tests.

Create a three-level climate indicator: normal below 25 °C, warm 25–30 °C, hot above 30 °C with a buzzer chirp every 2 s when hot. Use clear constants, a safety block to bound sensor input, and inline tests at thresholds.

Build a water-level controller with two float switches (low/high): turn pump on when low is dry and off when high is wet, providing simple hysteresis. Add a safety block to stop the pump if it runs more than 60 s continuously, and inline tests.

Develop a button-controlled latch: hold the button for 2 s to latch a relay on; a quick tap unlatches it. Use a small state machine, a debouncing safety block, and inline tests with simulated press durations.

Create a moving-average filter lesson: compute a 4-sample average of a sensor stream and drive an output when the average exceeds a threshold. Include a safety block for missing samples and inline tests with known sequences.

Design a pedestrian crossing demo: main light cycles green→red; when the walk button is pressed, insert a 8 s walk phase with a flashing countdown. Ensure no conflicting lights via a safety block, and provide inline sequence tests.

Class demo: use a distance sensor to produce two tones—close (<15 cm) high tone, far low tone—at 5 Hz toggling. Add a safety block to cap tone rate to 10 Hz max and inline tests for threshold behavior.

Implement a small scheduler with two periodic tasks: read sensors at 20 Hz and blink a status LED at 1 Hz. Include safety notes for WCET (sensor task < 3 ms, blink task < 1 ms) and inline tests to confirm rates.
Write a hysteresis thermostat: heat turns on below 19.0 °C and off above 21.0 °C. Add a safety block that disables heat if sensor changes faster than 5 °C/s (suspect fault), and inline tests.

Create a reaction game: after arming with a button, wait a random delay between 1.0–3.0 s, then light an LED; measure reaction time in milliseconds on the next button press. Use a safety block to prevent re-arming during a round and inline tests with seeded randomness.

Design a three-mode indicator: Off, Steady, Blink. Cycle modes with each button press. Ensure a safety block handles bounce and forbids mode changes faster than 100 ms. Include inline tests for wrap-around.

Build a simple alarm with two sensors: trigger if either temperature > 50 °C or gas level > 300 ppm. Add a safety block requiring both sensors to be valid within the last 500 ms, and inline tests for each pathway.

Make a servo demo: map a slider to an angle from 0 to 180 degrees and move the actuator smoothly (limit rate to 90 deg/s). Use a safety block to clamp angles and a small ramp, plus inline tests for limits and rate.

Create an LED breathing effect that ramps up and down with a 3 s period. Specify WCET: update loop must complete in under 2 ms. Include inline tests that check min/max brightness and period tolerance.

Student lab: combine two temperature sensors and display the average in °C; if they differ by more than 2.0 °C, light a fault indicator. Use a safety block to ignore obviously bad readings and inline tests.

Implement an inactivity timeout: if no button presses for 60 s, dim the indicator to 20%. Restore full brightness on the next press. Include a safety block that prevents dimming during a critical alert, and inline tests.

Intro PID lab: control the speed of a small motor to reach a target of 1200 RPM set by a knob. Implement a PID with anti-windup, clamp output 0–100%, and rate-limit changes. Run the control loop at 100 Hz with WCET < 5 ms. Provide inline step-response tests.

Temperature regulation exercise: maintain 37.0 °C using a heater with PID control. Include a safety block that shuts down if temperature exceeds 40.0 °C or sensor is stale >500 ms. Add inline tests for setpoint tracking and overheat handling.

Sensor fusion demo: estimate tilt angle in degrees by blending accelerometer and gyroscope using a complementary filter at 100 Hz. Add a safety block that detects saturation or dropouts and freezes output safely. Include inline tests with synthetic motion.

Two-sensor fusion for distance: combine a slow accurate sensor and a fast noisy sensor to produce a stable estimate in meters. Document assumptions, use a simple weighted filter, enforce WCET < 3 ms, and provide inline tests for step and noise cases.

Advanced state machine: a mini elevator model for three floors with calls, door open/close, and movement states. Enforce safety rules: door cannot open while moving; emergency stop halts immediately. Add inline tests for sequences and safety invariants.

Closed-loop water level control: maintain 50 cm in a small tank using a valve and level sensor. Use a PI controller with anti-windup, clamp actuator 0–100%, and a safety block to shut off if level > 60 cm. Include inline tests.

Line following exercise: using two reflectance sensors, compute an error signal and apply a P controller to adjust left/right motor outputs. Limit top speed to 0.5 m/s, include a safety block to stop if sensors lost, and add inline tests.

Battery health monitor: estimate state of charge (%) using voltage and current measurements with a simple coulomb counter. Include a safety block that flags if current exceeds 2.0 A or voltage < 3.0 V, and inline tests for charge/discharge cycles.

Headway keeper: maintain a following distance of 1.5 m using a distance sensor and motor command output with a PID. Enforce output rate limits and stop if distance < 0.3 m. Run at 50 Hz with WCET < 4 ms. Provide inline tests.

Orientation hold demo: hold a target angle using a gyro rate input and a PID loop. Add a safety block that detects integral windup and resets on saturation. Include inline tests for step, disturbance, and saturation scenarios.

Capstone classroom project: build a multi-mode climate controller with Manual, Auto, and Safe modes. Auto uses a PID to track 22.0 °C, Manual lets a student set output directly within 0–100%, Safe forces outputs off on faults. Specify task rates (control 10 Hz, UI 5 Hz), WCET budgets, and include a comprehensive inline test suite for mode transitions, faults, and recovery.

Design a comprehensive traffic system demo with Normal, Night (blinking), and Emergency Override modes. Include pedestrian requests, minimum green times, and safety interlocks preventing conflicting greens. Provide an inline test plan covering timing tolerances, mode switching, and emergency preemption.

Create a multi-rate sensor processing framework for a classroom robot: sensors at 100 Hz, control at 50 Hz, and logging at 1 Hz.
